target: Si kikenn koz kont Garson Limanite, li pou pardone.

input: You can tell what a tree is like by the fruit it produces.
target: Nou rekonet pie la dapre so fri.

input: Your words show what is in your hearts.
target: Labous exprim seki ena dan fon leker.

input: You want a sign because you are evil and won't believe.
target: zot pe rod enn sign parski ena move dan zot e zot pa pou krwar.

input: That's how it will be with you evil people of today.
target: Li pou parey avek sa move zenerasion la.

input: Then he taught them many things by using stories, he said:
target: Alor Zezi koz ar zot an parabol, li dir:

input: A farmer went out to scatter seed in a field.
target: Enn planter sorti pou al sem lagrin.

input: If you have ears, pay attention.
target: Saki ena zorey pou tande, ava tande.

input: Jesus' disciples came to him and asked, why do you use nothing but stories when you speak to the people?
target: So bann disip vinn ar li e dimann li, kifer to koz an parabol?

input: Everyone who has something will be given more.
target: Seki ena, pou gagn ankor plis.

input: These people will listen and listen,but never understand.
target: Zot pou bon ekoute, me zot pa pou konpran.

input: They will look and look, but never see.
target: zot pou bon gete, me zot pa pou trouve.

input: All of them have stubborn minds.
Their ears are stopped up, and their eyes are covered.
target: zot zorey bouse, e zot lizie ferme.

input: They cannot see or hear or understand.
target: Zot pa trouve ou ekoute ou konpran.

input: Jesus explains the story about the farmer.
Now listen to the meaning of the story about the farmer.
target: Aster ekout bien sinifikasion parabol planter.

input: So the message gets choked out, and they never produce anything.
target: Alors mesaz la toufe e zot pa prodwir nanye.

input: Jesus then told them this story:
target: Zezi rakont lafoul sa zistwar la:

input: Where did these weeds come from?
target: Kot sa bann move lerb la sorti alor?

input: An enemy did this, he replied.
target: Li reponn zot, nnn lennmi ki finn fer sa.

input: Allow both to grow together until harvest time.
target: Les toulede grandi ansam ziska rekolt.
Zezi rakont zot enn lot zistwar:

input: Jesus used stories when he spoke to the people.
target: Zezi servi parabol kan li koz ar dimounn.

input: In fact, he did not tell them anything without using stories.
target: An-fet,li p rakont nanie san servi zistwar.

input: Jesus explains the story about the weeds.
After Jesus left the crowd and went inside, his disciples came to him and said, explain to us the story about the weeds in the wheat field.
target: Apre ki Zezi kit lafoul e rant andan, so bann disip vinn kot li, e dir li, explik nou parabol move lerb dan karo.
Move lerb nou ramase e nou brile.

input: That's how it will be at the end of time.
target: Koumsamem li pou ete ler lafin-dimonn arive.

input: If you have ears, pay attention.
They keep the good ones, but throw the bad ones away.
target: Zor gard seki bon, e zet bann seki pa bon.

input: The people of Nazareth turn against Jesus.
target: Bann dimoun dan Nazaret rezet Zezi.

input: Isn't he the son of the carpenter?
Aren't James, Joseph, Simon, and Judas his brothers?
target: So bann frer pa Zak, Zozef, Simon ek Zida?

input: Don't his sisters live here in our town?
target: Tou so bann ser pa res isi avek nou?

input: How can he do all this?
The death of John the Baptist.
Then they told Jesus what had happened.
target: Apre sa zot al anons nouvel la Zezi.

input: When Jesus got out of the boat, he saw the large crowd.
target: Ler Zezi debark ater, li trouv enn gran lafoul.

input: He felt sorry for them and healed everyone who was sick.
target: Li pitie zot e li geri tou zot bann maladi.

input: Jesus replied, why should they leave.
target: Zezi reponn zot, kifer zot bizin ale?

input: Why don't you give them something to eat?
target: Kifer zot pa donn zot manze?

input: But he stayed until he had sent the crowds away.
target: Li reste ziska li fer lafoul ale.

input: Later that evening, he was still there.
target: Ler ariv aswar, li ti la li tousel.

input: By this time the boat was a long way from the shore.
target: Sa moman-la pirog ti bien lwin depi lakot.

input: When they saw him, they thought he was a ghost.
target: Kan zot trouv li, zot ti krwar enn fantom sa.

input: They were terrified and started screaming.
target: Zot ti terifie e zot ti koumans kriye.

input: Straight away, Jesus reached out his hand.
target: Zezi nek avoy lame, trap li, tir li e dir li, to lafwa feb.

input: He helped Peter up and said, you don't have much faith, why do you doubt?
The men in the boat worshipped Jesus and said, you really are the Son of God?
target: Bann ki ti dan pirog, zot loue Zezi e zot dir, vremem to Garson Bondie.

input: Jesus heals sick people in Gennesaret.
target: Zezi geri bann malad dan Zenezaret.

input: The people found out that he was there, and they sent word to everyone who lived in that part of the country.
target: Bann dimoun dan landrwa rekonet Zezi, zot avoy nouvel partou.

input: So they brought all the sick people to Jesus.
target: Alors zot amenn tou bann malad kot li.

input: They don't even wash their hands before they eat.
target: Zot pa lav lame avan manze.

input: Didn't God command you to respect your father and mother?
target: Eski Bondie pa finn ordonn zot pou onor zot papa ek zot mama.

input: Didn't he tell you to put to death all who curse their parents?
target: Eski li pa finn dir zot ki ninport kisannla ki modi so papa ek so mama, li merit lamor.

input: You let them say that what they have has been offered to God.
target: Zot les bann-la dir seki zot kapav ofer Bondie.

input: Is this any way to show respect to your parents?
target: Eski sa enn fason pou zot montre respe zot paran.

input: And you are nothing but show-offs, Isaiah the prophet was right when he wrote that God had said.
target: Zot pa nanie me zot zis montre, Izai ti ena rezon kan li ti ekrir seki Bondie ti dir.

input: It is useless for you to worship me, when you teach rules made up by humans.
target: Zot lapriyer pena valer,parski zot ansegn doktrinn bann imin.

input: The food that you put into your mouth doesn't make you unclean.
target: Manze ki zot met dan labous pa rann zot inpir.

input: Don't any of you know what I am talking about by now?
target: Eski zot pankor konpran seki mo pe dir ziska ler?

input: These are what make you unclean.
My daughter is full of demons.
target: Mo tifi, li extra posede par demon.

input: Jesus did not say a word.
They are like a flock of lost sheep.
At that moment her daughter was healed.
target: E deswit so tifi finn geri.

input: From there, Jesus went along Lake Galilee.
target: Dei laba Zezi al bor lak Galile.

input: Then he climbed a hill and sat down.
target: Lerla li mont lor kolinn e li asize.

input: They placed them in front of Jesus, and he healed them all.
target: Zot depoz zot devan Zezi, e li geri zot tou.

input: People who had never spoken could now speak.
Then they started praising the God of Israel.
target: Lerla zot koumans glorifie Bondie Izrael.

input: I don't want to send them away hungry.
target: Mo pa anvi ranvway zot vant vid.

input: They might faint on their way home.
target: Mo per zot gagn febles lor sime.

input: His disciples said, this place is like a desert.
target: Bann disip dir li, dan sa landrwa dezer la.

input: Where can we find enough food to feed such a crowd?
target: Kot nou pou gagn ase manze pou enn lafoul parey?

input: Jesus asked them how much food they had.
target: Zezi dir zot, komie manze ena?

input: They replied, seven small loaves of bread and a few little fish.
target: Zot reponn, set ti dipin, avek detrwa tipwason.

input: Everyone ate all they wanted, and the leftovers filled seven large baskets.
target: Tou dimoun manze vant plin e zot retourn set panie ranpli avek bann bout ki reste.

input: He came to shore near the town of Magadan.
target: Li vinn dan bor pre ar lavil Magadan.

input: The Pharisees and Sadducees came to Jesus and tried to test him.
target: Bann Farizien ek Sadisein avans ver Zezi pou piez li.

input: You can tell what the weather will be like by looking at the sky.
target: Zot kone kouma pou interpret sign lesiel.

input: But you don't understand what is happening now.
target: Me zot pa konpran ki pe arive asterla.
Apre sa Zezi kit zot li ale.

input: The yeast of the Pharisees and Sadducees.
Jesus then warned them, watch out.
target: Zezi dir zot, get bien, fer atansion.

input: Guard against the yeast of the Pharisees and Sadducees.
target: Fer atansion ar levin bann Farizien ek Sadisein.

input: The disciples talked this over and said to each other, he must be saying this because we didn't bring along any bread.
target: Bann disip kose e dir ant zot, sirman li pe bizin pe dir sa parski nou pa finn amenn dipin.

input: Why are you talking about not having any bread?
target: Kifer zot panse ki zot pena dipin?

input: Watch out for the yeast of the Pharisees and Sadducees.
target: Fer atansion ar levin bann Farizien ek bann Sadisein.

input: Then Jesus asked them, but who do you say I am?
target: Zezi dir zot, me zot, ki zot dir mo ete?

input: Simon Peter spoke up, you are the Messiah, the Son of the living God.
target: Simon Pier reponn, to Lemesi, Garson Bondie Vivan.

input: Simon, son of Jonah, you are blessed.
You didn't discover this on your own.
target: To pa finn dekouver sa par twa mem.

input: It was shown to you by my Father in heaven.
target: To Papa dan lesiel ki ti montre twa sa.

input: So I will call you Peter, which means a rock.
target: Alors mo dir twa Pier, to enn ros.

input: Jesus speaks about his suffering and death.
target: Zezi anons so soufrans ek lamor.

input: He said, I must go to Jerusalem.
target: Li ti dir, mo bizin al Zerizalem.

input: Then Jesus said to his disciples:
target: Apre sa Zezi dir ar so bann disip.

input: You must take up your cross and follow me.
target: Zot bizin pran so lakrwa pou swiv mwa.

input: If you want to save your life, you will destroy it.
target: Seki oule sov so lavi pou perdi li.

input: But if you give up your life for me, you will find it.
target: Me seki perdi so lavi akoz mwa pou sov li.

input: What would you give to get back your soul?
target: Ki zot pou done pou gagn zot nam?

input: They went up on a very high mountain where they could be alone.
target: zot al lor enn montagn bien ot kot zot ti tousel.

input: There in front of the disciples, Jesus was completely changed.
target: Laba divan so bann disip, Zezi ti sanze.

input: From the cloud a voice said, this is my own dear Son, and I am pleased with him.
target: enn lavwa dan niaz la ti pe dir, samem mo Garson ki mo bien kontan, li donn mwa boukou lazwa.

input: But Jesus came over and touched them.
target: Me Zezi apros zot e tous zot.

input: He said, get up and don't be afraid.
target: Li dir, leve, pa gagn per.

input: When they opened their eyes, they saw only Jesus.
target: Kan zot lev zot lizie, zot trouv Zezi tousel.

input: In fact, he has already come.
They will soon make the Son of Man suffer in the same way.
target: Koumsamem Garson Limanite pou soufer ar zot.

input: Jesus and his disciples returned to the crowd.
target: Zezi avek so bann disip retourn kot lafoul.

input: Jesus said, you people are too stubborn to have any faith.
target: Zezi reponn, zot tro latet dir pou ena lafwa.

input: How much longer must I be with you?
target: Komie letan ankor mo pou res ar zot?

input: Why do I have to put up with you?
target: Kifer kan mo bizin siport zot?

input: It is because you don't have enough faith.
But I can promise you this.
Everything would be possible for you.
target: Tou ti pou posib pou zot.

input: Jesus again speaks about his death.
target: Zezi koz ankor lor so lamor.

input: Does your teacher pay the temple tax?
target: Zot met, pa pey tax li?

input: After they had returned home, Jesus went up to Peter and asked him, Simon, what do you think?
target: Apre ki zot rant lakaz, Zezi koz avek Pier e li dimann li, ki to panse Simon.

input: Do the kings of this earth collect taxes and fees from their own people or from foreigners?
target: Bann lerwa lor later, kisannla zot fer pey tax?

input: But we don't want to cause trouble.
So go and cast a line into the lake and pull out the first fish you hook.
target: Al lamer zet lamson e premie pwason ki morde.

input: Use it to pay your taxes and mine.
target: Servi li pou pey tax pou twa ek pou mwa.

input: There will always be something to cause people to sin, but anyone who does this will be in for trouble.
target: Pou ena toultan bann pou fer dimounn fer pese, tou seki fer sa pou dan roblem.

input: If your eye causes you to sin, poke it out and get rid of it.
target: Si to lizie fer twa fer pese, aras li zete.

input: Don't be cruel to any of these little ones.
target: Fer sir ki zot pa mepriz sa bann tipti-la.

input: Wouldn't you leave the ninety-nine on the hillside and go and look for the one that had wandered away?
target: Eski zot pa pou les sa katrovin-diznef mouton la lor montagn pou al rod sa enn ki finn perdi la? í13S

input: That's how it is with your Father in heaven.
target: Koumsamem zot Papa ki dan lesiel ete.

input: If the follower refuses to listen to them, report the matter to the church.
target: Si dimounn-la refiz ekout zot, dir tou ar legliz.

input: An official who refused to forgive.
Not just seven times, but seventy-seven times.
target: Non pa zis set fwa, me swasann-dis-set fwa.

input: This story will show you what the kingdom of heaven is like:
target: Sa zistwar pou monte zot kouma Rwayom Bondie ete:

input: The king felt sorry for him and let him go free.
target: Lerwa sagrin li e les li ale.

input: He even told the official that he did not have to pay back the money.
target: Li mem dir ofise la ki li pa bizin retourn larzan-la.

input: So he grabbed the man by the neck.
When some other officials found out what had happened, they felt sorry for the man who had been put in jail.
target: Kan bann lezot ofise trouv saki pe pase, zot ti bien tris pou sa dimounn ki finn met dan prizon-la.

input: Then they told the king what had happened.
target: Zot al rakont lerwa ki finn pase.

input: The king called the first official back in and said, you're an evil man.
target: Lerwa apel premir ofisie-la e dir li, to move.

input: Some Pharisees wanted to test Jesus.
target: Enn bann Farizien koste ar Zezi pou teste li.

input: He becomes like one person with his wife.
target: Li vinn kouma enn dimounn avek so fam.

input: No one should separate a couple that God has joined together.
target: Fode pa dimoun separ seki Bondie finn met ansam.

input: Jesus replied, you are so heartless.
But from the beginning God did not intend it to be that way.
target: Me dan komansman li pa ti koumsa.

input: If you do, you are unfaithful.
target: Si zot fer sa zot pa fidel.

input: Jesus told them, only those people who have been given the gift of staying single can accept this teaching.
target: Zezii dir zot, pa tou dimoun kapav aksepte sa lansegnman la, me zis bann dimoun ki finn desid pou res selibater pou konpran sa.

input: Others stay single for the sake of the kingdom of heaven.
target: Lezot pa marye akoz Rwayom Lesiel.

input: Anyone who can accept this teaching should do so.
target: Seki kapav aksepte sa lansegnman la, li ava fer sa.

input: His disciples told the people to stop bothering him.
target: So bann disip dir zot pa fatig li.

input: People who are like these children belong to God's kingdom.
target: Rwayom Lesiel pou dimoun ki parey kouma zot.

input: If you want to have eternal life, you must obey his commandments.
target: Si to anvi gagn lavi eternel, swiv bann komannman.

input: Do not tell lies about others.

target: Onor to papa ek to mama.

input: Love others as much as you love yourself.
target: Kontan to prosin parey kouma tomem.

input: The young man said, I have obeyed all these.
target: Zenes la dir li, tousala mo finn swiv.

input: Then come and be my follower.
Yes, all of you have become my followers.
target: Wi, zot tou finn swiv mwa.

input: They will also have eternal life.
Early one morning a man went out to hire some workers for his vineyard.
target: Boner gramatin enn dimounn ti sorti gramatin pou anplway bann travayer dan so karo rezin.

input: Because no one has hired us, they answered.
target: Zot dir li, parski personn pa finn anplway nou.

input: Then he told them to go and work in his vineyard.
target: Li dir zot, al travay dan so karo.

input: He also told the man to begin with the ones who were hired last.
target: Komans ar bann dernie pou fini par bann premie.

input: But when they were given the same, they began complaining to the owner of the vineyard.
target: Letan zot resevwar mem lapey zot mirmire kont propriyeter la.

input: But you paid them the same that you did us.
target: E to tret zot parey kouma nou.

input: And we worked in the hot sun all day long.
target: E nou finn trime tout lazourne anba enn soley diplon.

input: I paid you exactly what we agreed on.
target: Mo finn pey twa exakteman kouma nou ti tom dakor.

input: Take your money now and go.
What business is it of yours if I want to pay them the same that I paid you?
target: Ki problem to ena si mo anvi pey bann-la parey kouma mo finn pey twa.

input: Why should you be jealous, if I want to be generous?
target: Ki fer to bizin zalou parski mo zenere?

input: Jesus then said, so it is.
target: Zezi dir koumsa sa ti ete.

input: Everyone who is now first will be last, and everyone who is last will be first.
target: Koumsamem, bann dernie pou vinn premie, e bann premie pou dernie.

input: Jesus talkss about his death a third time.
target: Zezi koz lor so lamor enn trwaziem fwa.

input: They will beat him and nail him to a cross.
target: Zot pou fwet li e zot pou krisifie li.

input: But on the third day he will rise from death.
target: Me lor trwaziem zour li pou resisite.

input: James and Jon's mother ask for a favour.
target: Mama Zak ek Zan dimann Zezi enn faver.

input: Jesus asked her what she wanted?
target: Zezi dir li, ki to oule?

input: Jesus answered, not one of you knows what you are asking.
target: Zezi reponn, zot pa kone ki zot pe dimande.

input: Are you able to drink from the cup that I must soon drink from?
target: Eski zot kapav bwar koup ki mo pe al bwar?
Zot dir li, wi, nou kapav.

input: That is for my Father to say.
target: Mo papa ki pou kapav dir.

input: But Jesus called the disciples together and said:
target: Me Zezi apel bann disip-la e li dir:

input: You know that foreign rulers like to order their people around.
target: Zot kone ki bann lerwa payin diriz e dominn lezot.
Sa bizin pa arive parmi zot.

input: Jesus was followed by a large crowd as he and his disciples were leaving Jericho.
target: Letan zot pe kit Zeriko, enn gran lafoul swiv Zezi.

input: Two blind men were sitting beside the road.
target: Ti ena de aveg pe asize lor bor sime.

input: When Jesus heard them, he stopped and asked, what do you want me to do for you?
target: Zezi arete, li apel zot, li dir, ki zot anvi mo fer pou zot?

input: They answered, Lord, we want to see.
target: Zot reponn, Segner, nou anvi trouv kler.

input: Jesus felt sorry for them and touched their eyes.
target: Zezi ranpli ar konpasion, li tous zot lizie.

input: Straight away they could see, and they became his followers.
target: Enn sel kout, zot retrouv kler e zot swiv li.

input: Untie the two donkeys and bring them to me.
target: Delarg de bourik-la, amenn zot kot mwa.

input: Straight away he will let you have the donkeys.
target: Toutswit, dimounn-la pou les zot ale.

input: Announce to the people of Jerusalem:
Your king is coming to you.
target: Zot lerwa pe vini kot zot.

input: He is humble and rides on a donkey.
target: Li lor enn ti bourik, e li ranpli ar imilite.

input: Hooray for the Son of David.
The crowd answered, this is Jesus, the prophet from Nazareth in Galilee.
target: Lafoul reponn, limem profet Zezi ki sorti Nazaret dan Galile.

input: But you have turned it into a place where robbers hide.
target: Me zot finn fer li vinn enn kavern voler.

input: Don't you know that the Scriptures say:
Jesus puts a curse on a fig tree.
When Jesus got up the next morning, he was hungry.
target: Kan Zexi leve landime gramatin, li ti gagn fin.

input: At once the fig tree dried up.
target: Enn sel kou pie fig sek.

input: And you will be able to do even more.
target: E zot pou kapav fer plis ki sa.

input: If you have faith when you pray, you will be given whatever you ask for.
target: Tou seki zot dimande dan lafwa, zot pou resevwar.
Kisannla finn donn twa sa lotorite la?

input: Who gave John the right to baptize?
target: Kisanla ti donn Zan drwa pou batize?

input: Jesus will ask us why we didn't believe John.
target: Zezi ou dimann nou kifer nou pa finn krwar Zan.

input: So they told Jesus, we don't know.
target: Alor zot reponn Zezi, zot pa kone.

input: Then you can tell me what you think.
target: Lerla zot kapav dir mwa ki zot panse.

input: The man then told his younger son to go and work in the vineyard.
target: Papa la vinn ar zen garson-la e li dir li mal travay dam lavign.

input: The elder one, the chief priests and leaders answered.
target: Grand garson-la, sef pret la reponn.

input: But these evil people did believe.
target: Me sa bann move dimounn-la finn krwar dan li.

input: Jesus told the chief priests and leaders to listen to this story:
target: Zezi dir bann sef pret ekout enn lot zistwar:

input: He also built a lookout tower.
But the tenants grabbed those servants.
target: Bann travayer trap bann serviter la.

input: He then sent more servants than he did the first time.
target: Li avoy ankor lezot serviter, plis ki premie fwa.

input: But the tenants treated them in the same way.
target: Me bann travayer la tret zot parey.

input: Finally, the owner sent his own son to the tenants, because he thought they would respect him.
target: Andernie li avoy so garson parski li ti panse zot pou respekte li.

input: But when they saw the man's son, they said, some day he will own the vineyard.
target: Me ler bann travayer trouv garson la, zot dir ant zot,ala leritie.

input: Then we can have it all for ourselves.
Jesus asked, when the owner of that vineyard comes, what do you suppose he will do to those tenants?
target: Asterla kan propriyeter karo rezin vini, ki li pou fer avek sa bann travayer la?

input: Jesus replied, surely you know that the Scriptures say,
target: Zezi dir, zame zot finn lir dan Lekritir ki dir:

input: It is amazing to our eyes.
target: Sa li enn gran mervey pou nou lizie.

input: So they looked for a way to arrest Jesus.
Once again Jesus used stories to teach the people:
target: Ankor enn fwa Zezi servi parabol pou ansegne:

input: But the guests did not pay any attention.
And the banquet room was filled with guests.
But the guest had no excuse.
Many are invited, but only a few are chosen.
target: Boukou pou apele, me tigit pou eli.

input: You teach the truth about what God wants people to do.
target: Seki to ansegne lor lalwa Bondie li vre.
Dir nou alor, ki to panse.

input: Should we pay taxes to the Emperor or not?
target: Eski nou bizin pey tax lanperer ou non?

input: Let me see one of the coins used for paying taxes.
target: Montre mwa enn pies avek ki zot pey tax.

input: His answer surprised them so much that they walked away.
target: So repons fer zot dekonserte ki zot ale.

input: The Sadducees did not believe that people would rise to life after death.
target: Bann Sadisein pa kwar dan rezireksion.

input: The first one married, but died without having any children.
target: Premie la marye e mor san zanfan.

input: So his wife was left to his brother.
target: Alors li kit vev la ar so frer.
Apre sa, fam la osi mor.

input: When God raises people from death, whose wife will this woman be?
target: Zour rezireksion, kisannla pou vinn so mari?

input: She had been married to all seven brothers.
target: Li finn pran touleset kouma mari?

input: You don't know what the Scriptures teach and you don't know anything about the power of God.
target: Zot pa konn Lekritir e pwisans Bondie.

input: They will be like the angels in heaven.
target: Zot pou viv kouma bann anz dan lesiel.

input: He isn't the God of the dead, but of the living.
target: Li pa Bondie bann mor me Bondie bann vivan.

input: One of them was an expert in the Jewish Law.
target: Enn parmi zot ki ti enn exper lalwa Zwif.

input: So he tried to test Jesus.
target: Alors li dimann Zezi enn kestion pou piez li.

input: This is the first and most important commandment.
target: Samem komannman pli gran e pli inportan.

input: The second most important commandment is like this one.
Love others as much as you love yourself.
Whose family will he come from?

input: One day the egg starts to crack.

input: Zan and Mariliz own a shop.

input: The hands of the clock move round: seven o’clock, eight o’clock, nine o’clock, ten o’clock, eleven o’clock, noon.
target: Zegwi revey tourne: seter, witer, never, dizer, onzer, midi.

input: They work from 1 o’clock to 7 o’clock.
target: Zot travay depi 1 er ziska 7 er.

When everything has gone quiet in the shop, mice come out from the corners.
target: Kan tu trankil dan labutik, lera sorti dan tu kwin.

input: Six little mice live behind a crate of dried beans.
target: Sis tilera res deryer kes grin sek.

input: There is one crate with butter beans in it and another one with split peas in it.
target: Ena enn kes gro-pwa e enn lot avek tipwa.

input: Five mice live behind the tin cans.
target: Sink lera res deryer bwat konserv.

input: Tins of sardines, cheese, peas, tuna fish and condensed milk.
target: Bwat sardinn, fromaz, tipwa, ton e dile kondanse.

Bottles of orange squash and wine and plastic bottles of oil.
target: Ena butey zi doranz e divin e butey delwil plastik.

input: All the mice are so hungry.
What can they do about it?

target: Kan zot fini manze, lera kumans zwe dan labutik.

input: The smallest mouse likes to play chase.
target: Pli tipti lera kontan zwe kuk galupe.

input: He runs and runs all over the place.

target: Li rul lor Sali, clong, clong, clong.

input: She says, “Zan did you hear that?”.

target: Zot leve, zot al gete ki pe arive.

input: When they open the door, it creaks.... errrck.
target: Letan zot ouver laport, li grinse, grinse, li fer krrrrnk.

input: The mice all run and hide behind the rolls of toilet paper.

input: Zan and Mariliz don’t see anything.

input: Then they go back to bed.

input: One mouse sits on the left side and the other one on the right side.
target: Enn mont a-drwat, enn mont a-gos.

input: Then they swing back and forth.

target: Li balanse divan, deryer, divan deryer.

input: Bottles fall over and get broken smash.
Zan, wakes up and says, “Mariliz, did you hear that?”.
target: Zan so somey kase, li dir, "Mariliz, to’nn tande?”.

input: They get up and go and have a look.
They push the door open and it creaks errrrck.
target: Zot pus laport, li grinse krrrrnk.

input: All the mice run away and hide.

input: Zan and Mariliz can’t see anything.

input: They start to play on the weigh scale.

target: Zegwi buze, buze, aret lor enn liv.

input: The little mouse climbs on to the scale.
target: Lerla, pli tipti lera mont lor balans.

input: The needle on the scale moves up and up and then stops on 1 /2 lb.
target: Zegwi buze, buze, aret lor demi liv.

input: Zan opens the shop at seven o’clock.

target: Ena dimunn vinn aste enn kar liv dite.

input: The little mouse wriggles and squirms.

input: They hide behind the counter, terrified.

input: Where they live, it rains almost every day.

input: They decided to go and search for the sun.

input: Marde, the gardener, had chopped off a huge bunch of bananas.
target: Marde, zardinye, ti kup enn rezinn banann.

input: Kankre and Lezlez climbed on the tree.

target: “Ki to pu fer ar sa baton-la, Rara?”

input: He comes to work on a bicycle.

input: All day long, all the dogs in town are tied up.

input: Every day Pekoy sees fishermen go out fishing in a boat.

input: a needle fish, a rock cod, a green parrot fish, a jack, a red mullet, a tailspot wrasse, a picasso fish, an eel, a rabbit fish.

input: Afterwards they dance around the fire.
Beautiful Old Woman of the Sea.

input: Malini is a little girl who lives by the sea.

When it is hunting season, people are allowed to kill deer with guns.

input: There isn’t a school where Abu’s father lives.

input: That’s why Abu lives with his mother in town.

input: Abu pulls the branches to one side.

input: He knocks at the door - knock, knock, knock.

input: I thought you had gone into the woods.

input: People shoot at deer and wild pigs with guns.

input: His mother laughs and says, “that’s a father deer Abu, a stag”.

input: “There were little rocks, some just had ears,

ubyen ena tipti korn” Abu dir.

input: In a garden a baby insect is born.

input: He’s hiding away in the parcel.

input: Do you know what the monsters are called?

input: It is as tall as a huge tree.
target: Li mem oter ki enn gran pye.

input: To find out what is on the other side.

input: Mariam says: “The dinosaur does not have babies in its tummy”.
target: Mariam dire: “Dinozor pa gyan ti-baba dan so vant”.

target: Zot tu inn disparet, kuma dodo.

input: One week after the wedding, my grandfather summoned my father, Siram Uncle and me to discuss how we were going to keep watch in the store at night.

input: “Bala!  Why are you grinning like a fool?”
target: "Bala! Kifer to pe sourir kouma enn pagla?"

input: My father suggested adding two rooms to the building so that a couple could live there.
target: Mo papa ti propoz ki azout de lasam dan batiman laboutik pou enn koup kapav viv.
Tro gran depans, mo granper ti dir.

input: My grandfather then suggested that Tonton Siram and I take turns, every other night.
target: Mo granper lerla ti propoz ki Tonton Siram ek mwa fer li atourderol, sak swar.
Nou toulede nou figir ti vinn long.

input: Siram Uncle had a woman, a young widow, who lived near the store, and I was in a similar situation.
target: Tonton Siram ti ena enn pies, enn zenn vev, ki ti res pre kot laboutik e mo problem si ti parey.

input: “Grandpa, I don't know if what I'm thinking is right, but what do you say to us doing it every other week?”
target: "Granper, pa kone si li bon seki mo panse, me ki ou dir si nou fer li toulesemenn?"

input: “I think that's a good idea, Dad”.
target: "Pa, mo kwar enn bon lide sa."

input: “Well, if the two of you are agreeable, then it's done”.
Sunil made it very clear that he was not a plaything, just there to satisfy my selfish whims.
target: Sunil ti fer mwa konpran ki li pa enn zouzou pou satisfer kapris enn egois.

input: I had made a clean break of it, and it was broken.
target: Mo ti swazir pou kas bag, bag ti finn kase.

input: He had already started to make a new life for himself, away from ‘Camp Hypocrite’.
target: Li ti finn fini rekoumans rekonstrir so lavi andeor Kan Ipokrit.

input: Sunil played guitar and liked to write songs.
target: Sunil ti pe zwe lagitar e ti kontan ekrir sante.

input: When he had gotten on his bike and left me that day on the beach, he had been really upset.
target: Ler li ti pran so bisiklet, kit mwa dan borlamer, li ti bien boulverse.

input: He felt I had betrayed a true love.
target: Li ti santi ki mo ti pe trair lamour.

input: That same night he went to a bar where a band played now and then, guys he knew.
target: Sa swar la li ti al dan enn bar kot enn ti group ti souvan zwe, li ti konn zot.

input: That night, the leader walked up to him and asked if he could sub for a band member who was sick.
target: Sa swar la sef group la ti vinn ver li pou dimann li si li ti kapav ranplas enn koleg ki ti malad.

input: The band leader told him he could just improvise.
target: Lider group ti dir li ki li ti kapav enprovize.

input: It was a good beginning and the band asked him to join them.
target: Ti enn bon koumansman e group-la ti dimann li vinn ar zot.

input: He agreed and pretty soon they had a fan base of youngsters and they also became quite successful playing at parties, weddings, concerts and fairs.
target: Li ti aksepte e bien vit bann zenn ti vinn zot fann e zot ti pe konn boukou sikse dan gamat, maryaz, konser ek fennsifer.

input: Our break-up freed Sunil from the fetters that were keeping him from blossoming.
target: Riptir nou relasion ti finalman kas lasenn ki ti pe blok devlopman Sunil.

input: But nothing is cut and dried—life is full of ups and downs.
target: Me nanye pa prop net - Lavi enn kontradiksion.

input: His group took the name ‘Cactus Flower’ and they began to play in beach hotels, and overseas too.
target: So group ti pran nom 'Fler Raket' e zot ti koumans zwe dan lotel dan borlamer e lot kote dilo osi.

input: Sunil wrote and sang songs that went to the top of the charts.
target: Sunil ti pe ekrir ek sant bann sante ki ti top dan itparad.

input: But an artist’s life is not easy, and the life of a gay artist is even harder.
target: Me lavi artis pa fasil e lavi enn artis ge ankor pli difisil.

input: He became a user, often sharing needles.
target: Li ti koumans pike, souvan partaz sereng.

input: That’s how he became HIV-positive, even though he and his boyfriends used condoms.
target: Se koumsa ki li ti kontamine ar VIH-SIDA malgre li ek so bann kopen ti pe servi kapot.

input: One day I got a message that Sunil had been hospitalized and wanted to see me.
target: Enn zour mo ti gagn enn mesaz ki Sunil, ki ti dan lopital, ti anvi get mwa.
Lor vites mo ti al get li.

input: My first love had become a skeleton, skin and bones, and could only whisper two or three words.
target: Premie lamour dan mo lavi ti vinn enn skelet, lapo kole lor lezo, li ti zis kapav mirmir detrwa mo.

input: “No, honey, I'm the one who messed up.”
There was a textile factory in the village.
target: Enn lizinn textil ti pe opere dan vilaz.

input: It was the policy of the central government to promote industrial development in rural areas.
target: Li ti politik administrasion santral pou ankouraz devlopman endistriyel dan rezion riral.

input: Businessmen liked to hire women because otherwise they’d have to pay men’s wages, which were one and a half times more than women’s.
target: Bann antreprener ti pe anplway bann fam sirtou, parski lapey zom ti ennfwaedmi lapey fam.

input: The technology was primitive so even uneducated women could be hired.
target: Mem bann fam ki pa ti literet ti anplwayab parski ti pe servi enn teknolozi primer.

input: Lots of women my age began to work in the factory.
target: Plizier fam dan mo laz ti finn koumans travay dan lizinn.

input: One day, Solange, who lived in Camp Mimi — it was weird how much she resembled Bala — told me that her boss was looking for workers.
target: Enn zour, Solanz ki ti abit dan Kan Mimi - drol ki manier li ti resanble Bala - ti dir mwa ki so patron ti pe rod travayer.

input: My mother-in-law was never going to let me work.
target: Mo belmer zame pa ti pou les mwa al travay.

input: The fact that we had both had life experiences made us good friends, bonded us together and made us determined to give our lives meaning.
target: Nou lexperyans negatif dan koumansman lavi ti fer nou vinn de bon kamarad, soude dan nou determinasion pou fer nou lavi gagn enn sans.

input: I needed him as much as he needed me.
target: Li ti bizen mwa kouma mo ti bizen li.

input: We had agreed to put up a show for the benefit of others, but we had an understanding.
target: Nou ti aksepte pou zwe lakomedi pou lizie lezot me ant nou ti ena enn konplisite.

input: I wanted to break out of the prison of convention and I knew that Bala would help me.
target: Mo ti anvi sorti dan prizon konvansion e mo kone Bala ti pou ed mwa.

input: He threatened his mother that he would takes his wife and live in a house far away if she wasn’t allowed to work in the factory.
target: Li ti menas so mama ki li ti pou al res dan enn lakaz lwe ar so fam si pa les li al travay dan lizinn.

input: His mother had to give in.
For the first time in my life, I was financially independent.
target: Premie fwa dan mo lavi mo ti ena lendepandans finansie.

input: The work conditions were difficult but at least I got a rare taste of freedom unknown in my domestic servitude to my in-laws.
target: Kondision travay ti difisil me omwen mo ti pe gout enn liberte rar ki pa ekziste dan esklavaz domestik boparan.

input: Because of his work in the shop, Bala and I spent very little time together.
target: Akoz so travay dan laboutik, Bala ek mwa ti pas bien tigit letan ansam.

input: I tried to console him when Sunil died.
target: Mo ti sey konsol li kan Sunil ti mor.

input: I decided to help him at this difficult time, before asking him for a divorce.
target: Mo ti desid pou ed li sorti dan so sitiasion difisil avan divorse.

input: One night he told me he had a boyfriend.
target: Enn swar li ti dir mwa ki li ti ena enn kopen.

input: “I don't know, but when I’m with him, I forget my sorrow.”
target: "Pa kone, me kan mo ar li mo bliye mo lapenn."

input: I only had to move my head a little.
target: Mo ti zis bouz mo latet enn bien tikou pou dir wi.

input: I got to know Bhai Farouk, the van driver who drove us when we worked the night shift.
target: Mo ti fer konesans Bay Farouk, enn sofer vann ki ti transport nou kan nou ti travay dan sift aswar.

input: My friends at work told me that he and his wife lived alone in a big house.
target: Bann kamarad travay ti dir mwa ki li ek so madam zot ti pe viv tousel dan enn gran lakaz.

input: They had only one child who had died of an overdose.
target: Zot ti ena enn sel zanfan ki ti mor par overdoz.

input: Once in a while they would take boarders.
One early morning, when he dropped me off, I asked him about it.
target: Enn gramaten, boner, ler li ti vinn depoz mwa, mo ti dimann li.

input: “You’re in luck, Miss!  My boarder has just left.”
target: "Ou ena sans Mamzel! Mo lokater finn fek kite."
Li ti apel tou bann fam mamzel.

input: It was a good way to avoid crap.
target: Enn bon fason pou evit lamerdman.

input: Some women don't like it if you call them "Mrs”.
target: Ena fam pa kontan kan apel zot “madam”.

input: Bala helped me a lot when I moved.
target: Bala ti bien ed mwa kan mo ti demenaze.

input: He was firm with his mother, telling her not to stick her nose in my business.
target: Li ti dir so mama, dan enn ton ferm, pa fou so nene dan mo zafer.

input: I had a comfortable room to myself in Bhai Farouk’s house.
target: Dan lakaz Bay Farouk mo ti ena enn lasam konfortab.
Nou ti partaz tou lezot fasilite.

input: His wife, who right away asked me to call her Auntie, was well educated.
target: So madam ki bien vit ti dir mwa apel li tantinn - pa madam - ti bien edike.

input: Later I learned that, because she hadn’t gotten any proposals, her parents pressured her to marry when Bhai Farouk sent one.
target: Pli tar mo pou aprann ki, parski li pa ti pe gagn demann, so paran ti met presion lor li pou li marye kan fami Bay Farouk ti fer so demann.

input: For Khadija Auntie’s family, it was a source of great shame if a girl was left high and dry.
target: Pou fami Tantinn Khadija, li ti enn gran laont kan enn tifi tas lor poto.

input: There were all kinds of gossip.
And yet, Khadija, who had grown up in the capital, went to high school, passed her exams, and was admitted to university overseas, which was rare in those days.
target: Pourtan, enn zafer rar pou dimoun sa lepok la, Kadija ki ti grandi dan kapital, ti al kolez, ti pas so matrik, ti gagn admision dan liniversite lot kote dilo.

input: But when she started her second year, her father had a stroke and his business suffered.
target: Me kan li ti rant dan so deziem lane, so papa ti gagn enn atak e so biznes ti soufer.
Khadija ti bizen retourne lor vites.

input: She hadn’t been able to become a professional, and independent.
target: Li pa ti reysi vinn enn profesionel endepandan.

input: There was only one solution, get her married.
target: Ti res enn sel solision, marye li.

input: Given her situation, finding a man was tough:  lawyers and doctors didn't think she was rich enough, civil servants were worried about an educated woman who had tasted life at university.
target: Bann zom maryab dan sa ka la ti rar: Bann avoka ek dokter pa ti trouv li ase ris, bann fonksioner ti per enn fam edike e ki ti finn konn lavi etidian liniversite.

input: Khadija was left high and dry.
target: Wi, Khadija ti tas lor poto.

input: For her brother, who had taken over her father’s business, she was nothing but a huge burden.
target: So frer ki ti pran biznes so papa ti trouv li kouma enn gran fardo.

input: A distant relative of Khadija’s who was also related to Bhai Farouk arranged their marriage.
target: Enn ti fami ar Khadija ki ti osi fami ar Bay Farouk ti aranz zot maryaz.

input: Khadija was five years older than Bhai Farouk, a simple peddler.
target: Khadija ti senk-an pli vie ki Farouk ki ti zis enn kolporter.

input: Once they were married, Khadija helped Farouk with his business.
target: Apre zot maryaz, Khadija ti koumans ed Farouk organiz so biznes.

input: Instead of letting him put the goods on a bicyle and selling it throughout our village, his wife gave him a motorbike.
target: Olie met marsandiz lor bisiklet pou al vande dan tou kwen nou vilaz, so fam ti donn li enn mobilet.

input: She also kept accounts of his sales.
target: Anplis li ti gard kont tou tranzaksion.

input: Later on, they had a storehouse built where they could stock a lot of the merchandise that Khadija and Farouk would buy once a month in the capital.
target: Pli tar zot ti fer konstrir enn godam kot ti kapav stok boukou marsandiz ki enn fwa par mwa Khadija ek Farouk ti al aste dan kapital.

input: When Khadija was expecting, the doctor was a bit concerned because Khadija of her age.
target: Ler Khadija ti ansent so dokter ti enpe trakase parski li ti ase vie.

input: The baby was delivered by C-section and the gynecologist told the couple to “close the tap”.
target: Zanfan la ti ne par sezaryenn e zinekolog ti dir koup la ferm robine.

input: Khadija and Farouk spoiled their son rotten.
target: Khadija ek Farouk ti tro gat zot garson.

input: Because their business was growing, they didn't have time for him, a maid used to take care of him.
target: Parski zot biznes ti pe grandi zot pa ti ena boukou letan pou okip li, enn servant ti pe okip li.

input: The boy got whatever he asked for.
target: Garson la ti gagn tou seki li ti dimande.

input: A little later, he started doing drugs.
target: Pli tar li ti koumans droge.

input: He’d steal money from his mother’s drawer or from his father’s pocket, so that he could buy his dose.
target: Li ti pe koken dan tirwar so mama, dan pos so papa pou aste so doz.

input: One day a dealer proposed a deal.
target: Enn zour enn trafikan ti propoz li enn diil.

input: He took delivery, sold some of the goods, used some himself and when the time came to pay up, there was a large deficit.
target: Li ti pran livrezon, vann enn parti marsandiz la, konsom enn parti e kan ti ariv ler pou fer kont ti ena enn gro defisit.

input: The drug lords realized that this kid had become dangerous because of what he knew.
target: Mafia ladrog ti realize ki sa garson la ti vinn danzere parski li ti konn tro boukou kiksoz.

input: Today, Khadija is about sixty-five and Farouk sixty.
target: Zordi Khadija ti ena anviron swasantsenk an e Farouk swasant.

input: Farouk got a contract to transport factory workers.
target: Farouk ti gagn enn kontra pou sarye travayer lizinn.

input: He bought a van and a bus.
target: Li ti aste enn vann ek enn bis.

input: They had material comforts but they were always burdened by great sadness.
target: Zot ti ena konfor materyel me enn gran tristes ti toultan pe trouble zot.

input: They felt that they were responsible for the death of their child, but they didn’t fully understand how.
target: Zot ti santi ki zot ti responsab lamor zot zanfan, me zot pa ti konpran kimanier.

input: That not knowing was the greater torture.
target: Sa flou la ti enn pli gran tortir.

input: Now, with me around, a boarder who before long was like a child in their home, Khadija and Farouk began to live again.
target: Aster ar mo prezans, enn lokater ki bien vit ti vinn enn zanfan lakaz, Khadija ek Farouk ti pe rekoumans viv.

input: One day Khadija asked me to consider continuing my studies.
target: Enn zour Khadija ti dimann mwa kifer mo pa ti rekoumans aprann.

input: I had passed my 12 years exams with distinction, I could study upto Matriculation.
target: Mo ti pas mo lekzame 12-an avek merit, mo ti kapav fasilman aprann ziska Matrik.

input: “I'm twenty years old, isn't it too late?”
target: "Mo ena plis ki ven-tan, pa tro tar?"

input: Look, I know what I'm suggesting is scary, so let’s meet half way.
target: Get sa, mo kone sa proze la pe fer twa gagn per, alors nou kas li ande.

input: Get your secondary school diploma, then we’ll see.
target: Aprann ziska diplomm lekol segonder, apre nou gete.

input: Is there a lot to learn?
I don't know the curriculum, but I do know someone who can help us.
target: Mo pa konn silabes me mo konn kikenn ki kapav ed nou.

input: I can help you in all subjects, I think.
target: Mo kwar mo pou kapav ed twa dan tou size.

input: It would make me very happy.
target: Sa pou fer mwa boukou plezir.

input: I don't want to trouble you, Auntie.
target: Mo pa'le donn ou traka, Tantinn.

input: This isn't trouble, dear, no trouble at all.
target: Pa traka sa beti, pa traka.

input: You’re going to help me forget my troubles.
target: To pou ed mwa bliye mo traka.

input: For four years, I went to work and I also studied, and when I was close to my twenty-fifth birthday, I passed my exams.
target: Pandan kat-ran mo ti okip mo travay ek mo letid e ler mo ti pre pou gagn vennsenk-an mo ti pas mo lexamen.

input: With my diploma, I was able to train to become a primary school teacher.
target: Ar sa diplomm la mo ti kapav rant treyning pou vinn mis lekol primer.

input: To do this, I would have to leave my village and learn to live without Khadija Auntie and Farouk Uncle.
target: Pou fer sa mo ti pou bizen kit mo vilaz e aprann viv san Tantinn Khadija ek Tonton Farouk.

input: It was a difficult decision, but I applied and I was accepted.
target: Ti enn desizion difisil pou pran, me mo ti aplay e mo ti gagn admision.

input: I went to see Bala at his shop.
target: Mo ti al get Bala dan so laboutik.

input: His view was that I’d be making a big mistake if I didn’t go.
target: Pou li mo ti pou fer enn gran erer si mo ti refize.

input: Farouk Uncle understood, but Khadija Auntie was very sad.
target: Tonton Farouk ti konpran me Tantinn Khadija ti bien tris.

input: She was sure we’d never see each other again.
target: Li ti sir ki zame nou pou rezwenn.

input: One month after I left, Farouk Uncle phoned me and gave me the sad news.
target: Enn mwa apre mo depar, Tonton Farouk ti telefonn mwa pou donn mwa enn move nouvel.

input: I saw Ratna at Mrs Farouk’s funeral.
target: Mo ti zwenn Ratna dan lanterman Madam Farouk.

input: She had become a different person, someone who knew who she was and where she wanted to go.
target: Li ti vinn enn lot dimoun ki ti kone ki li ti ete e kot li ti anvi ale.

input: My Dad, who wasn’t too well, gave me his share in the shop.
target: Mo papa ki pa ti tro bien ti donn mwa so par dan laboutik.

input: He and Mum had become quite religious and spent all of their time in prayer.
target: Li ek mama ti vinn bien relizie e zot ti pas tou zot letan dan lapriyer.

input: Siram Uncle and I, like two partners — Grandpa had long since passed on, and decided to change the look of the shop and turn in into a supermarket.
target: Mwa ek Tonton Siram, kom de partner, - depi lontan mo granper ti finn kit nou - nou ti desid pou sanz bataz laboutik pou fer li vinn enn sipermarket.

input: Some of the customers weren't too pleased, especially the ones who were accustomed to buy on credit and pay when they got their wages from the harvest.
target: Enn parti bann kliyan pa ti tro kontan, sirtou bann ki ti abitie pran kredi e peye kan kas lakoup rantre.

input: Unfortunately for them, this was the road progress had taken.
target: Malerezman pou zot progre ti pran sa sime la.

input: In our village and in the neighboring areas too, the winds of change had started to blow.
target: Dan vilaz e dan bann rezion avwazinan enn divan sanzman ti pe soufle.

input: But the change was always in just one direction: every man for himself.
target: Me sanzman ti touzour dan mem direksion: zwisans endividiel.

input: Our area always had the reputation of being temperate.
target: Nou rezion ti toultan ena repitasion enn landrwa tanpere.

input: Not too cold, not too hot, not too humid, not too dry.
target: Ni tro so, ni tro fre, ni tro imid, ni tro sek.

input: It was as if Nature had chosen us for an experiment to find a balance between extremes.
target: Vadire lanatir ti swazir kot nou pou fer enn lexperyans pou trouv lekilib ant extreme.

input: For some time, many outsiders had been coming to buy land on which to build second homes.
target: Depi enntan boukou etranze ti pe vinn kot nou pou aste teren pou konstrir zot rezidans segonder.

input: Slowly all the open spaces were beginning to disappear.
target: Dousma-dousma bann lespas ver ti pe disparet.

input: Soon, we heard that Grand Bois and Bois Noir, which had since time immemorial belonged to everyone, were now the property of a developer.
target: Timama tann dir ki Granbwa Bwanwar ki depi koumansman letan ti apartenir pou tou dimoun ti vinn propriyete enn promoter.

input: It was the same with Carreau Filaos, Carreau Eucalyptus, Carreau Bois d’Oiseau, Carreau Tekoma.
target: Parey pou Karo Filao, Karo Kaliptis, Karo Bwadwazo, Karo Tekoma.

input: We used to go wherever we pleased.
target: Nou ti ena labitid sirkile libreman.

input: Now everywhere we went there were signs: No Entry, Passage Interdit, Private Property.
target: Aster partou kot nou pase ti ena ekrito: no entry, pasaz enterdi, propriyete prive.

input: Same tune everywhere, from the valley all the way to the sea.
target: Mem son partou depi nou vale ziska borlamer.

input: Poor farmers were forced to sell their land; rich farmers saw their empires grow.
target: Bann fermie pov ti pe oblize vann zot later; bann fermie ris ti pe grandi zot lanpir.

input: I remember when Kavi Ram wanted to form a Village Committee to manage our locale.
target: Mo rapel kan Kavi Ram ti rod met dibout enn komite vilaz pou manej nou rezion.

input: The poor devil had to leave, and in a hurry.
target: Pov jab la ti bizen kite, sove.

input: But ten years ago, the financiers, the big farmers, the industrialists and the professionals succeeded in forming a municipal administration which made it easy for a small group to expand, people who controlled everything: land, water, the plantations, industry, banks, the media.
target: Me depi di-zan bann finansie, bann gran fermie, bann endistriyel ek bann profesionel ti finn reysi met dibout enn administrasion minisipal ki ti finn donn fasilite devlopman enn ti group dimoun ki ti pe kontrol tou: later, dilo, plantasion, lendistri, labank, media.

input: Instead of trying to win over the heads of the Camps and the clans, they simply bought them off one by one.
target: Olie sey persiad bann sef klan ek kan, zot ti finn zis aste zot enn par enn.

input: Those who tried to resist would discover that the banks had canceled their mortgage, that their children had been expelled for disorderly conduct, or that the canal that brought water to their crops had been blocked up.
target: Bann ki ti sey reziste ti aprann ki labank ti kansel zot ipotek, ki zot zanfan ti perdi plas pou konportman outrazan, ki kanal ki ti amenn dilo dan zot plantasion ti bouse.

input: Money, my friend, that’s the best argument, the most powerful one.
target: Pitay, mo fami, samem pli gran argiman, argiman pli for.

input: I myself didn’t have much to complain about because our business was doing well.
target: Mo pa ti kapav tro plengne parski nou biznes ti pe benefisie.

input: In order for us to get ahead, we put the other shops out of business.
target: Pou nou devlope nou ti obliz bann lezot ti laboutik ferme.

input: It was impossible to compete with us.
We had the support of a group of backers, so we were able to lower prices until our competitors buckled.
target: Nou ti ena soutien group finansie, akoz sa nou ti kapav kas pri ziska ki konpetiter dimann pardon.

input: I would offer them work in our supermarket, some menial job or other.
target: Mo ti donn zot enn ti job kas-kase dan nou sipermarket.

input: Flame-Tree Lane didn’t miss out on development either.
target: Lenpas Flanbwayan 'si pa ti sap dan lak devlopman.

input: There was a developer who was interested in all the properties along Grande Ravine.
target: Ti ena enn promoter ki ti enterese ar tou bann teren ki ti bord Gran Raven.

input: The small landowners, one by one, agreed to give up their land.
target: Bann ti propriyeter, enn par enn, ti pe aksepte sed zot drwa.

input: When it was our turn, Tonton Siram and I decided to refuse.
target: Ler ti ariv nou tour, Tonton Siram ek mwa, nou ti desid pou reziste.

input: The people of Camp Mimi, Bhai Goolam and his wife, Tonton Siram and Tantine Sita, my mother, my father and I, we all got together to discuss the situation.
target: Bann abitan Kan Mimi, Bay Goulam ek so madam, Tonton Siram ek Tantinn Sita, mo mama ek mo papa nou ti zwenn pou diskit sitiasion.

input: We were all firm in our resolve no to give up one inch of our land.
target: Nou tou ti ferm dan nou konviksion ki nou pa ti pou sed enn pous later.

input: But the clay pot gave way to the iron pot.
target: Po later ti bizen aksepte siperyorite po anfer.

input: The agents of the bigwig financiers, like slowly gnawing rats, had eaten away all resistance bit by bit.
target: Bann azan pwisans finansie, kouma lera soufle-morde, ti ronz rezistans bout par bout.

input: At first, the inhabitants of Camp Mimi weren’t sure, but then they were taken in by money’s power of reasoning.
target: Dabor bann abitan Kan Mimi ti koumans flote avan zot rant dan lozik pouvwar lamone.

input: There’s been promises of work, government housing, a consolidated farm for the raising of pigs, a four-lane bridge that was going to cross Grand Ravine; a cable-car that would come up and go down again.
target: Ti ena promes travay, lozman sosial, laferm entegre pou lelvaz koson, enn pon kat vwa ti pou travers Gran Raven; enn teleferik pou monte, desann.

input: In a flash, there were signatures, exes, thumbprints.
target: Avan lizie bat de kou ti ena signatir, lakrwa, pous lor bordro.

input: When my mother heard of this ‘betrayal’, she became hysterical, forgot all about her prayers and fell on my father.
target: Ler mo mama ti aprann sa "traizon" la, li ti vinn isterik, ti biye tou so lapriyer e ti tom lor mo papa.

input: That's when I finally understood why Solange looked so much like me.
target: Lerla ki mo ti konpran kifer Solanz ti resanble mwa koumsa.

input: Sure, can’t you see, she’s as stubborn as you are.
target: Be wi, to pa trouve, li teti kouma twa.

input: Banks and suppliers that had extended us generous credit all of a sudden tightened the leash in order to strangle us.
target: Labank ek fourniser ki ti donn nou boukou fasilite kredi enn kou ti redi lalinn pou trangle nou.

input: I sold my dignity to save our supermarket.
target: Mo ti vann mo dinite pou gard mo sipermarket.

input: Modernisation, liberalisation, deregulation, all blew their horns and beat their drums loudly.
target: Modernizasion, liberalizasion, deregilasion ti pe soufle tronpet ek tap tanbour for-for.

input: Our valley, hillside, everything up to the sea, became a model of development.
target: Nou vale, flan kolinn, lespas ziska lamer ti vinn enn model devlopman.

input: The newspapers were full of articles describing the municipality’s success.
target: Bann media ti ranpli ar lartik ki montre reysit minispalite.

input: No-one was in the least bit interested in finding out what had happened to the farmers, the fishermen, the artisans.
target: Personn pa ti enterese pou kone ki ti finn ariv bann planter, peser, artizan.

input: There were no articles about the huge ghetto, a rubbish dump of a city without water, electricity, decent housing, or social services — a human dustbin where alcohol, drugs and AIDS underwent great ‘development’.
target: Pa ti ena lartik lor enn imans geto, enn site depotwar san dilo, elektrisite, lozman desan, enfrastriktir social - enn poubel imen kot lalkol, ladrog ek SIDA ti pe 'devlope' for-for.

input: People there used to call this hell-hole ‘Danfour’.
target: Dimoun laba ti apel zot lespas 'Danfour'.

input: I think they were thinking Darfur.
target: Mo kwar zot ti'le dir Darfur.

input: According to official pronouncements, my village, which was organised into Camps and clans, had become a Uni-City, extending from Mapou to Belmont, and from Mademoiselle Jeanne to Grande Ravine.
target: Dapre bann diskour ofisiel mo vilaz ki ti divize an kan ek klan depi Mapou ziska Belmon, depi Mamzel Zann ziska Gran Raven ti vinn Siti-Ini.

input: Prosperity was visible everywhere you looked — a model for everyone.
target: Prosperite ti vizib partou - enn model pou limanite.

input: Gone were clan, class and Camp.
target: Nepli ti ena klan, klas, kan.

input: The Uni-City demanded, and got, autonomy.
target: Siti-Ini ti dimann e gagn so otonomi.

input: It became a state within a state.
target: Li ti vinn enn leta dan leta.

input: The industrial area was cosmopolitan, the residential area was cosmopolitan, the commercial area was cosmopolitan.
target: Kartie endistriyel ti kosmopolit, kartie rezidansiel ti kosmopolit, kartie komersial ti kosmopolit.

input: The Uni-City became a little UN.
target: Siti-Ini ti vinn enn miniatir Nasion-Zini.

input: From the hillside all the way to the sea, new had completely replaced old.
target: Depi kolinn ziska lamer nouvo ti ranplas ansien net.

input: So much so, that if you walked in Uni-City, you’d think you were in Hong Kong or Singapore, or New York, or London, or Paris.
target: Telman bien ranplase ki kan ou mars dan lari Siti-Ini vadire ou dan Hong-Kong ousa Singapore, ousa New York, London ou Paris.

input: Completely cosmopolitan!  Artists, poets and painters alike, began to miss ‘the old days.’
target: Kosmopolit net! Bann artis, poet kouma pent, ti koumans regret 'letan lontan'.

input: But the Autonomous Administration would rapidly denounce all their backward-looking impulses.
target: Me Administrasion Otonom lor vites ti pe denons reflex paseis.

input: The press boycotted them; galleries snubbed them.
target: Media ti boykott zot; galri ti boud zot.

input: Many preferred to emigrate, and local culture went underground.
target: Plizier ti prefer émigré e kiltir lokal ti al enndergrawn.

input: Holly-Bollywood was wildly successful and spoiling everything else.
target: Holly-Bollywood ti pe kas pake e kas konte.

input: Like I said, all the two-bit shops had disappeared and a whole bunch of small supermarkets like ours had taken their place.
target: Kouma mo ti dir, bann ti laboutik ti disparet ek enn trale ti sipermarket kouma pou nou ti ranplas zot.

input: They had nice-sounding names:  Flame-Tree, Citronella, Ayapana, Pipik, Cardinal, Plateau, Belmont, and the like.
target: Zot ti ena bann zoli nom: Flanbwayan, Sitronel, Yapana, Pikpik, Kardinal, Plato, Belmon ets.

input: The service was friendly because they knew everyone in their area.
target: Zot servis ti ena enn tous amikal parski zot ti pros ar dimoun zot lokalite.

input: The investors, who were on the lookout for areas that would guarantee them maximum profit in a hurry, homed in on retail.
target: Bann finansie ki ti rod bann domenn ki garanti maximem profi lor vites ti pe viz komers detay.

input: A multinational called Universal Stores decided to buy the whole lot and proceeded to modernise and reorganise the retail trade.
target: Enn miltinasional, Universal Stores ti desid pou aste tou, moderniz e reorganiz komers detay.

input: Both Siram Uncle and I knew that we were caught in a vice.
target: Tonton Siram ek mwa, nou ti kone ki nou ti fini tas dan leto.

input: No matter what we did, we would still be screwed.
target: Kot nou ti bouze nou ti manz feyaz.

input: They suggested that the two of us work with them as Assitant Managers.
target: Zot ti propoz ki nou de travay ar zot kom asistan-manejer.

input: Siram Uncle, who had been having serious marriage problems for some time, couldn't take the pressure of this new situation and took to the bottle.
target: Tonton Siram ki depi enn bon bout letan ti pe travers difikilte dan so koup pa ti kapav tini presion nouvo sitiasion e li ti tom dan lalkol net.

input: One day he gave me his whole library because, he said, there was no future in books.
target: Enn zour li ti donn mwa so libreri parski peyna lavenir dan liv.

input: Only then did I realize how deeply knowledgeable he was.
target: Lerla ki mo ti realize ki kantite so konesans ti profon.

input: He didn't have any kids—in his mind I was his spiritual child.
target: Li pa ti ena zanfan e dan so latet mo ti so zanfan spiritiel.

input: I was also close to Sita Auntie.
target: Tantinn Sita si ti bien pros ar mwa.

input: We had become good friends and I was the one on whose shoulder she cried.
target: Nou ti vinn de bon kamarad e zis ar mwa ki li ti rakont so soufrans.

input: In the beginning, she tried everything she could to save Siram Uncle from the snare of alcohol.
target: Dan koumansman li ti sey tou pou tir Tonton Siram dan piez lalkol.

input: But one day, exhausted and sickened, she left him.
target: Enn zour, fatige, degoute, li ti kit li.

input: His lifeline gone, Siram Uncle sank deeper still.
target: Tonton Siram ki ti finn perdi so boue sovtaz, ti plonz dan fon net.

input: Shame, loneliness and depression helped Thanatos prevail over Eros.
target: Laont, solitid, depresion ti ed Tanatos gagn laviktwar lor Eros.

input: He was nearly fifty years old the day he died.
target: Zour so lamor li ti ena pre senkant-an.

input: I lost my mother and father when I was very young and my aunt adopted me.
target: Bien zenn mo ti perdi mama ek papa e mo tantinn ti adopte mwa.

input: I was raised by the Treepats, a family who lived at the water’s edge.
target: Mo ti grandi dan klan Treepat, enn fami ki ti aktif dan borlamer.

input: Kausalya Auntie treated me like her own child.
target: Tantinn Kawnselia ti tret mwa kouma so prop zanfan.

input: She encouraged me with my schoolwork.
target: Li ti ankouraz mwa aprann dan lekol.

input: Even though she never went to school, she believed in education.
target: Mem zame li ti al lekol, li ti kwar dan ledikasion.

input: When I was seventeen, Kausalya Auntie told me that a good boy from a good family, the Ramasamy family, was interested in me, even since seeing me at the wedding of one of my cousins.
target: Ler mo ti ena diset-an Tantinn Kawnselia ti dir mwa ki enn bon garson dan enn bon fami, fami Ramsamy, ti enterese ar mwa depi li ti trouv mwa dan maryaz mo kouzinn.

input: He was handsome, and well educated; and he worked in his father’s shop.
target: Li ti enn zoli garson ar enn ase bon ledikasion; e li ti pe travay dan laboutik so papa.

input: When I was of age, I said yes.
target: Kouma mo ti gagn laz pou marye, mo ti dir wi.

input: Once his family had made the formal proposal, Siram used to come by.
target: Apre ki so fami ti fer demann ofisiel, Siram ti koumans frekante.

input: Six months later we were married.
target: Sis mwa pli tar nou ti marye.

input: In the beginning, everything went well.
target: Dan koumansman tou ti pas bien.

input: He wasn’t cruel, and once in a while he would buy me a book because he knew I liked to read.
target: Li pa ti brit, e tanzantan li ti aste liv pou mwa parski li ti kone ki mo ti kontan lir.

input: Often we would talk about the things we were reading.
target: Souvan nou ti koz lor bann zafer ki nou ti lir.

input: When I told him I thought I was pregnant he was really excited, and when I miscarried he was crushed.
target: Kan mo ti dir li ki mo kwar mo ansent, li ti extra eksite, e ler mo ti fer enn pert li ti boulverse.

input: When I miscarried a second time, I felt like something snapped.
target: Ler mo ti fer mo deziem pert mo ti santi koumadir enn resor ti kase.

input: He stopped talking about having kids and pretty soon he lost all interest in having sex with me.
target: Li ti aret koz koze zanfan e bien vit sex ar mwa pa ti pe enteres li.

input: When I would try and move close to him in bed at night, he would turn away saying that he was tired and that he had to get up early to go to work.
target: Kan mo ti koumans koste ar li aswar dan lili, li ti pe tourn so ledo, dir mwa li fatige, li ena pou leve boner pou al travay.

input: Eventually, being in bed with me became dull, cold and repelling to him.
target: Dousman-dousman mo lili ti vinn fad, frwa ek repousan.

input: When Bala got married and my father-in-law asked Siram and Bala to take turns keeping watch, my husband would be excited when his turn came.
target: Kan Bala ti marye e mo boper ti dimann Siram ek Bala fer gardien atourderol, mo mari ti extra eksite kan so tour ti vini.

input: He had another woman in his life.
target: Ti ena enn lot fam dan so lavi.

input: My life was like a boat left high and dry on the beach, like an inkpot without any ink.
target: Mo lavi ti kouma enn pirog dan sek lor disab, enn polank vid.

input: My aunt, my mother-in-law and my sister-in-law were all aware of my situation but they all advised me to act as if everything was fine.
target: Mo tantinn, mo belmer, mo belser ti okouran dilem dan lekel mo ti ete me zot tou ti konsey mwa fer vadire tou korek.

input: Later, when Bala married, I found a friend.
target: Pli tar kan Bala ti marye, mo ti gagn enn kompagn.

input: Ratna could talk to her husband at least, and when she felt that it was time fort her to leave, she left with the support of her husband.
target: Ratna omwen ti pe kapav koz ar so mari e kan li ti santi ki li ti bizen ale, li ti ale ar soutien so mari.

input: I too wanted to ecape the prison I was in.
target: Mwa osi mo ti anvi sorti andeor mo prizon.

input: I asked Siram if I could help them in the supermarket.
target: Mo ti dimann Siram kifer mo pa al ed zot dan sipermarket.

input: I could be the cashier but, no, they already had a cashier.
target: Mo ti kapav tini lakes me, non, ti ena enn kesier.

input: That’s right, that woman got herself a place.
target: Wi, ti fam la ti gagn enn plas.

input: I, his lawful wife, didn’t even have that privilege.
target: Mwa, so fam marye, pa ti ena sa privilez la.
Siram ti koumans bwar enpe tro.

input: Bala tried to explain things to me.
target: Bala ti pe sey fer mwa konpran.

input: That woman was doing him in.
target: Fam la ti pe fini li.

input: On top of it all, the alcohol made him impotent.
target: Lorla li ti pe vinn enpotan akoz lalkol.

input: How does such an intelligent man become a total wreck?
target: Kouma enn dimoun entelizan koumsa kapav vinn enn kales kase?

input: I wan't so young anymore, but I knew that if I didn't do something, I would definitely turn into a wreck too.
target: Mo nepli ti tro zenn me seki mo ti sir se ki si mo pa fer kiksoz mo 'si mo ti pou vinn enn kales kase.
Bala tousel ti konn mo plan.

input: He felt bad for Siram, but he understood.
target: Li ti sagren Siram me li ti konpran mwa.

input: I needed to leave this prison that was suffocating me.
target: Mo ti bizen kit mo prizon ki ti pe fini mwa.

input: May be I didn't pick the best time, but my priority was my own life.
target: Kikfwa mo pa ti swazir moman pli korek me mo priyorite se mo prop lavi.

input: It was lucky that Ratna let me stay with her until I could find some work.
target: Enn sans Ratna ti donn mwa enn ti plas kot li ziska mo gagn enn travay.

input: Once I had qualified as a teacher and gotten experience, I requested a position in Danfour.
target: Ler mo ti finn vinn enn proferser kalifie avek ase lexperyans, mo ti dimann poste mwa dan Danfour.

input: The inspector in charge of my file couldn't believe his eyes.
target: Enspekter ki ti pe okip mo dosie pa ti'le kwar so lizie.

input: Miss Ratna, is it true that you want to work in Danfour?
target: Mamzel Ratna, vremem ou'le al travay dan Danfour?

input: When I was much younger, I was in trouble.
target: Kan mo ti bien pli zenn, mo ti dan dife.

input: A lady who wasn't even a relative took me in, and fed my body and my mind.
target: Enn madam ki pa ti mem enn ti fami ar mwa, ti ramas mwa, nouri mo lekor ek mo lespri.

input: She gave me a great gift: belief.
target: Li ti donn mwa enn gran kado: lesperans.

input: The knowledge that God never abandons his children.
target: Enn santiman ki Bondie zame abandonn so zanfan.

input: Because if we all work together, may be we can restore belief in Danfour.
target: Si nou tou travay ansam, nou kapav replant lesperans dan Danfour.

input: There were teachers’ quarters on the school grounds.
target: Ti ena kwartez pou profeser dan lakour lekol.

input: Most of the kids were from single -parent homes, mostly single mothers and the kids were not well-fed.
target: Travay ti bien difisil - Mazorite bann zanfan ti viv dan fami enn paran, pli souvan kot zis mama prezan, bann zanfan la ti malnouri.

input: The older kids looked after the younger ones.
target: Enpe pli gran ti pe okip seki pli piti.

input: They came to school without slates, chalk, notebooks or textbooks.
target: Bann zanfan ti vinn lekol san lardwaz, kreyon, kaye ou liv.

input: The school gave them a piece of bread and a cup of milk thanks to the generosity of KaviRam, an NGO.
target: Lekol ti pe donn zot enn bout dipen ek enn goble dile grasa zenerozite enn ONG ki ti apel Kavi Ram.

input: If Uni-City lived in the eternal glory of immediate and immense profits, Danfour lived on charity.
target: Siti-Ini ti viv lor maximem profi toutswit dan laglwar eternal, Danfour ti viv lor sarite.

input: Most of the people in Danfour were farmers who had lost their land, people who had lost their livelihood because communal property had been privatised, and people who had lost their homes because developers had cheated them.
target: Mazorite dimoun dan Darfour ti bann planter ki ti perdi zot later, bann ki ti perdi zot gagnpen parski lespas kominoter ti privatize, e bann ki ti perdi zot lakaz parski bann promoter ti trik zot.

input: One day I met Solange, who had lived in Mimi Camp a long time ago.
target: Enn zour mo ti zwenn Solanz ki lontan ti viv dan Kan Mimi.

input: There had been a lot of development (bridges, highways, buildings, bungalows), but the houses that had been promised to the inhabitants has never materialised.
target: Ti finn ena gran devlopman (pon, otorout, imeb, vila) me lakaz ki ti promet pou donn bann abitan zame ti sort dan later.

input: Many young girls were forced to become sex workers.
target: Boukou zennfi ti pe oblize rant dan travay sexiel.

input: In the daytime, they slept in shanties and at night they made their living in the red light district.
target: Lazourne zot ti dormi dan enn lasam-kat-fey-tol e aswar dan rezion lantern rouz zot ti rod lavi.

input: Luckily, there were a few dedicated social workers who helped people regain some of their dignity.
target: Erezman ti ena ennde travayer sosial devoue ki ti pe sey fer dimoun regagn zot dinite.

input: But swimming against the current is no easy task.
target: Me naz kontkouran li pa enn zafer fasil.

input: Often, either because they were exhausted or because they had no resources, or because they didn’t get any support from the Autonomous Administration, they quit, and then another candle of hope was extinguished.
target: Souvan parski zot fatige, zot san resours, san soutien Administrasion Otonom, zot abandone e lerla enn ti labouzi lespwar tegn.

input: Compared to other people, I did fine.
target: Konpare ar lezot mo ti dan bien.

input: I had a regular salary, a roof above my head, and a job I enjoyed, even if the work conditions were tough.
target: Mo ti ena enn lapey regilie, enn plas pou kasiet lapli e mo ti ena enn travay ki mo ti kontan mem si kondision ti difisil.

input: I was still young, full of energy and grit.
target: Mo ti ankor zenn, ranpli ar lenerzi ek kouraz.

input: All things considered, I had no right to complain.
target: Akoz tousa mo pa ti gagn drwa plengne.

input: In Danfour, me and others like me formed a solidarity network. We had two reasons:  first, to prevent loneliness from weighing too heavily on us; second, to become interdependent since so many of our problems were connected.
target: Dan Danfour, bann dimoun kouma mwa nou ti form enn rezo solidarite pou de rezon: pou anpes solitid pez tro for e pou ki nou devlop konplemantarite parski tou bann problem ti konekte.

input: Once in a while, members of different NGOs would meet socially and professionally.
target: Tanzantan bann manm diferan ONG ti pe zwenn sosialman ek profesionelman.

input: We were a handful of people who had great hope that tomorrow would be better.
target: Nou ti enn ti pogne dimoun ar boukou lespwar ki dime kapav meyer.

input: At one of those meetings — I don't really remember if it was a social one or a working session — I got a real surprise.
target: Dan enn sa bann renion la - mo pa tro rapel sipa li ti sosial ousa profesionel - mo ti gagn enn sok.

input: Bala yes, my Bala was there, together with his boyfriend, Gerard.
target: Bala, wi mo Bala, ek so kopen Gerard ti la.

input: Who else do you think was there?
Gérard was the only one I didn’t know.
target: Ladan zis Gerard ki zame mo ti zwenn.

input: I knew of his existence, but we hadn’t met.
target: Mo ti kone li ti ekziste me zame nou ti zwenn.

input: He wanted to be a priest, but he left the seminary once he came to terms with his sexual orientation.
target: Li ti enn pret manke. Li ti abandonn seminer kan li ti pran foul konsians so oryantasion sexiel.

input: But his faith in Jesus wasn’t diminished.
target: Me so lafwa dan Zezi pa ti kabose.

input: Quite the opposite: because he was honest with himself, his faith shone with a thousand colours of the rainbow.
target: Okontrer parski li ti onet anver limem so lafwa ti pe briye ar mil reyon miltikolor.

input: We were a small group, like-minded in our aims and activities.
target: Nou ti enn ti group omozenn dan nou mision ek nou aksion.

input: All of us were between forty and fifty years old, and we had all traveled through a fire that can burn you, but which can purify you if you know how to stick through it, we all wanted to slow down the deterioration, physical, social, and especially moral.
target: Nou tou nou ti ena ant karant ek senkant an, nou tou ti travers dan dife ki kapav brile me ki pirifie si konn chombo li, nou tou ti anvi met fren ar deteryorasion fizik, sosial me sirtou moral.

input: Each one of us was a Uni-City reject.
target: Nou tou nou ti bann rebi lozik Siti-Ini.

input: Danfour was our apocalypse, the harbinger of the end of this Roman Empire that was oppressing us.
target: Danfour ti nou Apokalips ki ti pe anons lafen Lanpir Romen ki ti pe oprim nou.

input: Gerard was a natural-born leader, a genius at organising; Bala and I were good on the ground, because we knew how to talk to people, how to use their own turns of phrase to help them realise what was going on.
target: Gerard ti enn lider natirel, enn zeni organizasion; Bala ek mwa nou ti bon dan aksion lor teren parski nou ti konn koz langaz lepep, itiliz zot prop metafor pou fer zot trouv kler.

input: As for Sita Auntie—I don't know why I still called her Auntie—she knew how to build women’s confidence so that they could begin to take their fate into their own hands.
target: Tantinn Sita - pa kone kifer mo ti kontinie apel li Tantinn - li li ti konn met bann fam ankonfians pou ki zot kapav koumans pran zot desten dan zot lame.

input: She had a special way of talking.
There was a group of twenty-somethings in Danfour who became attracted to the idea of armed resistance.
target: Dan Danfour ti ena enn group zenn ven-vennsenk-an ki ti koumans atire par lalit arme.

input: Uni-City was swimming in money, whereas Danfour was drowning in misery.
target: Siti-Ini ti pe naz dan jalsa foulous pandan ki Danfour ti pe nwaye dan detres.

input: All channels of communication were blocked and the gap between these two realities was growing.
target: Tou bann arter kominikasion ti bouse e lekar ant sa de realite la ti pe grandi.

input: The Autonomous Administration stopped providing even minimal services in Danfour because it didn't contribute financially to activities.
target: Administrasion Otonom ti aret servis minimal dan Darfour parski zot pa ti kontribie dan finansman aktivite.

input: Roads weren't paved; there was no rubbish pick-up; the drains were all blocked; dead animals rotted on the streets.
target: Lari pa ti asfalte; pa ti ena ramasaz ordir; bann dren ti bouse; zanimo mor ti pe dekonpoze dan bor sime.

input: There was the serious danger of a cholera outbreak.
target: Ti ena enn gran danze ki enn lepidemi kolera eklate.

input: The banknote blinders covering the eyes of the Autonomous Administration and the Greater Finances Corporation, which controlled 90% of the region's wealth, meant that they didn't realise that any kind of catastrophe would in fact affect everyone.
target: Linet roupi lor lizie ni Administrasion Otonom, ni Gran Group Finansie ki ti kontrol 90% larises nou rezion ti realize ki nenport ki katastrof ti pou afekte tou dimoun.

input: The more people were excluded and marginalised, the more safety would be a concern for everyone.
target: Plis lamas dimoun exkli, marzinalize ti ogmante plis ti pou ena problem sekirite pou tou dimoun.

input: The moderates formed a political party which they called the KaviRam Party.
target: Bann modere ti regroup zot dan enn parti politik ki zot ti apel Mouvman KaviRam.

input: Who would have thought it would be possible to soften Mammon’s shield and inject into it the thinking of Jesus Christ and Mahatma Gandhi.
target: Zot ti panse ki li ti posib asoupli boukliye Mamon pou enzekte lespri Zezi ek Gandhi.

input: But the population of Danfour, who were having difficulty just making ends meet, weren't interested in highflying rhetoric.
target: Popilasion Danfour ki ti pe tir jab par lake pa ti enterese ar koze mervey.

input: The memory of recent duplicity traumatised them.
target: Souvenir desepsion resan ti tromatiz zot lespri.

input: Violent rhetoric was more attractive to them.
target: Langaz violan ti atir zot plis.

input: Digging a hole and filling it up again?
Using spit to put out a fire?
I had doubts often, which broke my stride.
target: Souvan dout ti rant dan latet e ti kal mo lelan.

input: God, why couldn't I have Gérard’s moral strength!
target: A Bondie kifer mo pa ti ena lafors moral Gerard!

input: As for Sita Auntie, she was like Sita in the Ramayana.
target: Tantinn Sita li, li ti kouma Sita dan Bannwas.

input: She said she knew that being exiled in Danfour was just a hell we had to go through on the way to our Moksha.
target: Li ti kone, li dir, ki exil dan Danfour li ti zis enn kalver ki ti pou amenn nou ver Moksha.

input: She thought her Moksha wasn’t far off and that belief helped her face difficulties.
target: So Moksha pa ti lwen, li ti panse e sa krwayans la ti permet li fer fas difikilte.
