input: But one night, on her way to see me, a group of hoodlums attacked her, even though they knew she was part of our group.
target: Me enn swar ler li ti pe vinn get mwa, enn group vakabon ti tom lor li, pourtan zot ti kone ki li dan nou group.

input: They beat her, robbed her, raped her and left her unconscious, in some thorn bushes.
target: Violans, vol, viol. Zot ti les li dan enn karo pikan, san konesans.

input: The next day, when her body was discovered, it was covered in red ants but she was still alive.
target: Lelandime ler ti trouv li, so lekor ti kouver ar fourmi rouz me li ti ankor vivan.

input: There was this free dispensary run by volunteers, which was where she was first treated.
target: Ti ena enn dispanser ki ti roule par bann volonter.

input: There was no ambulance to take her to the hospital.
target: Laba li ti gagn premie swen.

input: Someone with an old beat-up car offered to take her.
target: Pa ti ena lanbilans pou amenn li lopital.

input: That's how her life was saved.
target: Enn dimoun ki ti ena enn vie kachak-charli ti ofer so led.

input: But she was infected with the AIDS virus.
target: Se koumsa ki ti reysi sov so lavi. Me li ti kontamine par viris SIDA.

input: Her Moksha now seemed very far off.
target: So Moksha ti paret bien lwen aster.

input: When the news of her ‘accident’ spread, many women came to see her to give their support.
target: Kan nouvel so 'aksidan' ti fane, boukou fam ti vinn get li pou soutenir li.

input: They formed a women’s self-defense organisation.
target: Zot ti fer enn asosiasion otodefans pou fam.

input: They even built a place where a local could stay.
target: Zot ti mem ranz enn lokal pou rezidan.

input: A lot of men came to help them.
target: Boukou zom ti vinn ed zot.

input: In spite of the lack of interest in social action among the majority of people, every time there was a tragedy, there spontaneously arose a small solidarity movement and a little light appeared where no-one expected it.
target: Malgre dezenteresman dan aksion sosial par mazorite, asakfwa ki ti ena enn maler, ti ena enn mouvman solidarite spontane e enn ti lalimier ti alime kot personn pa ti atann.

input: Belief was not just an idle word.
target: Lesperans pa ti enn koze fos.

input: The hardest thing was finding a middle path between the repressive policy of the Autonomous Administration and armed resistance, a non-violent path, a specific one that would ensure social justice and greater happiness for many more people.
target: Seki ti plis difisil se trouv enn sime ant politik represif Administrasion Otonom ek lalit arme, enn sime non-violan, determine ki amenn lazistis sosial ek plis boner pou pli boukou dimoun.

input: How to make social activism and political action work together in harmony?
target: Kimanier fer travay sosial ek aksion politik mars annarmoni?

input: There was a conflict between the Social and the Political.
target: Ti ena enn konfli ant sosial ek politik.

input: Among the social workers were those who were anti-politics, for whom all politicians were liars, thieves, deceivers and the politicians saw adversaries everywhere, “those guys are plucking fruit from our orchard”, they’d say.
target: Parmi travayer sosial ti ena seki ti antipolitik - tou politisien manter, voler, kouyoner - e parmi politisien ti ena ki ti trouv rivalite - bannla pe lapes dan nou baraswa.

input: I myself had no political experience.
target: Mo pa ti ena okenn experyans politik.

input: In fact, I rather mistrusted politicians, but I had a notion that it was possible to have the two work together.
target: Anfet mo ti plito mefie politisien me dan mo latet ti ena enn lide vag ki li ti posib fer sa de la mars ansam.

input: According to Bala, I was a “voluntarist-idealist”.
target: Dapre Bala, mo ti enn “idealis volontaris”.

input: It certainly was all mixed up in my head.
target: Tou ti anbrouye dan mo latet.

input: The leader of the KaviRam Party was called Dario Ravaton.
target: Mouvman KaviRam so lider ti apel Dario Ravaton.

input: He had a lot of experience in social action, but always thought of it principally as a springboard for political action.
target: Li ti ena boukou experyans dan travay sosial me li ti toultan panse ki travay sosial li ti enn tranplen pou al ver aksion politik.

input: At the same time, social action, when it means consolidating effective lobbies, can become the basis of poltical success.
target: Anmemtan travay sosial, kan li vedir konsolidasion bann lobi efikas, li kapav vinn baz sikse politik.

input: For him, these two work together; sometimes one takes priority over the other, sometimes it’s the other way around.
target: Pou li sa de la mars ansam; parfwa enn plis priyoriter, parfwa lot ki priyoriter.

input: He refused to admit rigid divisions into a dynamic world.
target: Li ti refiz bann divizion rizid dan enn lemonn dinamik.

input: But to succeed, we had to be sure we didn’t forget what the source of our problems was.
target: Me pou reysi ti bizen ki toultan nou pa bliye kot lasours nou problem ti ete.

input: I understood his ideas because we met often.
target: Mo ti pe konpran so bann lide parski nou ti pe zwenn ase souvan.

input: Dario’s daughter was in my class.
target: Dario so tifi ti dan mo klas.

input: She had trouble with her studies.
target: Tifi la ti ena difikilte pou aprann.

input: I don't think she was dyslexic, but she was disturbed by something that had happened.
target: Mo pa kwar li ti dislektik me plito li ti boulverse par kiksoz ki ti ariv li.

input: I made a request that her father or mother come see me so I could understand the child.
target: Mo ti dimann ki so papa ousa so mama vinn get mwa pou ed mwa konpran zanfan la.

input: He made me understand that he was a single parent.
target: Li ti fer mwa konpran ki li ti paran-inik.

input: One day, his wife just upped and left them.
target: So madam enn zour ti kit zot anplan.

input: He hadn’t blamed her because he wasn’t a model husband himself.
target: Li pa blam li parski li pa ti enn mari ekzanpler.

input: Ever since that day, he looked after his two children with the help of a neighbour.
target: Depi sa zour la li ti okip so de zanfan avek led bann vwazen.

input: His daughter, Jessica, was very affected by her mother’s departure.
target: So tifi, Jesika, ti bien afekte par depar so mama.

input: I offered to look after the kids in the afternoon, after school, if he didn't have any objections.
target: Mo ti ofer pou okip zanfan la dan tanto apre lekol, si li pa ti ena okenn obzeksion.

input: Slowly, Jessica began to open up.
target: Jesika ti pe rapros nou dousma-dousma.

input: One afternoon, when he came to pick her up, he gave me a bottle of red wine and a red rose.
target: Enn tanto ler li ti vinn sers so zanfan, li ti donn mwa enn boutey diven rouz ek enn roz rouz.

input: I'll cook something, we can eat together.
target: Mo fer enn ti manze, nou gout li ansan.

input: David will be alone, I left him with a neghbour.
target: David pou tousle, Mo finn kit li kot enn vwazen.

input: As things deteriorated, the violence started to cast its net much wider.
target: Amizir sitiasion ti pe deteryore, violans ti pe fann so lapipi.
Bann zenn ti pe vinn deplizanpli enpasian.
Zot ti apel zot mouvman Maw-Maw.

input: It wasn’t clear whether they were Mao-Mao or Mau Mau.
target: Li pa ti kler si zot ti Mao-Mao ousa Mau-Mau.

input: One day I asked one of the leaders which it was.
target: Enn fwa mo ti dimann enn dirizan sa kestion la.

input: He stared at his big toes for two or three seconds before saying, “Both!”.
target: Li ti fixe so pous lipe detrwa segonn avan li ti dir mwa: "Toulede!".

input: In Uni-City, well-intentioned people began to say that if something wasn’t done soon, violence would become the norm.
target: Dan Siti-Ini ti koumans ena detrwa dimoun bonnvolonte ki ti pe dir ki si pa fer nanye, violans pou vinn kiltir zeneral.

input: One can't just talk about economic growth without taking stock of the deterioration on the social side.
target: Pa kapav zis koz krwasans san pran kont deteryorasion dan domenn sosial.

input: An independent state can’t just be an enabler, letting the rich get richer.
target: Leta otonom pa ti kapav zis enn fasilitater ki permet ris vinn pli ris.

input: It has to provide for the poor, the sick, the elderly, the handicapped; it has to provide education and health to all people.
target: Li ti bizen okip bann pov, bann malad, bann vie, bann andikape; li ti bizen okip ledikasion ek lasante tou dimoun.

input: These well-intentioned people weren’t organised; they had no influence on those who decided.
target: Sa bann dimoun bienentansione la pa ti organize; zot pa ti ena okenn enflians lor pouvwar desizion.

input: The press, which was in the pocket of big money, censored them, even though they themselves were officially against censorship.
target: Bann media ki ti dan lame gro lamone ti sansir zot malgre ki ofisielman zot ti kont lasansir.

input: Because open debate was silenced, violence became the standard reaction of the victims of all the heartless development.
target: Parski deba demokratik ti bloke, violans ti vinn expresion normal bann viktim devlopman san leker.

input: In the boardroom of FoulousPlennti, Inc.
Chairperson:  Stop messing around, you all!
According to certain scientists, what’s going on is just a warning.
target: Selon serten siyantis seki pe arive, zis so reklam.

input: Very soon the situation is going to become far more delicate and far more serious.
target: Sitiasion pou vinn pli delika e grav biento.

input: Member 1: The scientists are saying any old thing, talking the usual nonsense.
target: Manm 1: Bann siyantis pe rakont nenport, pe koz nenport.

input: I have scientists in my army who are willing to prove the opposite as long as we go along with them.
target: Mwa mo ena dan mo larme siyantis ki dispoze prouv lekontrer si nou fer zwer ar zot.

input: Member 2: Supposing it’s true, let’s use both science and technology to resolve the problem.
target: Manm 2: Asipoze li vre, anou servi siyans ek teknolozi pou rezoud problem la.

input: According to the experts, technology can’t fix the problems that technology created.
target: Dapre bann exper teknolozi, pa pe kapav bar sime problem ki teknolozi finn kree.

input: Technology has a solution for everything.
Chairperson: And yet, it hasn’t been able to put more marbles in your brain!
target: Cherpersonn: Pourtan li pa'nn reysi met enpe diplon dan to servo!

input: Our recent investments are all a washout.
target: Tou nou bann dernie envestisman pe tom dan dilo.

input: Member 12:  You’re too funny, Mr President.
target: Manm 12: Misie Prezidan, ou enn joker.

input: The seaside bungalows are almost all in the water, a real washout.
target: Bann vila piedanlo finn rant net dan dilo.

input: Chairperson: Number 12, stop being an idiot.
Chairperson: The buyers of the deluxe bungalows are claiming their rights.
target: Cherpersonn: Bann akerer vila delix pe fer valwar zot drwa.

input: In the contract, there’s a clause which says that if the water floods their property, then we, as sellers, must compensate them for damages.
target: Dan kontra ena enn kloz ki si dilo pa respekte zot propriyete, nou, vander vila, nou bizen dedomaz zot.

input: If we pay according to the leteter of the law, we'll be bankrupt.
target: Si nou ena pou pey konpansasion dapre lalwa, nou met fayit.

input: Member 12: There is a solution, Mr President, if you'll allow me.
target: Manm 12: Ena so solision, Misie Prezidan, si ou permet mwa.

input: Member 12: What if a bomb fell on our town and destroyed everything, would we have to pay any compensation?
target: Manm 12: Si koumadir enn bom tom lor nou lavil, kraz tou, ena konpansasion pou nou peye?

input: Member 7: Stop wasting our time, dickhead!
target: Manm 7: Aret fer ler do toutouk!

input: Member 9: There really ought to be a tax on talk.
target: Manm 9: Bizen met enn tax lor koze.

input: All: Yes! Yes! Yes! A tax on talk!
target: Zot tou: Wi! Wi! Wi! Enn tax lor koze!

input: Chairperson: The rising water is a natural disaster against which we've given our clients a guarantee, that’s why they put all their black money into our business.
target: Cherpersonn: Nivo dilo monte, sa li enn katastrof natirel kont lekel nou finn donn nou bann kliyan garanti pou ki zot met tou zot blakmoni dan nou biznes.

input: But a bomb, that’s not a natual disaster.
target: Me enn bom, li pa enn katastrof natirel.

input: Member 10: That’s what I was saying.
target: Manm 10: Samem mo ti pe dir.

input: There ought to be a tax on talk.
What if there’s a political solution.
In Danfour, we can find a sucker who’ll be able to do this for a little quick cash.
target: Dan Danfour ena enn ta ti kouyon ki pou enpe lamone pou dipoze fer travay la.

input: Chairperson: Look, we get a group of delinquents together, arm them, call them the Danfour Liberation Movement, and then give them what they need to blow up the waterfront bungalows.
target: Cherpersonn: Nou pran enn group delenkan, arm zot, apel zot Mouvman Liberasion Danfour, e donn zot materyel pou dinamit tou bann vila piedanlo.

input: Member 4: But there security cameras, the guards, the police patrols.
target: Manm 4: Be ena sirveyans kamera, gard sekirite, lapolis ki fer patrol.

input: Chairperson: The Surveillance, Safety and Security Company, we control the SSS.
target: Cherpersonn: Sosiete Sirveyans Ek Sekirite, SSS, li enn konpagni ki nou kontrole.

input: We'll instruct them to keep watch with their eyes closed.
target: Nou donn enstriksion sirveye lizie ferme.

input: I'll speak to the Chief Minister of the Autonomous Administration.  Autonomous!
target: Mo va koz ar Premie Administrater Otonom - Otonom!

input: Even the shirt on his back doesn’t belong to him!
target: Mem so semiz ki lor li pa pou li!

input: For one week, we’ll have the police patrol the hillsides instead.
target: Pandan enn semenn avoy lapolis al fer patrol lor kolinn.

input: Member 1: Isn’t what we’re planning a little drastic?
target: Manm 1: Li pa tro drastik seki nou pe rod fer?

input: Why don’t we just bulldoze the hills and use that earth to keep the sea at bay?
target: Kifer nou pa kraz bann kolinn pou konble lamer?

input: Chairperson: Haven’t you heard of global warming?
target: Cherpersonn: Zame finn tann global warming?

input: The melting of the North and South poles?
target: Pol Nor ek Pol Sid pe fonn?

input: If you build a dyke, the dyke will break.
target: Si zot konstrir ladig, ladig pou defonse.

input: Any anyway, our job isn’t to stop the water rising, it’s to maximise the profits of our shareholders, and right away.
target: Apre nou mision se pa aret lamonte dilo, nou devwar anver nou bann aksioner se maximem profi toutswit.

input: I make a motion that you give me the authority to carry out this plan.
target: Mo propoze ki zot donn mwa plen pouvwar pou fer sa louvraz la.

input: According to my information, the KaviRam Movement is becoming popular.
target: Dapre mo lenformasion, Mouvman KaviRam pe koumans vinn popiler.

input: I tried to buy off Dario Ravaton.
target: Mo finn sey aste Dario Ravaton.

input: Let’s kill two birds with one stone.
target: Enn kout ros, de zozo mor.

input: We’ll spread a rumour that an armed branch of KaviRam is destroying everything.
target: Nou fann rimer ki brans arme KaviRam pe detrir tou.

input: Member 2: But isn’t it a non-violent movement?
target: Manm 2: Pa enn mouvman non-violan sa?

input: Member 12: The bigger the lie, the more effective it is.
target: Manm 12: Pli enn mansonz gro pli li efikas.

input: We'll sling as much mud as possible.
target: Nou zet otan labou ki nou kapav.

input: The KaviRam people will try to remove as much as they can.
target: Bann KaviRam pou sey tir labou lor zot.

input: They can try and clean it, rub it off, wash it off, whatever they do, they'll still have some mud on them.
target: Souye, frote, lave ... Fer seki zot anvi, pou ena tras labou pou reste.

input: Chairperson: Hey, idiot, you’re not an idiot at all.
target: Cherpersonn: Zokris, to pa zokris ditou.

input: Where did you get this idea?
target: Kot to'nn gagn sa lide la?

input: Each gang will have only one mission, after which it will disappear.
target: Sak geng pou ena enn sel mision apre kwa li pou disparet.

input: There’ll be police investigations after each demolition, and they’ll result in shootouts at the hoodlums’ hideouts.
target: Pou ena lanket lapolis apre sak demolision ki pou fini par enn fiziyad kot bann bandi pou zwenn tase.

input: You should be running the country.
target: Ou ki ti bizen pe diriz sa pei la.

input: Chairperson: That time is not far off.
target: Cherpersonn: So ler pre pou vini.

input: In spite of its limited resources, our shelter, Papernoula, was able to help out about a dozen families.
target: Nou refiz, Papernoula, malgre resours limite, ti pe kapav ed enn dizenn fami.

input: When I was a little better, the membersasked me to look after the shelter full-time.
target: Kan mo ti degaze enpe bann manm ti dimann mwa okip refiz la foultaym.

input: This offer was a gift from God for me.
target: Pou mwa sa lof la ti enn kado Bondie.

input: My Mokshha took a form I would never have expected.
target: Mo Moksha ti pran enn form ki mo pa ti atann ditou.

input: I didn’t know how long I had left to live, but at least what little life I had left would have a clear direction and purpose.
target: Mo pa ti kone komie letan mo ti reste pou viv me sa tigit lavi ki ti reste ti ena enn direksion kler, enn sinifikasion prop.

input: In the yard outside the shelter we grew vegetables and raised chickens, rabbits and goats.
target: Nou ti pe servi later otour nou refiz pou kiltiv legim e pou fer lelvaz poul, lapen ek kabri.

input: But without the help of a philanthropist, we would not have been able to make ends meet, and those who were HIV-positive would not get any treatment.
target: Me san koudme enn filantrof nou pa ti pou kapav zwenn de bout, e bann seropozitif pa ti pou gagn tretman anti-retro-viral.

input: There were greedy financiers aplenty, but there was a handful of people who were troubled by the poverty of the people that the system threw into the rubbish dump.
target: Si ti ena finansie rapas anmazorite, ti ena enn pogne ki ti zene par lamizer dimoun ki sistem ti pe zet dan depotwar.

input: One day, the secretary of Mr Verylively, who had been financing our shelter, came to see us to ask if we would let his employer come over for a visit.
target: Enn zour sekreter Misie Robert Grangayar, ki ti pe finans nou refiz, ti vinn rann nou vizit pou dimann nou si nou ti pou aksepte vizit so patron.

input: He believed in doing charity because, for him, giving to the poor was like lending to God.
target: Li ti kwar dan sarite parski pou li kan donn dimoun pov se koumadir nou pe pret Bondie.

input: But once I told him that it’s not charity that would save us but economic power, he became uneasy.
target: Me ler mo ti dir li ki se pa sarite ki pou sov nou me pouvwar ekonomik li ti tike.
Li pa ti paret pe konpran.

input: “You don’t want me to help you?”
No, don’t misunderstand us, Mr Robert.
target: Non, pa mal konpran nou Misie Robert.

input: Your help is precious indeed, but it doesn’t help us stand on our own feet.
target: Ou led li plis ki presie me li pa permet nou dibout lor nou lipie.

input: I am accustomed to thinking in a particular way, but now it seems there’s another way of.
target: Mo finn abitie pans enn manier me la koumadir ena enn lot.

input: No, I’m sorry, I'm the one who isn’t explaining it properly.
target: Non, pardon, mwa ki pa konn koze.

input: I really appreciate your coming here.
target: Mo extra apresie ou prezans isi.

input: Do come see us whenever you have time.
target: Vinn get nou kan ou gagn letan.
Mo ena plis ki bizen me.

input: You know, people in my family, they think differently.
target: Ou kone dimoun dan mo klan, zot pans enn lot manier.

input: I no longer know what to think, since.
target: Mwa mo nepli kone ki pou panse depi ki.
Enn lot fwa mo dir ou.

input: Ever since that day, his contributions increased and his visits became more frequent.
target: Depi sa zour la so kontribision ti ogmante e so vizit ti pli frekan.

input: He needed us just as much as we needed him.
target: Li ti bizen nou kouma nou ti bizen li.

input: Was this alliance natural, or unnatural?
target: Enn lalians natirel ousa kont natir?

input: I thought it was quite normal, but there were badmouthers who were slinging mud.
target: Mwa mo ti trouv li normal me ti ena lagel sal ki ti pe zet labou.

input: I found flowers from the flame-trees at the end of the lane and on the edge of the ravine, once again.
target: Ankor enn fwa mo trouv fler depi pie flanbwayan dan fon lenpas dan bor presipis.

input: There was a lot of violence in Danfour, as well as in Uni-City.
target: Boukou violans dan Danfour kouma dan Siti-Ini.

input: News spread of seaside bungalows in Uni-City being bombed and exploding one after the other, and of gunfights between the police and ‘terrorists’, who were dying in droves.
target: Nouvel ti pe sirkile ki bann vila piedanlo ti pe eklate kout bom enn par enn e partou ti ena kout fizi ant lapolis ek 'teroris', ki ti pe mor par grap.

input: Many of the young people who had gotten in on the plan hatched by the Chairperson of FoulousPlennti and his accomplices ended up dead.
target: Boukou zenes ki ti rant dan lak Cherpersonn ek so bann konplis, ti zwenn lamor.

input: In Danfour, there was a different kind of violence.
target: Dan Danfour ti ena enn lot kalite violans.

input: The victims were usually women and children.
target: Bann viktim violans ti sirtou bann fam ek zanfan.

input: It was as if the stress and frustration made people dump their crap on the weak and defenseless.
target: Andire ler ena gran stres ek fristrasion, dimoun rod pli feb ki li pou vomi so malez.

input: The Papernoula shelter received many more requests for help from.
target: Ti ena boukou plis demann led dan refiz Papernoula.

input: Without Robert’s help we could never have survived.
target: San koudme Robert nou pa ti pou kapav zwenn de bout.

input: One day, a car stopped outside the shelter and the driver got down and handed me an envelope.
target: Enn zour enn loto ti aret divan nou refiz e sofer la ti amenn enn lanvlop pou mwa.

input: It was a letter from Robert inviting me to come to his place for dinner.
target: Ti enn let Robert ki ti envit mwa vinn dine kot li.

input: I hesitated, unsure what I shoud do.
target: Mo ti pe ezite, pa sir ki mo ti bizen fer.

input: I asked my friends what they thought and they all advised me to go.
target: Mo ti dimann konsey bann kamarad e zot tou ti konsey mwa ale.

input: That night, Robert’s car came to fetch me.
target: Sa swar la loto Robert ti vinn sers mwa.

input: I felt antsy in his house but Robert did whatever he could to put me at ease.
target: Mo ti pe gagn gos dan so domenn me Robert ti pe fer tou pou met mwa alez.

input: Sita, there’s something I have to tell you.
target: Sita, mo bien bizen dir ou kiksoz.

input: I don’t have long to live.
target: Mo pa ena boukou zour pou viv.

input: I have cancer and soon I’m going to ask my doctor to put me to sleep.
target: Mo ena enn kanser e biento mo pou dimann mo dokter andormi mwa.

input: Would you sit by me when the time comes?
target: Eski ou kapav asiz kot mwa ler sa arive?

input: I had two children, a girl and a boy, they would have been your age.
target: Mo ti ena de zanfan, enn tifi ek enn garson, zot ti pou ena mem laz ki ou zordi.

input: I have a lot of money, an empire.
target: Mo ena boukou kas, enn lanpir.

input: but today I have no-one to hold my hand as I take my last steps, no-one besides you.
target: Zordi peyna personn pou trap mo lame ler mo fer mo dernie pa apart ou.

input: Sita, what I’m asking of you is against the law.
target: Sita, li ilegal seki mo pe dimann ou.

input: I don’t have long to live either.
target: Mwa osi mo peyna lontan pou viv.

input: One day they’ll find a cure.
target: Enn zour pou dekouver so remed.

input: I have something else to tell you.
target: Mo ena enn deziem zafer pou dir ou.

input: I’ve decided to bequeath my empire.
target: Mo pe fer enn don mo lanpir finansie.

input: The principal beneficiary will be Papernoula.
My lawyer has already prepared the legal papers.
target: Mo avoka finn fini prepar bann dokiman legal.
Li pou explik ou tou bann detay.

input: There was a nice spread, but I’d lost my appetite.
target: Ti ena bon manze me mo pa ti fen ditou.

input: The next day I asked Ratna, Dario, Bala and Gerard to come meet me on an urgent matter.
target: Lelandime mo ti dimann Ratna, Dario, Bala ek Gerard vinn zwenn mwa pou enn zafer irzan.

input: They thought my health had gotten worse.
target: Zot ti kwar mo bien malad.

input: When I told them about the Father Christmas, their jaws fell open.
target: Ler mo ti donn zot nouvel Bonomnwel zot ti kwak.

input: We all worried about only one thing.
target: Nou tou ti per enn sel kiksoz.

input: Easy money might make us leave the straight and narrow, and there was the real danger that opportunists would descend on us en masse.
target: Lamone fasil ti kapav fasilman fer nou devie e ti ena danze ki bann roderdeler ti pou borde anmas.
Nivo lamer ti pe kontinie monte.
Enn saler torid ti pe bril partou.

input: The elderly and infants were among the first victims.
target: Bann vie ek bann baba ti parmi bann premie viktim.

input: Then, after a long drought, there were torrential rains.
target: Apre enn long peryod lasesres, enn lapli toransiel ti koumans tonbe.

input: Several violent cyclones passed over the island and the drenched earth could no longer take any water.
target: Plizier siklonn violan ti pas lor lil e later rasazie nepli ti kapav absorb dilo.

input: There were landslides and building began to crumble.
target: Teren ti koumans glise; bann imeb ti pe grene.

input: The landslides were sometimes spectacular, almost as if there was an earthquake.
target: Glisman teren ti parfwa spektakiler parski ti ena parfwa koumadir enn tranblemandeter.

input: Between the sea and the hillside there was now a canal through which small boats could navigate.
target: Ant lamer ek kolinn ti ena aster enn kanal ase profon pou bann ti navir navige.
Topografi nou rezion ti sanze net.

input: The natural surroundings had been martyred, it was as if a giant was shaking the dust off his coat and adjusting his body.
target: Lanatir martirize, koumadir enn zean ki ti pe sakouy lapousier lor so manto, ti pe redesinn so lekor.

input: The recession spread its tentacles everywhere.
target: Resesion ti fann so lapat ourit partou.

input: In Danfour too there were problems, but they weren't as serious.
target: Dan Danfour si ti ena difikilte me pa ti osi grav.

input: Two good things were happening there.
target: De kiksoz pozitif ti pe ariv laba.

input: First of all, the lay of the land was a plus because there was now a direct link between Danfour and the sea.
target: Premie dabor nouvo topografi ti vinn favorab parski aster ti ena enn lien direk ant li ek lamer.

input: Second, the stress-free muddling along, with people looking after Nature which looked after people—rather than people trample all over Nature—meant that a less drastic situation developed.
target: Deziemman sistem debrouy-debrouye san tro stres kot dimoun ti pe okip lanatir ki ti pe okip dimunn olie dimoun fer dominer ar lanatir, ti permet devlopman enn sitiasion pa tro drastik.

input: In spite of widespread death and destruction, it was still possible for people to have a relatively manageable life.
target: Malgre boukou lamor ek destriksion ti ena pou dimoun kreatif posibilite enn lekzistans pa tro difisil.

input: On the other hand, the situation in Uni-City was catastrophic.
target: Me lot kote, sitiasion dan Siti-Ini ti katastrofik.

input: It was as if Nature had an account to settle, and it was settling it with a vengeance.
target: Koumadir lanatir ti ena enn kont pou regle e li ti regle li san pitie.

input: When the youth in Danfour realised just how vulnerable Uni-City was, they descended upon it and looted the stores and the bungalows that had been abandoned or were in ruins.
target: Kan bann zenn dan Danfour ti realize ki kantite Siti-Ini ti vilnerab zot ti fer bann lennding, devaliz bann magazen ek bann vila abandone ou andetres.

input: It was impossible not to prevent chaos from reigning.
Private security, the police, nothing worked.
target: Sekirite prive, lapolis, nanye pa ti pe marse.

input: When it became clear that Uni-City was going to end up like Pompeii, the economic and political leaders made a hasty retreat.
target: Kan li ti kler ki Siti-Ini ti pou fini kouma Pompei, bann dirizan ekonomik ek politik ti ris zot kales.

input: Their money wasn't there anyway, it was in banks overseas.
target: Tou manier zot fortinn pa ti dan pei me dan bann labank lot kote dilo.

input: But those in the middle class, the ones who had been fed by the silver spoons of Providence, now had to find a lifeline fast.
target: Me dimoun klas mwayen ki ti pe manz dan avek kwiyer arzan dan Providans ti oblize rod enn boue sovtaz anplas.

input: They quickly began to understand the need for solidarity with those experiencing hardship, not because they felt the sudden need to be philanthropic but because it was the only way for them to save their lives.
target: Zot ti koumans konpran nesesite solidarite ar dimoun dan difikilte pa parski zot ti vinn filantropik me parski li ti sel fason pou zot sap zot lavi.

input: You see, Ratna, these types will want to find a way to whitewash themselves.
target: To trouve Ratna, sa bann la zot pou rod ris dra lor zot.

input: Then it’s just a question of not letting them into KaviRam.
target: Nek ena pou pa les zot rant dan KaviRam.

input: Don’t forget, among them are doctors, engineers, teachers, lawyers.
target: Pa bliye parmi zot ena dokter, enzenier, profeser, avoka.
Nou bizen sa bann dimoun la.

input: How are we going to stop them from lording it over us?
target: Kouma pou anpes zot fer zot fanor?

input: We have to organise the farmers, artisans and fishermen into co-ops which they run.
target: Bizen organiz bann planter, elver, artizan, peser dan bann korperativ kot zot ki kontrole.

input: We have to be very vigilant.
Most importantly, we mus not repeat our earlier mistake: just thinking about filling pockets.
target: Sirtou bizen pa refer mem erer ki avan: nek pans plen pos.

input: A habitat of several thousand souls would have to be rebuilt with very limited resources.
target: Ti pou ena pou rekonstrir enn abitat pou plizier milie dimoun ar resours limite.

input: The countries and neighbouring regions that might have been able to help us were worse off than we were.
target: Bann pei ek rezion ki ti kapav ed nou ti pli dan pens ki nou.

input: We had to depend on our own strengths.
target: Nou ti ena pou depann lor nou prop lafors.

input: Bala liked to say that we were against radical change.
target: Bala ti kontan dir ki nou ti kont sanzman radikal.

input: That change was acceptable as long as it was in the same direction as before.
target: Sanzman ti akseptab zis si li ti al dan mem direksion ki avan.

input: Now, change outside our control had forced us to change our very orientation.
target: Me aster sanzman andeor nou kontrol ti obliz nou sanz nou oryantasion.

input: We had to re-invent our future, re-draw the contours of a new tomorrow.
target: Ti bizen envant lavenir, redesinn kontour nouvo dime.
Nou tou nou ti dan lenpas.

input: Would the flame-trees bloom this year?
target: Eski flanbwayan ti pou fleri sa lane la?

input: What folklore is and why we collect it.
target: Ki folklore ete e kifer nu ramas li.

input: All Mauritians, as well as visitors to Mauritius, know about the sega, the intense, exciting, hip-swinging dance, which combines African and Indian elements.
target: Tu Morisyen, osi byen ki dimunn ki vizit Moris, kone lor sega, sa danse intans, palpitan, kas lerin, ki melanz eleman Afrikin e Indyin.

input: When the word folklore is mentioned,the sega is what many people think of.
target: Kan mansyonn folklor, dimunn mazinn sega.

input: They connect it with another way of life which is bound to disappear, if it hasn’t disappeared already.
target: Zot liye li ar enn ansyin manyer de viv ki pe al disparet, si li pa finn deza fini disparet.

input: A 1972 newspaper photograph showed cane cutters with a caption, “C'est le passé qui revient, c’est une facon de vivre.”
target: Ena enn foto dan lagazet 1972 montre bann kuper kann, e anba li ena lezand, "C’est le passé qui revient c'est une facon de vivre".

input: Cane cutting and cane cutters are still with us.
target: Lakup kann e kuper kann ankor tuzur lamem.

input: As to the sega,people in Mauritius have been declaring it dead or dying since 1830.
target: Konsernan sega, dimunn Moris finn deklar li mor ubyin dir kumkwa li agonizan depi 1830.

input: Charles Baissac, the Mauritian folklorist, confidently predicted in the 1880’s that the sega would disappear.
target: Eharles Baissae,folklorist Morisyen ti predir avek sertitid dan bann lane 1880 ki sega pou disparet.

input: Fortunately, it hasn’t disappeared, though it has undergone some changes.
target: Erezman li pa finn disparet, li finn konn sanzman, selman.

input: Another view of folklore sees it as all the kinds of artistic communicating which people do in their lives.
target: Ena enn lot fason trouv folklore se kouma tou kalite fason kominike avek enn sertin lar, ki dimunn pratike dan zot lavi.

input: Folklore in Mauritius,in this view, includes a great deal more than the sega and is performed by many more people than poor labourers.
target: Folklore dan Moris, anfet inklir buku plis ki sega e li pratike par buku plis dimunn ki laburer pov.

input: Storytelling,dancing, games, riddling, singing, healing, and telling jokes are all forms of folklore.
target: Rakont zistwar,danse, zwe, zedmo, devinet, sante, servi latizann, fer pas, fer jok, tusala form parti dan folklor.

input: They are activities which a family, a group of friends, or a community engage in.
target: Zot bann aktivite ki enn fami, enn group kamarad, ou enn group abitan fer.

input: This is what folklore means in this book: a form of communication, which all people engage in.
target: Ala seki folklor oule dir dan sa liv-la: enn form kominikasyon, kot tu dimunn angaz zot ladan.

input: Usually they communicate folklore face to face, but they can do it in writing (traditional prayers and sayings), by telephone (greeting and leave-taking formulas), radio (singing and storytelling), or television (festivals and celebrations).
target: Normalman zot kominik folklor fas a fas, me kapav fer li an ekri (lapriyer ek panse tradisyonel), par telefonn (formil ou swe ek lanons lamor), lor radyo (sante e rakont zistwar) ubyen televizyon (festival e seremoni).

input: Myths, folktales, legends, riddles, proverbs, sayings, oaths, charms, blessings and teases are examples of verbal folklore (folklore in words).
target: Mit, zistwar lontan, lezand, zedmo, devinet, proverb, panse, serman, konpliman, benediksyon ek sikane, zot diferan lexanp folklor verbal folklor an parol.

input: When verbal folklore focuses on the events or not able people ofthe past, it is often called oral traditions.
target: Kan folklor verbal met laksan lor dimunn koni dan lepok lontan, lerla ena tandans apel li tradisyon oral.

input: Other forms, partly involving words, are folksong (part words, part music), beliefs, superstitions, customs, dances, plays and games.
target: Ena osi lezot form folklor ki selman anparti parol, kuma santé folklorik (anparti parol, anparti lamizik), krwayans, siperstisyon, kutim, danse, drama ek zwe.

input: Some physical movements or gestures are the common property of a group and are thus folklore.
target: Sertin muvman lekor ubyen lexpresyon zot enn dibyen kolektif pou enn group, donk zot osi, zot folklor.

input: Ways of dressing, especially on ceremonial occasions, ways of building houses, tools used in farming or work, vessels used in cooking, furniture, foods, decorations and folk art, are also kinds of folklore.
target: Fason abiye,sirtu alokazyon bann seremoni, fason ranz lakaz, zuti servi pu plantasyon ek dan travay, resipyan lakuzinn, meb, manze, dekorasyon e lar popiler, zot usi bann kalite folkior.

input: One way in which people make use of folklore is to strengthen their sense of belonging to a group.
target: Enn rol ki folklor ena se pu ranforsi zot apartenans a enn group.

input: People who tell stories in Bhojpuri, say proverbs in Hakka, or carry out local religious observances in Tamil are confirming their membership in their group, almost unconsciously.
target: Dimunn ki rakont zistwar an Bhojpuri, dir proverb an Haka, ubyen ki gard karem relizye Tamil, pe konfirm zot apartenans dan zot grup preske inkonsyaman.

input: Children learn what it is to be an Indo-Mauritian, a Sino-Mauritian, or a Franco-Mauritian by learning the ways, proverbs, riddles, and stories of the group.
target: Zanfan aprann ki vedir enn Indo-Morisyen, enn Sino-Morisyen ou enn Franko-Morisyen atraver bann fason, bann proverb, zedmo, e zistwar lor sa group-la.

input: It is like learning a language.
Another use of folklore is to control behavior.
target: Enn lot rol folklor ena se pou kontrol konportman dimunn.

input: Proverbs, songs and folktales symbolically communicate the message that certain behaviour is approved and other behavior is not approved.
target: Proverb, sante e zistwar lontan, byen souvan kominik dan enn fason sinbolik, mesaz ki sertin konportman li akseptab e lezot pa akseptab.

input: For instance, a folktale about a girl who refuses all suitors and then marries a wolf-man points to what can happen to a girl who marries without her parents’ approval.
target: Par exanp, enn zistwar ki rakont lor enn tifi ki refiz tu pretandan e lerla al marye ek enn lugaru pe montre seki riske ariv enn tifi ki marye san benediksyon so paran.

input: A third use of folklore is to give a dignified and powerful character to the past and present of the group.
target: Enn trwazyem rol folklor se li donn lepase ek leprezan enn pep ubyen enn group so valer diyn ek pwisan.

input: An example is the legend of the pearl island, which comes out of the Ramayana and which connects Mauritius to India.
target: Enn lexanp, lezand Lil Perl, ki sorti depi Ramayana, li liye Moris ar Lend.

input: Rama has been exiled and is living peacefully in the forest with his wife Sita and younger brother Lakshman.
target: Rama finn exile e pe viv dan byen dan lafore ansam ek so fam, Sita, ek so ti frer, Lakshman.

input: Then Surpankha, the sister of Ravana, appears and wishes to marry the princes Rama and Lakshman.
target: Lerla ser Ravana, Surpankha, aparet e li anvi marye ar Prins Rama ek Prins Lakshman.

input: She attacks Sita, and Lakshman slices off her nose and ears.
target: Li atak Sita, e Lakshman kup so nene ek so zorey.

input: Then her brothers Kahar and Dushan attempt to counterattack and are killed by Rama.
target: Lerla Surpankha so de frer, Khar ek Dushan, sey kont-atake e Rama tuy zot.

input: Surpankha’s brother Ravana consults the magician Mareech, who transforms himself into a deer, approaches Sita, and is shot by Rama.
target: Ravana, frer Surpankha, al pran konsey ar mazisyin Mareeeh, ki transform li an serf, li apros Sita, e Rama tuy li kut fizi.

input: Mareech’s corpse changes into different sized pearls, which Rama throws southward.
target: Lekor Mareeeh transforme an but-but perl diferan grander ki Rama avoy anler dan direksyon Sid.

input: The pearls fall in the Indian Ocean and grow into islands there.
target: Bann perl tom dan Losean Indyin e vinn bann Lil.

input: One of those islands is Mauritius.
target: Enn parmi sa bann Lil-la se Moris.

input: In the legend, Mauritius is said to be spiritually connected to India.
target: Dan sa lezand-la, ti dir ki Moris ena enn lyen spirityel ar Lend.

input: Naturally, not everyone in Mauritius will feel or should feel that connection, but anyone can see how the legend makes the link between the countries.
target: Natirelman pa tu dimunn dan Moris ki pu neseserman resanti ni zot pa bizin resanti sa lyin-la, me nerport kisannla kapav truve kimanyer lezand-la fer enn lyen ant sa de pei la.

input: One way of seeing folklore around you, therefore, is to look for things people do that strengthen their sense of belonging.
target: Enn fason pu get folklor otur u se pu rod tu kitsoz dimunn fer ki ranforsi zot santiman apartenans.

input: Mauritians should begin to look at their own folklore, simply because it is their own and it is valuable.
target: Morisyen bizin kumans pran kont so prop folklor pu enn rezon byen sinp, akoz li apartenir a nu, e akoz li ena gran, gran valer.

input: Folklore and oral traditions should be recorded and preserved in Mauritius for their own worth and for their use in understanding and advancing the nation.
target: Folklor e tradisyon oral bizin anrezistre e preserve dan Moris akoz zot ena enn valer instrinzik, e osi pu zot itilite pu nu konpran nu pei e nu lepep, e pu nu fer nu pei buz divan.

input: Cultural activities like storytelling and singing of traditional songs exist all through life.
target: Aktivite kuma rakont zistwar ek sant santé tradisyonel existe tut long sakenn so lavi.

input: Folktale, oral tradition, and folksong are found among the richest people as among the poorest.
target: Zistwar lontan, tradisyon oral ek sante folklorik zot existe osi byin parmi dimunn pli ris ki parmi dimunn pli mizer.

input: The beauty of a tale or song, like the beauty of a bracelet near a pot, comes out of the qualities we see in it.
target: Bote enn zistwar ubyen enn sante, li kuma bote enn brasle pre ar  enn po later: li kalite ki nu truve ladan.

input: The story or song makes us feel a certain way.
target: Zistwar-la ubyen sante-la fer nu santi kiksoz.

input: It reminds us of old times.
target: Li fer nu rapel lepok lontan.

input: It should make us proud to be who we are.
target: Li ti bizin osi fer nu fyer ki nu seki nu ete.

input: When we listen to a folktale or dance a sega, it arouses our feelings and emotions.
target: Kan nu ekut enn zistwar lontan ubyin kan nu dans sega, li evey nu santiman e nu lemosyon.

input: So the primary value of Mauritian folklore is that it is emotionally important to us, dear to us.
target: Donk valer prinsipal folklor Morisyen se lefe ki li permet nu epannwir dan tu nu lemosyon, lefe ki li presye pu nu.

input: In order for us to have these experiences available to our children and their children, traditions must be preserved.
target: Pu ki sa bann lexperyans-la kapav ala dispozisyon nu zanfan ek zot zanfan, nu bizin rod enn fason prezerv sa bann tradisyon-la.

input: This doesn’t mean they must always be practiced.
target: Sa pa ule dir ki zot oblize pratik sa bann.

input: It means they must be recorded, so that our children can know about their traditions and decide what they want to preserve.
target: Li vedir ki bizin anrezistre zot, pu ki nu zanfan kapav konn lor zot tradisyon e deside ki zot anvi garde.

input: That is why tales, songs, riddles, proverbs, house types, clothes, ways of cookery and pieces of folk art deserve your attention.
target: Ala kifer zistwar, sante, zedmo, proverb, kalite lakaz, linz,fason kwi manze ek morso lar popiler merit nu latansyon.

input: Though new folklore is constantly being created, many Mauritians today feel their past to be slipping out of reach.
target: Mem si ena nuvo folklor ki pe kree konstaman, buku Morisyen zordi santi ki zot pe perdi kontak avek zot lepase, li pe glise, ale.

input: Since independence,‘Mauritius has seen many changes and new prosperity.
target: Depi lindepandans firm ena buku Sanzman e nuvo prosperite dan Moris.

input: Some people feel nostalgic about their past.
target: Ena dimunn santi nostalzik pu zot lepase.

input: Their attitude is justified by the fact that here as everywhere in the world, individual items of folklore do die out.
target: Zot latitid li zistifye par lefet ki isi, kuma partu dan lemond dayer, sak item folklor, li anfet al teyn.

input: When the British antiquary Thomas coined the word folklore in 1846, he felt this same nostalgia about British “manners, customs, observances, superstitions, ballads, proverbs, etc. of the olden time".
target: Kan Thomas, enn antiker Britanik ti invant sa mo folklor-1a an 1846, li ti santi samem nostalzi pu disparisyon "kutim, seremoni, siperstisyon, balad, proverb, Britanik lontan”.

input: Moreover, the attitude that culture is endangered has helped to bring into existence the funds and the institutional support for field research.
target: Anplis, sa latitid kumkwa kiltir andanze disparet, li tinn ede pu kree bann fon ek enpe sutyin institisyonel pu resers lor terin.

input: The Ministry of Cultural Affairs has directed the Mahatma Gandhi institute, as well as other institutions, to retrieve elements of ancestral culture which are fast disappearing.
target: Minister Kiltir finn donn direktiv Mahatma Gandhi Institute, ek lezot linstitisyon, pu rode e rekiper bann eleman kiltir lepok lontan ki pe disparet byin vit.

input: Perhaps in the future, the Mahatma Gandhi Institute will create and archive for the materials you collect.
target: Li posib ki dan lavenir Mahatma Gandhi Institute pu met dibut enn arsiv bann materyel ki u ramase.

input: Is this effort simply a form of communalism?
target: Eski sa travay-la li tu sinpleman enn form kominalis?

input: Rather it means being committed to revealing the full humanity and artistry of every person and group in Mauritius.
target: Pu li ule dir plito enn langazman pu dekuver valer an term limanite ek an term kapasite artistik, sak individi ek sak grup dimunn dan Moris.

input: It means finding and alternative to the growing sameness of modern life.
target: Li vedir rod enn alternativ fas a iniformite grandisan lavi modern.

input: Clothes, food, language, work, and tastes in Mauritius are becoming more and more alike.
target: Labiyman, manze, langaz, travay, e bann gu pe vinn deplizanpli parey dan Moris.

input: Mauritians are free to decide whether to preserve or let go of traditional clothes, traditional foods, or traditional proverbs.
target: Bann Morisyen lib pu deside pu prezerv ubyin les disparet linz tradisyonel, manze tradisyonel ubyen proverb tradisyonel.

input: But they should make their choices on the basis of a knowledge of tradition, not on ignorance.
target: Me vomye nu pran nu desizyon lor baz konesans plito ki delapar linyorans.

input: Going back to old proverbs or sayings, hearing old songs again, or remembering family stories can remind one that the differences between groups of people mean a great deal, than that all groups in Mauritius have a history worth knowing.
target: Kan nu tann vye proverb ubyen panse lontan, kan nu ekut sante lontan u rapel zistwar ki ti pe rakonte an fami, sa rekoleksyon la kapav fer nu reflesi lor sinifikasyon bann diferans ant diferan grup dimunn, e fer nu konsyan ki tu grup dimunn ena enn listwar ki vo lapenn kone.

input: This field manual is a tool of such retrieval.
target: Sa liv itiliter-la li enn zuti pu sa kalite travay-la.
Kisannla sa bann dimunn ki kree folklor?

input: What groups do this artistic communication called folklore?
target: Ki grup ki fer sa kalite kominikasyon artistik ki nu apel folklor?

input: All people who make known to one another their thoughts, feelings, knowledge, and hopes - that is, all groups,whether they are families, clans, villages, roomfuls of factory workers or cane cutters, politicians, estate managers.
target: Tu dimunn ki partaz antre-zot zot refleksyon, zot santiman, zot konesans, zot lespwar - setadir tu grup, ki li enn grup familyal, ann klan, enn vilaz, ann lasam ranpli ar travayer lizinn u laburer kann, enn grup politisyin, enn grup manejer.

input: All these groups are made up of persons who communicate with one another face to face over time.
target: Tu sa bann grup-la konpoze de dimunn ki kominike antre zot fas a fas pandan enn sertin tan.

input: One of their kinds of communication is "folklore event" - a single telling of a story, performance of a custom, or preparation of a traditional meal.
target: Si u pran enn sel parmi zot bann kominikasyon, li ann “avennman folklor" — rakont enn sel zistwar, fer ann sistem done, par kutim, ubyen prepar enn repa tradisyonel.

input: A folklore event is that moment when a person A says or does an action B for the other person C in the presence of the audience D.
target: Enn evenman folklor li sa moman kan ann dimunn A dir ubyin fer enn aksyon B pu ann lot dimunn E an prezans lodyans D.

input: A,B,C, and D (however many they are) are the participants in the event.
target: A, B, E, D (nerport ki zot nomb), zot partisipan dan evennman-la.

input: Of course, score of the persons in C and D may be outsiders, more or less (I think of the huge numbers of guests at a Hindu wedding).
target: Byinsir ann parti dimunn dan C ubyen dan D kapav andeor (mo pans sa kantite invite dan maryaz Indu).

input: Folklore events happen again and again.
target: Evennman fo1klor, zot arive, zot re-arive ankor.

input: Some features remain the same, others are different.
target: Sertin eleman res parey, lezot diferan.

input: The folklorist observes and records these sameness and differences.
target: Bann folklorist obzerv ek rikord sa resanblans ek diferans la.

input: In modern Mauritian life, everyone is a member of more than one folk group.
target: Dan lavi modern Moris, sak dimunn li manb plizyer grup folklor.

input: To begin, everyone speaks more than one language, whether Creole, Bhojpuri, French, English, Hindi, or Tamil.
target: Pu kumanse, tu dimunn koz plis ki enn langaz, ki li Kreol Morisyen, Bhojpuri, Franse, Angle, Inndi ubyen Tamil.

input: Thus members of some Mauritian groups are linked by their languages.
target: Donk bann manb sertin grup Morisyen ini ant zot atraver langaz ki zot koze.

input: Other linking factors are their geographical region and their religion.
target: Lezot fakter inifikater se zot rezyon zeografik ubyen zot relizyon.

input: Every family is also a folk group with tradition of its own.
target: Sak fami, li osi enn grup folklor avek so prop tradisyon.

input: Also, an especially rich group for folklore study is members Of the same occupation — sugar estate, docks, school.
target: Enn grup spesyalman ris pu letid folklor se dimunn ki exzers enn mem metye — travayer tablisman, travayer lepor, anplwaye dan lekol.

input: People who are connected by their place and conditions of work always develop traditions of their own.
target: Dimunn ki liye par zot plas e kondisyon travay tultan devlop zot prop tradisyon.

input: So far, we know little about Mauritian occupational folklore.
target: Ziska ler nu konn byen tigit lor folklore Morisyen dan sayt travay.

input: A study of the sayings, speech, stories, and customs characteristic of Port Louis dock workers, the police, or the Special Mobile Force would show how important folklore is in defining groups.
target: Enn letid lor bann koze, zistwar ek kutim ki karakteriz diferan sekter travay kuma travayer lepor Port Louis, ubyen polisye, ubyen bann Mobile Force, pu ede pu montre kimanyer folklor inportan pu definir sa bann diferan grup.

input: A folk group always has its own stories or customs.
target: Enn grup dimunn ki ansam pandan enn sertin tan, li tultan ena so prop zistwar ek so prop kutim.

input: These are common property within the group, but not outside.
target: Samem dibyen kolektif sa grup la, e li pa apartenir ar dimunn ki andeor sa grup-la.

input: They keep reappearing in more or less the same words or the stone form.
target: Zot kontinyelman reaparet avek plizir mem parol ubyen mem form.

input: If you recognise yourself in these groups, it is probably because all persons in their lifetime pass through a number of folk groups.
target: Kan u pe lir sa, si u rekonet u-mem dan enn sa bann kalite grup—la, li tutafe normal, akoz tu dimunn dan kur nu lavi, nu travers dan enn sertin nomb diferan grup folklor.

input: You could begin your collecting of folklore just there.
target: U kapav kumans u travay kolekte folklor lamem.

input: Try observing the people around you to discover what folk groups they belong to now, or in the past.
target: U ena pu sey observ dimunn otur de u pu dekuver dan ki grup folklor zot apartenir zordi, ubyin linn apartenir dan lepase.

input: This idea itself would be worthy of study.
target: Sa lide la limem vo lapenn etidye.

input: Ask yourself or your family: Do you know people who practice old-time curing or other such customs?
target: Dimann u-mem ubyen enn dimunn dan u fami: Eski u konn dimunn ki konn "fer pas" ubyen fer kiksoz similer?

input: What’s your attitude towards them and what they do?
target: Ki u latitid vizavi sa dimunn la ek vizavi seki zot fer?

input: Do you know people who look down on traditional ways of curing or healing?
target: Eski u konn dimunn ki mepriz dimunn ki "fer pas", ki geri metod tradisyonel?
Lezot vye kutim ki dimunn rakonte?

input: What do people tell you about customary behaviour that started many years ago, but that is not done nowadays?
target: Ki dimunn rakonte lor kutim ki ti ena lontan lontan, me ki nepli fer zordi?

input: These questions will make you wonder about how the users of folklore themselves think about their material.
target: Sa bann kestyon—la pu fer u mazine lor seki dimunn ki itiliz folklor zot—mem panse lor zot materyel.

input: What ideas do the storyteller think his story points to?
target: Dimann enn rakonter zistwar ki li panse lor moral so prop zistwar?

input: What does he think the story means?
target: Ki li panse zistwar-la so sinifikasyon?
Ki konportman zistwar la pe ankuraze?

input: The idea that folklore can be found mostly among ignorant or uneducated people is wrong.
target: Li enn fos lide pu panse ki se sirtu parmi dimunn innyoran ubyen seki mank ledikasyon ki kapav truv folklor.

input: The idea that folklore means ignorance, illiteracy, and savage customs is also wrong.
target: Lide ki folklor vedir linnyoraris, analfabetism, kutim sovaz, sa usi li fos.

input: Literate, highly cultivated people also belong to folk groups.
target: Dimunn letre, byin kiltive usi apartenir a bann kategori folklore.

input: Because all persons belong to folk groups, all persons participate in folklore.
target: Akoz tu dimunn apartenir a bann kategori folkgrup, tou dimunn partisip dan folklor.

input: In the past people did not know that.
target: Dan lepase dimunn pa ti konn sa.

input: During colonial times, European governments taught colonised people that foreign languages, customs, beliefs and culture were natural and right, and that their old ways were unnatural and wrong.
target: Pandan lepok kolonyal bann guvernman Eropein ti montre dimunn kolonize ki langaz, kutim, kwrayans ek kiltir etranze ki natirel e bon, e ki zot ansyen fason fer, li pa ti natirel e li ti move.

input: Today, there is no basis for believing that Mauritian culture is hybrid, or deteriorated, or degenerate.
target: Zordi pena okenn baz pu panse ki kiltir Morisyen li ibrid ubyen deteiyore, ubyen dezenere.

input: Some of this country’s customs and art originated in India, Africa, or China and migrated here.
target: Sertin kutim dan pei e sertin kalite ar li sorti Lend, Lafrik, ubyen Lasinn e li finn travers lamer, linn vinni.

input: Mauritian songs, tales,and customs are wise, witty, and beautiful.
target: Sante, zistwar, e kutim Morisyen zot saz, zot perspikas e zot zoli.

input: They need only to be recorded and published for the world to acknowledge their beauty.
target: Bizin zis rikord zot, pibliye zot, pu ki lemond antye rekonet zot bote.

input: Mauritian folklore also has a value in building the nation.
target: Folklor Morisyen ena usi so valer dan konstriksyon lanasyon.

input: By revealing people’s ideas of good and bad and identifying the parts of their life about which they have bad feelings, folklore gives us the finest information about what is important to them.
target: Folklor li demontre lide ki enn grup dimunn ena lor seki bon seki move, e li osi idantifye seki fer sa grup la gayn move santiman, e atraver sa, folklor donn nu linformasyon pli ratine lor seki inportan pu sa lepep-la.

input: Culture,says the Ministry of Education, Arts and Culture, "means the preservation of local assets and the understanding, appreciation and adoption of universal values."
target: Minister Ledikasyon, Lar e Kiltir dir ki "Kiltir vedir prezervasyon bann aki lokal e konpreansyon, apresasyon ek adopsyon valer iniversel".

input: It means also the clever and beautiful ways which people have found to solve problems that come up over and over for everyone.
target: Li osi vedir fason intelizan e zoli ki dimunn finn truve pu rezud bann problem ki vini ek revini pu sak dimunn, e pu tu dimunn.

input: The problem all Mauritians have faced is how to preserve their own reality in the face of extreme differences from other people around them.
target: Problem ki Morisyen inn fer fas se kuma prezerv zot prop realite divan diferans extrem depi lezot dimunn otur de zot.

input: The result is that all the members of any group know something often other groups, and many members areas proficient in the cultural activities of other groups as of their own".
target: So rezilta seki "tu mamb nerport ki grup, zot konn kitsoz lor lezot grup, e buku manb nerport ki enn grup osi konpetan dan aktivite kiltirel enn lot grup, ubyen lezot grup, ki dan zot prop aktivite kiltirel.

input: When you collect stories or songs, you can expect to witness that proficiency.
target: Kan u pe kolekte enn zistwar ubyen sante, u kapav atann truv sa konpetans-la.

input: People will switch from Creole to Bhojpuri and back again.
target: Dimunn pu sifte depi Kreol Morisyen ziska Bhojpuri e revinn ankor lor Kreol Morisyen.

input: They will switch also among different customs and traditions.
target: Zot pu sifte ant diferan kutim ek tradisyon.

input: What is more, knowing or participating in the traditions of the groups does not take away form the sense of identity which is shared in the group.
target: Pli inportan ankor, konesans ek partisipasyon dan tradisyon lezot grup, li pa ditu anlev santiman lidantite ki partaze dan enn grup.

input: As one anthropologist points out about language in the Caribbean, speakers and addressees are not and probably are not encouraged to expect to become members of the same social group.
target: Kuma enn antropolog finn fer resortir lor langaz dan Karaib, "dimunn ki koz enn langaz e seki pe ekute, zot pa form parti e sirman zot pa sipoze atann ki zot pu form parti manb mem grup sosyal".

input: This proficiency in the traditions of different groups has served people throughout Mauritian history as a means of adaptation to new circumstances.
target: Konpetans dan tradisyon bann lezot grup finn byen ed dimunn Moris tutolong listwar, kuma enn mwayen adapte a bann nuvo sityasyon.

input: For all Mauritian groups, "cultural resilience and adaptation might indeed be regarded as the most outstanding as well as the most persistent form of resistant: to the legal, spatial, economic, psychological, and health controls with which they have been surrounded.
target: Pu tu grup dan lasosyete Moris, "tenasite kiltirel ek adaptasyon kapav konsidere kuma enn de bann form rezistans pli extraordiner osi byin ki pli persistan" vizavi enn sel kontrol legal, kontrol plas kot ti gayn drwa ale, kontrol ekonomik, kontrol sikolozik e kontrol saniter ki ti antur dimunn dan lepok kolonyal.

input: Nation-building depends upon understanding this proficiency and this resilience.
target: Konstitisyon lanasyon depann lor konpreansyon sa konpetans kiltirel e osi sa tenasite la.

input: Since this manual is meant as a tool, it contains more questions than answers.
target: Etan done ki sa liv-la li pu azir kuma enn zuti, li kontenir plis kestyon ki repons.

input: You don’t satisfy your hunger by reading a cookery book.
target: U pa pu satisfer u lafin ek enn liv reset.

input: More examples would make the manual more fun to read.
target: Plis ena lexanp plis sa pu rann liv la enn plezir pu lir.

input: You, the reader, will have to collect them.
target: U antan ki lekter, ena pu kolekte sa bann lexanp la.

input: When a story, song, or proverb moves away from the time, place, or people of its origin, it often changes.
target: Kan enn zistwar, sante ubyen enn proverb buze depi plas so nesans ubyen lepok so nesans, byen suvan li sanze.

input: Stories change their language; songs change their tunes; proverbs mean something different.
target: Bann zistwar sanz langaz; sante sanz so ler; proverb pran enn lot sinifikasyon.

input: Meaning change; the use to which folklore is put changes.
target: Itilite ki donn folklor, li sanze.

input: Audiences are different in a new place, so that what was religious story for Muslims sounds like only an interesting tale to others.
target: Lodyans diferan dan enn nuvo plas, de sort ki enn zistwar ki klerman relizye pu dimunn relizyon mizilman li pran rezonans enn zistwar ki interesan tukur pu lezot.

input: There is nothing wrong with change.
target: Pena nanye de mal ar sanzman.

input: The changes that happen to items of folklore make it necessary for you to record the actual time, place, and persons of the performance.
target: Sanzman ki bann item folklor sibir fer li neseser pu u rikord ler, plas e dimunn dan sa performans-la.

input: Expect to find variant forms that differ from the ones you already know.
target: U bizin atann dekuver varyasyon dan but-but folklor ki lezot dimunn fer, diferan depi seki u deza kone.

input: Variant forms are not “wrong", only different.
target: Bann diferan form, zot pa "fos" ditu, me selman diferan.

input: Sometimes variant forms are created by clever people.
target: Parfwa sa nuvo varyete la li pran nesans akoz dimunn byen intelizan.

input: Children, for instance, often invent variant forms of songs or sayings they hear on television.
target: Byen suvan, nu tann zanfan invant enn varyasyon enn sante ubyen enn koze ki zot finn tande lor televizyon.

input: Then your record can be compared with the records,left by others.
target: Lefet ki u gard enn rikord vedir ki lezot dimunn finn rikord, de zot kote.

input: Comparison will bring an understanding of the nature of change.
target: Konparezon pu permet enn konpreansyon lor natir sanzman.

input: The main tools for comparison of folktales, for instance are Stith Thompson’s MotfIndex of Folk Literature and Aame and Thompson’s Types of the folktale.
target: Zuti prinsipal pu sa travay konpar zistwar—la li truv dan de liv: "MotfIndex of Folk Literature" par Stith Thompson ek "Types of the Folktale par Aame & Thompson.

input: hese show the variant forms of folktales and legends around the world.
target: Sa 2 liv la zot montre diferan varyasyon bann mem zistwar ek lezand depi lemond antye.

input: This manual can be used by anyone who can read and write.
target: Nerport kisannla ki konn lir ekrir kapav servi sa liv-la.

input: You can do valuable collection by asking only a few people a few of the questions below.
target: U kapav fer enn travay kolekte, seki ena buku valer,zis par poz enn ti grup dimunn inpe kestyon.

input: You do not have to work your way through all of the manual.
target: U pa bizin rant dan konteni liv—la antye.

input: The best plan will be for you and others to do your collecting and send your materials to a central place.
target: Meyer plan se pu u ek lezot, zot tu fer zot travay kolekte folklor, e lerla zot avoy zot materyel kot enn plas santralize.

input: This scheme - having collectors all over the country sending materials to a central archive — is based on the folklore achievements of the small nation of Ireland, which has a valuable lesson to teach.
target: Sa plan—la - kot ena kolekter partu-partu dan pei ki anvoy zot materyel kot enn arsiv santral - li baze lor seki enn ti nasyon, Lairland, inn akonplir, li res kuma enn leson byen valab pu nu tu.

input: Like Mauritius, ireland was for centuries a poor British colony, where many people could read and write.
target: Kuma Moris, Lairland pandan plizir syek ti enn koloni Britanik mizer, kot buku dimunn pa ti kapav lir e ekrir.

input: Soon after it gained independence, lreland set up a Govemment agency, the irish Folklore Commission, to observe and record folklore all over the country.
target: Zis apre ki li gayn so lindepandans, Lairland met dibut enn lazans guvernmantal, Komisyon Folklor Lairlande, pu observe rikord folklor partu dan pei.

input: A few folklorists made field recordings and watched over the central archives.
target: Enpe folklorist ti fer rikording lor terin e ti okip Arsiv Santral.

input: Most of the actual collecting, though,was done by ordinary persons - teachers, priests, school pupils.
target: Laplipar travay kolekter, se dimunn ordiner ki ti pe fer - profeser, pret, zelev kolez.

input: These persons did their collecting by working throughout the Handbook of Irish Folklore, a set of questionnaires put out by the Commission to show what folklore might be found.
target: Zot ti fer zot travay kolekte dapre konsey enn liv, "Handbook of Irish Folklore", enn seri kestyoner ki sa Komisyom la ti tire pu montre ki kalite folklor kapav truve.

input: The Irish book is the model for this book.
target: Sa liv lor Lairland enn model pu sa liv-la.

input: By 1962, the lrish Folklore Commission had put together a million pages of handwritten folklore information.
target: Ariv 1962, Komisyon Folklor Lairland ti rasanble ansam enn milyon maniskri informasyon lor folklor.

input: When Mauritius, with its many languages and traditions, decides to follow the example of ireland, people can use this manual in the same way.
target: Kan dan Moris, kot ena buku langaz e tradisyon, desid pu swiv lexanp Lairland, dimunn kapav servi sa liv-la dan mem fason.

input: most important body of knowledge about culture and tradition in the Indian Ocean.
target: pli inportan lor kiltir ek tradisyon dan Losean Indyin.

input: When the archives comes into existence, it will be consulted by folklorists, historians, and anthropologists from all over the world.
target: Kan fini met dibut enn arsiv, folklorist, istoryin ek antropolog depi partu dan lemond pu vinn servi li.

input: Your first quality should be patience.
As a folklore collector,you need a willingness to listen at length to peoples stories about themselves, their discussions, their comments and the principles they imply.
target: Antan ki enn dimunn ki ramas folklor, u bizin ena dezir ekut an longer zistwar dimunn rakonte lor zot mem, u bizin ena dezir ekut zot diskisyon, zot komanter e dekuver ki prinsip ki ena andan ladan.

input: At the same time, you need not expect that people can explain themselves or their traditions.
target: Anmentan u bizin atann ki dimunn kapav explik zot mem par zot mem, kuma zot kapav explik zot tradisyon.

input: People may know very well what they are doing without being able to tell you in words.
target: Dimunn kapav byen konpran ki zot pe fer San ki zot kapav dir u li an parol.

input: What the Chinese community tells us is equally true of all Mauritians.
target: Seki dimunn Sino-Morisyen dir nu, li egalman vre pu tu Morisyen.

input: If you ask a modern Chinese the meaning of rites of the ancestors, you usually put him into great embarrassment, because nobody ever asked him before.
target: Si nu dimann enn dimunn Sino-Morisyen modem sinifikasyon kit rit bann anset, normalman ou pu met li dan gran lanbara, parski personn zame pa finn dimann li sa avan.

input: Most Chinese will insist on the element of remembrance and respect for the ancestors, but most Mauritians will simply tell you, "It’s always done this way".
target: Dan zot repons, laplipar pu met lanfaz lor eleman memwar ek respe pu bann anset, me laplipar Morisyen pu dir u sinpleman "Tultan finn fer li kumsa".

input: The next question should be not "Why?" but "Was it always like that, or has it changed?"
target: Fode pa ki u prosenn kestyon li zis "Kifer?" me plito li “Eski li ti tultan kumsa, ubyen eski li firm sanze?"

input: Your second quality should be absolute faithfulness to what people say and do.
target: U dezyem kalite bizin enn lwayote, enn fidelite, anver seki dimunn dir e fer.

input: The words people say or sing in their folklore must be written down just as they are said.
target: Bizin ekrir parol ki dimunn dir ubyin ki dimunn sante dan zot folklor exakteman parey kuma zot dir li ubyen sant li.

input: Make no change in the words that person says or sings.
target: Pa bizin sanz okenn mo ki enn dimunn dir ubyin sante.

input: Don’t correct the language or the tune.
target: Bizin evit koriz langaz-la ubyenr ler sante-la.

input: Whatever language(s) are being used, record the words accurately.
target: Nerport ki langaz ki servi, u bizin rikord bann parol avek presizyon.

input: The easiest means to accurate recording is a cassette tape recorder, which will help you resist any temptation to change, for example, Creole into schoolbook French.
target: Mwayen pli fasil pu fer rikord ki presi se enn kaset ki pu ede pu evit tantasyon, par egzanp, pu sanz langaz Kreol Morisyen an Franse liv lekol.

input: Speak Creole to Creole speakers, Bhojpuri to Bhojpuri speakers, and listen carefully when they switch from one language to another.
target: Bizin koz Kreol ar dimunn ki koz Kreol, Bhojpuri ar seki koz Bhojpuri, e ekut avek latansyon kan zot shifte depi enn langaz a enn lot.

input: Even very small or seemingly unimportant words or behavior need to be recorded.
target: Mem bann parol ubyen konportman ordiner ubyin seki paret pa inportan bizin rikord li.

input: What is usual in one part of the island may be unusual or unknown in another.
target: Seki ordiner dan enn but pei kapav pa ordiner ditu ubyin inkoni dan enn lot parti.

input: Therefore, record all sorts of traditionnal words and behavior, even what you have already recorded from other persons or in other neighborhoods.
target: Donk pran not tu kalite parol ubyen konportman tradisyonel, mem seki u finn deza note depi lezot dimunn ubyin dan lezot landrwa.

input: The more times a single tale or proverb is written down, the more we will know about folklore in Mauritius.
target: Pli buku fwa nu ekrir enn zistwar ubyen enn proverb, plis ki pu kone lor folklore dan Moris.

input: Choose times and places to collect when people are more likely to be able to remember.
target: Swazir ler ek plas kan dimunn pli anmezir pu kapav rapel an detay.

input: If someone you are questioning does not know example of tales, riddles, or something else you are looking for, make a note of his or her lack of knowledge.
target: Si kikenn u pe kestyone pa konn lexanp zistwar, zedmo ubyen lezot kitsoz ki u pe rode, lerla pran not so mank konesans.

input: Adults know fewer riddles than children; wedding customs are easier to observe at a wedding than afterward; most folktales are told at night,not in the daytime.
target: Adilt konn mwins zedmo ki zanfan, kutim maryaz pli fasil obzerve pandan seremoni maryaz ki apre, laplipar zistwar rakonte aswar, pa lizur.

input: Transcribe on to paper the folklore you have observed, either while questioning the people or (if you use a tape recorder) as soon as possible afterward.
target: Met lor papye folklor u finn obzerve swa pandan ki u pe kestyonn dimunn ubyen (si u servi enn laparey kaset) transkrir li osito ki posib apre.

input: Use large paper; write clearly; use only one side of the page.
target: Servi gran fey papye, ekrir pu ki kapav lir fasilman, itiliz enn sel kote papye.

input: Leave white space of 3 cm at the top and left and 2 cm at the right and bottom, to make the pages readable if they are bound together later.
target: Kit enn lespas blan 3 santimet lao ek agos, ek 2 santimet a drwat ek anba, pu rann bann paz lizib si pengle zot ansam apre.

input: At the start or end of each bit you record, state the name, age,and place ofthe person(s) whose words are being written down.
target: Dan kumansman ubyin alafin sak but u rikord met nom, laz dimunn la e plas kot li pe pran so parol-la.

input: Or begin your tape recording by saying that information into your microphone: "It is May 17, l990, and we are in Fond du Sac, talking to Antoine Mamet".
target: Ubyin kumans u lanrezistreman 1o1 kaset par dir sa bann linformasyon la dan u mikro: "Li le 17 Me 1990, nu dan Fond du Sac, Mo pe koz ar Antoine Mamet.”

input: It is most important to record correctly the person from whom each story or other tradition has been taken.
target: Li extreman inportan pu rikord korekteman sa dimunn ar ki u finn pran sak zistwar u lezot tradisyon.

input: Find out something about each person’s life history.
target: Rod enpe detay lor lavi sak dimunn ki rakonte.

input: Has he/she always lived in that place?
target: Eski li ti tultan res dan sa lamdrwa-la?

input: Who were his/her father and mother?
What languages were spoken at home?
target: Ki langaz ti koze dan lakaz?

input: How does he/she make a living?
All these facts will help to show how and where a person came into touch with the folklore he/she knows.
target: Tu sa bann fe la pu ede pu montre kuma e kot enn dimunn finn rant an kontak ar folklor ki li kone.

input: If you want to specialize in recording people’s life histories, see "Life Histories" below.
target: Si u anvi spesyaliz u dan rikord zistwar personel lavi dimunn, get “Zistwar Lavi Dimunn" pli anba.

input: Many sorts of folklore have not yet been collected in Mauritius, though they are certainly there.
target: Buku kalite folklor pankor ko1ekte dan Moris, mem si nu sir zot ankor lamem.

input: Proverbs, riddles, beliefs about witchcraft, cookery, and folk architecture have hardly been written down.
target: Pa finn vremem met an ekri bann proverb, zedmo, devinet, kwrayans dan1 sorselri, reset lakuzinn e arsitektir ansyin.

input: Stories about dead people coming back to talk with living people, which are found all over the world, are almost unknown in Mauritius so far.
target: Zistwar lor dimunn mor ki releve pu koz ar dimunn vivan, ki nu truve partu dan lemond, preske inkoni dan Moris ziska ler.

input: This field manual tries to tell what will be found, but you should take every chance to think up questions of your own which you base on the questions here.
target: Sa liv de baz-1a sey montre seki u pu truve, me u bizin met tu dan u kote pu mazinn u prop kestyon ki baze lor kestyon depi isi.

input: Once you collect and write down your material,you should make two copies.
target: Kuma u kolekte e ekrir seki u finn gagne, u bizin fer 2 kopi.

input: When a central archive is created, send another copy to that archive.
target: Kan ena enn arsiv santral avoy enn lot kopi laba.

input: The reason folklore materials are put together in an archive is that Mauritians and foreign scholars need to compare the traditions of various members of each group, to examine everything that is known about the traditions of Mauritius, and to compare Mauritian folklore with the folklore of La Reunion, Seychelles, Madagascar,India, Africa and Europe.
target: Rezon kifer ramas ansam materyel folklor dan enn arsiv se parski Morisyen ek koneser depi lezot pei bizin kapav konpar folklor Morisyen ar folklor depi Larenyon, Sesel, Madagaskar, Lind, Lafrik ek Lerop.
Eski u bizin pey dimunn ki donn u linformasyon?

input: There is no money to be gained from collecting folklore.
target: Pena larzan pu gayne ar kolekte folklor.

input: Under Mauritian law, an artist and a collector may agree to work with each other by means of a contract; no money changes hands.
target: Su lalwa Moris enn artis ek enn kolekter kapav tom enn lakor pu travay ansam lor baz enn kontra; pena larzan ki rant anze.

input: Many sega performers, however, have been recorded by persons who then made profits from their music by selling cassettes but giving no money to the artist.
target: Me selman, ena dimunn ki finn anrezistre buku segatye e ki apre fer profi ar zot lamizik atraver lavant kaset, nie san donn enn su artis-la.

input: Therefore, many people think anyone interested in traditional culture will be bound to profit from it.
target: Donk, buku dimunn panse ki nerport ki dimunn interese dan kiltir tradisyonel oblize fer profi ar sa.

input: Be prepared to answer the question, "How much money are you going to make out of what I tell you?
target: Prepar u pu reponn kestyon, "Komye lamone u pu fer ar seki mo dir u?"

input: The real answer, ofcourse, is that traditional culture is a treasure of the nation.
target: Vre repons byin sir, seki kiltir tradisyonel enn trezor ki apartenir a lepep an antye.

input: But if you intend to sell folklore materials which you record, the law requires you to sign a different kind of contract with the artist to make sure he or she receives the profits.
target: Me si u ena lintansyon pu vann materyel folklore ki u finn rikord, dapre lalwa u bizin siyn enn diferan kalite kontra avek artis—la pu asire ki li resevwar so par dan profi.

input: Consult the Mauritius Society of Authors in Ebene.
target: Pran kontak ar Mauritius Society of Authors dan Ebene.

input: Some authorities urge you not to pay for information in cash, but to try to make a gift or perform some service for a person who has given you her time and effort.
target: Sertin lotorite dir u ki u pa peye pu linformasyon ki u gayne an "cash", me pu sey plito donn enn kado u rann enn servis dimunn ki finn donn u so letan ek zefor.

input: She is your co-worker, after all.
target: Apre tu, li u koleg travay.

input: Others have found that paying for stories and songs is a fine way to encourage people to make up new ones, which can then be compared with the old ones.
target: Lezot finn truve ki peye pu zistwar e sante enn bon mwayen pu ankuraz dimunn kree nuvo, ki lerla kapav konpare ar seki ansyin.

input: You will need to think about what place you have, as a collector of folklore, in the local community.
target: U pu bizin panse lor ki plas u-mem ena, antan ki dimunn ki kolekte folklor, dan sa landrwa-la.

input: If you come to the place as an outsider, people will expect you to act as an outsider and will try to extend hospitality to you.
target: Si u vinn dan landrwa la kuma enn etranze, dimunn pu atann ki u azir kuma enn etranze, e pu sey etann ospitalite ar u.

input: Being a foreigner, I’ve had that experience many times.
target: Etan done mo sort deor, mo finn fer sa lexperyans la suvan.

input: If you are a local school teacher, you may need to make it clear that you are stepping out of your usual behavior as a teacher and taking up, for the moment, a new place.
target: Si u enn profeser dan landrwa, kapav u pu bizin fer li kler ki u pe met dekote konportman u abitye ena antan ki profeser e pran enn nuvo plas pandan ki u pe rikord folklor.

input: If they think you are a government officer, they may treat you as more important than they are, putting aside their own desires, thoughts, and feelings.
target: Si zot panse u enn ofisye Guvernman, kapav zot pu tret u kuma kikenn pli inportan ki zot, zot pu kasyet zot prop dezir, panse e santiman.

input: Then they cannot be expected to show you freely what is important to them in their past or in their communal life.
target: Lerla u pa kapav atann ki zot pu montre libreman seki inportan pu zot dan zot lepase ubyen dan zot lavi an komin.
