input: In fact, informants are more important than collectors, and you will need to let people know that you think so.
target: Anfet dimunn ki donn linformasyon li pli inportan ki dimunn ki rarnas linformasyon, e u pu bizin fer dimunn kone ki u pans kumsa.

input: The recording of Mauritian folklore can be carried out on a large scale or a small one.
target: Lanrezistreman folklor Morisyen kapav fer lor enn gran lesel ubyin enn tipti lesel.

input: To begin with, you might sit in on an exchange of riddles by local children, to see how they do it.
target: Pu kumanse u kapav asiste enn zwe lesanz zedmo ant zanfan enn landrwa pu gete kimanyer zot fer.

input: You should be able to ask the older children, at least, how the game is played.
target: U bizin kapav dimann seki pli gran parmi bann zanfan omwin kimanyer zwe la derule.

input: Or you might hear people singing songs as they do their daily work; then you could ask singers to sing them to you, so that the words can be written down.
target: Uswa ukapav tann dimunn sante dan zot travay tulezur; lerla u kapav dimann bann santer sante pu u kapav ekrir bann parol.

input: If you are collecting in your home community, you can begin looking carefully at how people behave at weddings, births, funerals, and other important occasions.
target: Si u pe ramas folklor dan landrwa kot u reste, u kapav kumanse par obzerve dan enn fason pli aktiv kimanyer dimunn azir dan maryaz, otur nesans enn ti-baba, dan lanterman, e dan lezot lokazyon inportan.

input: Observe what people do and say; write notes about the social and physical conditions; record or write the words and behavior ofthe people.
target: Obzerv seki dimunn fer ek dir, pran not lor kondisyon sosyal e lanturaz fizik; anrezistre lor kaset ubyin ekrir parol ek konportman dimunn.

input: Also in your home community, you could make a list of the folk groups (schoolchildren, married women, unmarried men, and ofcourse families).
target: Kot u reste usi u kapav fer enn lalis bann grup folklor (zanfan lekol, fam marye, zom selibater ek, byensir, bann fami).

input: It may be better to start collecting from the people most like yourself young men if you are a young man, married women if you are a married woman.
target: Li kapav meyer pu kumans kolekte folklor depi dimunn kuma u mem — zenn zom si u enn zenn om, fam marye si u enn fam marye.

input: Often you will find and get help from and "active tradition bearer".
target: Suvan u pu gayn kudme depi enn siporter aktif tradisyon.

input: This phrase describes a person who is more interested in tradition, or is a better storyteller, or has responsibility for family history.
target: Sa fraz—la dekrir enn dimunn ki plis interese dan tradisyon, ubyin ki enn pli bon rakonter listwar lafami.

input: Since an active tradition bearer has always enjoyed an audience, he/she is well known to all.
target: Etan done ki enn "siporter aktif tradisyon" tultan gayn enn lodyans, tu dimunn konn li.

input: Nelzir Ventre of Poudre d’Or, Ti-Frer (Alphonse Ravaton) of Quartier Militaire, the brothers Sydney and Jocelyn Joseph of Grand Bel Air near Mahébourg, Fanfan the segatye are well known in their neighborhood and beyond.
target: Nelzir Ventre depi Poudre D’Or, Ti- Frer (Alphonse Ravaton) depi Quartier Militaire, bann frer Sidney e Jocelyn Joseph depi Grand Bel Air pre Mahebourg, segatye Fanfan byin koni dan zot landrwa e ayer.

input: You can ask this person, as well as other people, how he/she got his place in the community.
target: U kapav dimann dimunn-la, osi byin ki lezot dimunn, kimanyer li finn gayn sa plas dan so landrwa.

input: One of the important duties of Mauritian folklorist is to find active tradition bearers and get them better known.
target: Enn travay inportan enn folklorist Morisyen se pu rod bann "siporter aktif tradisyon” e fer zot rekoni.

input: After you have recorded some tales, proverbs, legends, riddles and songs, you may decide to try something more ambitious like a public observance.
target: Apre ki u finn anrezistre inpe zistwar lontan, proverb, lezand, zedmo ek sante, u kapav desid pu sey kitsoz pli anbisye kuma enn sistem ubyen rityel piblik.

input: Celebrations, calendar customs, and rituals are what many people think of when Mauritian folklore is mentioned.
target: Kan mansyonn folklor Morisyen buku dimunn pans lor selebrasyon kutim liye ar kalandriye ansyin ek rit.

input: All Mauritians know Grand Bassin, Eid, spring festival, Easter, Cavadee and other festivals that attract many tourists.
target: Tu Morisyen konn lor Grand Bassin, Eid, Fet Printan, Pak, Kaveri ek lezot festival ki atir buku turis.

input: Up to now, however, very little systematic, painstaking observation of these customs has been made.
target: Me ziska ler fnn ena byin tigit travay obzervasyon sistematik ek metikile lor sa bann kutim-la.

input: One reason for this lack is the difficulty of observing everything that is going on in a complex event.
target: Enn rezon pu sa mankman—la se difikilte pu obzerv tu seki pe pase dan enn evennman konplex.

input: Even in a relatively straightforward event like a pilgrimage, hundreds of persons carry out many different kinds of activities.
target: Mem dan enn evennman osi net kuma enn pelrinaz, dimunn par santenn fer plizir kalite aktivite.

input: The worship of Ammen, the Tamil mother goddess, brings hundreds together to take part in different ways.
target: Kilt Ammen, mama bondye Tamil, atir par santenn dimunn ansam, e zot pran par dan diferan fason.

input: We might take what seems a relatively manageable example Of a complex observance, the Haldi ceremony the night before a Hindu weddings.
target: Nu kapav pran enn lexanp relativman fasil trete de enn pratik konplex kuma seremoni Haldi, so aswar avan enn maryaz relizye Indu.

input: In this ceremony, the bride-to-be is anointed and then segregated from other people.
target: Dan sa seremoni-la, pas safran lor figir nuvel marye, e separ li depi lezot dimunn.

input: In addition to the prescribed ritual activities carried out by the priest, the person(s) to be married, and the members of their family, you would have to observe many other activities.
target: Anplis de bann rit ofisyel ki pret, dimunn ki pu marye e manb zot fami fer, u pu bizin obzerv buku lezot aktivite.

input: While they are part of the whole event, they are neither sacred nor prescribed by scripture or priests.
target: Me zot form parti evennman la an antye, zot ni sakre ni preskrir dan liv sakre ubyen par prêt.

input: The way in which an outdoor area has been converted to an indoor area by being enclosed in a tent,the arrival and seating patterns of hundred of guests,the preparation and serving of their food.
target: Fason ki transform enn but lakur exteryer dan enn lespas andan  atraver konstriksyon enn latant ferme, larive bann invite, e manyer met invite asize, par Santenn, preparasyon ek manyer servi manze.

input: their many informal conversations surrounding the central area,and the kinds of folkloric communication going on within and outside the house.
target: Tu sa konversasyon informel ki ena lye, otur plas santral e tusa kalite kominikasyon folklorik ki pe ale andan ek andeor lakaz-la.

input: As for you, the observer, you cannot be everywhere at the same time, you can’t even see everything directly in front of you, a videocamera will see less than you see yourself, and yet you are expected to record whatever is relevant to an accurate description of the whole ceremony.
target: Pu u antan ki obzervater, u pa kapav anmentan partu alafwa, u mem pa kapav truv tu kan u get zis par divan, enn kamera video pu truv mwins ki u truve u mem, purtan u bizin rikord nerport ki evennman ki apropriye pu ki u gayn enn deskripsyon presi seremoni-la an antye.

input: The description of Haldi should aim at understanding where the official and formal elements leave off and the unofficial and informal elements begin.
target: Deskripsyon seremoni Haldi bizin viz pu konpran kot bann eleman ofisyel ek formel termine, e kot seki inofisyel ek informel kumanse.

input: Here are some questions to carry with you in field work in case you decide to investigate customary observance.
target: Ala inpe kestyon pu amenn ar u dan travay lor terin anka u desid fer lanket folklorik lor enn pratik ki abitye ena.

input: This list has been adapted from the classic work on the subject.
target: Sa lalis-la finn adapte depi enn klasik lor sa size-la.

input: “A Guide for Field Workers in Folklore”, which you can consult for further guidance.
target: "A Guide for Field Workers in Folklore” ki u kapav rode pu gayn plis gid.

input: Where are you, indoors,outdoors, or both?
target: Kot u ete, andan, deor u tulede?

input: Where is the house or other location?
What is the size and shape of the space that is being used?
target: Ki grander e ki form lespas pe servi?

input: Perhaps you can measure it before or after the event.
target: Kitfwa u kapav pran so mezir avan u apre evennman-la.

input: Make a sketch if the space is irregular.
target: Fer enn sketch si lespas-la iregilye.

input: In a room, are there pictures on the walls, religious or other symbols,curtains, furniture?
target: Eski ena foto lor miray, sinbol relizye ubyen lezot sinbol, eski ena rido, meb dan lasam?

input: Have chairs or other furniture been hired for the occasion?
target: Eski sez ubyen lezot meb inn lwe pu sa lokazyon la?

input: Describe this transaction by interviewing family members or the dealer.
target: Dekrir sa demars-la par intervyue manb fami-la ubyin seki responsab sa demars-la.
Kimanyer lekleraz organize dan sa lespas—la?

input: What sounds do you hear - music, bird calls, dogs barking, automobiles passing?
target: Ki son u tande — lamizik, zwazo pe kriye, lisyen pe zape, loto pe pase?

input: What do you smell incense, wood fire, women’s perfumes, cooking odors, tobacco smoke?
target: Ki parfin ek loder eski u gayne, sandal, dife dibwa, parfin fam servi, parfin manze, lafime sigaret?

input: What are the weather conditions and temperature?
target: Ki letan fer e ki tanperatir?

input: Make an accurate record of the identities and roles of the participants.
target: Fer enn rikord presi idantite e rol tu partisipan.

input: Many of these will be in groups, which you can describe (families sitting or standing together, children playing, old men chatting).
target: Buku parmi pu dan bann grup, ki u kapav dekrir (fami ki finn asize ansam ubyen dibute ansam, zanfan ki pe zwe ansam, vye dimunn pe koz koze).

input: How many men, how many women?
If you know some of them, record their names.
target: Si u konn inpe dimunn parmi, mark zot nom.

input: What position in the community do the main participants hold?
target: Ki stati partisipan prinsipal ena dan lanvironnman zot reste?
Mem zafer pu partisipan mwin santral?

input: What relationship exist among the participants?
Where are they placed in the physical setting?
Describe their general appearance and dress (make photographs).
target: Dekrir zot laparans zeneral ek zot labiyman (tir foto).

input: What role does each participant play in this event?
target: Ki rol sak partisipan zwe dan sa evennman—la?

input: If the roles have traditional names, record these.
target: Si rol-la ena enn mo tradisyonel pu li, rikord li.

input: Where do people direct their attention?
Do people converse with each other while performance is taking place?
target: Eski dimunn koz koze ant zot pandan ki tu pe derule?

input: What seems to be people’s attitude when many actions take place at the same time?
target: Ki latitid li paret dimunn ena kan buku aksyon pe derule anmemtan?

input: "Performance" is the best word to denote the sequence in which some participants take responsibility for carrying out certain actions.
target: “Performance” li meyer mo pu dekrir sekans dan lekel sertin partisipan pran responsabilite pu fer sertin aksyon.

input: Describe this sequence of actions from beginning to end.
target: U pu dekrir sa sekans aksyon-la depi so kumansman ziska lafin.

input: Are separate performances going on at the same time?
target: Eski ena plizyer performans separe ki fer anmemtan?

input: Observe and record recitation, singing, chanting, tone of voice, high or low pitch, vocal intensity, pauses, switching among languages, facial expressions, gestures, pantomime, imitating sounds or other persons` voices repetition.
target: Obzerv e rikord resitasyon, sante, parol, ton lavwa, not ot ubyin ba, intansite vokal, bann pozman ubyen silans, sanzman ant diferan langaz, expresyon lor figir, zes, pantomim, imitasyon son zanimo ubyin lavwa lezot dimunn.

input: What equipment is being used to support the performers - microphone, amplification, musical instruments, noise makers?
target: Ki lekipman pe servi pu sutenir bann ki pe zwe - mikro, anpli, linstriman lamizik, zafer ki fer tapaz?

input: How does videotaping affect the performance?

target: Dekrir reaksyon lodyans ek lezot ki pe gete.

input: How do they show their evaluation of what is going on?
target: Kimanyer zot montre zot valyasyon lor seki pe pase?

input: How do onlookers show their encouragement, disapproval, or other reaction (singing, laughing, shouting, yawning, applauding, weeping)?
target: Kimanyer zot montre zot lankurazman, ubyen zot dezakor, ubyen lezot reaksyon (sante, riye, kriye, baye, aplodi, plore)?

input: Ask (now or later) for evaluation of this event from as many participants as you can.
target: Dimann (asterla ubyen plitar) otan partisipan posib zot evalyasyon sa evennman-la?

input: Is this a good one of its kind?
target: Eski li enn kalite evennman ki bon?
Ki kitsoz ki rann li bon?

input: Is this a "normal" performance or does it differ in some way from the usual practice?
target: Eski li enn derulman “normal" ubyen dan ki fason li diferan depi pratik abityel?

input: Ask experienced persons to discuss variation with you.
target: Dimann dimunn ek lexperyans pu explik u diferan varyasyon ki ena?

input: The performance of Mauritian folklore always differs from the way in which customs were performed in people’s countries of origin.
target: Performans folklor Morisyen li tultan diferan depi dan pei kot li sorti.

input: Therefore, observe and record as much as possible about the specific details of performance here.
target: Donk obzerv e rikord otan ki posib bann detay spesifik dan tu seki pe derule isi.

input: Also, performance today is different from performance yesterday.
target: E seki dimunn perform zordi li byin diferan depi lepok avan.

input: Therefore, record what people are actually doing today as well as what they say about what was formerly done.
target: Alor pran not avek presizyon performans dimunn osi byen ki seki zot dir ti abitye ver avan.

input: Your accurate observation of present practice can then be used for comparison with what history and anthropology tell us about practices in the ancestral land.
target: U bann obzervasyon presi pu kapav servi pu konpar seki listwar ek antropolozi dir nu pratike dan pei bann anset.

input: How does your presence affect the performance?
Can you move around to observe different parts of the events?
target: Eski u kapav buze tutotur pu obzerv diferan parti evennman—la?

input: What is going well for you at this event?
target: Ki zafer ki u pe truv pe mars byen dan sa evennman-la?
Ki kitsoz rann li difisil pu u?

input: Folklore is always perfonned according to certain rules, which people know and which you should find out.
target: Folklor li tultan derule selon sertin regleman ki dimunn kone e ki u bizin fer enn manyer kone.

input: For instance, is there some part of the space where some person(s) should not go?
target: Par egzanp, eski ena sertin seksyon sa plas-la kot sertin dimunn fode pa ale?

input: Is there some time when some person(s) should not speak?
target: Eski ena sertin moman kan sertin bann dimunn fode pa koze?

input: What is the right time for holding this event?
target: Ki lepok ek ki ler konsidere propis pu ena sa evennman—la?

input: What would be a wrong time for holding it?
target: Ki ler li pa propis pu ena li?

input: What or who determines the right and wrong time?
target: Ki zafer ubyin kisannla deside ki lepok ubyen ki ler propis ubyen pa propis?

input: Is this an official, formal determination or an unofficial, informal one?
target: Eski li kitsoz ofisyel, formel ubyen inofisyel ek informel?

input: Is the practice today different from what it was in former times?
target: Eski so pratik zordi li diferan depi seki li ti ete avan?

input: Ask those present and record their exact words.
target: Dimann dimunn prezan sa kestyon la, e fer enn rikord zot mo exak.

input: Note the exact order in which parts of the event occur.
target: Pran not lord exak ki zafer derule dan evennman-la.

input: What would happen if this order were varied?
target: Ki ti pu arive si sa lord-la ti sanze?

input: What or who could interrupt or break up the event?
target: Ki zafer ubyin kisannla ki kapav interonp u kraz enn tel evennman-la?

input: Your notes and observations can be sent in to the future archive,or to the Department of Folklore at the Mahatma Gandhi Institute,just as you have written them, or in more finished form.
target: U kapav avoy u not ek u obzervasyon kot fitir arsiv ubyin kot departman Folklor Mahatma Gandhi Institute, swa osito u finn ekrir zot, swa apre ki u enn rafinn zot enpe.

input: If you decide to put your notes and observations into finished form, as an essay, begin with many full, detailed notes which contain anything you think might be relevant.
target: Si u desid pu met u not ek obzervasyon dan enn form rafine, kuma enn ese, u bizin kumans avek buku not, ranpli ek detaye, ki kontenir tu zafer ki u panse kapav aproprye.

input: Remember that at first you are making note to yourself, not writing a report to the Minister.
target: Rapel ki dabor u pe pran not pu u-mem, e u pa pe ekrir enn rapor pu donn kit Minis.

input: Then comes the framing of a proposition (thesis, main idea) for your paper.
target: Lerla bizin fer enn tit (tez prinsipal, lide santral) pu u papye.

input: This should be a single sentence (hypothesis) which you will probably revise later.
target: Li bizin enn fraz sinp (enn ipotez) ki kitfwa u pu regete apre.

input: A sample proposition might be, “The Mauritian fire-walking ceremony, while preserving many features of Tamil practice in India, contains many new elements which make it unique to Mauritius" or "the Haldi ceremony, whether Sanathari or Arya Samaj, is a microcosm of Hindu marriage because it symbolizes all the important features".
target: Enn esantiyon pu enn tit, “Seremoni mars dan dife dan Moris an mem tan ki u prezerv sertin pratik depi Tamilnadu dan Lind, li kontenir buku nuvo eleman ki rann li tipikman Morisyen." ou "Seremoni Haldi, ki li Satanist ubyen Arya Samaj, li enn mikrokosm maryaz Indu parski li sinboliz tu so karakteristik inportan”.

input: As you continue to observe the ceremony, you will reshape this sentence,but always bear in mind that you final paper must defend this single central idea.
target: Kan u kontinye obzerv seremoni-la, u pu reformil u fraz, me tultan gard antet ki u papye final bizin defann sa sel lide santral—la.

input: All the details you have observed, when put in logical order, will support this sentence.
target: Tu detay u finn obzerve, kan met zot dan enn lord lozik, pu sutenir u fraz.

input: This manual is a set of directions for the collecting of folklore in Mauritius.
target: Sa liv-la kontenir enn seri indikasyon kimanyer kolekte folklor dan Moris.

input: Other explanations of fieldwork methods and procedures in folklore in general include the following:
target: Lezot explikasyon lor metod travay lor terin e lor prosedir folklor an zeneral inklir:

input: Bruce Jackson, Fieldwork (Urbana: University of Illinois Press, 1987).
target: — Bruce Jaekson, Fieldwork (Urbana: University Of Illinois Press, 1987).

input: The most useful guide to supplement the present one.
target: Gid pli itil pu siplemant sa liv-la.

input: Detailed explanations of recorders, microphones, and photography.
target: Explikasyon detaye lor lanrezistreman, mikro e fotografi.

input: A Manual for Field Workers in Folklore.
target: A Manual for Field Workers in Folklore.

input: In Mauritius, people are keenly aware of the speed of cultural and economic change in their own lives and experience.
target: Dan Moris dimunn deza byen konsyan vites sanzman kiltirel ek ekonomik dan zot prop lavi ek lexperyans.

input: Many (may be you) feel strongly that old traditions are threatened by such change.
target: Buku dimunn (petet u-mem parmi) kapav panse ki bann vye vye tradisyon pe al sanze, mem disparet.

input: If you tell them you are interested in folklore, they say, "Our generation has no folklore.
target: Parfwa, si u dir kikenn ki u ena enn lintere partikilye pu folklor zot pu reponn u “Abe, nu zenerasyon pena folklore”.

input: This idea is itself a bit of folklore.
target: Sa lide la, limem, li enn but folklor.

input: It is a folk idea, a traditional notion that Mauritians have "about the nature of man, of the world, and of man’s life in the world,” as defined in an important article by Alan Dundes(1971 :95).
target: Li enn lide folklore, enn nosyon tradisyonel ki, li ena “lor natir imin, kimanyer lemond ete, elavi imin dan lemond", kuma Alan Dundes(1971:95) definir folklor dan ann lartik byen inportan lor la.

input: This idea that folklore is dying out is one of the commonest folk ideas everywhere.
target: Sa lide ki folklor pe al mor, li enn—de bann lide pli komin ki ena, parmi tu bann lide folklore partu.

input: People use it to express their sense of loss.
target: Dimunn servi sa lide—la pu exprim enn dey ki zot resanti pu enn pert.

input: It is therefore a familiar point at which to start your collection of Mauritian folklore.
target: Alor, li enn pwin kot u kapav santi u-mem alez pu u kumams kolekte folklor Moris.

input: To enable you to see how much of this sense of loss you share with other Mauritians, here are some question you can ask yourself.
target: Pu ki u kone ziska ki pwin u partaz avek lezot Morisyen sa sansasyon ki u finn perdi kitsoz, ala enn-de kestyon ki u kapav poz u-mem.

input: Later you can try asking them of other people in similar situations.
target: Plitar u kapav sey poz sa bann kestyon la lezot dimunn ki dan mem sitiasyon ki u.

input: What differences do you see between your parents’ life and yours?
target: Ki diferans u truve ena ant lavi u paran ar u prop lavi?

input: How would you contrast their life-experiences with yours?
target: Kuma u kapav fer enn kontras ant zot lexperyans lavi avek pu u?

input: What do you think your children’s life will be like?
target: Kuma lavi u zanfan pu ete, dapre u?

input: What will they do, or see, or have that you don’t?
target: Ki zafer zot pu fer, ou truve, ou ena ki ou pena?

input: Will your children understand your parents?
target: Eski u zanfan pu ariv konpran u paran?

input: In your own life,what are the major changes so far?
target: Dan u prop lavi, ki bann gran sanzman profon finn ena ziska ler?

input: Why does it seem to you that your life has changed as much as it has?
target: Kifer u lavi inn sanze otan, dapre u?

input: What stories have you heard about people who have made big changes in their lives?
target: Ki zistwar u finn tande lor dimunn ki finn fer gran sanzman dan zot lavi?

input: Begin with yourself, then go on to ask others: Narratives.
target: Kumans avek u mem, apre al dimann lezot: Narasyom.

input: What old stories do you remember from when you were a child or from when your parents were children?
target: Ki vye zistwar u rapel depi u lanfans ubynm depi lanfans u paran?

input: What words, or groups of words, or sayings are used nowadays that were not used formerly?
target: Ki parol, ubyen mo, ubyen koze, ubyen lexpresyon, ki servi zordi zur ki pa ti servi lontal?

input: Language of madam sere: how it works, when it is used, by whom, to whom, for what purposes (hiding from those who don’t understand it?).
target: Langaz madam sere kuma li marse, kan itiliz li, kisannla servi li pu koz ar kisannla, avek ki bi (gard sekre depi dimunn ki pa konpran?).

input: What words or expressions or sayings did you hear in former times that you don’t hear any more?
target: Ki mo ubyen lexpresyon ubyen koze ki u ti abitye tande lontan me ki u nepli tande aster?

input: What language(s) were used in former times that you do not hear any more?
target: Ki bann langaz ki ti koze lontan e ki nepli tande zordi?

input: Do you ever find it hard to understand the way people around you speak?
target: Eski parfwa u gayn difikilte pu konpran dimunn koze otur u, akoz problem langaz?

input: Do you know any stories about difficulties of language (Creole—French, Hindi-English...)?
target: Eski u konn enn zistwar lor tirayman ubyen konfizyon ki gayne akoz diferan langaz (Kreol—Franse, Hindi-Angle .... )?

input: Mistake in language made by people who normally speak some other language.
target: Ki erer ki dimunn fer dan enn langaz akoz li abitye koz enn lot langaz?

input: Need to learn French or English to get work, or for some other purpose.
target: Ki zistwar ubyen koze dimunn dir lor lefet ki li neseser pu aprann Franse-Angle pu gayn travay ubyen pu lezot zafer?

input: Use of French or English by a child whose parents speak only Creole or Bhojpuri.
target: Ena zanfan ki servi Franse-Angle me ki so paran koz zis Kreol-Bhojpuri.

input: Switching form Creole to Bhojpuri and back again: when is this done, by whom, to whom, for what purposes?
target: Kan dimunn sanze depi Kreol a Bhojpuri, ubyen vis—versa: kan dimunn fer sa, kisannla fer li,  kan li pe koz ar kisannla?, kifer?

input: Do adults still say proverbs to children in the same way now as they did long ago?
target: Eski bann adilt tuzur dir proverb a bann zanfan dan mem fasan zordi ki zot ti fer lontan?

input: Have the ways of speaking proverbs changed, as you recall?
target: Eski manyer dir proverb inn sanze, kuma u rapel li?

input: What new proverbs have you heard or spoken?
target: Ki nuvo proverb u finn tande ubyen dir u-mem?

input: Did people formerly remember more proverbs than they remember nowadays?
target: Eski dimunn ti konn plis proverb lontan ki zot kone aster—la?

input: How have people‘s clothes changed since you were a child?
target: Kimanyer lamod abiye finn sanze depi ki u ti ankor zanfan?

input: Do people work less or more?
target: Eski dimunn travay plis ubyen mwins?

input: Do people drink alcohol more or less than formerly?
target: Eski dimunn bwar pli buku lalkol ubyen mwins ki lepok avan?

input: What did people do for amusement when you were a child?
target: Ki dimunn ti fer pu amize kan u ti ankor zanfan?

input: Are there more lazy people nowadays?
target: Eski ana plis dimunn pares zordi zur?

input: Are there more of some other kind of people nowadays?
target: Eski ena enn lot zar dimunn aster—la?

input: Writing down your own and other people’s answers to these questions will tell you how much folklore you are carrying around with you.
target: Kan u ekrir u prop repons a tu sa bann kestyon la, u pu konpran ki kantite folklore u deza pe amene ar u.

input: Your knowledge of your own folklore will help when you are ready to question others.
target: U konesans lor u prop folklor pou ed u, kan u1 pu inn pare pu al kestyonn lezot dimunn.

input: In this kind of open-ended investigation, you will learn to base your questions on what a person has already said.
target: Dan sa kalita damars kot u pa rantre lespri-uver pu aprann, u pu devlop iskil pu poz kestyon dimunn baze lor seki li finn deza dir u.

input: Open questions like "Really? Tell me more about that,” or “what would be an example of that?" will be your main contribution.
target: Bann kestyon plito uver, kuma  "Vreman? Rakont mwa inpe plis lor—la? ubyen "Eski u pu kapav donn mwa enn lexanp?" sa kalite kestyon la pu u veritab kontribisyon.

input: Do not change the subject or go on to another one of the written question until your informant is clearly finished with one topic.
target: Napa sanz size ubyen pas lor enn nuvo kestyon lor u lalis ziska li kler ki dimunn la fini koz seki li ani koze lor enn size done.

input: From this series of questions, you will probably be able to get a sense of people‘s feeling about change in their life.
target: Depi sa seri kestyon la, u pu  sirman gayn enn lide ki dimunn resanti lor kestyon sanzman dan zot lavi.

input: You will also identify talented storytellers and singers.
target: Anmemtan u pu reysi idantifye bann bon rakonter zistwar ek santer ki ena talan.

input: Then you can decide what your next step should be as a collector.
target: Apre, u pu kapav deside ki u prosenn demars antan ki enn kolekter folklor.

input: For instance, you might like to look at Mauritian cookery.
target: Par exanp, u kapav kontan zet kudey lor lakwizinn Morisyen.

input: This is a realm where people like to participate in each other’s traditions.
target: Sa li enn tem kot dimunn kontan partaz zot tradisyon.

input: Take the person who cooks in your family, supposing that it’s a woman.
target: Mazinn ki dimunn ki prepar manze dan u fami, dizon li enn fam.

input: Does she know something of the cookery practiced by other groups?
target: Eski li konn reset pratike dan lezot grup?

input: Is she as proficient in the cookery of another group as in the cookery of her own?
target: Eski li konn osi buku sa lezot kalite manze ubyen li pli konn so prop manyer prepare?

input: Or is what she calls "her own" cookery, a combination of other people’s cooking traditions?
target: Ubyen eski seki li apel so prop fason kwi manze anfet enn amalgam diferan tradisyon?

input: Has she acquired some of the raw materials, methods of cooking, seasonings, or implements of other groups?
target: Eski li finn gayn diferan furnitir, metod kwi, zepis, ubyen zuti depi tradisyon enn lot kominote ubyen grup?

input: Are there certain occasions or time when he chooses to used these?
target: Eski ena bann lokazyon ki li swazir pu servi sa bann lezot kalite tradisyon?

input: Or is the attachment of some dishes or seasonings to a certain group (like the French?) a reason to prefer them?
target: Ubyen, ena bann pla u zepis ki dimunn dir `Franse’ pu donn zot enn rezon pu prefer zot?

input: Cooking and eating are profoundly important to people’s sense of who they are and what group they belong to.
target: Nu bizin kone kimanyer nu kwi manze li byen inportan pu dimunn dan so lide lor kisannla li ete, e kot li apartenir.

input: People often express their sense of change in life by contrasting people in the present with the past.
target: Dimunn suvan exprim zot santiman par rapor avek bann sanzman dan lavi, par koz ki diferans ena ant dimunn lontan ek dimunn asterla.

input: Folklore thus take in local and national history.
target: Kumsa ki folklor anglob listwar lokal ek listwar nasyonal.

input: The central way by which people remember history is to tell stories about it.
target: Manyer kle ki dimunn ena pu rapel listwar, se pu rakont zistwar lor seki iinn derule.

input: These are probably the easiest kind of story to collect,because people tell them as true.
target: Sa kalite zistwar la, limem pli fasil kolekte, parski dimunn rakont li kumadir li vre.

input: Folklorists call them “personal experience stories" and "legends".
target: Bann folkloris apel zot "Zistwar veki" ek "Lezand".

input: A personal experience story is one that happened to you, or to the person who is telling it to you - a first-person history.
target: Enn zistwar veki li enn zistwar lor enn lexperyans personel ki iinn ariv u-mem - apel sa "fers personn".

input: In L’Express for 7 July 1980, for example, there appeared an interview with a man who dreamed a girl was telling him how to find buried treasure.
target: Par exanp dan L’Express 7 Ziyet 1980 ti ena enn intervyu avek enn misye ki ti fer enn rev, e dan sa rev la enn tifi ki pe dir li kot  li pu truv enn trezor inn antere.

input: His account to the interviewer, Philippe Christian, is a personal experience history.
target: Seki li finn rakonte a  so intervyuer, Philippe A Christian, li enn zistwar veki.

input: Other examples: memorable events which happened to you, humourous tales about yourself.
target: Lezot lexanp: Evennman memorab ki finn ariv u—mem, zistwar komik lor u mem.

input: Experiences you had while traveling somewhere.
target: U prop lexperyans ki u finn gayne ler u finn al vwayaze parla.

input: A legend is a third-person history.
target: Enn lezand li listwar an tyers person.

input: The word legend is often used to mean an untrue history.
target: Sa mo “lezand" la suvan finn sinifye ki li enn fos zistwar.

input: Whether people think they are true or not does not keep them from telling the stories.
target: Ki dimunn krwar lezand la vre ubyen fos, sa napa anpes zot rakont zot kanmem.

input: Legends are a way of answering the questions about how thing have change in the past, because they are set in a period when the world was much as we see it today.
target: Lezand li enn fason pu reponn kestyon lor kimanyer tu kitsoz finn sanze dan lepase, parski li derule dan enn lepok ki resanble lepok zordi.

input: Legends also are part of the continuing fabric of people’s thinking about themselves.
target: Lezand form parti sa tisi de panse, ki konstitye manyer panse lor nu—mem.

input: A historical examples of the legend of the band of escaped slaves living at Morne Brabant.
target: Anu get enn lexanp istorik, sa lezand lor bann esklav maron ki ti pe viv lor Montayn Le Morn.

input: When they were finally found, the story goes, they throw themselves into the sea rather than submit.
target: Kan ti al dekuver zot alafin, zistwar la dir, zot finn zet zot lekor dan lamer dan plas rann lekor ubyen sumet.

input: The legend shows the former slaves to have been proud, strong, defiant people.
target: Lezand—la montre ki esklav ti dimunn fyer, kuraze ek bann dimunn ki finn defye listwar.

input: Once a story like this is told among Mauritians again and again, it should be called a legend.
target: Kan enn zistwar kuma sannlala li rakonte ek re-rakonte plizyer fwa par dimunn Moris, nu oblize apel li enn lezand.

input: This one have been put into printed form, which has probably made it better known (Ramdoyal 1979: 1-7).
target: Sa lezand-la finn inprime, e sa finn sandut fer li pli koni ankor (Ramdoyal 1979: 1 -7).

input: Every well-known historical person is the subject of stories,songs and sayings which are passed along orally.
target: Tu personaz byen koni dan listwar, zot vinn size bann Zistwar, sante ek koze ki rakonte.

input: Traditionally accounts of great historical persons.
target: Koze lor tu bann gran personaz istorik.

input: The following names are only the beginning.
target: Ala enn de nom pu komanse.

input: Famous persons of the period before independence.
Stories about Sir Seewoosagur Ramgoolam, Dr Maurice Cure, Guy Rosemont.
target: Zistwar lor Sir Seewoosagur Ramgoolam, Dr Maurice Cure, Guy Rosemont.

input: Examples: Sookdeo Bissondoyal had a rose in his house, which is used to consult every morning.
target: Par exanp: Sookdeo Bissondoyal ti ena enn roz dan so lakaz, ki ti kuma enn oroskop pu li.

input: If it was open, his project(s) that day would succeed (`Flower"); if closed, they would not.
target: Si roz-la ti uver, sa ti anons li ki tu so proze pu lazurne pu bon (pu "fleri"), si fler roz-la ti ferme, sa ti ule dir ki so bann proze pa pu abuti (pu “ferme”).

input: He had no telephone: he prefers to walk rather than own a car: if he went to the cinema, he sat only in the third class.
target: Li pa ti ena telefonn; li ti prefer marse ki pran enn loto; si zame li al sinema, li asize dan trwazyem.

input: Pupils who went to him for tuition were told to pay whatever they could afford.
target: So bann zelev leson ti kapav pey li seki zot kapav.

input: Think of other examples and other famous persons yourself.
target: Pans lezot lexanp lor lezot personaz inportan.

input: Living persons are often the richest material for folklore.
target: Dimunn vivan suvan enn matyer ris pu folklor.

input: especially those people who are not often seen, we only hear story.
target: spesyalman bann dimunn ki pa truv zot suvan, zis tann zistwar.

input: Choose (or let your informants choose) your own examples from television or public life today.
target: Swazir (ubyen les u informater swazir) u lexanp depi televisyon ubyen depi lavi piblik.

input: Often the finest material for folklore is lound in a contemporary political situation.
target: Suvan materyel pli zenyal pu folklor truv dan sityasyon politik kontanporin.

input: Every village and community has its own local characters who have won fame or unusual qualities.
target: Sak vilaz ek landrwa ena so prop karakter lokal avek zot bann repitasyon pu zafer inabityel.

input: Accounts of the saying and doings of these local characters should be recorded.
target: Kolekte bann zistwar ek koze lor sa bann karakter-la bizin rikord.

input: Local heroes who did something memorable.
target: Ero lokal ki finn fer kitsoz memorab.

input: persons with unusual body forms: Very tall.
target: Dimunn ki so lekor drol: byen gran.

input: Deformed persons who dressed in an unusual way.
target: Dimunn diforme ki abiye enn drol fason.

input: person who had special powers (curing, foretelling the future, reciting holy writings).
target: dimunn ki ena puvwar spesyal (pu gerizon, dir u destin, resitasyon bann ekri sakreu).

input: person who lived to great old age.
Great singers, story tellers, dancers, athletes.
target: Gran santer, rakonter zistwar, danser, atlet.
dimunn ki konn fabrik tu kitsoz (zarm, zuti).

input: For all such persons, get answers to "How did this person become known?" and ‘“what was the story of his/her life?“.
target: Pu tu sa bann dimunn-la, bizin gayn enn repons pu kestyon swivan: ‘Kimanyer sa dimunn la ti vinn koni ubyen notwar?” ‘Ki ti listwar so lavi’?

input: You can begin with your own family.
target: U kapav kumans avek u prop fami.

input: Who is the person of your family who is most talk about?
target: Kisannla dan u fami ki tu dimunn plis koz so koze?

input: What stories have you heard about this person?
target: Ki zistwar u finn tande lor li?

input: Which are the best known family names in your part of the island?
target: Ki bann dimunn ou fami ki ou pli tande?

input: Which families have lived there longest?
target: Ki bann fami ki ti pe res laba pli lontan?

input: Who are the well—known persons in the family’s past?
target: Ki personaz dan lafami dan lepase ki ti pli koni?

input: If you can find a family occasion that happens again and again during which stories about the family are told, it will make and excellent study for you.
target: Si u truv enn espes lokazyon, enn fet kiksoz, kot dimunn repet e re-repet bann zistwar dan lafami, sa pu kapav enn letid exelan.

input: Family gathering’s, especially at holiday time, are often the major opportunity people have to tell and hear bit’s of the family past.
target: Rasanblemam lafami, sirtu pandan konze, suvan li sa lokazyon spesyal pu dimunn rakont bann but-but zistwar lafami.
Obzerv e mark tu seki u tande:

input: Names, roles and relationships of the people who are there.
target: Non, rol sak dimunn, ek so lyen ek lezot ki prezan.

input: The actions that happen one another.
target: Aksyon ki arive, enn apre lot.

input: The ways of speaking and acting that people use (speaking, shouting, whispering, laughing, singing, chanting, making or breaking eye contact).
target: Fason ki dimunn koze ek zot aktinng (koze, kriye, sufle, riye, sante, fason servi lizye, fixe u, pa fixe u, pez enn lizye u get gro lizye).

input: Who is allowed to tell stories and who should listen?
target: Ki sannla gayn draw rakonte ek kisannla bizin ekute?

input: How old does a person have to be to participate actively in this occasion?
target: Ki laz enn dimunn bizin ena pu li partisipe dan sa rasambleman-la?

input: How do they assume their roles (for instance, does one person tell others to listen to the story teller?).
target: Kuma zot asim zot diferan rol (par exanp eski ena enn dimunn ki dir lezot ekute?).

input: Other Themes to Ask For Unfaithful husbands and wives Children fathered by wrong person.
target: Lezot topik ek tem ki u kapav rode mari ubyen fam ki finn tronp lot la.
Zanfan ki ti ena enn papa ki pa ti sipoze so papa.

input: Person who eat a great deal.
Persons who are great talkers or singers or dancers.

target: Dimunn ki gran rakonter zistwar ubyen santer ubyen danser.

input: Some of the history elements in the following list are numbered.
An unexpected person gets reward or fortune.
target: Nu finn nimerot bann eleman dan.

input: A man who people think will never do anything important does something to change their attitude.
target: Enn dimunn ki pa ti krwar pu gayn erm rekonpans ubyen enn fortinn, ki gayn li.

input: Stories about a fool or stupid person.
target: Enn zom ki dimunn ti krwar zame li pu reysi fer enn kitsoz inportan, me li fer kiksoz ki sanz sa lide lor li.

input: People who is unusually kind or unkind.
target: Zistwar lor dimunn bet ubyen inbesil.

input: Rewards for keeping on with a job or sticking to a task.
target: Dimunn ki tro bon, ubyen ki tro kriyel.

input: Stories that show it was no use keeping on with a job.
target: Rekonpans pu persistans dan enn travay ubyen pu tini ferm dan enn travo.
Zistwar ki montre ki pa ti ena itilite persiste avek enn sel travay.

input: Stories about cyclones, storms, rain, dry years, times or sickness.

target: Zistwar lor siklonn, lor loraz, tanpet, lasesres, lepok lepidemi.

input: Prediction that a child or a man will become an important person.
Prophecy of the downfall of the British colonizers.
target: Prediksyon ki enn zanfan ubyen enn zom pu vinn kikenn inportan.
Profesi lor ekrulman reyn kolon Angle.

input: Prophecies concerning the destiny of Mauritius, India, or another country.

target: Profesi konsernan destin Moris, Lind ubyen enn lot pei.

input: Present-day accounts of the past of Mauritius (oral histories)are valuable records of the way people see themselves, their group, and their life up to now.
Persons that traditionally tell stories about the past of Mauritius can usually be found, because they are well-known in their locality.
target: Versyon aktyel bann zistwar lor lepase dan Moris (listwar oral) ena enn valer, zot rikord manyer dimunn zordi truv zot—mem, zot grup ek zot lavi ziska leprezan.

input: Sometimes people select a special person to keep and pass on the oral history of the place and people.
target: Pa difisil truv sa bann dimunn ki tradisyonelman rakont zistwar lor lepase dan Moris, parski zot rekoni dan zot landrwa.

input: Or sometimes one person simply feels more interest in traditions or is a better storyteller.
target: Parfwa enn landrwa selekte enn dimunn spesyal pu gard ek fer pas listwar oral enn landrwa.

input: When you find such and active bearer of tradition, give him or her special attention.
target: Ou parfwa enna dimunn ki limem li pli interese dan tradisyon ubyen li anfet enn meyer rakonter zistwar.

input: Oral stories should be recorded literally, along with the conditions under which they are usually told: persons listening, time of day, manner of telling the account.
target: Kan u zwenn enn dimunn ki ena sa rol aktiv ek konsyan, u bizin donn li enn latansyon spesyal.

input: Oral stories of the settlement of the a district and of the effects of important events upon the people deserve being recorded.
target: Zistwar oral bizin anrezistre mo-ta-mo, mark detay lor tutotur osi: lodyans ki pe ekute, ki ler li ete, manyer rakonte.

input: What do people say about the settling of their particular part of Mauritius?
target: Zistwar oral lor kimanyer sa landrwa finn peple, ek lor lefe bann evennman inportan lor sa lepep la, zot inportan garde.
Ki dimunn dir lor fason ki finn vinn res dan sa but Moris?

input: Why did they live their former place (local fighting, overcrowding, sickness, desire for a better place)?
target: Kot bann abitan-la ti sorti? Kifer zot finn kit kot zot ti reste avan (lager laba, sirpopilasyon, maladi, lepidemi, lespwar pu enn meyer lanvironnman)?

input: Did they find the place empty, or were others living there before?
target: Eski landrwa la ti vid ubyen eski ti deza ena abitan?

input: How did they live (raising vegetables or goats, cutting sugarcane, working in sugar estate)?
target: Kuma zot ti viv plant legim ubyen nuri kabri, kup kann, travay tablisman?

input: Where did people put their homes?
target: Kot dimunn ti aranz zot lakaz?

input: What made them decide to build there?
target: Ki fer zot desid pu aranz lakaz laba?

input: What sort of houses had they?
target: Ki kalite lakaz zot ti ena?

input: Have the villages of groups of houses in your district been changed at any time?
target: Eski vilaz ubyen lakaz finn sanze enn ku dan lepase?

input: What effects had the wars ofthe British (1914-18) and 1939-45 on the people of your neighborhood?
target: Ki lefe Lager Angle (1914-18 ek 1939-45) iinn ena lor u landrwa?

input: Were men taken into the army?
target: Eski ti pran zom pu rant dan larme?

input: Were food supplies taken for the army?
target: Eski ti pran stok manze pu larme?

input: What accounts do people remember in families, for instance of the lives of men who were affected by wars?
target: Ki but-but zistwar dimunn rapel (dan lafami par exanp) lor lavi bann zom ki ti afekte par lager?

input: How were army companies made up (Mauritian together)?
target: Kuma iinn konstitye bann reziman larme?

input: How were men taught to tight?
target: Eski tu Morisyen ti ansam? Kuma ti montre bann zom pu lager?

input: Guns and other equipment, ways of fighting, victories, battles, defeats.
target: Fizi ek lezot lekipman, manyer lager, viktwar, batay; defet.

input: Military service today (Mauritius Police and Special Mobile force).
target: Servis militer zordi (Lapolis ek Mobayl Fors).

input: What do men say about serving in the Special Mobile Force?
target: Dimunn ki dir lor travay Mobayl Fors?

input: Why does a young man join?
Why do they join the Police?

target: So lavi, so manze, so linz.
Amizman ek spor ki polisye zwe.

input: Orders to return to camp before a certain time, and those who disobeyed such orders.
target: Lord pu rant kwarters enn ler fix, si enn polisye napa obeyir.

input: Objects worn to protect men from danger or death.
target: Obze proteksyon ki zot mete ubyen porte pu protez zot kont danze ek lamor.

input: Soldiers from Britain or other foreign place in Mauritius in the past.
target: Solda Angle ubyen depi lezot plas dan lepase.

input: What accounts have come down (through families?) of old times in Mauritius?
target: Ki vre zistwar rakonte depi lepok lontan Moris (atraver lafami)?
Vye zistwar ki ti rakonte lontan.
Zistwar lor kifer enn plas ena tel ubyen tel nom?

input: What explanations do people give for place names in your neighborhood, or in some other part of Mauritius?
target: Ki explikasyon dimunn done pu tel nom enn landrwa pre kot u, ubyen enn lot plas dan Moris?

input: You will find that these are different from the "official" explanations.
target: U pu dekuver ki sa explikasyon li napa ditu parey avek explikasyon "ofisyel".

input: For instance, some people say that Moka isnamed  for Mecca, the holy city of Islam, while others connect it to mocha coffee.
target: Par exanp, ena dimunn dir ki nom "Moka” ena kit lyen ek Lamek, lavil sakre dapre Islam, tandi ki ena lezot dimunn dir ki li pe fer referans a enn kalite kafe ki apel mocha.

input: Some people think Rose Hill describes something once seen in that town, while others insist that it’s named after a place in a foreign country.
target: Ena dimunn krwar ki Rose-Hill gayn so nom akoz dimunn ti truv li kuma enn "Rose-Hill" alor finn donn li sa nom-la, ena dimunn dir ki li enn nom ki finn amene depi enn lot lavil dan enn lot pei.

input: Record the place names exactly, especially if the name is no longer used officially, and especially if it occurs in variant forms.
target: Bizin mark nom bann plas avek presizyon, sirtu si nom la nepli servi ofisyelman, e sirtu si nu tann li dan plizyer diferan versyon.

input: Record place name legends exactly, no matter how fantastic they seem.
target: Bizin mark ek gard bann nom tu diferan plas dan lezand, pa fer naryen ki degre farfeli nom la paret.

input: Like the story of Pieter Both‘s head.
How did the following places get their name?
target: Kimanyer sa bann plas-la gayn sa bann nom-la?

input: Villages, rocks,hills, mountains, caves, rivers, streams, bodies of water.
target: Vilaz, ros, kolinn, montayn, lakav, larivyer, rwiso, lasurs dilo.

input: What stories are told about certain things in your neighbourhood, such as graves, monuments to the dead, altars, old roads or paths, and mined buildings?
target: Ki zistwar u finn tande dan u landrwa, lor bann tom, kavo dimunn mor, moniman, vye sime ubyen santye, batiman ki tinn tom an rwinn?

input: Record these stories and photograph the place.
target: Kolekte sa bann zistwar e tir foto sa bann plas la.

input: What do people say about how land was held in former times?
target: Ki dimunn dir lor distribisyon later dan lepok lontan?

input: Why people settled in a particular place.
target: Kifer dimunn inn instal zot dan enn plas partikilye.

input: Fights with other families or groups about who should live on a certain piece of land.
target: Diskisyon dan lafami ubyen dan grup lor kisannla pu res lor ki morso later.

input: Beliefs about how boundary lines should be recorded.
target: Panse lor kuma bann teritwar kapav marke.

input: What do people do to keep boundaries?
target: Ki dimunn fer pu tini sa bann frontier-la?

input: How are people punished if they break boundaries?
target: Kimanyer ti pini dimunn ki ti kas bann tel baryer?
Dimunn ki finn purswiv zot kamarad.

input: Describe a house and its surroundings.
target: Dekrir enn lakaz ek so lanturaz.

input: Select one that represents fairly the ones in your neighborhood.
target: Swazir enn lakaz ki reprezantativ lakaz dan u landrwa.
Mark so grander, so form, so longer, so larzer.
Eski ti servi fennsing uhyen baraz banbu ubyen raket?

input: Amounts of land used for growing certain crops.
target: Kantite later ki servi pu plant sertin kalite manze.

input: Number of goats, chickens, dogs, other animals.
target: Kantite kabri, pul, lisyen, lezot zanimo.

input: Do people divide their land among themselves and their children?
target: Eski dimunn partaz later ant zot ek zot zanfan?

input: Stories of people who build second or third houses for themselves or their children (at the seaside, elsewhere).
target: Zistwar lor dimunn ki aranz enn dezyem u trwazyem lakaz pu zot mem u pu zot zanfan (dan bor lamer, ubyen enn lot plas).

input: Folklore Communication at a Fancy Fair.
The Fancy Fair in Mauritius is a fund raising event.
target: Dan Moris fennsifer li enn kalite aktivite ki servi pu lev finans.

input: often sponsored by a church and held at a weekend.
target: Kumsa lev fon pu legliz enormalman zot pandan wikenn, sirtu dimans.

input: It is a good example to remind you that everyday life is where you find most folklore.
target: Li enn bon lexanp rapel rapel nu ki lavi tulezur ki kotenir plis Folklor.

input: At every Fancy Fair you find several of the same things over and over: games, a flea market of donated clothes, prepared food, predictable dishes like Briani, beer, and plenty of public drinking.
target: Dan sak fennsifer, ti truv mem zafer plizyer fwa, mem kalite zwe, marse tipis, preparasyon manze ki u kapav kone pu ena kuma briyani, plis labyer ek enn ta labwason ki konsome an piblik.

input: There are also many stories on fancy fair.
For instance, the Fancy Fair of St Anne of Chamarel, some people say, is famous for much public drunkenness.
target: Dimunn dir ki fennsifer Ste Anne dan Samarel byen rekoni pu lefet ki buku dimunn su an plin piblik.

input: It doesn’t matter whether that’s true or not.
target: Pa fer nanyen pu enn folkloris si li vre u fos.

input: It does matter what people say and think about it.
target: Seki inportan se dimunn pe dir sa.

input: What can you find out about this and other Fancy Fairs?
target: Ki u kapav dekuver lor sa e lezot fennsifer?

input: Also, Fancy Fairs have undergone change over the last generation: song competitions, for instance, used to be part of every program, but now they don’t appear as much.
target: Finnm ena buku sanzmam dan manyer organiz fennsifer dan dernye zenerasyon: ti pe gayn konkur sante, me nepli gayne.

input: In 1989 a "chamber of horrors" turned up as part of the entertainment in one.
target: An 1989, ti ena enn "chambre horreur” ki ti form parti dan enn fennsifer.

input: Thus, another topic is changes in this event over time.
target: Donk lane apre lane ena bann kalite sanzman ki opera dan sa fennsifer spesifik.

input: Thanks to Vinesh Y.Hookoomsing for this suggestion.
target: Remersiman a Vinesh Y Hookoomsing pu sa linformasyon la.

input: Many kinds of speech play, games and riddles exist in Mauritius, waiting to be systematically collected.
target: Ena enn kantite zedmo, zwe, ek badinaz avek parol ki existe dan Moris, pe atann kikenn kolekte zot sistematikman.

input: Playing with words, speech and language is one of the principal ways by which children learn.
target: Enn-de fason pli inportan pu zanfan aprann, se atraver zwe avek mo, zwe avek parol, zwe avek langaz.

input: In a multilingual society like this one, children also learn how to manage several languages.
target: Dan enn sosyete miltiling kuma isi, zanfan usi aprann kimanyer pu mannej plizyer langaz.

input: Be alert for game and amusements in which children with from Creole to French or Bhojpuri to Creole, or use English words in Creole sentence.
target: Bizin obzerve dan ki kalite zwe ek badinaz zemfan sanze depi Kreol a Franse ubyen depi Bhojpuri a Kreol, ubyen servi mo Angle dan fraz Kreol.

input: Games with words, letters, numbers, or papers should be observed and recorded.
target: Bizin obzerv ek rikord bann zwe avek mo, let, sif, ubyen avek papye.

input: Also, bear in mind questions like these:
target: Bizin usi rapel bann kestyon kuma: Eski sa bann zwe ek sante la zis pu zanfan, ubyen eski zot form parti lavi adilt osi?

input: Are the games and songs of children in your community known and played only by children, or are they also part of the life of adults?
target: Eski zwe ek sante ki zanfan lekol zwe diferan depi zwe ek sante zanfan ki pa al lekol?

input: Do the games and songs of schoolchildren differ from the games and songs of children who are not in school?
target: Si li diferan, dan ki fason?
Eski zanfan aprann serten zwe ek sante kan li ena enn serten laz, lerla apre sa, amezir li grandi, eski li aprann lezot?

input: Does the child learn some games and songs at a certain age and then go on to learn others as he gets older?
target: Eski li bliye saki li ti kone avan?

input: Does he forget the ones he learned before?
target: Eski zwe zenes varye depandan sezon, ubyen depandan diferan lepok lane?

input: Do the games of young people change in any way according to different times of year?
target: Zwe spesyal ki zwe zis pandan konze, ubyen lezot zur spesifik?

input: Special games played on holidays or other special days.
target: Eski zot zwe lizur ubyen aswar?

input: Are games played by day or night?

target: Eski ena zwe ki separ enn zwer depi tu lezot zwer?

input: Do some games separate one player from all the others?
target: Eski ena kikenn dan u landrwa ki sey montre zanfan zwe lontan, zistwar lontan, ubyen sante dantan?
Kan zanfan zwe zedmo, byen suvan zot pe zwe avek bann parol ki zot servi tulezur, ubyen zot pe servi zedmo pu determinn kisannla so tur dan enn zwe.

input: The exchange of riddles among children is usually a game, involving the words they speak, the rules they follow for taking turns.
target: Li osi interesan pu obzerve komye puvwar ki zot donn dimunn ki dimann zedmo-la, ek komye lenerzi ki zot met dan sa zwe la.

input: It is also interesting to observe the degree of power they grant to the person who puts the riddle, and the energy they put into it.
target: Obzerv zwe zedmo dan enn grup zanfan, swa enn zwe ki arive natirelman ubyen enn ki u finn large u-mem.

input: Observe the exchange of riddles by a group of children, either an exchange that occurs naturally or one which you suggest to them.
What are the roles of the participants (active, passive)?
Where do they sit or stand? Record the way the game is played, especially the questions and answers that make up the riddles themselves.
target: Rikord manyer ki zwe—la pe fer, sirtu bann kestyon ek repons ki form parti zedmo la li-mem.

input: Games of initiation are related to riddling.
target: Byen suvan zwe "inisyasyon" liye ar zedmo.

input: Observe and record any games in which children let other children in to their little society with formal works or actions.
target: Obzerve ek rikord tu zwe kot zanfan permet lot zanfan rant dan zot ti grup atraver enn performans ubyen aksyon ase formel.

input: Notice the confusing devices used in riddles.
target: Etidye bann taktik konfizyonist ki servi dan zedmo.

input: Some riddles say that an object has two opposed qualities.
target: Serten zedmo dir ki enn obze ena 2 kalite ki kontradiktwar.

input: “The mother says, ‘Go straight up’, the children say, ‘Let’s go crosswise’.
target: "Mama la dir, ‘Al drwat mem’, bann zanfan dir, ‘Anu al vizavi’.

input: This corner is no corner at all.
target: Sa kwin la pa ennm kwin ditu.

input: Still others reverse the usual relations of power between parent and children.
target: Lezot zedmo ranvers relasyon puvwar ki ena ant paran ek zanfan.

input: Riddling is usually a way of displaying or calling for knowledge.
target: Zedmo li suvan enn fason pu montre konesans, swa pu rod kmiesans.

input: To ask is to possess one kind of power; to answer is to possess another kind.
target: Pu dimande inplik enn zar puvwar; pu reponn inplik enn lot kalite puvwar.
Kisannla pe montre ki li ena konesans?

input: Who calls for knowledge to be displayed?
target: Kisannla dimann pu ki enn lot dimunn montre so konesans?

input: When and where does this happen?
target: Kan ek kotsa ki tusala arive?

input: What purposes are these players showing?
target: Ki rol sa bann zweer la pe ranpli?

input: Tongue-twisters are short sayings which are difficult to say, especially for someone just learning a language, and which must be said over and over very fast.
target: Ena bann zafer difisil pu dir, sirtu pu dimunn ki pe aprann enn langaz, e ki bizin dir e dir ankor bien vit.
Kolekte otan lexanp kumsa ki u kapav.

input: What names are used locally for tongue-twisters?
target: Kuma apel sa bann zwe la?

input: Do children put them to each other?
target: Eski zanfan fer so kamarad dir sa bann zwe la?

input: How many of these does one child know?
How many times must a tongue-twister be said to show that the child can do it?
target: Komye fwa enn sa bann zwe la bizin dir pu montre ki u kapav fer li?

input: What happens if a child can’t say it?
target: Ki arive si emi zanfan pa kapav dir li?
Eski bizin “peye" ubyen eski li gayn kit "pinisyon"?
Dimann zanfan sa bann detay la.

input: Lullabies (songs that put children to sleep).

target: Ti-sante kot ena sif ki konte ladan.

input: Are these used to pick out one player for the playing of another game?
target: Eski servi zot pu swazir enn zweer pu enn lot zwe?

input: Action songs that must be acted out.
target: Santo ki ena aktinng ki al ar li.

input: How do children divide themselves into groups for the playing of games or the singing of songs?
target: Kimanyer zanfan kas zot an grup pu zwe ubyin pu sante?

input: Do they form a ring, an arch, a line?
target: Eski zot fer enn ron, enn arch, enn laliyn?

input: Games in which players do something different or opposite to what they are ordered to do.
target: Rod zwe dan lekel bann zweer bizin fer zafer diferan ubyin mem lekontrer de seki inn dir zot fer.

input: What objects do children play with (hoops, wheels)?
target: Avek ki obze eski zanfan zwe (zant, serk)?

input: Give a full description of each one, along with the way that children play with it.
target: Donn deskripsyon an detay, e explik kimanyer zanfan zwe avek zot.

input: Is the toy a small imitation of a familiar or known object (swords,shields)?
target: Eski zuzu la enn ti-imitasyon enn obze ordiner ubyen enn obze ki zot  kone (lepe, panye)?

input: Don‘t assume that all toys are imported to Mauritius and bought from shops.
target: Napa asime ki dan Moris tu zwe inporte ek aste dan magazin.

input: Who makes toys in your neighborhood?
target: Kisannla ranz zwe dan u lanturaz?

input: Games with balls, flowers, plants, buttons, sticks, ropes, strings,stones, bones, hoops, other objects.
target: Koleksyonn bann zwe ki zwe avek bul, avek fler, plant, buton, baton, lakord, but-but difil, ti-ros, lezo,zant, lezot obze.
Koleksyonn zwe ki inplik pye, zwazo, zanimo.

input: Games in which children play at being these things.
target: Zwe kot zanfan pretann ki zot sa bann kreatir la.

input: Games in which children play at being fathers, mothers, school-teachers, shopkeepers, or other adults.
target: Zwe kot zanfan fer rol papa, mama, profeser lekol, butikye, ubyen lezot adilt.

input: Games in which players act certain parts.
target: Zwe kot zanfan amenn rol fer aktinng.

input: Games in which children march around,or go from house to house.
target: Zwe kot zanfan fer lef-rayt ubyen fer port a port.

input: Hindu, Muslim, Chinese, European, and all other cultures that have contributed to Mauritius have always known the value of stories and proverbs in educating the young.
target: Kiltir Lind, Lafrik, Madagaskar, Lasinn, Lerop, ek tu lezot kiltir ki finn kontribye dan kreasyon Moris finn tultan konn valer bann zistwar ek bann proverb dan ledikasyon zanfan.

input: Teachers and parents are responsible for making sure that children do not forget their traditional folklore.
target: Profeser ek paran responsab asire ki zanfan napa bliye folklor tradisyonel.

input: This includes both the riddles, games and amusements they learn from each other and the stories and proverbs in educating the young.
target: Sa inklir zedmo, zwe ek lamizman zot aprann antre zot, ek zistwar ek proverb ki zot gayne depi bann adilt avek lotorite.

input: What more, if a teacher or a parent shows that she values a child’s real knowledge, she will suggest that children have something important that is theirs, and that the children themselves are important.
target: Anplis, si profeser ubyen paran montre ki zot ena estim pu konesans ki zanfan deza ena, li pu ankuraz enn zanfan donn limem valer, e truv linportans so prop kontribisyon.

input: Does anyone try to get children away form television to listen to storytelling?
target: Eski ena dimunn ki sey tir zanfan depi televizyon pu rakont zot zistwar?

input: What times and places are suitable for storytelling?
target: Ki ler ek kotsa eski li bon pu rakont zistwar?

input: Ask children to tell stories they know and discuss them.
target: Dimann zanfan rakont zistwar ki zot kone e lerla amenn diskisyon lor la.

input: Do children like the same stories you used to know as a child?
target: Eski zanfan kontan zistwar ki u ti kontan kan u ti zanfan?

input: What do children like in the stories?
target: Ki zafer zanfan kontan dan zistwar?

input: Here is something that secondary school children will enjoy.
target: Ala enn zafer ki zanfan lekol segonder pu kontan.

input: Write the story that you like best.
target: Ekrir zistwar ki u pli kontan.

input: It can be a story you have heard at home, or while playing with other children, or in school, or anywhere else.
target: Li kapav enn zistwar ki zot finn tande lakaz, ubyin kan zot ti pe zwe avek lezot zanfan, ubyen dan lekol, ubyin ninport kotsa.

input: Why do you like this story?
Who first told the story to you?
target: Kisannla ti rakont u sa zistwar la premye.

input: Was it first told in Creole, or some other language?
target: Eski u ti tann li an Kreol premye fwa, ubyen dan enn lot langaz?

input: How old were you when you tirst heard the story?
target: Ki laz u ti ena kan u ti tann sa zistwar la premye fwa?

input: Results of this assignment can be put together in a book as a creation of your school (Adapted from an experiment done in Ghana).
target: Rezilta sa asaynmennt la kapav met dan enn liv kuma enn kreasyon u lekol (Adapte depi erm experyans depi Gana).

input: Proverbs are memorable sentences which are used to sum up and pass judgement on a situation.
target: Proverb zot bann fraz memorab ki servi pu rezim enn sityasyon e pu port enn zizman lor la.

input: Expressions shorter than a sentence, like “Ene bapteme lera, (a rat’s baptism)" are proverbial phrases.
target: Enn expresyon pli kurt ki enn fraz, kuma "Ene baptmme lera” se enn ‘morso proverbyal’.

input: Though it is the words which are memorable, and therefore which should be written down exactly, it is the situation in which the proverb is aid that should be observed most carefully.
target: Li vre ki se bann mo ki form parti enn proverb ki memorab, alor ki bizin ekrir exak exak seki ena ladan; me li osi vre ki pli inportan ankor se sityasyon kot dir proverb, alor bizin obzerv sa avek otan latansyon.

input: For example, you might hear someone say, "the snail dances, the monkey laughs".
target: Par egzanp, u kapav tann kikenn dir: "kurpa danse, zako riye".

input: Without any information about when these words were said, by whom, to whom, we cannot know what this saying means.
target: San okenn detay lor kan dir sa parol la, kisannla dir li, a kisannla, nu pa kapav kone ki sa parol ule dir.

input: You cannot assume that you already know.
target: U pa kapav asime ki nu deza kone ki li ule dir.

input: You must find out from the person who says it.
target: U bizin kareman dimann dimunn ki ti dir li ki li ule dir.

input: Ask him or her to say the same idea in other words, and to explain the intention.
target: Dimann li pu redir seki li finn dir dan enn lot fason, e pu li explik so lintansyon.

input: Proverbs are employed in Mauritius, as everywhere else, according to certain rules.
target: Dan Moris, parey kuma lezot plas, partaz proverb dapre serten regleman.

input: They are spoken only at certain times by certain persons (adults?) to certain other persons (children?).
target: Serten dimunn (adilt?) dir zot dan sertenn moman selman a lezot dimunn (zanfan?).

input: Part of recording folklore consists in finding out the rules governing the usage of proverbs.
target: Enn parti rikording folklor li sirtu lor truv bann regleman ki kontrol itilizasyon bann proverb.

input: Notice also that proverbs are impersonal.
target: Remarke usi ki bann proverb zot enn zafer inpersonal.

input: They allow the hearer to listen to the voice of experience, the nameless creators of the proverbs.
target: Zot permet dimunn, ki pe tann kikenn so lavwa, avredir gayn lokazyon ekut lavwa ‘lexperyans’ direk, ekut lavwa `kreater proverb’.

input: From their impersonality they gain their authority.
target: Atraver inpersonalite ki bann proverb ena, zot gayn lotorite.

input: Proverbs tend to vary less in their wording than other verbal forms.
target: Preverb ena tandans varye mwins dan ki mo li kontenir, ki lezot form koze.

input: A person will usually say the proverb the same way this time as last time.
target: Dimunn suvan rakont bann proverb parey kuma ladernyer fwa.

input: But proverbs do vary in the meanings people attach to them.
target: Selman sinifikasyon bann proverb kapav varye depandan ki sinifikasyon dimunn donn zot.

input: It may refer in one person`s mind to noise and in another person’s mind to impoliteness.
target: Pu enn dimunn, li kapav pe fer referans a tapaz, e pu enn lot dimunn, li ule dir mank polites.

input: All variant interpretations should be observed and recorded.
target: Bizin obzerv ek rikord diferan interpretasyon.

input: How are the speaker and listener related?
target: Ki relasyon ant dimunn ki pe koze ek seki pe ekute?

input: What is the literal meaning of the proverb?
What is the meaning the hearer is supposed to get?
target: Ki sinifikasyon ki dimunn ki pe ekut proverb sipoze konpran?

input: What was happening in the immediate conversation just then?
target: Ki ti pe arrive dan kenversasyon zis avan kikenn dir proverb la?

input: How do you interpret the proverb in this setting?
target: Kimanyer u interpret proverb la dan sa moman la, e dan sa dekor la?
Koze folklor ki idantifye diferan grup.

input: What words, groups of words, or sayings are used by people who are engaged in particular occupations?
target: Ki bann mo, seri mo, ubyin ki koze ki servi par dimunn ki ena diferan travay?

input: Clerk or secretary in private sector.
Women’s folk speech, in these and their other occupations, should be observed and recorded.
target: Bizen obzerv koze folklor fam, dan travay, e osi dan lezot lokipasyon ki fam ena.

input: For centuries, women in Mauritius have worked unbelievably hard to keep house, feed their families, and grow food.
target: Fam dan Moris finn travay byen dir pandan plizir syek fer luvraz lakaz, nuri zot fami, e plant manze.

input: Also, the recent entry of thousands of women into the textile factories, airlines, hotels, and restaurants of Mauritius means the creation of new folk traditions — speech, custom, song.
target: Anplis, ena par milye fam dan Moris ki finn rant dan lizinn, konpagni avyon, lotel, ek restoran, savedir nuvo tradisyon oral — koze ki koze, kutim ki zot swiv, sante ki zot sante.

input: Women’s traditions are often quite separate from men’s and should be given special attention.
target: Nu bizin akord tradisyon fam enn latansyon spesyal etan done byen suvan li diferan depi seki pu zom.

input: What kinds of music or poetry belong to women?
target: Ki kalite lamizik ek poem ki fam prodir?

input: Lullabies, death songs, wedding songs, songs making fun of people,songs at work.
target: Bersez, sante lamor, sante maryaz, sante ki sikann dimunn, sante dan travay.

input: What numbers are used to stand for persons or objects?
target: Ki bann nimero ki servi pu dir dimunn ubyen obze?

input: When and where do people use these expressions?
target: Kan ek kotsasa ki servi sa bann lexpresyon la?

input: Are they used to superiors, to inferiors, only among good friends?
target: Eski servi zot avek dimunn inportan, a bann pli tipti, zis parmi bon kamarad?

input: Listen for examples of how they are used in ordinary speech.
target: Ekute kimanyer servi zot dan koze ordiner?

input: Listen also for the following names for pieces of money:
target: Ekut usi diferan nom ki servi pu pyes larzan:

input: Folk speech usually invents many names for one thing that is of concern to people.
target: Suvan tradisyon oral invant buku nom pu enn sel kiksoz, si li enn kiksoz ki inportan pu dimunn.

input: For instance, being drunk may be called roze, nisa (also used to mean high on drugs.
target: Par egzamp, enn dimunn ki finn su, kapav dir li roze, nisa usi servi pu dir lor ladrog.

input: Listen for and record other examples of various words for the same thing.
target: Ekut ek rikord lezot legzanp kot ena buku mo pu mem zafer.

input: Poetry and song, in Bhojpuri, Creole, French, Chinese, or any language, are closely connected.
target: Poezi ek sante, ki li dan Bhojpuri, Kreol, Franse, Sinwa ubyen ninport ki lot langaz, zot liye ansam.

input: Some of the most appealing of all folk literature comes in the form of poetry or song.
target: Parmi pli zoli zafer dan folklor se poezi ek sante.

input: Poetry is one of the most highly valued things people create.
target: Poezi li parmi zafer plis presye ki imin finn kree.

input: Standards of what is beautiful vary, however, from group to group.
target: Kimaniyer zize exakteman ki vedir pli zoli poem, sa li varye buku, de grup a grup.

input: No poem or piece of sculpture or folksong is going to strike every person as beautiful.
target: Tu dimunn pa neseserman truv enn mem poem ubyen enn mem but skilptir pli zoli.

input: What some people think is beautiful is just ugly to others, and no amount of telling them will make them believe otherwise.
target: Seki emi dimunn truv zoli, li kapav vilin pu lezot, e ninport komye u dir zot, zot pa pu sanz zot lide.

input: It is only necessary that the people who keep a song or poem in memory should value it.
target: Seki neseser ladan se kan dimunn gard enn sante ubyen enn poem vivan dan so lespri, par sa, li donn li so valer.

input: One service you can perform for your community is keeping these beautiful songs and poems in memory.
target: Enn kontribisyon ki u kapav fer u landrwa, se pu gard dan memwar tu zoli sante ek poem.

input: The collection of Bhojpuri songs made by Ms. Suchita Ramdin of the Mahatma Gandhi Institute shows what can be done with them.
target: Koleksyon sante Bhojpuri ki Ms Suchita Ramdin depi Mahatma Gandhi Institute ti fer, montre nu seki kapav fer avek zot.

input: If you are interested in folksong in Indian languages, consult this book.
target: Si u interese dan sante tradisyonel dan langaz indyen, u konsilte sa liv-la.

input: Because folksong and music are arts of performance, you should take special care in recording them.
target: Parski sante ek lamizik tradisyonel, zot seki nu apel bann lar ki depann lor performans, u bizin akord plis latansyon pu rikord zot.

input: Microphones, tape recorders, and conditions of recording should all be of the best quality.
target: Mikro, kaset odyo, ek bon kondisyon pu rikordinng, zot tu bizin bon kalite.

input: Much poetry in Mauritius is sung.
target: Dan Moris ena buku poezi ki dimunn sante.

input: But you should also listen for any sort of poetry not connected with music: children’s rhymes, poems on the death of a local person.
target: Me u bizin usi rod poezi ki pa lye ek lamizik: morso ki zanfan dir ek redir, poem alokazyon lamor enn dimunn dan landrwa.
Sante ek poem pu dey, sante otur lamor, poem finerer.
Kimanyer perform sa bann poem la?

input: Do they get written down regularly, or are you the first person to write them in your community?
target: Eski dimunn abitye ekrir zot lor papye, ubyen eski u-mem premye dimunn dan u lanvironnman pu koleksyemn zot?

input: Are there special poems having to do with religious ritual, or connected with religion in any way?
target: Eski ena poem spesyalman pu serten rit relizye, ubyn ki ena pu fer ek relizyom dan kik fason?

input: These may be folk creations, or folk variations of sacred texts.
target: Sa kapav et bann kreasyon folklor, ubyen varyasyon folklor lor bann liv sakre.

input: Observe and record these poems, and ask poets or singers to tell you about them.
target: Obzerv ek rikord sa bann poem la, e dimann bann poet ek santer pu rakont u lor la.

input: How do they leam to make poems like this?
target: Kimanyer zot tinn aprann pu perform sa poem?

input: Do different religious groups have different songs associated with them?
target: Eski diferan grup relizye ena diferan sante ki asosye ek zot?

input: Remember that while some religious songs are permitted to be sung only in a certain required form, others can be sung in variant forms.
target: Rapel ki ena sante relizye ki kapav sante zis dan serten form selman, lezot kapav sante dan diferan form.

input: Record the life history of a poet or singer who is specially well known and approved.
target: U kapav desid pu kree enn rikord, enn listwar lavi enn poet ubyen santer ki byen koni e byen popiler.

input: How does someone learn to make up or perform poems or songs?
target: Kimanyer dimunn aprann sante ubyen resit poem?

input: Does a person know he is to become a poet or singer by having a dream or vision?
target: Eski enn dimunn konsyan ki li pu vinn enn poet ubyen enn santer atraver enn vizyon ubyen enn rev?

input: Record such dreams from the person; get his statement about what they mean.
target: Mark detay lor sa kalite rev ki dimunn ena; mark ki sinifikasyon li donn sa rev la.

input: Do poets move from place to place to practice their art?
target: Eski bann poet al landrwa a landrwa pu pratik zot lar?

input: Do poets and singers belong to a high or a low social level?
target: Eski bann poet ek santer sort depi enn ran sosyal elve ubyen ba?

input: Do they look for persons who will pay them for writing poems or songs?
target: Eski zot rod dimunn ki pu pey zot pu ekrir poem ubyen sante?

input: What persons have made such payments - landowners, merchants?
target: Ki dimunn ki finn fer sa kalite peyman — proprieter later, marsan?

input: How do poets or singers get in touch with patrons?
target: Kimanyer poet ubyen santer gayn kontak ek zot bann sponsor?

input: Do parents give direction to their children to become poets or singers?
target: Eski paran gid zot zanfan pu fer zot vinn poet ubyen santer?

input: Do they make sure their children have music lessons?
target: Eski zot fer li zot devwar pu asire ki zot zanfan al leson lamizik?

input: Does being a poet or musician run in some families?
target: Eski et enn poet ubyen enn mizisyen swiv dan fami?

input: Do many blind persons become musicians?
target: Eski ena buku dimunn aveg ki vinn mizisyen?

input: Why do blind persons take up music?
Do poets learn songs by heart?
target: Eski poet aprann sante par ker?

input: Do people make up new songs or poems now?
target: Eski dimunn tuzur ekrir nuvo sante ek poem aster?

input: Is the poet allowed or encouraged to make new songs?
target: Eski dimunn ankuraz poet pu fer nuvo sante ou ankuraze pu invant nuvo sante?

input: How long are songs or poems remembered and sung?
target: Pu komye letan eski enn sante ubyen poemn res dan memwar?

input: Do you find songs that people say were made up long ago?
target: Eski u truv sante ki dimunn dir ti invante byen, byen lontan desela?

input: Is any person thought of as being the “owner” of a song, or a poem?
target: Eski ena dimunn ki konsidere kuma ‘proprieter’ enn sante, ubyen enn poem?

input: When and where would this person perform the piece?
target: Kan ek kotsa eski sa dimunn la pu perform sa morso la?

input: Are some parts of the song made up by the performer on the spur of the moment?
target: Eski ena serten parti sante ki santer kree anplas—anplas, inprovize?

input: Is he or she expected to put such things in?
target: Eski dimunn atann ki li pu inprovize kumsa?

input: Style of performance: Is the singing voice higher or lower than the singer’s usual speaking voice?
target: Zar performans: Eski santer la so lavwa pli ot ubyen pli ba kan li sante ki so lavwa ordiner kan li koze?

input: Does he/she get excited while performing?
target: Eski li exite kan li pe sante?

input: Are certain songs sung with instruments and not others?
target: Eski sertin sante ki sante avek linstriman ek ena non?

input: What kinds of song is everyone expected to know—work songs, children’s songs, lullabies?
target: Ki kalite sante ki laplipar dimunn sipoze kone, sante travay, sante zanfan, bersez?

input: Are people expected to know the group parts of songs sung with a leader?
target: Eski dimunn sipoze konn bann morso "koral” dan enn sante, kot zot sipoze sant enn but spesifik an grup, pu reponn a enn soloist?

input: What songs are sung only on certain occasions (weddings, funerals, births, initiations)?
target: Ki bann sante ki sante zis dan serten lokazyon (maryaz, lamor, nesans, inisyasyon)?

input: How does a singer know to appear at such an occasion?
