target: Kimanyer enn santer kone li bizen aparet dan enn serten moman?

input: What reward does he/she get, and who gives it to him/her?
target: Ki rekonpans li gayne, ek kisannla donn li sa?

input: Is that reward more or less than the reward people get for other kinds of work among that community?
target: Eski sa rekonpans la plis ubyin mwins ki seki dimunn gayne pu lezot travay dan landrwa?

input: It sometimes happens that singers or poets will sing a song or say a poem twice.
target: Parfwa bann santer ubyen poet sant enn sante 2 fwa ubyen rakont enn poem 2 fwa.

input: You may decide to record the same piece again,because your first recording was not of good quality.
target: U kapav deside pu anrezistre mem morso ankor enn fwa, parski u premye rikording pa ti de bon kalite.

input: Or you may record it again in order to find out whether the performer always does the same thing.
target: Ubyin u kapav rikord li ankor pu gete si performer la tultan fer mem zafer.

input: Often, singers and poets tell you that the second time was just like the first, but you, the observer hear differences.
target: Suvan, santer ek poet pu dir ki dezyem fwa li parey kuma premye, me u, ki pe ekute, u pu truv bann diferans.

input: The singer or poet has put in changes without knowing it.
target: Santer ubyen poet inn introdir sanzman san ki li kone.

input: Notice this process if you can.
target: Bizin kapav obzerv sa prosedir la, si u kapav.

input: Variation can occur between different performances by the same poet or singer between artists between generations in a family and in many other ways.
target: Varyasyon arrive parmi diferan performans par mem poet ubyen santer, parmi artist, parmi zenerasyon dan enn fami ek dan buku lezot fason.

input: How many and what kind of changes do people allow in their poetry and Song?
target: Komye sanzman ek ki kalite sanzman eski dimunn permet dan zot poezi ek sante?

input: Some peoples want their songs and poems repeated just as they were heard long ago.
target: Serten lepep anvi repet sante ek poem parey kuma lontan zot ti tann li.

input: How important is sameness the people in your community?
target: Komye linportans eski dimunn dan u landrwa akord a sa lide "parey-parey” kuma avan.

input: Try to find written forms of poems and songs.
target: Esey rod poem ek sante ekri.

input: Copy these and compare them with the oral versions you record.
target: Kopye zot, e konpar zot avek versyon oral ki u finnn rikord.

input: How much difference do you notice?
If a poet or singer changes words, does the music remain the same?
target: Si enn poet ubyen enn santer sanz so bann mo, eski lamizik res parey?

input: Does the leader of a song make up new words while performing with a group?
target: Eski lider sante la inproviz nuvo parol mem kan li pe sante ansam ek enn grup?

input: What are the most popular subjects for poems and songs?
target: Ki size pli popiler pu poem ek sante?

input: If a subject is popular, like love, we know that it is important to people.
target: Si enn size popiler, kuma lamur, nu kone ki li inportan pu dimunn.

input: Events ofthe present, or of long ago.
Are these subjects treated with approval, disapproval, ridicule, sadness, joy, sorrow, anger?
target: Eski tret sa bann size la avek aprobasyon,dezaprobasyon, ridikiliz zot, tristes, lazwa, regre, koler?

input: Sometimes people put into song what they do not dare to say in ordinary talk.
target: Parfwa dimunn sant lor bann zafer ki zot pa oze dir dan koze ordiner.

input: Is there a special sort of poem or song that praises or makes fun of a person?
target: Eski ena diferan kalite sante ubyen poem ki flat dimunn ubyen fer dimunn riy enn lot dimunn?

input: Do people ever make up and sing poems or songs praising themselves?
target: Eski dimunn invant ek sant poem ki flat zot mem?

input: Among the Islamic and Hindu communities, as among any Mauritian community, there may be folk poems about the religion.
target: Dan serten kiltir Islamik ek lndu, parey kuma dan sosyete Morisyen dayer, kapav ena poem folklor lor relizyon.

input: Because Islamic people in Mauritius live far from Mecca and other centres of islamic culture, they have had to make special effort to strengthen their connection with the religion.
target: Parski dimunn ki krwar dan Islam e ki res Moris viv lwin depi Lamek ek lezot sant kiltir islamik, zot finn bizin fer bann zefor spesyal pu ranforsi zot relasyon avek relizyon.

input: Look for short Lyric poems recited orally.
target: Rod poem kurt lirik, ki resite oralman.

input: written poems using the style of older oral poems.
target: poem an ekri ki firm servi ansyen stil poem oral.

input: When groups of people work together building a house or fishing, they often sing songs which help to keep the work going and prevent them from getting bored.
target: Kan enn grup dimunn travay ansam pu ranz enn lakaz ubyin pu lapes, suvan zot sant sante pu ed zot travay e pu zot pa truv li repetitif ek borinng.

input: What songs go along with work?
target: Ki bann sante al ansam ar travay?

input: Were the songs made over from old songs?
target: Eski zot bann vye sante, ki finn re-travay?

input: Try to find old and new forms of the same songs or poems.
target: Esey rod bann vye ek nuvo form sa kalite sante ubyin poem la.
Eski ena dimunn inportan ki mansyone ladan?

input: How does a person get to be a leader in the singing?
target: Kimanyer enn dimunn vinn sef dan sante?

input: Is such a person also a leader in the work?
target: Eski sa dimunn la arive vinn sef dan travay usi?

input: Which is more important, the music or the work?
target: Ki pli inportan, lamizik ubyin travay?

input: What songs are sung while launching a boat for the first time?
target: Ki sante dimunn sante kan pe ambark enn bato pu premye fwa?
Kan pe amenn lasenn dan bato?

input: What songs are sung at a birth?
target: Ki bann sante ki sante kan enn tibaba ne?
Dan enn lamor ubyin enn lanterman?
Sante ki ti santé avan lindepandans.

input: Songs sung during political campaigns or other competitions between rivals for public office.
target: Sante ki sante pandan kanpayn politik ubyen konpetisyon parmi adverser dan eleksyon.

input: Are these based on older songs?
target: Eski zot baze lor bann vye sante?
Sante lor sorselri ubyen bann sorsyer.

input: Songs about men or women at home.
target: Sante lor zom ubyen fam ki res lakaz.

input: Beliefs about love, courtship, and marriage form an important part of Mauritian folklore.
target: Krwayans lor lamur, frekante, maryaz, zot bann size byen inportan dan folklor Moris.

input: This is of course true because people from different backgrounds have learned to participate in each other’s traditions.
target: Sa li sirtu vre akoz dimunn avek zot prop lexperyans familyal ek sistem finn deza osi aprann partisip dan sistem lezot dimunn, dan system ki diferan depi pu zot fami, setadir sistem ki zot vwazin swiv.

input: Try, for instance, to collect stories about how people got their first sexual experience.
target: U kapav sey, par exanp, ramas zistwar lor premye rankont sexyel kikenn.

input: Beliefs about exciting one’s own sexual parts (masturbation) and the effects this act can have.
target: Krwayans otur tus u prop sex, setadir mastirbasyon, e lor lefe sa kapav ena, dapre dimunn.

input: Words and sayings connected with sexual activity.
target: Koze ek lexpresyon otur diferan ak Sexyel.

input: Songs and traditional knowledge about sex taught to boys; to girls.
target: Byen suvan ena bann sante ek konesans tradisyonel lor sexyalite ki anfet anseyn garson, enn1 kote, ek tifi, lot kote, lor sexyalite.

input: Special times and places for sexual activity.
target: Plas ek ler pu aktivite sexyel.

input: Weddings: Topics to think and ask about during, before, or after your attendance at some wedding ceremonies.
target: Maryaz: Diferan size refleksyon ek size konversasyon pandan, avan, ubyen apre enn maryaz ubyen enn sistem otur enn maryaz.

input: How much freedom do people have to choose a husband or wife?
target: Konbyen liberte dimunn ena pu swazir enn mari ou fam?

input: How has this freedom increased or decreased?
target: Eski liberte-la finn ogmante ou diminye?

input: To what extent and by what ways does the change show the influence of other communities in Mauritius?
target: Ziska ki pwen eski sa indik enn linfliyans lezot kiltir Moris?

input: Ask for stories about persons who tried to get round the usual ways of marrying, or who were unhappy with the usual ways.
target: Rod zistwar dimunn ki finn sey evit fason ordiner pu marye u dimunn ki ti malere akoz manyer ordiner.

input: Stories about young wives and old husbands.
target: Zistwar zen fam ki ena enn vye mari.

input: Stories or experiences of marriage without the knowledge of parents.
Carrying off a wife by force, or in secret.
target: Pran enn fam par lafors, u an katimini.

input: Did the woman know about it in advance?
Did relatives try to get her back?
target: Eski so fami ti sey re-pran li amene?
Eski dimunn finn pini sa kup la?

input: Tests to be sure a woman had not experienced sex.
target: Bann tes ki fam-la pa finn deza gayn lexperyans sexyel?

input: Tricks played on newly married couples.
target: Badinaz ki fer ar dimunn fek marye.

input: Time and place of marriage: At what time of the day or night is it usual to marry nowadays?
target: Ler ek plas maryaz: Ki ler marye zordi lizur u aswar?

input: Which days of the week are avoided for marriage.
target: Ki zur lasemenn bizin evit fer maryaz?

input: How do people find out the best day and time for marriage?
target: Kimanyer dimunn ariv deside ki zur e ki ler pli bon pu maryaz?

input: According to people’s memory, how has the usual time for marriage changed?
target: Dapre memwar dimunn, eski ler abityel pu maryaz finn sanze depi lepok avan?

input: Where do marriages usually take place?
Where did they take place in former times?
target: Kot tip e fer lepok avan?

input: Here is a good place for you to make direct observations and take photographs.
target: Isi u bizin obzerve e tir foto.

input: Then ask people who are present, how do people dress for getting married?
target: Dimann dimunn prezan, kimanyer dimounn abiye pu maryaz?

input: Describe dress for the woman; for the man.
How do parents, family members guests dress?
How has dress changed, according to what people remember?
target: Kouma abiyman finn sanze, dapre seki dimounn rapel.

input: Songs sung before, during, after weddings.
How are these learned, from whom?
Describe a traditional marriage in a single community.
target: Dekrir enn maryaz tradisyonel dan enn sistem.

input: If possible, attend more than one ceremony.
target: Si posib, al plis ki enn maryaz dan sa mem sistem la.

input: Ask old people about how marriages were done formerly.
target: Dinann gran dimunn kimanyer ti organiz maryaz lepok avan.

input: Look for influences from outside and from other religious groups.
target: Rod infliyans depi lezot sistem ek lezot relizyon.

input: To what extent and in what ways are people participating or making use of other people‘s traditions?
target: Ziska ki pwen eski dimunn pe apropriye kutim lezot?

input: What was done before the wedding?
target: Ki tip e fer avan maryaz?

input: Use of rings or other symbolic objects.
target: Servi bag ubyen lezot obze sinbolik.

input: Way of leaving the place where wedding was held.
target: Fason dimunn kit plas kot ti ena maryaz.

input: Does the woman go back to her parents’ house?
target: Eski fam return lakaz so paran?

input: How to bring good fortune upon the bride and groom.
target: Ki port boner pu enn nuvo kup, nuvo marye?

input: How to avoid bad luck for them.

target: Ki kado zot ti gagne avan?

input: What is the appropriate time for gift—giving?
Meals and foods connected to marriage.
How have they learnt what to prepare?
target: Kimanyer zot finn aprann ki pou prepare?

input: Amusements connected with marriage: games, songs.
target: Bann badinaz ek pastan otur maryaz: sante, zwe.

input: Stories, songs, sayings told at weddings about second wives.
target: Zistwar, sanson, zedmo, moral ki dimunn rakonte otur maryaz, kan pe koz enn dezyem fam.

input: Experiences of men with more than one wife.
target: Lexperyans zom ek plis ki enn fam.

input: Stories, songs, sayings about good wives, bad wives, good husbands, bad husbands.
target: Zistwar, sante, koze lor bon fam,  move fam, bon mari, move mari.

input: Sayings, beliefs, stories about women who did not bear children, or who were unable to bear children.
target: Koze, krwayans, zistwar lor fam ki pa finn gayn zanfan, ubyen ki pa ti kapav gayn zanfan.

input: How was such a woman thought of?
target: Kimanyer dimunn ti konsider sa fam la?

input: Stories about what her husband has done.
target: Zistwar lo ki so mari ti fer?

input: What if a man were sterile?
Stories about men who could not father children.
target: Zistwar lor zom ki pa kapav vinn papa.

input: Are any of these known in your neighborhood?
target: Eski dimunn konn sa bann dimunn la dan landrwa?

input: Stories about men who tried to father children with several wives and were unable to.
target: Zistwar zom ki sey gayn zanfan ar plizir fam e pa ti kapav.

input: How are women carrying unborn children thought of?
Do they get any special treatment?
target: Eski zot gayn enn konsiderasyon spesyal?

input: Sayings, beliefs,customary behaviour of pregnant women and of other people towards them.
target: Koze, krwayans, komportman tradisyonel fam ansent, e lezot dimunn anver zot.

input: What should they do or not do?
target: Ki zot sipoze fer ou evit fer?

input: Do people try to find out whether an unborn child will be a boy or girl?
target: Eski dimunn sey kone sipa garson ou tifi?

input: Beliefs and customary behavior about the children.
target: Krwayans ek konportman tradisyonel anver zanfan.

input: How are twin children thought of?
Did women ever try to keep from bearing twins?
target: Eski fam ti sey evit gayn zimo?
Kimanyer dimunn finn azir anver zimo?

input: Stories about families with only sons; families with only daughters, powers belonging to the first son, last son, or some other specially-born child.
target: Zistwar lor fami ki gayn zis garson, zis tifi, puvwar gran garson, dernye garson, ubyen ami lot zanfan ki ne spesyal.

input: Children who die at birth or soon after.
target: Zanfan ki mor ne ubyen mor preske tutswit.

input: Some people believe that anything unusual in a child’s birth brings bad effects later.
target: Ena dimunn krwar ki enn nesans drol kapav port maler pu plitar.

input: Are there ever children who are unwanted?
What is done with unwanted children?
target: Ki dimunn fer ar zanfan non-dezire.

input: Beliefs and stories about the killing of babies or children.
target: Krwayans ek zistwar lor tuy ti baba ubyen zanfan.

input: Signs that let people know a child will die soon after birth.
target: Siyn ki dimunn rekonet ki vedir enn zanfan pu mor dan enn ti—mama apre so nesans.

input: What signs let people know one of their family will soon die?
target: Ki siyn dimunn truve ki kikenn dan so fami pu mor?

input: When such a sign is seen, do people try to prevent death.
target: Kan dimunn truv sa siyn la, eski zot sey evit sa lamor la?

input: Do they try to do anything that will keep the person alive?
target: Eski zot sey gard dimunn-la  vivan?

input: Beliefs, stories about the labor of childbearing.
Keeping danger away from the newborn child.
target: Gard danze lwin depi enn nuvo-ne.

input: Where is the baby to sleep?
Marks on the baby from birth.
Baby`s first teeth: beliefs about it.
With birth, as with marriage and death, we have to distinguish between what is required by “official" religion and what is done "unofficially" that is special to Mauritius.
target: Nesans, parey kuma maryaz ek lamor, nu bizin fer enn distinksyon ki ena enn bann zafer ki relizyon dir bizin fer ondire "ofisyel" ek ena zafer ki dimunn fer par zot, ondire "inofisyel" ki byen suvan partikilye a Moris.

input: What is done after the baby is born to make him or her strong?
target: Ki dimurm for apre nesans enn tibaba pu asire ki li vinn for?

input: Throwing baby into the air, banging a metal dish, burying the afterbirth.
target: Avoy li dan ler, fer tapaz ek enn resipyan an metal, anter lonbri.

input: What do midwives and others say these systems will do for the mother and child?
target: Sarzfam ki dir sa bann sistem la pu fer pu mama la ek tibaba la?

input: Tape-record and photograph birth events wherever possible.
target: Kot posib servi kaset ek foto pu gard enn listwar evennman otur nesans.

input: Take note ofthe roles and identities of participants.
target: Pran not lor rol ek idantite tu partisipan.

input: What‘s the name for this person?
target: Ki nom donn sa dimunn la?

input: What is the relation of the participants to the ritual specialist?
target: Ki relasyon ant lezot partisipan ek sa spesyalist dan rityel la?

input: What demonstrations of feeling or emotion do you see during the event?
target: Ki lemosyon u kapav truve exprime pandan evennman la?

input: One important specialist for birth is the midwife, who helps women deliver babies.
target: Enn spesyalist inportan dan enn nesans se sarzfam ki ed fam gayn tibaba.

input: What is the local name for this person?
Do only certain persons act as midwives?
target: Eski selman sertin dimunn kapav fer travay sarzfam?

input: Does a midwife serve people of different ethnic groups or religions?
target: Eski li fer travay sarzfam pu tu dimunn, tu relizyon?

input: Which groups do and do not perform circumcision?
target: Ki grup fer ubyen pa fer sirkonsizyon?

input: What do they say about the importance of the ceremony?
target: Ki linportans zot akord seremoni la?

input: Ritual bath of the new mother.
Give detailed description of the event.
What is thrown on the fire?
What does the midwife say this ritual does for the new mother?
target: Sarzfam ki dir lor kifer fer sap u nuvo mama?

input: Other rituals: Offering of coins to the new mother.
target: Lezot rityel: Donn enn larzan nuvo mama.

input: Do people of different groups follow the same custom?
target: Eski diferan grup dimunn swiv mem sistem?

input: Is meat given to guests and the needy?
target: Eski donn kari lavyann invite e dimunn pov?

input: (seventh or eleventh day after the birth, whenever they can afford to do it?).
target: (Setyem ou onzyem zur apre nesans, kan ena ase larzan?).

input: Stories, sayings, songs used by midwives in delivering babies.
target: Zistwar, koze, sante ki sarzfam servi kan pe akus enn fam.

input: What language does the midwife use?
How are bad spirits or evil effects kept away from the newborn baby?
target: Eski li dir bizin bare kont movezer ubyen lizye?

input: Is a woman regarded as impure after giving birth?
target: Eski enn fam konsider malsen apre akusman?

input: What name do people use for this impure state?
target: Kimanyer dimunn apel sa leta apre akusman la?

input: A Hindu example is exposing the mother to the rays ofthe sun after six or twelve days of confinement.
target: Enn lexanp indu, fam bizin expoze a reyon soley swa 6 zur ubyen 12 zur apre so akusman.
Dekrir ki zot fer an detay.

input: After the ritual, is she completely pure, or does impurity leave her only gradually?
target: Eski fam la pirifye tutswit, ubyen gradyelman apre sa rityel la?

input: Have people explain this to you in whatever way they understand it.
target: Permet dimunn explik u sa dan manyer ki zot truv li.

input: Remember that their practice is real even when it departs from what is "official."
target: Rapel zot sistem li enn vre system mem si li pa "ofisyel", mem si li diferan depi "ofisyel" la.

input: Sayings about good and bad fathers, good and bad mothers, good and bad children.
target: Koze lor bon papa move papa, bon mama move marina, bon zanfan move zanfan.

input: Religion is not folklore, but there is much folklore growing out of religion.
target: Relizyon li pa folklor, me ena buku buku folklor ki prise depi dan relizyon.

input: Anyone interested in people gives full respect to every person’s religion.
target: Nenport ki dimunn ki interese dan imin li dwa respe krwayans relizye sak dimunn.

input: Anyone interested in folklore does the same.
target: Nenport ki dimunn ki interese dan folklor, li osi santi parey.

input: Religious folklore does not violate anyone’s faith.
target: Folklor relizye li pa kont lafwa personn.

input: Usually, in fact,tradition deepens religious faith by increasing the devotion of believers.
target: Anfet, normalman, tu sa bann tradisyon la zot aprofondi lafwa relizye dimunn atraver ogmant langazman ek devosyon dimunn.

input: Many people think immediately of religion when they hear the word folklore.
target: Buku dimunn pans relizyon tutswit kan zot tann parl folklor.

input: One reason is the importance of folklore in defining a group - Arya Samaj, Ismaili, Catholic, and so on.
target: Enn rezon pu sa se linportans folklor dan definisyon enn grup - Arya Samaj, lsmaili, Katolik, ansi deswit.

input: Another reason is the prominence that is held by cultural festivals based in religion, like Cavadee, Ganga Snan, Maha Shivaratree, Chinese New Year and Eid—ul-Adha.
target: Enn lot rezon se linportans festival kiltirel baze lor relizyonz Kavadi, Ganga Snan, Mahasivaratri, Lane Sinnwa e ld—ul-Adha.

input: These are held out to tourists and visitors as colourful examples ofthe variety ofcultures in Mauritius.
target: Suvan pran sa bann Festival la pu montre turis ek visiter bann lexanp miltikolor varyete kiltir Moris.

input: According to some people, the beliefs and customs of religion in Mauritius, which have largely been brought here in former times, are now undergoing change or disappearance.
target: Dapre sertin dimunn, krwayans ek kutim relizye dan Moris, ki ti amene lepok avan, pe sanze buku zordizur, ubyen disparet.

input: But disappearance of a custom or a belief does not mark it as folklore.
target: Me, kan enn kutim ubyen krwayans disparet, pa sa ki fer li vinn folklor.

input: What marks a custom as folklore is that many people practice it in varying forms.
target: Seki definir enn kutim kuma folklor se lefet ki buku dimunn pratik li, dan diferan fason.

input: Religious folklore thus is often illogical, unsystematic, or inconsistent.
target: Folklor relizye byen suvan ilozik, san riger, ou inkonsistan.

input: folklore meant something inherited from earlier times which is now threatened with disappearance, one could call Sanathan Hinduism or Chinese Buddhism folklore.
target: folklor ti ule dir kiksoz erite depi lepok avan e menase ar extinksyon, nu ti kapav dir ki Induism Sanatanism ubyen Budism Sinnwa folklor.

input: Hinduism, Buddhism, Islam and Christianity are world religions.
target: Induism, Budism, Islam ek Kretyente zot bann relizyon mondyal.

input: They are unified, coherent systems, explained and preached by priests.
target: Zot bann sistem inifye, koeran, ki bann prêt explike ek prese.

input: In Mauritius, they are not disappearing, but they are changing, partly under the influence of the way they are actually practiced.
target: Dan Moris, zot napa pe disparet. me, zot pe sanze, anparti su linfliyans manyer ki dimunn pratik zot dan realite.

input: Folk religion means whatever beliefs and customs are now actually being practiced, by any group whatsoever, in varying forms, in Mauritius.
target: Relizyon popiler ule dir samem krwayans ek kutim, ki dimunn au realite pratik Moris.

input: Observing and recording folk religion will increase everyone’s knowledge of life as people are living it today.
target: Li kapav nerport ki grup dimunn, pratik la kapav dan diferan form.

input: It will also increase people’s awareness of the depth and variety of human beliefs, as we are living it.
target: Kan nu fer obzervasyon ek anrezistreman sistematik relizyon popiler, nu pu ogmant konpreansyon tu dimunn lor lavi tu dimunn zordi, kuma an realite nu pe viv li.

input: We must make a separation between “official" and “unofficial", or popular.
target: Nu bizin fer enn separasyon ant relizyon "ofisyel", ek seki “inofisyel”, ubyen popiler.

input: Some beliefs are "official": they are the prescribed forms and observances of their religion, as these are set forth by sacred writings and authorities.
target: Ena krwayans ki “ofisyel": zot form parti seki relizyon deza preskrir ek seki deza bizin fer dapre relizyon, dapre liv sakre ubyen lotorite aksepte.

input: Other beliefs and customs of folk religion are the "unofficial" variations, additions, and deletions which are being created in the actual practice of Mauritian people.
target: Lezot krwayans ek kutim, seki popiler, se bann varyasyon "inofisyel", bann lazut, bann omisyon, bann kreasyon ek re-kreasyon ki pe fer dan lavi reel dimunn Moris.

input: As a folklore collector, you should observe and record both the "official" and the unofficial.
target: Kuma enn kuleksyoner folklor, u bizin obzerv e anrezistre tulde seki "ofisye1" ek seki "inofisyel".

input: When you know the difference, give special attention to "unofficial" actions and words.
target: Kan u fini rekonet diferans ant le de, u bizin akord enn latansyon spesyal seki “inofisyel" ki li aksyon ubyen parol.

input: Place these in the foreground, because these are folk religion.
target: Met sa alavanplan, samem ki relizyon popiler.

input: Be sure to give an account of all variant forms of an action or a set of words.
target: Fer enn manyer ki u donn enn kontrandi lor diferan varyasyon sak aksyon uhyen sak seri parol.

input: Place authoritative prescriptions by priests or sculptures in the background.
target: Seki pret ubyen liv sakre dir, u met sa a lavanplan, kan u ramas folklor.

input: Record what people think, what people say about what they think  and what they do to act on what they think.
target: Ramas seki dimunn panse, setadir zot krwayans, seki zot dir lor seki zot panse, e seki zot fer lor seki zot panse.

input: A vital topic for folk religion is the dead.
target: Enn size inportan pu relizyon popiler se bann mor.

input: Much belief and customary behaviour has to do with death and the dead, all of which needs recording, along with any stories.
target: Buku krwayans ek kutim ena pu fer ar lamor ek bann mor, nu bizin anrezistre tu sa ansam avek nenport ki zistwar.

input: The signs people understand to be telling them death is coming.
target: siyn ki ena ki lamor pe vini.

input: The things they do when there is a death in the house?
target: Ki dimunn fer kan ena lamor kot zot?

input: How strongly people feel about the end of life and those who have left this world?
target: Ki lemosyon for ki exprime otur lafin enn lavi e bann ki finn kit sa lemond la?

input: Some people can act as though nothing has happened, but of course they too know that a major event has taken place.
target: Ena dimunn kapav azir kumsi—ryen-ete, me, mem zot kone ki enn evennman byen inportan finn ena lye.

input: What do people believe about the spirits of the dead?
target: Ki krwayans lor lespri bann mor?

input: What are the words for these spirits?
target: Ki mo servi pu sa bann nam la?

input: Do they exist near graves, in cemeteries?
Are more recent dead different from older dead, for instance, are they more accessible?
target: Eski dimunn fek mor diferan depi dimunn mor depi lontan, par exanp, eski kapav kominik ar zot pli fasilman?

input: How can someone gain access to the spirits: offerings to graves, to a cross in the cemetery?
target: Kimanyer rant an kontak ek bann lesprit ofrand lor tom, ofrand divan enn lakrwa dan simityer?

input: What kind of offerings (candles, flowers, rum, perfumes, sweets)?
target: Ki kalite ofrand (labuzi, fler, rom, parfen, bonbon)?

input: Is there a local word for a power found in the bodies of the dead?
target: Ki mo servi pu puvwar lekor dimunn mor?

input: Belief that parts of the bodies of the dead have special effects such as curing or harming people.
target: Krwayans ki diferan parti lekor dimunn mor ena puvwar spesyal, swa pu geri ubyen pu fer ditor dimunn.

input: What powers or conditions do people say are the causes of death?
target: Ki kalite puvwar ki kapav amenn lamor kikenn?

input: Does death ever appear to people in a form they can see?
target: Ki kalite kondisyon ki amenn lamor?

input: Words or sayings used in connection with the coming of death, or dying, or dead persons.
target: Ki bann parol, bann koze ki dimunn abitye dir otur enn lamor, enn dimunn ki pe agonize, ubyen seki iinn fek mor?
Ki siyn ki lamor pe aprose?

input: Stories about ways that people died which are still remembered as unusual.
target: Zistwar lor drol lamor ki dimunn ankor rapel ek re-rakonte sak fwa.

input: Stories about a person who knew he, or someone else, was soon to die.
target: Zistwar lor dimunn ki ti predir so prop lamor, ubyen lamor enn lot.

input: Signs that death has come (the body, the soul).
target: Siyn ki lamor fini arive (lor lekor, dan nam).

input: Stories of strange happenings at the minute of a person’s death.
target: Zistwar zafer drol ki arive mem moman ki kikenn mor.

input: How is news of a death told to other people?
Is the death of an important person ever kept secret?
target: Eski gard lamor enn dimunn inportan enn sekre?

input: How is a dead body made ready for the ceremony after death?
target: Kimanyer prepar lekor pou seremoni apre lamor?

input: Describe customary behavior after a person dies?
target: Ki kutim dimunn kan enn dimunn mor?

input: Has this changed in recent years?
target: Eski sa finn sanze depi bann lane avan?

input: Do people usually weep over a dead body?
target: Eski dimunn abitye plore kot lekor dimunn mor?

input: Describe traditional funerary ceremonies of your place.
Who should go to the ceremony?
What do people think if some persons fail to go?
target: Dimunnn ki dir si kikenn pa vinn lamor?

input: Stories about unusual funerals or strange happenings in a funeral.
target: Zistwar lor drol lamor ubyen drol evennman pandan enn lamor.

input: Men buried on the right and women on the left?
target: Eski zom antere kote drwat ek fam kote gos?

input: Is there a secret society that has special acts to do when a person dies?
target: Eski ena sosyete sekre ki fer zafer partikilye kan Kikenn mor?

input: (Note that any society of this type is automatically a folkgroup, by the fact of being closed).
target: Remarke ki sosyete kumsa li otomatikman enn grup folklor parski li ferme.

input: Stories, songs, sayings, beliefs of this group.
target: Zistwar, koze, sante ki sa grup la ena.

input: How does a person come to be a member of this society - by birth, initiation?
target: Kimanyer rant manb - par nesans, atraver rit inisyasyon?

input: Do many people want to be a member of this society?
target: Eski dimunn anvi rant manb sa sosyete la?

input: Details of how the secret society acts.
What special powers has a dead body?
target: Ki puvwar spesyal eski lekor enn dimunn ena?

input: How can these powers be seen or recognized?
target: Kimanyer truv ubyen rekonet sa bann puvwar la?

input: Observe and record stories about how these special powers of a dead body have been used.
target: Fer observasyon ek anrezistre zistwar lor kimanyer puvwar dimnnn mor firm servi.

input: How do dead people come to life?
by their parts being arranged by a magic charm in words?
target: atraver re-aranz but but zot lekor par enn pas dan sertin parol partikilye?

input: Ask for stories or experiences about a person brought back to life, especially more than once.
target: Rod zistwar ubyen lexperyans enn dimunn ki finn reviv, sirtu si li finn reviv plis ki enn fwa.

input: Person brought back to life by medicine.
Wild animals killed who then came back from the dead.
target: Zanimo sovaz ki dimunn finn tuye me ki finn reviv.

input: Do some dead people still show interest in their families and homes?
target: Eski sertin dimunn mor ankor okip zot fami e zot lakaz?

input: Stories or experiences in which a dead person, perhaps a relative, comes back to speak to or see a living person.
target: Zistwar ubyen lexperyans kot enn dimunn mor, kapav-et enn fami, returne pu koz ar kikenn vivan, uswa pu rann li enn vizit.

input: Experiences of dreams telling what is coming in the future.
target: Lexperyans bann rev ki predir ki pu arrive dan lavenir.

input: Do the dead continue to live in another world?
target: Eski bann mor kontinye viv dan enn lot plas?

input: Local names for those dead persons who go on living in another world.
target: Nom pu dimunn mor ki kontinye viv enn lot plas.

input: What is the other world like?
target: Kimanyer sa lot plas la ete?

input: Can people visit the other world in dreams?
target: Eski dimunn vizit sa lot plas la dan rev?

input: Ghosts and others who come back from the dead.
target: Nam trene ek lezot ki return depi lamor.

input: Person comes back from the dead to kill the man who killed him or her.
target: Enn dimunn ki return depi lamor pu tuy dimunn ki finn tuy li.

input: Person comes back as a bird; as a plant; as a musical instrument.
target: Dimunn ki returne kuma enn zwazo; kuma enn pye; kuma enn instriman lamizik.

input: Skin, hands, or other body parts are brought back from the dead.
target: Lapo, lame, lezot parti lekor ki returne apre lamor.

input: Woman who died pregnant returns to her husband from death because the baby was not taken out from her body.
target: Fam ki mor ansent returne pu rann visit so mari akoz napa finn tir tibaba dan so lekor.

input: Dead person comes back because some custom was not followed (ears were not stopped up).
target: Dimunn mor returne akoz ena enn sistem ki pa finn swiv otur so lamor (pa ferm bus so zorey).

input: Dead person can find out human secrets.
Dead person eats large amount of food.
Living person who was frightened by a dead person.
target: Dimunn vivan ki finn per enn mor.

input: Things people do to prevent people from coming back from the dead (burial in a special place)?
target: Zafer bizin fer pu anpes bann mor returne (anter lekor dan enn landrwa spesifik)?

input: Many Mauritians share beliefs about magic, witchcraft, healing, and supernatural powers which are separate from their official religion.
target: Buku dimunn Moris partaz lide lor mazi, sorselri, treter, puvwar sirnatirel ki separe depi zot relizyon ofisyel.

input: Magic is doing something in order to produce an effect you want to produce; sometimes it is done by means of an object with special powers.
target: Mazik ule dir fer kiksoz pu reysi prodir enn lefe ki u anvi prodir; parfwa bizin servi kit obze ki ena enn lafors spesyal.

input: Some people are known to have special powers for good or harm or for curing.
target: Ena dimunn ki koni pu zot puvwar fer dibyen, ubyen puvwar fer ditor, ubyen puvwar gerison.

input: People may be unwilling to tell you their beliefs in these matters, especially if you are not a local person yourself.
target: Par fwa dimunn ezite pu rakont sa bann zafer la, sirtu si u pa sorti mem landrwa.

input: Make it clear that you think only well of them and want only the best for them.
target: Fer li kler ki u estim dimunn, e ki u anvi dimunn-la viv ere.

input: How to bring harm upon another person.
target: Kimanyer fer enn move sor lor kikenn.

input: What words are used for injuries to the body by supernatural means?
target: Ki mo servi pu atak enn lot dimunn fizikman, atraver sirnatirel?

input: What do people call a person who causes such injuries (witch, sorcerer)?
target: Ki apel dimunn ki fer sa kalite travay-la (sorsyer, longanis)?

input: Does this person always know his/her power and use it willfully, or are there some people who have special powers without meaning to injure others?
target: Eski dimunn tultan kone ki li ena sa puvwar la e li servi li expre uswa eski ena dimunn ki ena sa bann puvwar la, malgre zot kapav fer ditor san vulwar fer ditor?

input: Are some persons born with such powers, like a substance inside them?
target: Eski dimunn ne avek sa kalite puvwar la, kumsidire li andan dan zot?

input: Look for stories of witches and their effects.
target: Rod zistwar sorsyer e zot lefe.

input: How do these persons kill or injure others?
target: Kimanyer dimunn tuy ubyen fer ditor zot prosin?

input: killing a small child by touching it with sex organ.
target: tuy enn tizanfan par tus li ek enn organn sexyel?

input: Stories about tools that come alive by magic, go to find a person, and harm him.
target: Zistwar zuti ki pran lavi par mazik, al rod kikenn, fer li ditor.

input: Objects that kill or harm people without being seen.
target: Obze ki tuy ubyen fer ditor san ki truv li.

input: Magic objects put underground where a person usually walks.
target: Obze mazik suterin ki kasyet anba enn plas kot dimunn abitye marse.

input: Drawing out a person’s breath with a hollow reed or pipe.
target: Ris lesuf kikenn avek enn pip ubyen tiz.

input: Offering a coin to a grave or spirit?
target: Ofer enn larzan a enn tom ubyen enn nam?

input: Burying a shell with a drawing and the person’s name written on paper?
target: Anter enn koki kot finm desinn kiksoz lor li ek inskrir nom kikenn lor papye dan koki?

input: Collect examples of these shells and papers.
How can this practice be neutralized - by digging up the shell?
target: Kimanyer kapav kont-kare sa kalite sor la - deter koki la?

input: Other things to do against witchcraft.
target: Ki lezot fason bare kont sorselri?

input: What people do to keep it away from themselves?
How to keep oneself from death or harm.
How to keep from getting ill.
How to keep goats or other animals from getting ill.
target: Kimanyer gard kabri ou lezot zanimo an bon sante?

input: Objects made to have magic power.
target: Obze ki fabrike avek bi puvwar mazik.

input: Ask about leaves and water, powders in materials tied in cloth or thread, pieces of wood, metal rings.
target: Dimann lor fey e dilo, lapud atase dan latwal, but but lafisel, dibwa, serk metal.

input: Ask about these to keep off all magic sent by someone else to keep danger away from house, fields, land to give power to the owner to send magic back on the sender to make the owner live a long time.
target: Dimann dimunn lor zafer ki bare kont enn lot dimunn so sor lor u, protez u lakaz, lakur, karo depi sor, don puvwar proprieter obze la, return sor lor seki finn avoy li, fer proprieter obze gayn longvi.

input: To make someone love the owner to help the owner get something he wants to help the owner in law — cases or business to cure illness to keep babies or pregnant women well to know if a sick person will die.
target: Fer kikenn tom amure ek proprieter obze la, fer proprieter la gayn enn kiksoz li ule gayne, fer proprieter gayn enn ka lakur, swa fer profi dan biznes, geri maladi, gard tibaba ubyen fam ansint an bon santé, kifer dimunn kone sipa kikenn malad pu mor.

input: Are any of these specially powerful?
target: Ki parmi sa bann obze la byen pwisan?

input: Stories of how one person caused run to another by witchcraft.
target: Zistwar kimanyer enn dimunn inn fer ditor enn lot par sorselri.

input: Actions which at first people could not understand, until they found that witchcraft was the cause.
target: Bann evennman ki dimunn pa ti kapav explike ziska zot finn finalman ariv kont ki sorselri ki deryer sa.

input: Stories about moving plants or other things from the victim’s house to the witch’s house.
target: Zistwar lor kimanyer plant ubyen lezot zafer buze depi lakaz viktim la, fini dan lakaz sorsye so lakaz.

input: How a woman gave birth before the right time.
target: Zistwar kimanyer enn fam akuse avan ler.

input: Trouble to the relations of family members; trouble to friendships.
target: Traka dan fami; lamerdman ar kamarad.

input: What is the local name for a person who magically harms others (witch, sorcerer)?
target: Ki nom servi dan sak lokalite pu enn dimunn ki fer ditor par mazik (sorsyer, longanis)?
Zistwar lor sa kalite dimunn la.

input: Did the person know he/she was doing harm?
target: Eski dimunn konsyan ki li pe fer ditor.

input: Did he/she mean to do harm?
How have they been found out?
How does the witch/sorcerer pass on magical medicine to the other person?
target: Kouma sorsyer kapav donn so puvwar lezot dimunn?

input: Magical substances in food; in drink.
target: zafer mazik ki kapav met dan manze; dan bwar.

input: People who get hurt when they are sleeping.
target: Dimunn ki gayn dimal kan li pe dormi.

input: Use of spirits to cause harm to others.
target: Servi nam pu fer ditor lezot dimunn.

input: Can a witch/sorcerer attack only at certain times?
target: Eski enn sorsye ubyen sorsyer kapav fer so travay a nerport ki moman, ubyen zis dan sertin ler?

input: Which groups are expected to have special powers for harming others?
target: Ki grup dimunn ki ena puvwar spesyal pu fer ditor lezot?

input: Are these special powers limited to those persons?
target: Eski zis sa bann dimunn la ki ena puvwar spesyal kumsa?

input: Religious festivals, which involve hundreds of persons in numerous different activities stretching over many clays, are the most complex and difficult of all topics to research in Mauritian folklore.
target: Fet relizye ki inplik par santenn dimunn dan enn seri aktivite diferan pandan buku zur, zot mem pli komplex, pli difisil pu etidye dan folklor Moris.

input: General accounts of many Mauritian religious festivals are already available, for instance the account by Burrun in Mauritius, its people, its cultures, by Sydney Selvon, Issa Asgarally, and Abhimanyu Unnuth.
target: Deskripsyon boukou bann fet relizie Morisyen, par exanp seki Burrun rakonte dan Mauritius, so dimunn, so kiltir, enn liv par Sydney Selvon, Issa Asgarally ek Abhimanyu Unnuth.

input: The next steps in research will have to be a much more detailed and specific treatment of each festival as it actually is carried out in each place.
target: Prosenn demars se pu gayn buku plis detay, plis deskripsyon spesifik sak fet kuma li anfet fer dan realite dan sak landrwa diferan.

input: Clear and accurate recording of their innumerable details requires many repeated observations and interviews.
target: Bizin anrezistre seki u truve ek tande dan enn fason presi ek kler pu gayn tu bann detay bizin obzerve suvan, bizin dimann dimunn dan  bann intervyu.

input: As suggested before, take careful note of people’s actual behavior, record exactly what they say, and be on the look-out for variant forms of belief custom, and statement.
target: Kuma nu fnn deza dir, bizin get seki dimunn anfet fer, anfet dir  e veye pu bann diferan varyan enn mem kutim, krwayans ubyen koze.

input: A checklist of festivals to observe:
target: Enn lalis fet ki bizin letid:

input: Ganga Asnan, Eid-ul-Adha, Chinese Spring Festival Ching Ming, Mid-Autumn or moon festival, Eid-ul—Fitr, Cavadee, Maha Shivaratree, Holi, Ganesh Chaturti, Divali, Easter, The Assumption.
target: Ganga Snan, Id—ul-Adha, Fet Printan, Ching Ming, Mi-Lotonn u Fet Lalinn, Id-ul-Fitr, Kavadi, Maha Sivaratri, Holi, Ganes Chaturti, Divali, Pak, Lavierz.

input: Ancient Indian, Chinese, and other myths are stories about the beginning and nature of the world, about gods and other non human beings, and about the origins of the world of animals and plants.
target: Ansyen mit dan Lenn, Lasinn e lezot explik kumansman lemond e natir lemond, lor bondie ek lezot kreatir non imin, plis lorizinn zanimo ek pye.

input: Many such myths are kept alive by being told again and again.
target: Sa bann mit-la res vivan akoz dimunn rakont ek re-rakont zot a sak fwa.

input: Look for oral or "unofficial" versions or tales about origin of rain, Origin of day and night, Origin of death,Sun and moon rise and set in turn, tide caused by the breathing of a sea—monster, rain from a rain-spirit, Origin of war among human beings.
target: Rod versyon oral ek "inofisye1" lor lorizinn lapli, lorizinn lanwit lizur, lorizinn lamor, leve ek kuse soley ek lalinn, lamare monte desann akoz enn mons lamer pe respire, lapli depi enn nam-lapli, lorizinn lager ant imin.

input: Mauritian have developed many ways of understanding disease.
target: Dimunn Moris ena buku fason konpran maladi.

input: and many materials to treat it, such as herbal medicine.
target: E ena buku fason tret maladi, kouma latizann.

input: They also consult clinics, dispensaries, hospitals, and doctors when they need to.
target: Dimunn osi al klinik, dispanser, lopital, e dokter kan neseser.

input: In a thorough study ofthe range of medical practices available in Mauritius, the anthropologist Linda Sussman found patients exercising considerable choice as to which treatment(s) they would utilize for vapours kinds of illness.
target: Dan enn letid detaye lor swen medikal dan Moris, enn antropolog, Linda Sussman truve ki pasyan ena buku swa lor kalite tretman pu tu kalite maladi.

input: All of the village respondents held multicausal medical belief systems,” grouping illnesses into categories "of God”, “of dead souls,”, "of fright", "of saints”, “of man", or "of sorcery".
target: Tu dimunn vilaz ki finn rann mwa repons ti ena enn sistem krwayans medikal ki inplike ki maladi ena plizyer lakoz kuma "par maladi bondye", "par movezer", "par lafreyer", "par maladi sin",  “par dimunn," u "par sorseri".

input: Up to seven distinct types of healers and eight different healing systems were available to her informants, who would regularly choose the healing system appropriate to each sort of illness.
target: Li ti truv ziska set kalite geriser Moris ek wit diferan sistem swen ki dimunn ti ena, zot ti swazir sistem ki pli korbor ar maladi ki zot ena.

input: To confirm this study ofmedical choices, all traditional knowledge and methods of healing should be recorded, along with the occasions when people choose one rather than another: What traditional healers are in your neighborhood?
target: Pu konfirm sa resers lor swa medikal, nu bizin anrezistre tu konesans tradisyonel ek tu metod swen, ansam avek lokasyon kan dimunn swazir enn sistem pa lot la: Ki bann geriser tradisyonel ena dan u kartye?
Eski dimunn aste depi marsan latizann?

input: diseases from offending a Hindu saint or god.
target: Maladi akoz u finn ofans enn sin ubyen bondie Indu.

input: diseases caused by a person wanting to harm someone.
target: Maladi akoz u anvi fer ditor enn lot.

input: diseases named for a part of the body.
diseases named for the feelings they produce.
target: Maladi klasifye par sansasyon li done.

input: diseases named after something in nature.
target: Maladi ki gayn so nom dapre lanatir.

input: diseases named after their causes or their cures.
target: Maladi ki gayn so nom delapar so koz ubyen so gerizon.

input: Proverbs, sayings, traditional knowledge about health or illness.
target: Proverb, zedmo, koze, konesans tradisyonel lor lasante ek maladi.

input: Local words for the beginning of illness; for sudden attacks of illness.
target: Mo local pu kumansman enn maladi; pu maladi ki vinn enn sel ku.

input: Signs of good health; of poor health.
How to tell when someone is about to fall ill.
target: Kouma pu dir kan kikenn pre pu tom malad.

input: How do people find out the nature of a person’s disease?
target: Kimanyer dimunn ariv kone ki maladi kikenn ena?

input: Sayings that keep off colds, eye trouble, toothache, fever, bleeding, headache, stomach-ache, broken bones, coughs, dog bites.
target: Koze ki explik kimanyer anpes gayn lerim, malady lizye, malad ledan, lafyev, seynman, latet for mal, duler vant, anpes lezokase, anpes gayn tuse, anpes lisyen mord u.

input: Do people try to get themselves and their relatives cured right away, or are they willing to wait for a time?
target: Eski dimunn rod enn gerizon tutswit, ubyen eski zot atann enn tan?

input: Are sick people unwilling sometimes to tell anyone they are sick?
target: Eski dimunn ezite parfwa pu dir lezot dimunn ki zot malad?

input: Give detailed accounts of the means people use to cure various diseases, especially when they use several methods one after another.
target: Donn detay lor kimanyer dimunn geri maladi diferan, sirtu kan zot servi diferan metod enn apre lot.

input: Bathing the sick part of the body, or all of the body in milk,in water, in other liquids.
target: Beyn parti lekor ki malad, ubyen beyn lekor dan dile, dilo, dan lezot likid.

input: Can a disease be cured by moving it from a person to an animal?
target: Eski kapav geri enn maladi atraver tir li, transfer li dan enn zanimo?

input: killing an animal to get rid of disease.
target: tuy enn zanimo pu tir maladi ar kikenn.

input: Herbal medicine: what herbs, plants, or flowers are used for treating which diseases?
target: Latizann: Ki lerb, pye, ou fler ki servi pu tret maladi?

input: ask about indigestion, vomiting, hypertension, rheumatism, coughs.
target: Dimann lor indizestyon, vomisman, tansyon, rematis, tuse.

input: Local words for these herbs and these ailments: do people know sitronel, ayapana, lament,koko, badamye sovaz, kamomiy, tulsi, sulfat, kashpyant, fey pes, katrepeng?
target: mo local pu latizann-la e pu sa bann maladi la: eski dimunn kone lor sitrorzel, ayapana, lament, koko, badamye sovaz, kamomiy, tulsi, sulfat, kaspyent, fey pes, katrepeng?

input: Which herbs are said, or were said, to be able to cure?
What makes these herbs have their good effects?
Stories about how each herb got its curative powers.
target: zistwar lor kimanyer sak latizann ti gayn so puvwar geri.
Ki obze ki servi pu gerizon.

input: How are these made from roots?
Stories about famous people ofthe past who were the first to use a certain cure.
target: Zistwar lor gran dimunn dan lepase ki finn premye pu servi enn kalite latizann.

input: Stories of how a cure got started.
target: Zistwar lor kouma enn gerizon finn koumanse.
Zistwar bann gerizon ki pa marse.

input: doctors who could not cure someone.
target: dokter ki pa ti kapav geri kikenn.

input: People who found that an herbal cure was better than a hospital or clinic.
target: Dimunn ki ti truv latizann pli bon ki lopital ou klinik.

input: Divination is trying to get knowledge about unknown things or events, now or in the future, by asking non—human beings.
target: Devine se kan nu sey gayn konesans lor zafer ki nu pa kone, swa prezan ubyen fitir - atraver dimann bann ki pa imin.
Suvan bizin al zwenn enn dimunn ki kunn devine.
Enn dimunn ki ena puvwar spesyal.

input: Interview a longanis directly if possible.
target: Intervyu enn longanis an personn si posib.

input: When do they do their activities (day, night)?
Can they cause sickness to someone?
target: Eski zot kapav fer kikenn tom malad?

input: Does this person wear special clothes to do his/her work?
target: Eski li met linz spesyal kan li travay?

input: Who is the one to go to the longanis?
target: Kisannla ki bizin al get li?

input: Do other people watch when he is doing his/her work?
target: Eski lezot dimunn obzerve kan li travay?

input: Why do people go to this person?
target: Kifer dimunn al get sa dimunn-la?

input: They are unable to have children.
They are ill or unable to work.
target: Zot malad ubyen pa kapav travay.

input: They are unable to have sex.
target: Zot pa pe kapav gayn relasyon sexyel.

input: Their wives or husbands no longer love them.
target: Zot fam ou mari pa kontan zot.

input: They want to find out who is doing harm to them.
target: Zot anvi kone kisannla pe fer zot ditor.

input: They want to do well in business.
They are afraid of illness or death.
They want help in choosing a wife.
target: Zot pe rod kudme swazir enn fam.

input: They want to choose where to build a house.
target: Zot ule kone kot pu konstrir enn lakaz.

input: Give a full account of why a person in your neighborhood would go to a diviner or curer.
target: Donn detay kifer enn dimunn dan u landrwa pu al get enn longanis ubyen enn treter.

input: Have the reasons changed since former times?
target: Eski sa bann rezon la diferan depi lepok avan?

input: What do people say about changes in this practices?
target: Dimunn ki dir lor kestyon sanzman dan sa bann pratik la.

input: Is there more or less of it than before?
target: Li plis ubyen li mwins ki avan?

input: Do diviners or curers charge payment?
target: Eski longanis ubyen treter la pran larzan?

input: Do some charge one fee before and another fee after their work?
target: Eski zot pran kas avan, lerla lot kas apre ki zot fini travay.

input: What or who decides the amount of the fee?
Is divining or curing a full-time job for this person?
target: Eski dimunn la so travay fultaym?

input: Is a curer the same as a witch, or different?
target: Eski enn treter mem zafer ki enn sorsyer, ubyen diferan?

input: How does the diviner get his/her power?

target: Depi so papa ubyen so mama?

input: From another diviner or curer who teaches?
target: Depi enn lot longanis ubyen enn lot treter ki anseyne?

input: Are there any outward signs by which a diviner can be seen to be special person?
target: Eski bann siyn exteryer ki fer ki u kapav rekonet enn longanis kan u truv enn?

input: with leaves of a plant (beating leaves in water).
with wooden charms, shells, or other object.
target: Avek but but dibwa, koki, ou lezot obze.

input: reading designs in water or other liquid.
target: Atraver lir dilo ubyen enn lot likid.

input: throwing bits ofa broken pot against a stick.
target: Zet but but po kase kont enn baton.

input: with seeds on a chain, or nuts.
target: Avek lagren anfile kuma enn lasenn, ubyen badam.

input: Photograph it if the diviner does not mind.
Give an account of how it is used.
What other objects are used (carrying bags, cups)?
Looking at the insides of a dead animal or chicken.
target: Eski zot vwar bann andan enn zanima mor, ubyen enn kok mor?
Ki but zot servi pu gete?

input: Does the diviner look for spots on them?
target: Eski treter-la rod mark lor zot?

input: What signs tell a curer that a sick person will get better?
target: Kimanyer li kone kikenn malad pu refer?

input: What is one with the animal or chicken then?
target: Ki li fer avek zanimo ubyen kok la apre?

input: Give a full account of all the steps of the process.
Did or do people offer something to a god or supernatural being?
target: Eski dimunn fer ofrand enn bondye ubyen enn lot kreatir sirnatirel?

input: Were animals killed for this purpose?
target: Eski ti tuy zanimo pu sa?

input: Accounts of how these sacrifices were or are done.
target: Rakonte kimanyer fer sa sakrifis la?

input: Story of how a dream caused someone to make a sacrifice.
target: Zistwar kimanyer enn rev fer kikenn fer enn tel sakrifis.

input: How does the diviner call up a spirit?
How can a person get a message from the spirit world, or from some other place?
target: Kimanyer enn dimunn gayn enn mesaz depi lemond bann lespri, ubyen depi enn lot plas?
Zistwar ki servi dan prosesis longanis.

input: Ask the diviner to tell you the meaning of each story, and what it has to do with the divination.
target: Dimann longanis rakont u sinifikasyon sak zistwar li servi, e ki li ena pu fer avek manyer li pe devine.

input: Do people consult horoscopes or astrological writings in newspapers or elsewhere?
target: Eski dimunn get oroskop dan lagazet ou ayer?

input: How do these influence their thinking or behavior?
target: Eski sa iniliyans zot manyer panse ubyeen zot aksyon?

input: Are there any sorts of divination or curing that people do not take seriously?
target: Eski ena fason devine ubyen geri dimunn ki dimunn napa pran oserye?

input: Practices that they think are a joke.
Practices that do not work nowadays.
target: Zafer zot panse nepli travay zordizur.

input: Are there people who disapprove of any of these practices?
target: Eski ena dimunn ki kont longanis e so travay?

input: What do such people say about them?
Which numbers are said to be lucky, which unlucky?
target: Ki sif port boner, sif Malefik?

input: What do people say about these beliefs?
target: Ki dimunn dir lor sa bann krwayans la?

input: What names or other words are kept secret, or should not be used at certain times?
target: Ki nom ek ki lezot mo ki gard sekre, ou ki gayn drwa servi zis dan bann momen Spesifik?

input: What sayings or groups of words are said at special times of day, or special seasons?
target: Ki koze, ki seri koze, ki dir zis dan enn sertin moman dan lazurne ubyen dan sertin sezon?

input: Words showing approval or disapproval of someone.
target: Mo ki montre ki u dakor ubyen pa dakor ek kikenn.

input: Sayings used in divination, magic, or healing.
target: Ki parol servi kan devine, dan mazik, ubyen dan gerizon.

input: Sayings that keep off bad effects from witches, enemies, persons with special powers, weather, animals.
target: Koze ki bar movezer, ki bar sorsyer, lennmi, lezot dimunn avek puvwar, movetan, zanimo.

input: How to Recognize and Collect Folktales.
Folktales do not take place in real time.
target: Foltel pa rakonte dan letan reel.

input: Mauritian folktales were collected and printed by Charles Baissac in Le Folklore de l’Ile Maurice.
target: Charles Baissac ti kolekte e pibliye folktel Morisyen dan enn liv apel Le Folklore de L’Ile Maurice.

input: When you find storytellers oftoday telling versions ofthe tales Baissac printed a century ago, you will know that they were kept in memory through the end ofthe colonial period, into independence, right up to the time of industrialisation.
target: Kan zordi u pe tann rakonter rakont zistwar ki ti pibliye plis ki 100 an desela, u pu rann u kont ki se zistwar ki finn res dan memwar dimunn, finn travers lepok kolonyal ziska lindepandans pu ariv zordi dan lepok Moris indistriyalize.

input: Many characters and incidents occur in the folktales of both East Africa and India and were probably brought to Mauritius from there.
target: Buku karakter ek insidan dan bann zistwar Moris paret pran rasinn depi Lafrik de Les ek Lend.

input: You may collect stories about an animal trickster, for instance.
target: U kapav, par egzanp, kolekte zistwar lor kit zanimo kuyoner.

input: In the well-known story of the tarbaby and the rabbit.
target: Ena zistwar ki byin koni, kot servi koltar pu may kikenn.

input: An animal (hare, rabbit) has been stealing food.
target: Enn zanimo (yev ubyen lapin) ki pe kokin manze.

input: He is punished when another animal, the tortoise captures him with tar.
target: Torti may yev par fer li kol ar koltar kumsa li gayn so beze.

input: Since this story is known all over Africa and throughout north and central India, we should expect to find it in Mauritius.
target: Etan done ki sa zistwar la byin popiler dan Lafrik e osi pran lenor Lind ziska Sant Lind, nu kapav atann tann li dan Moris osi.

input: In fact it is very popular here.
It appears in Baissac's book and the storyteller Nelzir Ventre perfumed it on a MaBC television broadcast on 2 January 1983.
target: Li dan liv Baissac e Nelzir Ventre ti rakont sa zistwar la lor televizyon MaBC le 2 Zanvye 1983.

input: Or you might find another well-known tale in Mauritius, which concerns a girl of an age to be married who refuses all suitors.
target: Ena osi enn lot zistwar byen koni dan Moris kot enn tifi enn sertenn laz refiz tu demann.

input: She willfully marries a stranger who turns out to be a wolf or other monster.
target: Li desid pu marye enn etranze ki transforme an lulu uswa mons.

input: Then she has to escape from this impossible marriage, sometimes with help from her brother.
target: Lerla li bizin sove depi sa menaz inposib la, parfwa avek kudme so frer.

input: These plots are favorites of Mauritian storytellers; there are many more.
target: Sa kalite zistwar la zot bann zistwar ki rakonter zistwar dan Moris byen konta; ena buku lezot ankor.

input: Folktales exist in variant forms, forms which differ from one another.
target: Folktel existe dan tu sort kalite diferan varyasyon, ki razm sakerm enpe diferan depi lezot.

input: For instance, in another story involving animals, a man learns secrets from the talk of animals.
target: Par exanp, ena zistwar kot enn misye anprann enn sekre depi koze enn zanimo.

input: He is told he will die if he lets anyone know what the animals said.
target: Si li rakont sa sekre ki Zanimo finn dir li la, li pu truv lamor.

input: From this point, the story moves on in different forms.
Either the man tells his wife and hence dies, or, on advice from the ruler, he does not tell his wife.
target: Swa li rakont so fam e lerla mor, ubyen li ekut konsey depi lao e li pa rakont so fam.

input: Neither form is correct or incorrect.
target: Nu pa pe rod form zistwar la ki bon ubyen pa bon.

input: Both variants are of equal importance to a knowledge of Mauritian folklore.
target: Tulede varyan ena mem linportans pu folklor Moris.

input: Variant forms like this should be carefully recorded.
target: Seki inportan bizin marke kuma li ete.

input: Many books containing one or more folktales are written for school children and others who are just learning to read.
target: Buku liv folktel, selman, zot viz swa zanfan lekol ubyen lezot dimunn ki pe anprann lir.

input: The tales are rewritten into suitable language, information is added which no oral storyteller would need, and pictures illustrate scenes from the stories.
target: Bann zistwar dan liv, zot enpe diferan byen suvan, oter-la re-ekrir zistwar la dan enn langaz apropriye, azut linformasyon ki rakonte pa pu bizin, ek inklir zimaz pu ilistre diferan senn dan zistwar la.

input: These books suggest indirectly that folktales are mainly suitable for children.
target: Sa bann liv la interes prinsipalman zanfan.

input: Indeed, Europeans have thought for many years that folktales were not interesting to adults.
target: Anfet, dan Lerop, pandan enn bon lepok, dimunn ti panse ki folktel pa interesan pu adilt.

input: The folk in India, Africa, and Mauritius do not agree.
target: Dan Lend, Lafrik ek Moris li pa parey.

input: Fishermen, housewives, tradesmen, and ordinary people continue to tell their old stories to adults, children, and anyone else who will listen.
target: Peser, fam ki fer luvraz lakaz e zuvriye ek dimunn ordiner kontiyn rakont zistwar pu adilt, zanfan e nerport kisannla ki interese pu ekute.

input: Children are not the only audience for folktales.
target: Pa zis zanfan ki ekut rakont folktel.

input: Folktales have value for all people, as your collecting experience will quickly tell you.
target: Folktel ena valer pu tu dimunn, parski u pu aprann sa byeni vit, kan u pu kumans kolekte folktel.

input: The reader of a children’s book, however, is a different audience from a group of family members and friends listening to a village storyteller at night.
target: Me selman, ena enn gran diferans ant zanfan ki pe lir enn liv, ek adilt ki pe ekut enn rakonter zistwar dan enn vilaz enn aswar.

input: Adults find meanings in folktales which children don’t yet know.
target: Adilt truv sinifikasyon dan folktel ki zenfan pankor kapav konpran.

input: The story about the girl who marries a wolf suggests to an adult that young women should take their parents’ advice about whom to marry.
target: Zistwar sa tifi ki marye ar enn lulu kapav sinifye ki enn tifi bizin rod konsantman so paran avan li swazir enn mari.

input: To a child it`s an exciting story about a wild animal and a magical escape.
target: Pu zanfan li pu enn zistwar amizan lor enn zanimo sovaz ek enn tifi ki reysi sove.

input: The wisdom of tales can be taken in by any person, without regard to age.
target: Sazes enn folktel li interes adilt ek zanfan, tulde.

input: People around the world agree on this point.
target: Antye lemond dimunn dakor lor sa pwin la.

input: Few people in India or Africa keep their folktales only for children.
target: Rar ki dimunn Lend ubyen Lafrik gard folktel zis pu zanfan.

input: Furthermore, no one should think that folktales represent the “childhood ofthe human race."
target: E fode pa personn krwar ki folktel reprezant ‘peryod lanfans ras imen’.

input: Folktales do not come to us from a more primitive stage of culture; they are not survivals of a crude past.
target: Folktel pa sorti depi ennh staz primitif kiltir; se pa restan lepase.

input: They are the most highly developed kind of oral art.
target: Li lar oral pli devlope ki ena.

input: Folktales should be recorded in the exact words of the teller.
target: Zame u perdi naryen par akord.

input: Does the performer use different tones of voice?
target: Bizin anrezistre folktel kom tel, mo pu mo, parey kuna rakonter rakont zistwar la.

input: Does he/she imitate animal sounds, sing, chant, recite?
target: Eski rakonter la servi diferan ton lavwa?
Eski li imit son zanimo, inklir santé ek resitasyon?

input: also be recorded; do people laugh, sing, clap?
target: Bizin usi anrezistre konportman lodyans: eski dimunn riye, sante ek tap lame?

input: To tell a story properly, should other people be performing along with the storyteller?
target: Pu ki rakont enn zistwar byen, eski lezot dimunn bizin partisip avek rakonter la?

input: How do people show how they feel about the performance?
target: Kuma dimunn reazir kan pe rakont zistwar?

input: Be sure to observe and record all the persons who are in a storytelling event, and describe what they do there.
target: Bizin obzerv ek anrezistre tu dimunn ki pe partisip dan evennman rakont zistwar dekrir ki zot pe fer laba.

input: Find out from the storyteller or others what rules exist that determine performance.
target: Seye dekuver regleman ki derterminn performans-la.

input: Should stories be told only at night?
target: Eski bizin rakont zistwar zis aswar?

input: Are only certain persons allowed to perform stories?
target: Eski selman enn grup ki otorize pu rakont zistwar?

input: What stories may not be told to women, men, children and outsiders?
target: Ki zistwar ki pa sipoze rakonte divan fam, zom, zanfan ek etranze?

input: Stories to ask for the best way to collect folktales is to be present at a time when they are being told — a family gathering, a village evening, or a celebration.
target: Zistwar ki bon u dimande pli bon fason pu ramas folktel se pu asire ki u prezan u-mem dan moman ki pe rakont zistwar – dan enn rankont familyal, enn sware dan vilaz ubyen dan enn selebrasyon.

input: Then you can observe and record each story in order,notice who tells it to whom, how the audience responds and how one story seems to answer another.
target: U kapav Obzerv ek anrezistre sak zistwar an ord, gete kisannla pe rakonte ar kisannla, kuma lodyans rispoonn e kuma enn zistwar pe reponn enn lot.

input: Another way, which is less natural but which I have often used,and which may succeed for you, is to interview a storyteller.
target: Enn lot fason, ki mwin natirel, ki momem monn fer, me kot u kapav reysi, se fer enn intervyu avek enn rakonter.

input: You can ask whether the storyteller knows tales like those in Baissac’s.
target: U kapav dimann rakonter la si li konn bann zistwar parey kuma dan Baissac.

input: You can summarize the stories from the books during your interview.
target: U kapav fini fer enn rezime bann zistwar dan liv la pandan intervyu.

input: Or you can ask whether the storyteller knows tales about Tizan, or about the hare.
target: Ouswa dimann li rakont u zistwar Tizan, ubyen zistwar yev.

input: To help you jog the memory of storytellers you meet, you will find below a list of characters and incidents that might turn up.
target: Pu fer enn rakonter mazinn zistwar ki li kone, anba nu finn met enn lalis personaz ek insidan ki abitye tande.

input: A motif is not all of a story, but part of one: a trickster character like the hare is a motif and so is his action of tricking another character, as when hare tricked snail into acting as his riding-horse.
target: Enn motif li pa enn zistwar antye, me enn but ladan: enn kuyoner kuma yev, li enn motif e so aksyon kot li kuyonn enn lot personaz, par exanp kan li kuyonn kurpa pu li vinn so seval, sa osi enn motif.

input: The motif has something memorable about it; a remarkably holy man, for instances a legend motif.
target: Enn motif ena kiksoz dan li ki rann li memorab enn sadu remarkab, sa li enn motif, e u kapav gayn sa motif la dan plizyer diferan zistwar, kuma enn zom ki anfet enn lulu.

input: And it can be found in more than one story, like the man who is really a wolf.
target: U kapav servi sa lalist motif dan fason swivan.

input: You can use the list of motifs like this.
target: U poz enn kestyonz “Eski u konn kit zistwar kot enn zanimo reysi sap enn dimunn depi enn gran danze?

input: You ask, "Do you know any stories in which an animal gets a man out of a dangerous place?" or, "Do you know any story about how death came on Earth?".
target: ubyen “Eski u konn kit zistwar kot lamor finn desann lor later?".

input: The following motifs are common to the folklore of both East Africa and India and are likely to turn up in Mauritius.
target: Bann motif swivan byen komen dan Lafrik deles ek Lind, alor pli sans nu truv zot dan Moris.

input: Work your way through the list, asking yourself and local people, “Do you know any stories in which animals talk?," or “Do you know any stories in which a man goes through great difficulties to get a wife?"
target: U bizin fer lalist la enn par enn, poz u mem lakestyon, ubyen poz lezot dimunn lakestyon “Eski u konn kit zistwar kot zanimo koze?" ou “Eski u konn kit zistwar kot enn zom bizin fer buku demars pu li reysi gayn enn fam?".

input: Where one person gives an unclear answer, another person in the same community will have many stories to tell you.
target: Si enn dimunn pa tro sir, pa traka, pu ena enn lot dimunn dan mem landrwa ki konn enn ta zistwar pou dir ou.

input: Animal escapes death when it makes the enemy believe it is dead.
target: Zanimo sape depi lamor kan li deklar mor.

input: A boy lets a magic animal escape and has to get it back.
target: Enn garson larg enn zanimo mazik par erer e bizin re-may li ankor.

input: War between different kinds of birds or animals.
target: Lager ant diferan kalite zwazo ubyen zanimo.

input: One animal puts blood on another‘s mouth to make him look guilty of murder.
target: Enn zanimo met disan l1or lagel enn lot pu fer li paret kriminel.

input: To win a contest in throwing, one animal throws stones, the other one throws fruit.
target: Pu raanport enn konkur avoye, enn] zanimo avoy ros, lot—la avoy frwi.

input: False nurse (hyena, dog) eats the children of her enemy (lion,leopard).
target: Enn fos infirmye (lyenn, lisyen) manz zanfan so lennmi (lyon, leopar).

input: Trickster (slow) agrees to race a faster animal.
target: Kuyoner (lant) tom dakor pu met paryaz ar enn zanimo ki ena lavites.

input: He puts a member ofhis family, or others who look like him, along the line of the crace.
target: Li avoy manb so fami, sipa lezot zanimo ki paret kuma li, dibut tut-o-long lapist.

input: The one who is tricked sees them and thinks trickster is winning the race.
target: Seki pe sibir sa trisri la, li krwar kuyoner—la pe gayn lekurs.

input: Hare (or other animal) tells the animal holding (biting) his foot, “You are holding (biting) a root."
target: Enni yev (ubyen kit lot zanimo) dir enn lot zanimo “ki pe anfet tini to lipye (ubyen mord so lipye) kumsa: "U pe tini (mord) enn rasinn".

input: Animal lets go of hare’s foot and hare gets away.
A hunter saves some animals from a trap.
target: Enn saser sov enn zanimo depi enn latrap.

input: Animals reward him, but later he is accused of stealing.
target: Zanimo donn li enn kado pu sa, me plitar dimunn la akize de vol.

input: Ungrateful animal, who has been rescued, is put back into captivity.
target: Zanimo ki pa rekonesan apre ki finn sap li, bann la remay li.

input: Very well known in india and Africa.
Giant bird that carries off man or men in its claws.
target: Ennzwazo zean sarye enn dimunn swa plizir dimunn dan so grif.

input: Sea creature with the head and upper body ofa woman and the tail of a fish (mermaid) marries a man.
target: Bebet lamer avek latet ek lestoma Kuma fam, e lake kuma pwason (lasirenn) marye enn dimunn.

input: Worm that grows to very large size and eats people.
target: Lever ki vinn telman gran ki li manz dimunn.

input: Bird gives people knowledge of a killing.
target: Zwazo amenn nuvel ki finn ena enn krim.

input: Birds give knowledge of future events or gives message.
target: Zwazo ki konn dir lavenir ubyen ki amenn mesaz.

input: A man learns the language of animals.
target: Enn zom ki aprann langaz zanimo.

input: What happens next varies from one storytelling community to another.
target: Seki arive apre, sa depann landrwa kot pe rakone.

input: Learning the language of animals is part of the story.
target: Aprann langaz zanimo. li zis enn but dan zistwar la.

input: Therefore, versions of the tale in all regions and languages must be carefully recorded.
target: Alor, bizin rikord tu bann diferan versyon, e dan tu langaz ki tann li.

input: How the friendship between two animals began and ended, or how the enmity between two animals began.
target: Kuma  de zanimo finn rant kamarad ubyen finn ariv gayn diskisyon.

input: Ask for tales about a cruel stepmother or second wife, a cruel father or mother-in-law.
target: Dimann zistwar lor enn move belmer, ubyen enn dezyem madam, enn move papa, ubyen enn move belmer.

input: A monster or ogre disguises and wins a girl.
target: Enn mons degiz li pu gayn enn tifi.
Enn ofrand ki bizin fer a enn mons.

input: Children or other persons abandoned in a forest or exposed in a boat.
target: Zafan ki abandone dan enn lafore ubyen abandone dan enn pirog.

input: The older one of two or three brothers or sisters is unkind to people.
target: Granfrer ubyen granser kriyel anver dimunn.

input: He/she gets no help from them.
The younger one is kind,and so is helped by people, becomes rich and gets rewards.
target: Tiser ubyen tifrer li zanti, alor dimunn ed li, li vinn ris e li gayn riward.

input: A man wins a wife by winning a contest or a race or by doing things such as making the wind calm or finding a very unusual something or lives through hardships.
target: Enn zom gayn enn fam atraver enn konkur ubyen paryaz ubyen atraver akomplir zafer rar, kuma fer labriz kalme ubyen li truv kiksoz rar ubyen li sirviv tu kalite kontretan.

input: Tests of quickness of mind or strength.
target: Paryaz pu gete sipa lespri vif ubyen pu gete kisannla pli for.

input: A man wins a wife by being tested how well he is able to deal with a situation.
target: Zom gayn enn fam parski li konn rann lapel dan enn sityasyon difisil.

input: A wife gives her husband actions to do, or gives him a task to show his love for her.
target: Enn fam donn so mari enn seri travay pu akonplir, ubyen enn seri tas pu akomplir pu pruv so lamur pu li.

input: A girl is set free by several men.
target: Enn titi libere par plizyer zom.

input: Which one will she belong to?
target: Ki parmi bann zom pu gayn li?

input: A girl or woman is offered to a man as the reward for doing something.
target: Ofer enn tifi ubyen enn fam a nerport ki zom ki reysi akomplir kit aksyon.

input: One person in a family gets another out of danger.
target: Enn dimunn dan enn fami sap enn lot dimunn dan fami la.

input: Stories in which it is forbidden to do something: Talk roughly to a wife or child who is a magic or divine being.
target: Zistwar kot kiksoz anpese fer: Anpese koz brit ar u madam ubyen ar enn zanfan akoz zot mazik ubyen divinn.

input: Eat certain food (an insect, bird, or animal).
target: Manz kit manze (enn insek, enn zwazo, enn zanimo).
Koz lor kiksoz ki finn traverse.

input: Give out knowledge of animal language.
target: Partaz konesans lor enn langaz zanimo.

input: Go into a certain room in a house (other rooms are not forbidden).
target: Rant dan enn lasam an partikilye dan enn lakaz (lezot lasam gayn drwa rantre).

input: Hunt in a certain part of the forest.
target: Fer lasas dan enn but dan la fore.

input: Father forbids his son to do something, then dies.
target: Papa anpes so garson fer kiksoz,  lerla li mor.

input: Wife does something forbidden, then dies.
target: Fam ki fer kiksoz ki anpese, lerla so mari mor.

input: Or someone else does something forbidden which causes a wife to die.
target: Ubyen enn lot dimunn fer kiksoz interdi, e fam-la mor.

input: Magic changes from one form to another.
target: Transformasyon mazik depi enn zafer a enn lot.

input: The story elements listed here are thought of as imaginary.
target: Isi nu pe donn enn lalis bann eleman zistwar ki konsidere kuma imaziner.

input: man becomes woman, man becomes animal, animal becomes human being.
target: Zom vinn Fam, dimunn vinn zanimo, zamimo vinn dimunn.

input: Other changes: Man changes to a stone.
Man or woman changes into jewels or other ornaments.
target: Zom ubyen fam vinn bizu ubyen enn lot dekorasyon.

input: Man changes into wind, water, a pile of earth, a pile of bones.
target: Zom vinn labriz, dilo, enn ta later, enn pil lezo.

input: Image or wooden likeness of a person is changed into a human being.
target: Enn skilptir dibwa an form imen, ubyen enn bolom dibwa vinn enn imen.

input: Man changes form to get away from those who are chasing him.
target: Zom sanze vinn enn lot zafer pu li sove depi enn lennmi ki pe galup deryer li.

input: Change of form as punishment for something.
target: Sanz form kuma enn pinisyon pou kiksoz.

input: Obstacle flight: people running away throw objects behind them which, by magic, turn into things that stop their pursuers.
target: Obstak kan pe sove: dimunn ki pe sove depi enn kikenn, zot zet bann ti-obze ki vinn bann lezot zafer, ki reysi protez zot.

input: Magic objects: Magic fruit, earth, leaf, grain or rice, honey, water.
target: Obze mazik: Fri mazik, later, fey, diri ubyen gren sek, dimyel, dilo.

input: Magic skull, breasts of woman, head of an animal, tail of an animal, speaking head.
target: Krann mazik, tete fam, latet zanimo, lake zanimo, latet ki koze.

input: Magic object holds person from moving.
target: Enn obze mazik ki anpes dimunn buze.

input: Magic object makes it possible for a person to have many children.
target: Obze mazik ki fer gayn buku zanfan.

input: Magic powers and how they work: Magic power of mermaid (half-woman half—fish).
target: Pwisans mazik e kimanyer li marse: Pwisans mazik lasirenn (larnwatye fam, lamwatye pwason).

input: Power to have children is brought by magic.
Magic journey on a beam of sunlight.
Magic powers from being born with an animal tail.
target: Puvwar spesyal akoz zanfan ne avek enn lake.

input: Marvels and wonders: Journey to the country in the moon on a seat attached to a cord.
target: Mervey: Vwayaz dan enn pei lor lalinn lor enn syez atase ar enn lakord.

input: Journey to a country where only women are found.
target: Vwayaz a enn pei kot ena zis fam.

input: Person is carried off by a bird.
Birds, spirits, or other nonhuman creatures clear and cultivate a piece of land.
target: Zwazo, lespri, lezot kreatir ki pa dimunn, fer desavanaz e kiltir later.

input: Strong man is not killed, though people try.
target: Zom for pa mor, mem kan dimunn sey tuy li.

input: Person who can see specially well.
target: Dimunn ki so lizye truv pli kler.

input: They are then helped out of the animal’s stomach.
target: Lerla bann-la tir li dan so vant.
Later uver e aval enn dimunn.

input: Great fear brings an end to sickness.
target: Enn gran kut lafreyer geri malady.

input: Person eats the flesh of a member of his family without knowing it.
target: Dimunn manz laser enn so fami san kone.

input: Meat of a human being talks when it is cooked.
target: Laser imen koze kan kwi li.
