target: Li enn fe ki burzwazi li sel klas ki ena akse a buku resurs an permanans, e ki ena enn rezerv ideolog pu defann so fason panse ek so ideolozi ziska lamor.

input: And I think it is important, as we enter a period of crisis, that we do not repeat the mistakes of some of us in the struggle in South Africa, who said Apartheid cannot end without the end of capitalism.
target: E mo panse li inportan ki nu pa fer mem erer ki serten dant nu finn fer dan lalit Sid Afrik kan nu pe rant dan enn peryod kriz, nu pa fer erer pu deklare ki laparteid pa pu fini tank kapitalism ankor-la.

input: We found out that it can.
target: Purtan se sa ki finn arive, kapitalism finn sirviv apre lafen aparteid.

input: We can say that there is still racism, but objectively the idea that it was impossible to conceive of capitalism in South Africa without the juridical form of Apartheid was obviously, with hindsight, quite wrong.
target: Zordi, ankor ena rasism me avek rekil, obzektivman lide ki ti inposib pu konsevwar kapitalism dan Sid Afrik san institisyon aparteid, li ti kareman fos.

input: Therefore my last point is that there are no final crises.
target: Alor mo dernye pwen se ki pena okenn kriz final.

input: It’s all conditional on the conduct of the revolutionary forces, whether they can solve the issue in their own interest, in the interests of the classes they represent, or whether the issue again gets resolved in the interests of the bourgeoisie.
target: Tu depann lor fason lafors revolisyoner diyl ek kriz-la. Eski pu kapav rezud bann problem dan nu prop lintere, dan lintere klas ki nu reprezante? Ubyen eski bann problem pu rezud dan lintere burzwazi ankor enn fwa?

input: Or, a third option, which I think Marx and Gramsci talked about, which is the “peace of the graveyard”.
target: Ubyen trwazyem posibilite,ki mo krwar Marx ek Gramsci ti mansyone se “lape simityer”.

input: In other words those classes in the battle are so exhausted that the whole thing disintegrates.
target: Setadir bann klas ki dan sa lalit de klas, zot telman epwize ki tu dezentegre.

input: And sometimes we get a strong man emerging to stitch up everyone.
target: E parfwa ena enn lider for ki lev latet pu rakomod tu, fors laburzwazi ek tu leres dimunn kol ansam.

input: The rise of the strong man, in a reactionary storm of fascism.
target: Ena lamonte enn lider for dan enn siklonn fasism reaksyoner.

input: The Mauritian economy is in big enough trouble to warrant it.
target: Lekonomi Moris li dan gran gran problem.

input: For 200 years the Mauritian private sector bosses have been in charge of the economy.
target: Depi 200 banane patrona Moris finn ansarz lekonomi.

input: They have kept a tight monopoly control on big capital.
target: Zot finn gard enn monopol lor gran kapital.

input: They have taken all major decisions as to when to invest in what and how much to invest in it.
target: Limem li finn gete ki pu investi, komye, e kan.

input: They have kept a tight control on investment in what they refer to as “labour”, meaning one of the inputs into production.
target: Pareyman, patrona finn gard enn monopol lor seki li li apel “mindev”.

input: So, it has been the private sector bosses who have decided how to create jobs, in what sectors and under what conditions.
target: Limem finn gete kimanyer kree lanplwa, dan ki sekter, e dan ki kondisyon.

input: This same capitalist class has kept a monopoly control over most of the land, deciding all by themselves what to plant and how to organize production.
target: E patrona mem ki finn gard kontrol monopol lor mazorite later. Limem li finn determine ki pu plante, kimanyer organiz plantasyon.

input: So it is that the bosses take all the decisions about how to feed us.
target: Patrona finn pran tu desizyon lor kimanyer pu nuri nu tu.

input: In the past 10 years, this monopoly situation has, if anything, deteriorated.
target: Patrona dan dernye 10 an finn al pli lwen ankor.

input: When the rate of return to private investment has started, as usual, to go down, the private bourgeoisie has sent its tentacles out into the public sector.
target: Li finn anvoy so tantakil lor sekter piblik sann ku la.

input: It has taken over control of Mauritius Telecom, which was a department of Government.
target: Sekter prive finn rant dan departman Telecom, pran li.

input: It is trying to get control of CEB and CWA, thus adding electricity and water to its list.
target: Li pe rod pran CEB ek CWA.

input: It is bent on controlling pension funds, and has already started investing in health and education.
target: Li pe rant dan sekter pansyon. Li finn rant dan Lasante ek Ledikasyon.

input: It has gone deeply into muck-collection.
target: Li finn rant dan netwayaz lari ek ramas salte.

input: It has even gone into policing.
target: Li finn rant dan sekter lapolis.

input: Government after government has perpetuated this state of affairs.
target: Guvernman apre guvernman finn perpetye sa monopol la.

input: From colonial times through the Labour Government of the 1960’s and 1970’s, up until the MMM and MSM Governments during the 1980’s and 1990’s, and until today, all Governments have organized everything so that the bosses continue their rule, continue taking decisions off their own bats.
target: Depi lepok kolonyal, ziska guvernman Travayis bann lane 1960 ek ‘70, depi bann guvernman MMM ek MSM pandan bann lane 80 ek 90, ziska ler, zot tu finn organiz tu, pu ki patrona kontiyn pran tu desizyon plizumwen li tusel.

input: At most, the government has sometimes intervened so as to ensure a bit of extra profit from cane and sugar for the bosses.
target: Forse-forse, guvernman finn intervenir pu li ogmant profi misye la dan so kann ek so disik.

input: For example, government has organized pre-payments to small planters for their cane.
It has set up the factory area system, to share planters out amongst mills.
target: Li met dibut “factory area” pu alwe tiplanter so mulen.

input: And it is governments who negotiate sugar prices with European governments and the EU.
target: Limem li al negosye pri disik ar Lerop.

input: And whenever workers have risen up in rebellion against the bosses and the Government, then and only then has the Government seen fit to intervene; the colonial Government introduced the first old-age pensions and the Village Election system after the rebellions of 1937 and 1943; then around the mobilization for Independence, it introduced permanent employment on sugar estates from 1964; and nationalized one sugar Estate, Rosebelle, and the CEB; new labour laws and the system of Awards were introduced; under pressure Government forced the bosses to recognize the sugar sector trade unions SILU and UASI after the August 79 general strike; laws were introduced to prohibit the estates from having their own shops for their workers, and later forced the estates to close down the system of tied housing.
target: E, kan travayer finn fer sulevman kont patron ek kont Guvernman, lerla Guvernman finn intervenir: finn introdir pansyon vyeyes ek sistem Konsey Vilaz apre rebelyon 1937 ek 1943; finn introdir sistem “anplwaye” apartir 1964; finn nasyonaliz enn tablisman ek CEB; finn met lalwa travay ek award; finn fors tablisman rekonet sindika SILU ek UASI apre lagrev Ut 79; finn anpes tablisman ena so prop labutik; finn fors tablisman ferm dankan tu dernyeman.

input: But, it is still the bosses that continue to take all decisions of importance for the entire people and our survival on the planet. And they do it single-handed. They continue their monopoly on land control, on capital, and on decisions about how to deploy “labour” and what jobs to create or not.
target: Me, se tuzur patrona ki finn kontinye pran tu desizyon. Li finn kontiyn ena monopol lor buku later, lor buku kapital, ek desizyon monopol lor ‘mindev’.

input: And now today, the bosses and the Government have come forward to begin to admit that their project is a failure.
target: Zordi patrona ek guvernman finn kumans admet ki zot proze li enn esek.

input: The sugar industry is already in a deep crisis.
target: Lindistri sikriyer li dan enn kriz deza.

input: And for the three next years, this same crisis will deepen further into a cataclysm.
target: E pandan trwa prosenn lane, li pu dan enn kriz ase katastrofik.

input: The “Sugar Protocol” under the Lome Convention has reached its limit.
target: ‘Protokol Disik’ su Konvansyon Lome finn ariv so lafen.

input: So, the crisis is, in some ways, “the chronicle of an anticipated crisis”.
target: Alor, sa kriz la li anfet enn ‘kronik enn kriz anonse’.

input: Everyone with any nouse knew the crisis was coming.
target: Tu dimunn ti kone ki sa kriz la pe vini.

input: But those who take decisions persisted in doing absolutely nothing to prevent it, avoid it, or transcend it.
target: Naryen zot pa finn fer pu sey truv enn lekonomi alternatif.

input: The Government has allowed mill after sugar mill to close down, with more and more job-losses leaving the countryside without any serious employment prospects at all.
target: Guvernman finn permet patron tablisman ferm mulen, met artizan ek laburer deor, detrir lanplwa; anplas li obliz patron tablisman konverti so mulen dan enn lot kalite lizinn, anplas li obliz patron tablisman gard laburer pu devlop prodiksyon alimanter.

input: We suppose the MCB and other banks just went and announced bad debts of Rs 800,000,000 for each economic disaster.
target: Lerla, MCB ek lezot labank res avek bann “bad debt” Rs 800,000,000, a-sak fwa ena enn dezast.

input: The free zone textile industry is also at the beginning of an absolutely major crisis.
target: Textil zonn frans, li dan kumansman enn kriz grav.

input: Many factories have already shut down.
The Multi-fibre agreement ends now, in January 2005, making this crisis yet another “chronicle of an expected crisis”.
target: Avek lafen Lakor Milti-fib (Zanvye, 2005), sa osi enn kriz ki fini anonse depi avan.

input: This kind of export processing zone was doomed from its very inception to be a non-sustainable type of so-called “development”. It was always a “stop-gap”.
target: Sa osi, ti enn stil devlopman pa sutenab.

input: Now, all the profits produced by 30 years of workers’ sweat and tears, flies off to be invested elsewhere, leaving no profound traces of economic development in Mauritius.
target: E tu profi ki finn fer pandan 30 an, li anvole, san kit enn tras dan enn devlopman ekonomik profon dan Moris.

input: When the first place the textile bosses ran to was Madagascar, they bumped into a major political crisis, and there too, lost everything.
target: Kan patron textil tir zot kapital, al Madagaskar, la osi, zot finn fer lapert.

input: Over the past 30 years, productivity of labour has increased 50-fold.
target: Dan dernye 30 an, prodiktivite finn ogmante buku.

input: Agricultural production has been helped by mechanization, and the mills and textile factories have been helped by centralization and the introduction of electronic machinery.
target: Masinnri finn rann lagrikiltir ek lindistri buku pli prodiktif; setadir sak enn travayer pe prodir ziska 50 fwa seki enn travayer avan li ti prodir.

input: So, how on earth, at times like this can the Government and bosses have the cheek to come and announce that “unfortunately” old age pensions as a right are no longer affordable?
target: E dan enn lepok kumsa, kot pei finn sanse devlope buku, dan sa kalite moman-la, Guvernman ek patrona vinn dir u ki zot pu nepli donn pansyon vyeyes kuma enn drwa;

input: How can they announce that Government can no longer afford to pay 1/2 the SC and HSC examination fees as of right?
target: ki zot nepli pu pey 1/2 fiz lexame pu SC ek HSC kuma enn drwa;

input: That certain hospital services may need to be paid for by the patient at the moment of the service?
target: ki serten swen dan lopital pu sanse oblize vinn peyan.

input: Paul Berenger and Pravind Jugnauth have even set about destroying agricultural land now.
target: E Paul Berenger ek Pravind Jugnauth finn kumans detrir later agrikol.

input: Instead of building a Cyber-City on rocky land somewhere, they spread concrete all over the finest land in the country at Ebene.
target: Anplas met enn Cyber-City dan enn landrwa ros-ros, zot kul beton lor pli bon later Moris, dan Lebenn.

input: So long as the sugar estate bosses get lots and lots of money for selling their land.
target: Purvi patron tablisman gayn gro gro larzan.

input: Instead of developing agriculture and industry to assure food security and food for export, they go ahead with a slave-minded plan to attract the millionaires of the planet to come and build big villas here, thus reducing Mauritian citizens to being virtual servants on a permanent basis.
target: Anplas devlop lagrikiltir ek lindistri pu asir sekirite alimanter, ek pu asir exportasyon, zot pe al delavan avek zot proze esklavazist kot zot atir dimunn ris vinn konstrir gran-gran lakaz, redwir sitwayen Moris an serviter permanan.

input: What kind of bankruptcy are they admitting to for their very own development strategies?
target: Abe, ki kalite bankrut zot pe admet, pu zot prop stratezi devlopman?

input: It is an important moment to think about political economics.
target: Li enn moman inportan pu refleksyon lor politik ekonomik.

input: In fact, it is already late.
Berenger, Ramgoolam and Jugnauth, all of them have contributed to bringing us to the brink of a grave economic crisis, one on a scale never known in the history of the country prior to this.
target: Berenger, Ramgoolam, Jugnauth, zot tu finn amenn nu dan rebor enn kriz ekonomik kuma zame pei-la pa finn traverse. Ena dezast divan nu. E li pa lwen. Dan prosenn 2-3 an, nu pu an gran difikilte dan sa pei la.

input: And it is not just Lalit that says so. The bosses and Government have finally come around to agreeing that that is the case. The sugar industry has no future. Free Zone-style development has none either. There will be further mass sackings with new VRS (the so-called Voluntary Retirement Schemes that are all but compulsory) and with further mill closures. Unemployment can be expected to continue to rise. Recently Prime Minister Berenger was so het-up about the rate of unemployment that he took to blaming the Central Statistical Office for it, accusing them of not calculating accurately.
target: E pa zis Lalit ki pe dir sa. Mem patrona ek Guvernman pe finalman truv kler. Lindistri Sikriyer pena lavenir. Indistriyalizasyon stil Zonn Frans parey. Lisansiman imans atraver VRS, atraver fermtir lizinn. Somaz pe ogmante de zur an zur. Ziska Berenger truve ki Biro Statistik pe mal kalkil sif somaz!

input: It is in such a context that Lalit is launching this campaign on a national level to force the Government and the bosses and their lackey-ideologues to open their eyes and look at what the future holds for all the humans of this land.
target: Li dan tu sa kad-la ki Lalit pe lans enn kanpayn nasyonal pu fors Guvernman ek patrona, ek zot bann ideolog patante, uver zot lizye, get lavenir imen dan sa pei la.

input: It’s in this context of generalized flux that Lalit has begun a national campaign to force Government and the bosses, and their accredited ideologues, to wake up and act in the interests of the people of this country.
target: Pu lamas dimunn, kanta nu, nu pena swa. Nu oblize defann nu prop drwa a lavi lor sa planet la.

input: As long ago as in 1983-84, Lalit was already in the middle of a campaign to warn of the dangers of leaving the Sugar Oligarchs to dictate agricultural politics of the whole country. What happened then, was that we bumped into State repression.
target: An 1983-84 kan Lalit ti lans li dan kanpayn pu averti tu dimunn lor danze ki tablisman kontinye dikte politik agrikol enn pei an-antye, nu ti tap ar represyon Leta.

input: We had prepared a Slide Show and Talk Series called “Disik, Ki Lavenir?” that was touring towns and villages of Mauritius.
target: Nu ti ena enn ‘Slide show’ ek kozri ki ti kumans fer letur bann kartye dan Moris.

input: We were, even then, proposing a legal framework that would oblige the Sugar Estates to plant their rows of cane in a format that allows inter-line cropping of food crops every year, and not just when there is new cane planted every seven or so years.
target: Partu, alabaz. Ti apel “Disik: Ki Lavenir?” Deza lerla nu ti pe prekoniz enn kad legal pu obliz tu tablisman plant so kann dan enn format ki permet legim antreliyn dan tu so later, e nu ti osi prevwar enn pursantaz plantasyon alimanter obligatwar, lor baz plennter.

input: In our campaign against ‘fermtir sovaz’ of Sugar Mills, which had only just begun, we were, even then, envisaging forcing the Oligarchs to convert all mills closing down into agro-industries of modern types (canning, freeze-drying, freezing, transformation into juices, soups, etc).
target: Dan kad kanpayn kont fermtir sovaz Mulen Kann, ki ti pe fek kumanse lerla, nu ti prekoniz transformasyon obligatwar tu mulen ki pe ferme (kote disik) an lizinn pu diferan form modern pu prezerv prodwi agro-alimanter (Kanning, friz-dray, friz, transformasyon an zi, lasup, etc).

input: SLAVERY, INDENTURE, WAGE SLAVERY AND THE NEED FOR AGRARIAN REFORM.
target: LESKLAVAZ, LANGAZMAN, ‘WAGE SLAVERY’ EK NESESITE REFORM AGRER.

input: STRUCTURAL CRISIS IN THE SUGAR INDUSTRY.
The sugar industry has gone into a crisis so deep that it cannot be alleviated by the depreciation of the rupee, nor even by a devaluation.
target: Lindistri Sikriyer finn rant dan enn kriz ki nepli kapav kolmate par enn depresyasyon akselere rupi, ni mem par enn devalyasyon.

input: The measures the Government and bosses are proposing now will not have any really positive affect, and this neither in the short nor long term.
target: Bann mezir ki pe propoze aktyelman pa pu ena okenn lefe pozitif, ni a kur term, ni alonterm.

input: This kind of crisis has dangerous social repercussions in addition to the obvious economic effects.
target: Enn tel kriz kapav ena reperkisyon sosyal byen danzere, apar reperkisyon ekonomik evidan.

input: Even when there are tourist hotels and free zone factories in the countryside in Mauritius, it is still, until today, life around the sugar mill and cane plantation that provides the social cohesion of village life.
target: mem ek prezans lizinn Zonn Frans ek lotel turist, koezyon sosyal dan lakanpayn ankor byen depandan lor aktivite otur plantasyon kann ek mulen disik.

input: The crisis in the sugar industry today is a direct and predictable result of the introduction of WTO rules and of the restructuring of agriculture in a European Union, which is growing in size all the time.
target: Kriz dan Lindistri Sikriyer zordi, li enn rezilta direk ek previzib sanzman ki pe dekul depi aplikasyon regleman WTO, osi byen ki restriktirasyon lagrikiltir dan enn Lerop Ini ki pe agrandi de zur an zur.

input: The protectionist regime under which the sugar industry grew and survived in colonial times, is now being dismantled really fast: there will no longer be the same quotas and guaranteed prices that ex-colonies like Mauritius have had when they produce for and export to Europe.
target: Sa proteksyonism su lekel lindistri sikriyer finn devlope ek sirviv depi lepok kolonyal, aster pe demantle: nepli pu ena mem kota ek pri garanti pu disik ki ansyen koloni kuma Moris finn prodir ek exporte, prinsipalman ver Lerop.

input: We all know about the times of the  “sugar boom” in the mid 1970’s which quickly became the economic crisis of the late 1970’s, when the revenue from sugar was no longer enough to assure the cost of imports of basic needs, and when there were two devaluations which aimed at making workers and ordinary people bear the brunt of the crisis.
target: Nu ankor rapel lepok “boom sikriye” o-milye bann lane ’70, ki byen vit finn transforme dan enn kriz ekonomik byen grav ver lafen bann lane ’70: reveni disik nepli ti pe kapav asir importasyon nesesite de baz, ek finn ena 2 devalyasyon ki ti viz prinsipalman pu fer travayer ek lamas dimunn mizer sarye tu fardo sa kriz la.

input: Instead of thinking about what long-term future the sugar industry really had, the ruling classes just went into textiles and tourism, while gradually giving more and more tax concessions to the sugar bosses, mainly reducing the Sugar Export Levy.
target: Olye reflesi lor lavenir alonterm sa lindistri sikriyer la, bann klas dirizant finn opte pu akseler devlopman lindistri textil ek turist, ek anmemtan sulaz lindistri sikriyer par kumans diminye Tax Sorti.

input: We all remember the notorious 57 million rupee “tax relief” that the first MMM-PSM Government introduced.
target: Tu dimunn ankor rapel sa fame 57 milyon “sulazman” ki premye Guvernman MMM-PSM ti ofer a Lindistri Sikriyer.

input: Instead of diversifying agriculture so as to assure food security and to increase the productivity of agricultural land, the sugar companies went on planting cane and investing in textiles and tourism for the short-term profits these offered them.
target: Olye diversifye lagrikiltir pu asir sekirite alimanter ek ogmant rantabilite later agrikol, bann konpayni sikriyer finn kontinye plant kann ek investi dan lindistri textil ek turist pu asir zot profi akurterm.

input: Later these companies would take the surplus made by Mauritian workers and go and invest in other countries, where often they lost all that social capital.
target: Pli tar sa bann konpayni-la finn osi investi buku kapital ki finn prodwir par travayer dan Moris, dan lindistri sikriyer lezot peyi kuma Mozambik ek Kot Divwar, ek parfwa zot finn dilapid tu sa kapital-la.

input: In the 1980’s, the export levy on sugar was further reduced, until it disappeared altogether.
target: Pandan bann lane ’80, finn ena enn seri rediksyon lor tax sorti lor disik, ziska ki sa tax la disparet net.

input: At the same time mill concentration and mechanization of the fields went ahead full steam, supposedly to lower production costs.
target: Anmemtan santralizasyon mulen ek mekanizasyon dan karo finn akselere, sipozeman pu diminye ku prodiksyon.

input: But once again it was just that the working class was being made to bear the brunt of the crisis, because jobs themselves (not just individual workers’ salaries) were being lost ever.
target: Me anfet se ankor enn fwa klas travayer ki ti pe sarye fardo, a mezir ki ena destriksyon lanplwa pu artizan ek laburer.

input: Already, the price sugar was bringing was not increasing in real terms, nor in comparison with increases in the price of imports.
target: Deza apartir sa lepok-la, pri disik nepli ti pe ogmante an term reel, par rapor ek pri bann marsandiz importe.

input: But the sugar industry went on surviving because of the protectionism that Europe offered through the Sugar Protocol.
target: Me Lindistri Sikriyer ti ankor pe sirviv gras a proteksyonism ki Lerop ti pe ofer a traver Protokol Disik.

input: Under the present MMM-MSM Government all this has accelerated further: rapid mechanization of planting and harvesting has brought the VRS, which destroyed some 10,000 labourers’ jobs; a mill on average has closed each year, with a reduction in mill workers’ jobs; piece rate “speed-ups” for labourers and mill workers continue, while the salaries and bonuses of the management remain a secret; the IRS (Integrated Resorts Scheme) projects are converting thousands of arpents of good agricultural land into holiday camps for millionaires from abroad.
target: Se su Guvernman MMM-MSM aktyel ki tu sa prosesis la finn akselere: mekanizasyon rapid pu plantasyon ek rekolt kann ki finn amenn VRS, kot preske 10,000 lanplwa laburer finn detrir; an mwayenn, enn mulen pe ferme sak lane, avek rediksyon lanplwa pu artizan; latas laburer ek artizan finn kontinye ogmante, anmemtan ki lapey ek bonis kolom rest sekre; proze IRS (Integrated Resorts Scheme) ki pe konverti par milye arpan bon later agrikol an kan vakans pu milyoner internasyonal.

input: All these measures aim at nothing else but floating the profits of the sugar estates, without the least regard for the futures of the 30,000 to 40,000 small cane planters, let alone the workers.
target: Tu sa bann mezir la viz inikman pu asir reveni pu tablisman, san ki lavenir sa 30,000 a 40,000 ti planter kann pran an konsiderasyon.

input: But, as early as 1995, with the setting up of the WTO and all its new trade rules, it had become clear that the subsidies that the beet-producers of Europe as well as the ACP (Africa, Caribbean and Pacific) countries got, would be bound to become illegal.
target: Me deza a partir 1995, avek formasyon WTO ek aplikasyon bann nuvo regleman pu komers internasyonal, li ti kler ki sa sibsid ki prodikter disik betrav Eropein ek prodikter disik kann dan peyi Lafrik, Karaib, ek Pasifik (ACP) benefisye, sa ti pu disparet.

input: That is precisely what is happening today. Under pressure from countries that produce sugar for the world market and earn about one-third of what the producers for Europe earn, countries like Australia, Brazil, and Thailand, the WTO has declared the subsidies on beet sugar “illegal” under WTO rules, because Europe sells some of this very sugar on the world market, thus helping depress its price further.
target: Se sa ki pe arive aster-la, su presyon depi peyi kuma Lostrali, Brezil, ek Tailand: zot osi prodir ek export disik kann lor Marse Mondyal, me zot gayn enn pri ki selman 1/3 seki prodikter Eropyen gayne, parski ena sibsid lor disik betrav ek sa li “ilegal” dapre regleman WTO, parski Lerop osi vann enn parti so sirplis lor marse mondyal.

input: Another factor that has accelerated this process is the fact that Europe has grown from 15 to 25 members now, and has to decrease its agricultural subsidies, especially as many of the new members are agricultural producers.
target: Lot fakter ki finn akseler sa prosesis la, se ki kan Lerop finn agrandi depi 15 a 25 peyi mamb, li pe bizin diminye so bidze sibvansyon agrikol, sirtu ki laplipar nuvo peyi mamb, zot byen agrikol.

input: So when the European Commissioners come and propose a reduction of 37% in the sugar price they will guarantee over the next 2 years all we can say is that such a proposal was eminently predictable.
target: Alor kan bann Komiser Lerop Ini finn propoz enn rediksyon 37% dan pri disik lor prosen 2 an, sa ti totalman previzib.

input: And all the measures in the world to assure short-term profitability for the sugar estates will not suffice to rectify that scale of price reduction.
target: Ek tu bann mezir pu asir profitabilite a kur term tablisman pa pu sifi pu fer fas a sa kalite rediksyon pri.

input: For small planters, this scale of price fall will be a veritable catastrophe.
target: ek pu ti planter li pu enn veritab katastrof.

input: Already the rupee is depreciating rapidly relative to the Euro and the Pound Sterling and this is bringing inflation;
target: Deza rupi pe depresye rapidman par rapor ek Ero ek Liv Sterling ek sa pe amenn inflasyon;

input: is the Government feeling tempted to precipitate a devaluation so as to increase the sugar revenue in rupee terms to absorb the price reduction?
target: eski Guvernman pu tante pu presipit enn devalyasyon pu ogmant reveni an term rupi pu sa disik ki pu sibir enn rediksyon pri?

input: At the moment, Government is putting all its efforts into “diplomacy”, to try to put off or decrease the amplitude of the price reduction that Europe has already announced, and to negotiate some sort of temporary “compensation”;
target: Pur le moman Guvernman pe met tu so zefor dan “diplomasi”, pu sey ranvway ubyen diminye lanpler sa rediksyon pri ki Lerop finn fini anonse, ek pu negosye pu enn espes “konpansasyon” tanporer;

input: they are also working on a new speeded up “re-structuring” plan. This will mean more of the deadly job destruction of VRS and mill closure.
target: anmemtan zot pe travay lor enn plan “re-striktirasyon akselere”.

input: Until almost all employment in the sugar industry will be seasonal and casual, with lower wage rates than at present.
target: Sa pu vedir ki pu ena ankor VRS ek fermtir mulen, ziska ki preske tu lanplwa dan lindistri sikriyer pu vinn sezonye ek kazyel, ek lapey mwins ki li ete aster-la.

input: No doubt the Sugar Syndicate (The bosses organization in charge of the sale of sugar in general) will demand a price increase for sugar sold in shops in Mauritius. But this will be difficult because the shop-keepers will be able to import sugar cheaper from the world market and sell it at the same price as it is now.
target: Sirman “Sindika Disik” (lorganizasyon patron ki okip lavant disik an zeneral) ki an sarz lavant disik lor marse lokal pu reklam enn ogmantasyon pri disik dan labutik, me sa li difisilman akseptab etan done ki komersan kapav import disik ki zot aste lor marse mondyal, ek vann li mem pri ki aster-la.

input: The long-term proposal to use molasses to make ethanol for energy production to replace some of the imported petroleum products is also problematic under WTO-type logic. Will Mauritius be able to produce it cheaper than it can be bought from other big producers like Brazil?
target: A long term ena propozisyon pu servi melas pu prodir etanol ki kapav servi kuma enn surs lenerzi pu ranplas an parti petrol importe. me ankor enn fwa, eski etanol ki prodir dan Moris pu pli bomarse ki etanol ki kapav importe depi gran peyi prodikter kuma Brezil?

input: Has the time not come to put into question why we grow cane and make sugar?
target: Eski letan pa finn vini kan nu bizin met an kestyon plantasyon kann ek prodiksyon disik mem?

input: Is it not time to start thinking instead about if we are using our agricultural land and our climate in an optimal way when we persist with this cane and sugar?
target: Eski nu pa bizin kumans reflesi si pe servi later agrikol ek klima ki ena dan enn fason optimal, kan pe persiste ek kann?

input: Is it not time to consider other agricultural and agro-industrial production that creates jobs, for now and for future generations?
target: Eski nu pa bizin konsider lezot aktivite agrikol ek agro-indistriyel ki kapav prodir ase lanplwa, pu aster-la ek pu zenerasyon ki pe vini?

input: There is no doubt that unemployment has already become the most urgent and most basic question in the country: it is not possible to go on looking at the sugar industry without considering diversification and new agro-industries which have potential for job-creation.
target: Pena okenn dut ki se somaz ki finn fini vinn problem irzan ek fondamantal: li pa posib get kriz dan Lindistri Sikriyer san konsider posibilite ki se diversifikasyon agrikol ek devlopman agro-indistri ki pu ofer plis potansyel pu kreasyon sa kantite lanplwa ki neseser zordi.

input: But before looking into agricultural diversification in more detail, let us look at what kind of institutional “backing” it is that has kept everyone believing that sugar is the best thing, when it is only (and maybe that too is not true) good for the “sugar oligarchy” as a class.
target: Me avan nu vinn lor diversifikasyon agrikol, anu zet enn kudey lor manyer ki baking politik ek sipor institisyonel dan Moris finn sutir sa monokiltir kann dan lintere sa oligarsi ki kontrol Lindistri Sikriyer.

input: GOVERNMENTAL BACKING FOR THE SUGAR INDUSTRY IN MAURITIUS.
target: BAKING GUVERNMANTAL PU LINDISTRI SIKRIYER DAN MORIS.

input: For decades the sugar industry has benefited from an array of supports, set up from before Independence and on until the present.
target: Lindistri Sikriyer finn benefisye pandan plizyer deseni ankadreman enn seri institisyon ki finn met dibut avan ek apre Lindepandans.

input: This support is what gives the appearance that sugar and cane are “the best thing” for “Mauritius” to be investing in.
target: Se presizeman sa sutyen-la ki finn tultan donn laparans ki kann ek disik “pli bon” investisman pu Moris.

input: In 1951 under the Commonwealth Sugar Agreement, the sugar industry benefited from a guaranteed market for sugar.
target: An 1951 su Commonwealth Sugar Agreement, Lindistri Sikriyer finn benefisye marse garanti pu disik.

input: This agreement was included into the “Sugar Protocol” under the LOME Convention in 1974 when Britain Jointed the European Economic Community.
target: Sa lakor la finn integre Protokol Disik dan konvansyon LOME an 1974 kan Grand Bretayn finn zwenn Communaute Economique Europeen (CEE).

input: The Mauritian sugar bosses thus remained couched in the “comfort” of a guaranteed market, and were not interested much in agricultural diversification or in food production.
target: Kapital dan Lindistri Sikriyer finn res dan sa konfor enn marse garanti e pa finn interese ar diversifikasyon agrikol ek prodiksyon agro-alimanter.

input: The sugar industry bosses thus continued pocketing their short-term profits year after year. Plus they benefited from all sorts of State aid, mainly through a series of institutions and fiscal concessions.
target: Lindistri Sikriyer finn kontiyn ankes zot profi imedya e kontiyn benefisye led Leta atraver enn seri institisyon ki finn met dibut e osi atraver enn seri konsesyon fiskal ki diferan guvernman finn fer.

input: The “bureaucracies” and political nominees at the head of all these institutions, in turn, for their own “comfort” developed a kind of vested interest in the continuation of the Sugar Oligarchs’ profits.
target: Birokrasi ek nomini politik alatet sa bann diferan institisyon, pu zot prop konfor, finn konplis ar Lindistri Sikriyer pu kontiyn mintenir Moris dan enn leta monokiltir, kontiyn gard disik kuma prinsipal prodwi agrikol.

input: This means that these very bureaucracies and political nominees have always been colluding with the bosses and government in attacking jobs and in threatening the future of the people of the country, as a whole.
target: Zot finn konplis pu atak lanplwa, ek menas lavenir zenerasyon ki pe monte.

input: THE INSTITUTIONS AND CONCESSIONS SET UP BEFORE AND AFTER INDEPENDENCE.
target: DIFERAN INSTITISYON EK FASILITE KI FINN KREE LEPOK KOLONYAL EK APRE LINDEPANDANS.

input: 1919  Mauritius Sugar Syndicate, which got a new status in 1951.
target: 1919 Mauritius Sugar Syndicate, ki gayn nuvo stati an 1951.

input: 1921  La Ferme dam built to irrigate sugar in the West.
target: 1921 Konstriksyon rezervwar La Ferme ki furni dilo pu irigasyon kann dan Lwes

input: 1925  Opening of the College of Agriculture, later to become the University of Mauritius in 1965.
target: 1925 Luvertir Kolez Lagrikiltir ki vinn University of Mauritius an 1965.

input: 1926  La Nicoliere dam built to irrigate sugar in the North.
target: 1926 Konstriksyon rezervwar La Nicoliere ki furni dilo pu irigasyon kann dan Lenor.

input: 1939  Cane Planters’ and Millers’ Arbitration and Control Board (which manages relations between planters and millers).
target: 1939 Cane Planters and Millers Arbitration and Control Board (ki zer relasyon ant Planter ek Izinye).

input: 1946  Cyclone and Drought Insurance Fund for planters.
target: 1946 Cyclone and Drought Insurance Fund, enn lasirans kann ki kuver planter.

input: 1965  University of Mauritius, Faculty of Agriculture and Engineering which at first catered almost exclusively to the sugar industry.
target: 1965 University of Mauritius, Fakilte Lagrikiltir ek Fakilte Enzenyeri ki dan kumansman ti ena kur ki plis oryante pu form kad pu Lindistri Sikriyer.

input: 1980  Mauritius Bulk Sugar Terminal (VRAC) comes into operation.
target: 1980 Mauritius Bulk Sugar Terminal (VRAC) rant an operasyon.

input: 1986  Farmers Service Corporation (nine centres that offer services to planters).
target: 1986/91 Farmers Service Corporation (nef sant operasyonel dan Moris ki ofer servis ti planter kann dan Moris).

input: FISCAL CONCESSIONS THAT HAVE BENEFITED THE SUGAR INDUSTRY DIRECTLY AND INDIRECTLY.
target: KONSESYON FISKAL FINN BENEFISYE DIREKTEMAN EK INDIREKTEMAN LINDISTRI SIKRIYER.

input: 1982  MMM-PSM Government gives tax concession of 57 million rupees on Export Levy.
target: 1980 Guvernman MMM-PSM fer konsesyon 57 milyon rupi Tax Sorti lor disik.

input: 1986  Minister Deerpalsingh’s restructuring, allows parcellization of cane land and 100 million rupee tax concession.
target: 1986 Plan restriktirasyon minis Deerpalsingh, ankuraz morselman later kann ek rediksyon ziska 100 milyon rupi lor tax sorti.

input: 1987  Sugar Industry Efficiency Act, tax concession for diversification. Estates benefited but did not diversify.
target: 1986 Sugar Industry Efficiency Act, konsesyon fiskal pu tablisman diversifye. Tablisman benefisye me san al delavan avek diversifikasyon.

input: 1994  Amendment of the Finance Act 1994, remove the Sugar Levy altogether.
target: 1994 Amandman Finance Act 1994, retir tax sorti konpletman lor disik.

input: 2001  “Illovo deal”- Huge concession to estates on land conversion.
target: 2001 “Illovo deal”- Gro konsesyon a tablisman lor konversyon later agrikol.

input: 2001  Sugar Sector Strategic Plan, MMM/MSM/PMSD/FTS plan for mill closures and massive job destruction in sugar industry.
target: 2001 Sugar Sector Strategic Plan, plan guvernman MMM/MSM/PMSD/FTS pu fermtir mulin ek rediksyon masif lanplwa dan lindistri sikriyer.

input: It was this institutional support, arbitrarily handed out by Governments and regimes, one after the other, to pump up sugar profits, that has been a brake on the kind of agricultural diversification that would have averted the present crisis.
target: Dan enn larz mezir sa sutyen institisyonel ek arbitrer ki Leta ek bann rezim politik finn donn Lindistri Sikriyer finn responsab pu labsans enn politik diversifikasyon agrikol ki zordi ti pu evit kriz ekonomik ek sosyal ki divan nu.

input: HISTORY OF THE DEBATE ON AGRICULTURAL DIVERSIFICATION.
target: DEBA LOR DIVERSIFIKASYON AGRIKOL DAN LISTWAR.

input: In the history os Mauritius, there have been numerous attempts to put the question of agricultural diversification on the agenda.
target: Dan listwar Moris, finn ena plizyer tantativ pu met diversifikasyon agrikol lor azanda.

input: During the 2nd World War, the Colonial Government took a number of measures to assure food crops, so as to assure food security, since shipping was interrupted.
target: Kan ti ena 2yem Ger Mondyal, Leta kolonyal ti pran enn seri mezir pu ki plant manze pu asir sekirite alimanter, akoz bato aprovizyonnman pa ti pe kapav vinn Moris akoz lager.

input: In 1944 the Colonial State had a Land Resettlement Scheme (a kind of land reform plan) to allow small planters access to land for food crops.
target: An 1944 Leta kolonyal ti mem ena enn Land Resettlement Scheme (enn plan pu reform later) pu permet ti-planter gayn akse a later ek diversifye lagrikiltir.

input: But the capitalists who controlled most of the land and who were attached to sugar production did not agree and forced the State to abandon this plan very quickly.
target: Me akoz klas kapitalis ki kontrol gran mazorite later kiltivab ek ki amare avek prodiksyon disik ti telman for, Leta kolonyal finn byin vit abandonn so plan.

input: THE MEADE REPORT: AN ENLIGHTENED REPORT IN FAVOUR OF AGRICULTURAL DIVERSIFICATION.
target: RAPOR MEADE: ENN RAPOR EKLERE AN-FAVER DIVERSIFIKASYON AGRIKOL.

input: Before Independence, the State appointed Prof. Meade to study the economic and social structure of Mauritius.
target: Avan lindepandans, Leta ti nom Profeser Meade pu fer enn letid lor striktir ekonomik ek sosyal Moris.

input: His report, published in 1961, outlined the danger of a mono-crop economy based on cane and sugar.
target: So rapor, pibliye an 1961, explik danze enn lekonomi baze lor monokiltir kann ek prodiksyon disik.

input: He explained how this kind of economy would not be viable in the long term. He said that if ever the sugar quotas were called into question, this would have a very serious effect on the whole country’s economy.
target: Dan so rapor, li explike kimanyer sa kalite lekonomi-la pa viab a lon term.

input: He referred to existing studies that showed that the land and climate in Mauritius suggested many other forms of agriculture than cane and sugar.
target: Li finn dir ki si zame kota disik diminye uswa menase, sa pu ena enn lefe nefast lor lekonomi.

input: He proposed that the State should discourage and limit sugar production and encourage diversification.
target: Li finn dir ki ena letid ki deza pe montre ki avek later ek klima ki ena Moris, kapav plant enn seri lezot zafer apart kann. Alor li finn prekoniz enn seri mezir pu Leta kapav dekuraz e limit prodiksyon disik, ek ankuraz diversifikasyon agrikol.

input: Among the measures he proposed was the Export Levy on sugar.
target: Parmi bann mezir ki li finn propoze, ena propozisyon ki met enn tax spesyal lor prodiksyon ek exportasyon disik (sa-mem ki vinn “Tax Sorti” lor disik).

input: To encourage diversification he proposed institutions like what would later become the Marketing Board.
target: Li finn osi propoz ki an-mem-tan, ankuraz diversifikasyon agrikol atraver enn seri mezir kuma met dibut institisyon ki aste legim lor enn pri minimom garanti. Sa-mem ki ti sipoze rol Marketing Bord.
KIFER PA FINN ENA DIVERSIFIKASYON AGRIKOL A-LEPOK?

input: The historical bourgeoisie, which owns and controls most of the land and especially most of the prime agricultural land did not agree to diversify.
target: Burzwazi istorik, ki posed ek kontrol mazorite later ek pli bon later agrikol dan Moris, pa ti dakor avek diversifikasyon.

input: They were too attached to their sugar.
target: Li ti atase avek prodiksyon disik.

input: But they were not the only ones with a vested interest.
target: Me pa zis li tusel ki ti ena lintere dan prodiksyon disik.

input: Towards the end of the 19th Century, there was a change when the estates got together to form companies and began the process of modernization and centralization.
target: Lafin 19yem syek, ti pe ena sanzman dan lindistri sikriyer. Propriyeter tablisman ti kumans regrupe dan konpayni prive ek ti kumans moderniz ek santraliz izinaz.

input: This increased their output so fast that they became “hungry” for cane. This means the estates had a vested interest in small planters supplying cane to keep their mills running.
target: sa finn ogmant kapasite pu kraz kann ek transform so zi an disik telman pli vit ki tablisman ti ena lintere pu ki planter plant kann ek anvoy li dan so mulin.

input: The increase in the number of small planters also meant that the estates gained a “reserve army” for the cane cutting season.
target: Ogmantasyon nomb planter ti osi vedir ki tablisman gayn enn “rezerv mindev” dan lepok lakup.

input: At the end of the 19th Century there thus came the time of “parcellization” when estate sold marginal land to planters who would provide them with cane, in return.
target: Alor, lafin 19yem syek, ti ena seki ti apel a lepok “morselman” kot tablisman ti vann inpe later marzinal ar planter, pu furni kann bomarse pu izinaz.

input: The production of vegetables would thus fall considerably.
target: Plantasyon legim par planter finn diminye buku ant 1881 ek 1901.

input: From 1900 the number of planters continued to grow.
target: Nomb planter finn kontiyn ogmante depi lane 1900.

input: Planters thus developed a vested interest in the sugar industry.
target: Planter finn plito plant kann ek anvoy li kraze dan mulin tablisman.

input: The working class had its interest elsewhere. Agricultural diversification was in its interests.
target: Klas travayer, li, ti ena lintere pu ki diversifye lagrikiltir ek moderniz li.

input: This would keep employment stable, and bring food security. This would have created the basis, in turn, for the development of a modern economy.
target: Parski li enn form devlopman ki amenn lanplwa stab, ki amenn sekirite alimanter, ki enn form devlopman dirab lor lekel kapav batir enn lekonomi modern.

input: The workers in the years 1930-40 were organized in unions, and also politically in the Labour Party and the Bissoondoyalist movement.
target: Klas travayer dan bann lane 1930-40 ti pe organize dan sindika, ek osi politikman, dan Parti Travayis ek muvman Bissoondoyal.

input: But the colonial State used repression systematically against workers.
target: Selman Leta kolonyal ti servi represyon sistematikman kont lorganizasyon travayer.

input: On the other hand, the associations of small planters became stronger and developed a political voice through the Advance Group, a team led by SS Ramgoolam, who stood against the Labour Party in the 1948 elections, and would later actually “take over” the Labour Party.
target: Lot kote, bann asosyasyon ti-planter ti pe devlope ek ti pe truv zot lavwa politik dan Grup Advance, enn grup politik ki ti poze kont Parti Travayis dan eleksyon 1948, ek ki plitar pran lidersip Parti Travayis. SSRamgoolam ti ladan.

input: Advance represented the voice of a petty-bourgeoisie in trade, planting and in the professions, whose rise was blocked by the alliance between the sugar oligarchs and the colonial State.
target: Grup Advance ti reprezant lavwa ti-burzwazi dan komers, ti regrup planter ek “intelektyel” ki ti truv zot sime bloke par lalyans ant burzwazi istorik ek Leta Kolonyal.

input: This group also wanted to accumulate capital.
target: Zot bi se pu kapav akimil plis kapital zot osi.

input: As, from about 1950 the Labour Party in fact represented the planters who were partly in conflict with the Estates but who also had an interest in the continued production of sugar.
target: Alor Parti Travayis apartir 1950, ti reprezant an-parti lavwa planter ki an-konfli avek tablisman, me ki ena enn lintere dan prodiksyon disik.

input: All this helps explain who even after Labour was in power, even after Independence, there was no political will to reform land nor to diversify agriculture.
target: Sa enn bann rezon ki explik kifer apre lindepandans, mem kan Parti Travayis vinn o-puvwar, li pa ti ena volonte politik pu amenn reform propriete later ek diversifye lagrikiltir.

input: A section of Labour’s base was dependant on sugar production, which was dependent on the Estates.
target: Enn parti so labaz ti depann lor prodiksyon disik-mem, ek ti depandan lor tablisman.

input: DEBATE ON AGRICULTURAL DIVERSIFICATION AFTER INDEPENDENCE.
target: DEBA LOR DIVERSIFIKASYON AGRIKOL APRE LINDEPANDANS.

input: After Independence, the working class re-organized: the MMM, between 1969 and 1982, became its political voice.
target: Apre lindepandans, klas travayer finn re-organize: MMM, ant 1969 ek 1982, finn vinn so lavwa politik.

input: The first political programs of the MMM put a lot of emphasis on the need for land reform, on nationalization of the estates and on the need for diversification (Pour une Ile Maurice possible 1970, Socialisme et Developpement 1971).
target: Bann premye program politik MMM ti met buku lanfaz lor nesesite enn reform agrer, lor nesesite pu nasyonaliz tablisman ek intansifye diversifikasyon agrikol (Pour une Ile Maurice possible 1970, Socialisme et Developpement 1971).

input: The MMM’s governmental program for the 1976 General Elections still put emphasis on job creation through diversification and industry, and on the development of marine resources and the need to nationalize 5 estates and 20,000 arpents of land for the purposes of this diversification.
target: So program guvernmantal ki li ti tire pu Eleksyon Zeneral 1976 ti ankor met lanfaz lor kreasyon lanplwa dan diversifikasyon agrikol, avek indistrializasyon, devlopman rezurs marinn, ek nesesite pu nasyonaliz 5 tablisman ek 20,000 arpan later lezot tablisman pu ki kapav amenn sa diversifikasyon-la.

input: Early in 1979, a group in the MMM called LEL GOS (Madan Dulloo, Jack Bizlall, Habib Mosaheb, Rama Poonoosamy, Rajiv Servansing, the late Siven Chinien) brought out a program for self-reliance.
target: Kumansman 1979, enn grup andan MMM apel “Lel Gos” (dan lekel ti ena Madan Dulloo, Jack Bizlall, Habib Mosaheb, Rama Poonoosamy, Rajiv Servansing, (fe) Siven Chinien) sorti piblikman avek enn program pu “oto-sifizans” (self-reliance).

input: They said it was an economic strategy based on local resources.
target: Zot ti dir ki sa li enn stratezi ekonomik baze lor enn model devlopman santre an-priyorite lor rezurs lokal.

input: They did not intend reducing sugar production, but thought it needed to be limited.
target: Zot pa ti pe viz rediksyon prodiksyon disik, me zot ti panse ki bizin limit li.

input: They sought an alliance for the working class with a section of the capitalist class (against the imperialists) for their plan for a “national reconstruction” project.
target: Zot ti dir ki sertin kapitalis kapav kadre dan sa proze “rekonstriksyon nasyonal”, ek ti prekoniz enn lalyans ant klas travayer ek kapitalis lokal kont inperyalis.

input: Mauritius was to produce food for its own needs, and at the very most develop a common market for the Mascarene zone.
target: Zot lide sete ki Moris prodwir tu seki li bizin an-term agrikol ek forse-forse, devlop komers dan enn nuvo “Marse Komin Maskareyn” ek dan enn regrupman pei Lafrik de Lest ki zot dir bizin met dibut.

input: Their project was not convincing because it persisted in seeing agricultural diversification only in terms of national production, separate from the rest of the world.
target: Kalite stratezi ekonomik ki Lel Gos ti pe propoze pa ti konvinkan parski zot ti truv diversifikasyon agrikol dan kad enn lekonomi ki izole depi leres lemond, ki andeor komers internasyonal, ek kot Moris so lekonomi ti pu plizumwin ferme lor li-mem.

input: This kind of “isolationism” was not on, and at the time Lalit criticized their plans, as nationalist in the extreme.
target: Li ti evidan ki sa kalite stratezi ekonomik-la pa ti ena lavenir.

input: Mr. Michel de Speville, director of Food & Allied, pleaded publicly for diversification in order to assure food security, to assure foreign exchange, and to decrease imports, keep inflation down and get more value-added.
target: M. Michel de Speville, direkter konpayni Food & Allied, par ekzanp, ti piblikman fer pledwari pu ki ena diversifikasyon lor baz ki li amenn plis sekirite alimanter, li permet pei ekonomiz deviz akoz diminye inportasyon, li gard inflasyon ba, gayn valer azute plis.

input: He also warned of the possible end to the Sugar Protocol under the Lome Convention, and said that war could also isolate Mauritius and leave us without our food imports.
target: Li ti osi averti ki li posib ki Protokol Disik dan Konvansyon Lome (ki ti pe garanti kota ek pri disik) kapav disparet enn zur, ek si zame ena lager, Moris pa ti pu kapav import manze.

input: He called on the State to encourage food production, agricultural diversification through subsidies, marketing, and to tax imports.
target: Li ti dir ki Leta bizin ankuraz prodiksyon manze, diversifye lagrikiltir par donn sibsid, fer marketing, permet ki kapitalis Moris kapav vann manze-la pli bomarse ki seki inporte.

input: He estimated that 13,500 arpents of land would suffice for self-reliance in food.
target: Li ti dir ki bizin zis 13,500 arpan later (dapre li) pu ki ariv a “oto-sifizans”.

input: The MMM leadership quickly picked up on the class collaboration involved in the Lel Gos line, and announced that there were indeed “Patron du progres”.
target: Lidership MMM byin vit finn repran laliyn sa seksyon kapitalis (ki li ti apel “Patron du progres”) ek finn repran lide Lel Gos.

input: The MMM made “self-reliance” its reason for land reform.
target: MMM finn fer “otosifizans” vinn rezon kifer bizin reform agrer ek diversifikasyon agrikol;

input: In Lalit we have a different philosophy. We believe it is necessary to develop diversified agriculture and agro-industry not just for “self reliance” but as part of an export strategy as well.
target: anfet, dapre nu dan Lalit, li neseser pu devlop agro-indistri modern ek ena reform later pu ki moderniz lekonomi ek prodwir pa zis pu marse lokal, me pu exportasyon osi.

input: At the time, in Lalit de Klas we criticized the concept of “self-reliance” as one that was back-ward looking.
target: Se lor sa baz-la ki nu, dan Lalit de Klas a-lepok, ti opoz konsept “otosifizans”.

input: In historical terms what happened was that, because the “self-reliance” project was not viable, and it took centre-stage in debates, the debates on agricultural diversification came a cropper.
target: E akoz proze “otosifizans” pa ti viab, deba lor nesesite diversifikasyon agrikol finn tom plot.

input: Soon the MMM abandoned the concept of self-reliance and by the time they came to power in 1982 they were already the best defenders of the sugar oligarchy that the oligarchs had ever had.
target: Byin vit, lidersip MMM abandonn konsept “otosifizans” ek kan li vinn o-puvwar an 1982, byen vit vinn gran defanser burzwazi istorik ki atase ar prodiksyon disik.

input: Lalit has always worked for land reform, for agricultural diversification and for the development of a modern agro-industry.
target: Lalit finn tuzur met nesesite pu reform later, diversifikasyon agrikol ek devlopman agro-indistri modern, lor azanda.

input: Since 1982, Lalit is really the only political force to have systematically warned against the kind of economic strategy based on sugar, free zone and tourism.
target: Depi 1982, Lalit finn sel lafors politik ki finn sistematikman met an-gard kont enn stratezi ekonomik baze lor disik, Zonn Frans ek Turism.

input: Today we are being proven right.
target: Zordi, listwar pe donn nu rezon.
LAGRIKILTIR E LELVAZ SYANTIFIK E LINDISTRI TRANSFORMASYON E PREZERVASYON.

input: In Mauritius, work in the agricultural sector has always been associated with hard and heavy labour due to the semi-feudal working conditions, which characterize labourers work on the sugar estates.
target: Dan Moris travay agrikol finn tultan asosye ar travay lur e dir, akoz move kondisyon lanplwa semi-feodal ki finn karakteriz travay laburer lor tablisman.

input: In fact, the economic policy applied by different governments has perpetuated this situation.
target: Anfet politik ekonomik ki diferan guvernman finn aplike depi lindepandans finn perpetye sa sityasyon-la.

input: Working conditions in the agricultural sector stayed archaic compared to other sectors.
target: Kondisyon travay dan sekter agrikol finn res an retar par rapor a buku lezot sekter.

input: It is not surprising to find much more work accidents in this sector.
target: Li pa etonan ki dan samem sekter ki ena pli buku aksidan travay.

input: This has greatly contributed to discouraging people from working in agriculture.
target: Sa finn kontribye an gran parti pu dekuraz dimunn fer travay later e lelvaz.

input: Alternative agriculture does not only mean a “return to the soil” in a romantic fashion as was promoted by people like Rousseau in Europe long ago.
target: Enn lagrikiltir alternatif li pa vedir sinpleman enn revalorizasyon travay agrikol, kuma enn “retur a later” dan enn fason romantik kuma Rousseau e so bann adep ti promuvwar byin lontan dan Lerop.

input: In our modern times it will be agriculture based on scientific methods of cultivation and breeding, built on existing traditional knowledge, and for the amelioration of working conditions and production.
target: Dan lepok modern li pu vedir enn form lagrikiltir ki repoz lor bann metod plantasyon e lelvaz ki itiliz progre lasyans kuma sipor pu amelyor kondisyon travay e prodiksyon.

input: It will also mean the integration of the preserving of agricultural products into the sector.
target: Sirtu li pu bizin integre ar lindistri transformasyon e prezervasyon bann prodwi agrikol.

input: Nowadays satellite photos are being used in some European countries for an assessment of the better use that land can be put to.
target: Zordi dan sertin pei Lerop pe servi foto depi satelit pu konn plis lor kalite later ki pli bon pu plante pu amelyor rannman.

input: This technology is even used on tractors.
target: Ena mem trakter ki itiliz sa kalite teknolozi-la pu alez e fasilit travay agrikilter.

input: But technology and science does not necessarily mean better working conditions: it depends on who has the economic power and on, what social class has control over the economy.
target: Me nuvo teknolozi e lasyans pa neseserman vedir meyer kondisyon dan travay: sa depann buku lor kisannla detenir puvwar politik e ki klas ena kontrol lor lekonomi.

input: Therefore all new forms of agriculture must include the question of how to bring more democracy to the workplace, how to establish democratic control and free circulation of knowledge on agriculture, how scientific progress can bring about the welfare of every human being and the protection of the environment from pollution.
target: Alor tu nuvo form lagrikiltir bizin inklir kestyon kimanyer amenn plis demokrasi dan travay, kimanyer ena kontrol demokratik e lib sirkilasyon konesans lor lagrikiltir, e osi kimanyer progre syantifik kapav vinn o-servis byinet tu imin e pu enn lanvironnman kot pena polisyon.

input: In Mauritius some people already have a profound knowledge about farming, including cow-keeping, other animal rearing and planting all sorts of food crops.
target: Dan Moris ena deza buku dimunn ki kone lor plantasyon ek lelvaz.

input: But the government has consistently attacked small scale agricultural production, especially compared with sugar production.
target: Me guvernman pe tultan atak ti prodiksyon ki li par ti-planter, ti-elver pork ubyen ti-elver pul.

input: To give just a few examples. In Montagne Ory, for example, chicken rearing by people in the locality has decreased because sanitary inspectors have forbidden shops to stock chicken feed.
target: Dan Montayn Ori, par exanp, dimunn pe aret nuri pul parski labutik koperativ nepli gayn drwa vann manze pul.

input: This reminds us of how dholl puri sellers were driven away from Port-Louis by the authorities at the exact time when MacDonalds was opening its fast food there.
target: Nu rapel kimanyer bann lotorite ti pe farus ti marsan dal puri dan Port Louis zis kan MacDonald ti pe instal li dan sa landrwa-la.

input: There is a political will on the part of the government to destroy all that is traditional, and they tend to turn to the new WTO-style phyto-sanitary controls as their main pretext.
target: Ena enn volonte politik dan guvernman pu detrir tu seki tradisyonel atraver bann sistem kuma kontrol fito-saniter.

input: They want to destroy all sectors that they qualify as “inefficient”.
target: Zot ule fini ar tu sekter ki swadizan pa efisyan.

input: Instead of developing the will to modernize and rationalize this traditional form of agriculture, the MMM-MSM governments economic policy relies on slogans like “bio-technology”, which, in the way they intend to use it, will in fact bring about the destruction of this sector.
target: Olye devlop volonte pu moderniz e rasyonaliz sa lagrikiltir tradisyonel-la, politik ekonomik guvernman MSM-MMM viz plito pu servi bann slogan kuma bio-teknolozi pu anfet amenn lafin sa sekter-la.

input: Pravind Jugnauth’s positions on traditional methods of cultivation, when the law on Genetically Modified Organisms (GMOs) was being passed in Parliament clearly demonstrates this.
target: Pozisyon ki Pravind Jugnauth ti pran kont metod tradisyonel dan plantasyon kan pe vot lalwa lor Organism Zenetikman Modifye (OGM) finn devwal sa politik-la byin.

input: They want to “eliminate” small planters, for example, and thus risk losing all the already-acquired knowledge possessed by them and passed from generation to generation, sustaining humans on the planet.
target: Zot ule detrir tu sa konesans ki buku planter ena lor kimanyer gard lagrin par exanp.

input: Their political will, as far as we can decode it, is to destroy the knowledge on the preservation of seeds, and the transmission of seeds “free”, so as to replace this system by the system of seeds produced by Monsanto and sold in cans.
target: Volonte politik ki zot ena se pu detrir sa konesans dan prezerv bon lagrin pu semans, ek ranplas li par seki prodir par Monsanto.

input: In fact Monsanto seeds have the feature very often of being “terminator”.
target: Anfet Monsanto so lagrin byen suvan li enn kalite ki apel “terminator”, e li riske eliminn tu lagrin ki planter finn servi depi plizir banane.

input: This in turn endangers (through cross-pollination) seeds that small planters have been using for years.
target: Li vre ki lagrikiltir e lelvaz modern li forseman pu bizin fer lor enn gran lesel e pu nesesit gro investisman.

input: It is true that some forms of cultivation and cattle rearing can be done on a large scale and that big investments are needed, even if small scale farming is to develop.
target: Me sa pa vedir ki bizin eradik konesans e tradisyon ki finn devlope dan sa domenn-la.

input: But it does not mean that the knowledge and tradition that has been developed in this sector must be “eradicated”, as the Government intends to do.
target: Li pa kestyon fez-awt lagrikiltir e lelvaz tradisyonel.

input: Traditional cultivation and cattle rearing must not be eliminated.
target: Bizin batir lor konesans ek lexperyans ki deza ena.

input: We must use already acquired knowledge and experience.
target: Veritab drayv guvernman MMM-MSM se pu prodir dapre filozofi WTO e non pa dapre progre syantifik.

input: The MMM-MSM governments true consideration is to produce as per the WTO philosophy, not with and for scientific progress.
target: Pu zot se plito bann konsiderasyon komersyal ki prime, setadir prodiktivite, efisyans e profi.

input: Only commercial considerations, that is a narrow definition of productivity and efficiency, and short-term profit are their only motivation.
target: Enn lagrikiltir ki lye ar transformasyon e prezervasyon li pa tutafe nuvo dan Moris.

input: The link between agriculture and transformation of agricultural produce is not new in Mauritius.
target: Li deza inplante isi, mem si li lor enn ti-lesel.

input: It already exists here, even though it is on a small scale.
target: Dan Moris nu ena lavantaz ki deza ena enn long tradisyon konesans lor transformasyon e prezervasyon manze.

input: One advantage that we have in Mauritius is that we already have a long tradition of knowledge in the preservation and transformation of food. People know how to make jam, pickles, chutneys, and conserves from a diverse range of fruits and vegetables.
target: Dimunn konn fer konfitir, zasar, kutya, konfi ar enn varyete fri e legim.

input: It is based upon this know-how that certain family enterprises have started to commercialize jam, jelly, fruit juice, crystallized fruits, pickles, chutneys, sometimes on a semi-industrial scale: either in cans, in bottles or plastic bags.
target: Se lor baz sa kalite konesans-la ki sertin lantrepriz familyal finn met dibut bann komers konfitir, lazle, zi fri, fri kristalize, zasar, parfwa lor enn baz semi-indistriyel: swa dan bwat, dan po, ubyin sase plastik.

input: These technologies are already mastered, and are very successful.
As for cattle rearing, the situation is similar.
Nowadays there are factories, which produce pasteurized milk, yogurt or ghee.
target: Ena zordi lizinn ki konn prodir dile pasterize, yaurt, manteg.

input: There is also a great diversity of products from chicken, pork, fish and shrimps that are sold in plastic bags.
target: Ena osi enn gran varyete prodwi apartir pul, pork, pwason, kamaron ki vande dan sase.

input: Some of those products are exported.
target: Ena sertin sa bann prodwi-la ki pe mem exporte ver lezot pei.

input: These kinds of local produce are the possible basis for a transformation and preservation industry for local, regional, and international demand.
target: Tusala reprezant enn baz ki kapav servi pu devlopman enn lindistri transformasyon e prezervasyon pu marse lokal, rezyonal, pu kontinan Lafrik, e ayer.

input: The economical crises that we are witnessing today are certainly creating a new kind of initiative amongst the people to think deeply and collectively about a new form of agriculture and new forms of agro-industry.
target: Zordi kriz ki pe afekte bann pilye lekonomi pe kree kondisyon pu enn refleksyon lor devlopman lezot form lindistri.

input: Facilities should be provided to those who are interested in developing this sector on an industrial and scientific level.
target: Bizin donn fasilite dimunn ki interese devlop sa kalite sekter-la lor enn baz indistriyel e syantifik.

input: For example tax should be removed on all machinery used in this sector.
target: Kapav par exanp anlev tax lor tu masinnri ki servi dan sa kalite lizinn-la.

input: Non-polluting form of energy, which will also decrease our dependence upon petroleum products, should be encouraged to be used in these small industries.
target: Bizin ankuraz sa lindistri-la pu itiliz bann form lenerzi non polyan ki pu diminye nu depandans lor prodwi petrolye.

input: Research institutes must be encouraged to direct their work towards the amelioration of this industry’s products.
target: Bann linstitisyon ki fer resers bizin gayn lankurazman pu oryant zot travay pu amelyor bann prodwi dan sa sekter-la.

input: Exchanges between the University of Mauritius, planters and breeders must be made so as to develop not only traditional but more rational methods.
target: Bizin lesanz konesans ant Liniversite Moris ek planter e elver pu devlop bann metod pli rasyonel, ek pa zis tradisyonel.

input: Facilities should be given to people to learn from other countries like China, Cuba and other countries advanced in this sector.
target: Guvernman ti bizin donn fasilite pu dimunn al aprann dan Lasinn, Kiba e lezot pei ki byin avanse dan sa domenn-la.

input: Necessary facilities should be given to modernize agriculture in Rodrigues.
target: Guvernman bizin donn fasilite neseser pu moderniz lagrikiltir e lelvaz dan Rodrig.

input: In sum, we need an economic policy, which will encourage the development of scientific agriculture based on what is already used in Mauritius, which will produce not only for the local market but also for exportation.
target: Donk bizin enn politik ekonomik ki ankuraz devlopman enn lagrikiltir syantifik baze lor konesans ki deza ena Moris, ki pu prodir pu marse lokal e pu exportasyon.

input: The government must invest in this kind of industry instead of spending large sums of money for the benefit of the textile, tourist and sugar sectors capitalists.
target: Guvernman bizin investi dan sa kalite lindistri-la olye kontiyn depans par milyon rupi zis pu profi patrona textil, lotelri e tablisman.

input: The government slogans about “bio-technology” are not solutions, neither are new techniques like GMO, which aims only at guaranteeing the profit of multinationals which has control on this technology.
target: Li pa ditu enn solisyon pu lans bann slogan kuma Guvernman pe fer lor “bio-teknolozi”, ek li pa ditu enn solisyon pu vinn propoz itilizasyon nuvo teknolozi kuma OGM ki viz prinsipalman pu asir profi bann miltinasyonal ki kontrol sa teknolozi la.

input: In the 90’s the multinationals financed laboratories to invent methods of genetically modifying living organisms.
target: Dan bann lane 90, bann laboratwar finanse par miltinasyonal finn dekuver fason pu modifye organism vivan zenetikman.

input: They called it GMO (Genetically Modified Organisms).
target: Zot finn apel sa OGM (Genetically Modified Organism).

input: Some traditional and conventional methods have been used over the ages, so as to increase production of plants; but when genetic transfers are being used in food production, it can be very dangerous.
target: Finn servi serten metod tradisyonel ek konvansyonel pu amelyor plant depi buku lane; me seki grav se kan fer transfer zenetik dan sekter alimantasyon.

input: They have used this new invention to put patents on living things, and this has been done with the help of the WTO (World Trade Organization).
target: Zot finn servi sa nuvo dekuvert la pu met patant lor bann kitsoz ki vivan avek led OMC (Organizasyon Mondyal Komers).

input: With this new form of agriculture, nature and people’s health on our planet earth are in great danger.
target: Apartir de sa form lagrikiltir, lanatir ek lasante dimunn lor bul later, li an gran danze.

input: The first introduction of GMO in Mauritius has been done by the MSIRI in May 1999 with the presentation of a new transgenic sugar cane, but there was no legal framework in those days.
target: Premye introdiksyon OGM dan Moris li ti fer par MSIRI an Me 1999 avek prezantasyon enn kann transzenik, ek a lepok pa ti ena kad legal pu kontrol resers.

input: Following this research, Maurice Le Court De Billot, a Monsanto laboratory representative visited Mauritius and declared that the “Mauritius Sugar Industry Research Institute is well ahead concerning the utilization of GMO in the sugar cane sector and that they were interested” (From an interview in L’Express newspaper 22 October 2000).
target: Swit a sa resers la, Maurice Le Court de Billot, reprezantan laboratwar Monsanto fer enn vizit Moris, ek deklare ki “ ‘Mauritius Sugar Industry Research Institute’ est en avance sur les OGM en ce qui concerne la canne a sucre. Cela nous interesse” (dapre enn interview lagazet L’Express 22 Oktob 2000).

input: Multinationals like Monsanto, Novartis, Aventis are striving so as to get the monopoly on seeds through control over distribution, thus they will have control over our food supply.
target: Miltinasyonal kuma Monsanto, Novartis, Aventis pe fer tu pu ena monopol lor lagrin atraver kontrol lor so distribisyon. Kumsa zot pu kapav anfet ariv gayn kontrol nu alimantasyon.

input: The Mauritian Government helped them by passing a law, the “Genetically Modified Organisms Act” in March 2004; this gave legal support for the utilization, marketing and application of GMOs in the alimentary and agricultural sectors.
target: Guvernman Moris finn ed zot par pas enn lalwa “Genetically Modified Organism Act” an Mars 2004, ki donn enn kad legal ki permet itilizasyon, marketing ek aplikasyon OGM dan sekter alimanter ek agrikol.

input: We must stress that this law is in conflict with the United Nations convention on biodiversity called ‘FAO Concept of Farmers’ Rights’, which points to the necessity of the “Precautionary Principle”, which allows the concerned parties to refuse to produce and commercialize GMOs as long as it has not been proven to be harmless to health.
target: Nu bizin fer resortir ki sa lalwa la li an konfli avek Konvansyon Nasyon Zini lor biodiversite, ki apel ‘FAO Concept of Farmers’ Rights’, ki dir ki bizin ena enn “Precautionary Principle” ki permet bann linstans konserne pu refiz prodiksyon OGM ek so komersyalizasyon tan ki pa finn gayn prev ki li inofansif pu lasante.

input: An organism is genetically modified when genetic materials from other or from the same species are added to it.
target: U modifye enn organism zenetikman kan u azut materyel zenetik ki sorti depi enn lot espes u enn mem espes.

input: Through this process, the organism will produce new proteins, which will give them new functions.
target: Par sa prosesis la, organism la prodir nuvo proteinn ki donn li nuvo fonksyon.

input: Those who promote GMOs are saying that its quality and quantity will increase, that it will be more resistant to bacteria, parasites, and climatic conditions.
target: Dimunn ki promuvwar itilizasyon OGM dir ki li donn enn meyer randman an term kalite ek kantite, li vinn pli rezistan kont bakteri, parazit, ek kondisyon klimatik.

input: They also say that GMO will wipe out hunger from the earth.
target: Zot osi dir ki OGM li kapav anpes lafaminn dan lemond.

input: What they are keeping secret, is that:
target: Me seki zot pa dir, se ki:

input: * No GMO commercialization concerns increase in food production.
target: * Okenn komersyalizasyon OGM, li napa konsern randman manze.

input: It is always in the interest of the multinational’s profit.
target: Li tuzur dan lintere profi miltinasyonal.

input: With 99% of the seeds produced, the firm produces herbicides and insecticides, which can be used only with their seeds.
target: Avek 99% dan bann lagrin OGM ki zot prodwir zot usi prodwir so insektisid ek so erbisid ki al zis ar sa kalite lagrin la.

input: This means they will also sell more of their different kinds of poison.
target: Savedir ki zot pu osi vann plis sa bann pwazon-la osi.

input: Thus they will control each stage in the food production chain.
target: E donk zot pu kontrol tu letap dan prodiksyon manze ki nu pu fer.

input: They will only produce GMOs that will be resistant to their herbicides.
target: OGM ki zot prodir se inikman seki rezistan a zot erbisid.

input: This also means that it will encourage people to use more herbicides and pesticides, and thus we will consume more herbicides and pesticides.
target: Sa vedir li ankuraz planter servi plis erbisid ek pestisid e alor nu pu konsom plis erbisid ek pestisid dan nuritir.

input: * Most of the GMO seeds can be used only once, implying that for us to get seeds for the next season, we won’t be able or we won’t have the right to use seeds from the fruits of our previous harvest.
target: * Laplipar lagrin kinn modifye zenetikman kapav servi zis enn sel kut, sa vedir ki pu nu gayn lagrin pu prosen sezon, nu pa pu kapav uswa, nu pa pu gayn drwa servi lagrin apartir de bann fri nu rekolt presedan.

input: So we will be forced to go back to Novartis each time we sow, and they will probably have the monopoly on this species and the price will thus depends only on them.
target: Donk nu pu oblize re-al kot misye Novartis pu aste lagrin sak fwa ki nu fer semans, ek pri la pu depann zis lor li, ek suvan li ena monopol.

input: They name this “Intellectual Property Rights” or “Trade-Related Intellectual Property Rights” (TRIPS).
target: Zot apel sa “Intellectual Property Rights” unyrn “Trade-Related Intellectual Property Rights” (TRIPS).

input: * Research has shown that with the wind and pollinating insects, transgenic plants contaminate other plants nearby.
target: * Resers finn demontre ki avek labriz ek insekt polinater, bann plant transzenik finn kontaminn lezot plant natirel ki dan zot lanturaz.

input: This can risk endangering the ecological balance by killing species of insects and plants.
target: Sa debalans ekosystem par tuy sertin insek ek plant sovaz.

input: It is not only a danger to our ecology but also to cultivation as well, where GMOs are not used.
target: li enn gran menas pu lekilib ekolozik ek pu lagrikiltir ki pa servi OGM.

input: * No research has been done on the effect of GMOs on human health in the long term.
target: * Zot pa finn fer okenn resers lor enn long peryod letan lor lefe ki OGM kapav ena lor dimunn.

input: A scientist who studied the effects that genetically modified potatoes had on rats, observed that the consummation of GMOs during 3 weeks has shrunk the brain, increased the volume of the pancreas and affected the immune system of these animals.
target: Kan enn syantist dan Langleter finn etidye linpak pomdeter zenetikman modifye lor lasante, li finn fer lexperyans ar lera ek finn obzerve ki konsomasyon OGM pandan 3 semenn finn retresi servo, duble groser pankreas ek afekte system iminiter sa bann zanimo la (See endnote).

input: This process cannot be reversed because these plants will keep these genetic manipulations forever.
target: Sa prosesis la li ireversib parski bann plant la pu gard sa manipilasyon zenetik la pu tultan.

input: All this goes to show that GMO utilization might in fact end up increasing hunger in the world because of the risks to nature and to people’s health.
target: Tusala demontre ki avek itilizasyon OGM, risk lafaminn pu anplifye. Sa li akoz li antrenn destriksyon lanatir, ek li usi riske amenn danze direk ki OGM ena lor lasante tu dimunn.

input: Even if the catastrophe scenarios do not occur we will live under the slavery of these multinationals, which will control our food supply.
target: Mem san bann tel katastrof, nu pu viv dan enn depandans lor sa bann miltinasyonal ki pu kontrol nu alimantasyon.

input: In the feudal period the lords controlled the peasants by proclaiming themselves as the owners of the land, nowadays their descendants are proclaiming themselves to be the owners of plant seeds, and as if this was not enough they are setting about destroying our planet earth.
target: Dan lepok feodal bann senyer ti pe kontrol peizan parski zot ti dekret zot mem proprieter later, zordi zur zot desandan finn donn inpe later, me zot dekret zot mem proprieter lagrin semans, ek an plis zot pe detrir nu bul later.

input: But today there is an international movement fighting this theft of the multinationals over agriculture:  a movement regrouping peasants, planters, cattle breeders, progressive unions, left political parties, ecologists, women and youth organizations.
target: Me deza ena enn muvman internasyonal ki pe reziste sa minmiz bann miltinasyonal lor lagrikiltir: enn muvman ki regrup peizan, planter, elver, sindika progresis, parti politik de gos, ekolozist, lorganizasyon zenn ek feminist.

input: In Mauritius, we have seen these types of organizations group together to protest against and to warn the MMM-MSM Government against the utilization of GMO seeds and products, at the time that the Government brought in its own GMOs.
target: Dan Moris mem, nu finn retruv sa kalite regrupman progresis pu proteste ek met an gard kan Guvernman MMM-MSM ti vini ek so lalwa pu ofisyaliz itilizasyon lagrin ek prodwi OGM.

input: Lalit was one of the organizations in this movement.
target: Lalit ti parmi bann inisyater sa muvman la.

input: Even though there have been protests, the law was passed in the national assembly in March 2004.
target: Malgre protestasyon, lalwa la finn vote dan Lasanble Nasyonal an Mars 2004.

input: COMMON PROTEST AGAINST THE GMO BILL (GENETICALLY MODIFIED ORGANISMS).
target: PROTESTASYON KOMIN KONT BIL lor OGM (ORGANISM ZENETIKMAN MODIFYE).

input: Given that there is sufficient food production for everybody on planet earth and that the problem of hunger and famine is instead due to the politics of distribution;
target: Etan done ki deza ena sifizan prodiksyon alimanter pu tu dimunn lor bul later manze a-sa-fen, e ki problem lafin ek lafaminn dan lemond li plito problem politik distribisyon;

input: Given that 99% of the research on GMOs is done by private multinational companies which aim at profit-maximization for their stake holders;
target: Etan done ki resers lor OGM li fer a 99% par konpayni prive miltinasyonal ki ena pu bi iltim fer profi pu zot gro aksyoner;

input: Given that multinationals which are engaged in the production of seeds (MOSANTO, etc), produce 99% of GMO seeds so as to tolerate their herbicides (poisons) such as Round-up or to transform the tree itself into insecticides (more poison), that is they are increasing the dangerous products dosage in food;
target: Etan done ki sa bann miltinasyonal ki dan prodiksyon semans (MONSANTO, etc), zot prodwir semans OGM a 99% pu toler zot erbisid (pwazon) kuma Round-up ubyen pu transform pye la limem an insektisid (ankor pwazon), setadir zot pe ogmant prodwi danzere dan manze;

input: Given that multinationals aim at a monopoly on the production of seeds, they made it illegal to re-use their seeds (with WTO agreement), or impossible to use it more than once (due to the fact that it is a ‘terminator’ seed and it cannot reproduce itself);
target: Etan done ki sa bann miltinasyonal viz enn monopol lor prodiksyon semans, zot fer li ilegal pu reservi zot semans (atraver lakor WTO), ubyen inposib pu re-servi li (akoz li enn semans “terminator” e pa reprodwir);
