input: Given that studies done in the United States of America have shown that American food production has been contaminated in a more vast way than scientists had predicted, in fact through wind and pollination insects;
target: Etan done ki letid dan Leta Zini fini demontre ki prodiksyon alimanter Amerikin finn kontamine dan enn fason buku pli vast ki syantist ti predir avan, atraver labriz ek insekt polinater;

input: Given that pollinating insects can be affected by it, this results in great risk of contamination for agricultural reproduction of other foods;
target: Etan done insekt ki fer sa polinasyon la kapav limem afekte, sa kapav met an peril reprodiksyon agrikol lezot manze;

input: Given that nature itself (beyond agriculture) is being affected by the GMOs, which are not being controlled;
target: Etan done ki lanatir limem (odela de lagrikiltir) pe kumans afekte par OGM andeor kontrol;

input: Given that the WTO allows private companies to take out “patents on life”, this means that food security of the worlds people is critically under threat;
target: Etan done ki system WTO ki vinn permet konpayni prive tir “patant lor zafer vivan”, sa vedir sekirite alimanter bann lepep gravman menase;

input: Given that the consequences on human beings and human health, on animals, are totally unpredictable, and given that recent studies in United Kingdom show an increase in “allergic” reactions due to GMOs;
target: Etan done ki lefe lor imen e so lasante, e lor zanimo, li totalman inprevizib, e etan done letid resan an Gran Bretayn montre ki finn ena ogmantasyon ka “alerzi” akoz OGM,

input: Given that the change brought about by GMOs can be irreversible because it deals with genetic materials;
target: Etan done ki tu sanzman amene par introdiksyon OGM, li riske vinn ireversib akoz li rant dan matyer zenetik;

input: Given that there is a risk of popular boycott of our sugar in Europe if it is not “GMO-FREE”,
target: Etan done risk enn boykot popiler dan Lerop ek ayer kont nu disik si li pa “GMO-FREE”;

input: Given the awareness of tourists on GMO contamination,
target: Etan done sansibilite turist a danze kontaminasyon par OGM,

input: Given that Mauritius is constituted of islands and Archipelagoes, we have the possibility of an agriculture, which is really “GMO-FREE”, thus giving it a great commercial value,
target: Etan done ki Repiblik Moris konstitye par enn seri Lil ek Arsipel, nu ena posibilite enn lagrikiltir vreman GMO-FREE avek enn gran valer komersyal,

input: Given that the first GMOs that have been manipulated by the MSIRI has been done specifically to make sugar cane resistant to Round-Up herbicide,
target: Etan done ki premye OGM ki pe trafike par MSIRI li finn fer pu rann kann rezistan a erbisid Round-Up,

input: * Denounce all the propaganda of multinational companies and local private companies, which say that GMOs are designed to decrease suffering in the world.
target: * Rezet tu propagann par konpayni miltinasyonal ek sekter prive lokal kumkwa pe fer OGM pu sanse diminye sufrans dan lemond.

input: * Demand a prompt withdrawal of the bill proposed by the MMM/MSM/PMSD/FTS/LES VERTS government.
target: * Demand retre imedya Bil propose par Guvernman MMM-MSM-PMSD-FTS-Les Verts.

input: * Demand that the government come forward with a new bill which:
target: * Demand ki Guvernman vinn delavan avek enn proze delwa ki:

input: a) Insists that imported food should be labeled “GMO-FREE”.
target: (a) Exize ki tu manze inporte ena enn letiket ki li “GMO- FREE”.

input: b) Insist that all research and development be done by the government without any influence or funding from the private sector or the multinational companies.
target: (b) Exize ki tu resers-ek-devlopman fer par Guvernman san okenn linfliyans ni larzan depi sekter prive ni konpayni miltinasyonal.

input: c) That all commercialization of all future GMO plants, which are not necessary in our world, should be done under the ‘Precautionary Principle’, that is it is the duty of the company, which is selling something to the public, to prove that it will not have any harmful effect on any future consumer.
target: (c) Ki tu komersyalizasyon fitir plant OGM, ki pa neseser dan lemond zordi, li bizin fer avek “precautionary principle”, setadir ki li devwar sa konpayni ki pu vann kiksoz ar piblik pu limem o-prealab vinn pruve ki li pena lefe nefast lor enn itilizater fitir.

input: The list of organizations which endorsed this common protestation in March 2004: Institute for Consumer Protection, Ledikasyon pu Travayer, Rodrigues Government Employees’ Association, Muvman Liberation Fam, Mouvement pour l’Autosuffisance Alimentaire, Lalit, ABAIM, Federation of Pre-School Playgroups.
target: Lalist lorganizasyon ki ti enndors sa Protestasyon Komin an Mars 2004: Institute for Consumer Protection, Ledikasyon Pu Travayer, Rodrigues Government Employees’ Association, Muvman Liberasyon Fam, Mouvement pour l’Autosuffisance Alimentaire, LALIT, ABAIM, Federation of Pre-School Playgroups.

input: In the past, due to the fact that cultivation and cattle rearing had been done only on a commercial basis for profit, there has not been enough thinking on how to integrate different types of plant cultivation and also cattle rearing within the same project.
target: Dan lepase, parski lagrikiltir ek lelvaz finn fer lor baz komersyal pu profi, finn ena byen tigit reflexion lor ki manyer kapav integre diferan plantasyon ek lelvaz dan enn mem proze.

input: According to the narrow-minded capitalist economists, sugar produced by the sugar industry must be profitable, inter-line cropping done by planters must be profitable, cattle rearing must be profitable.
target: Kann ki tablisman plante bizin profitab, plantasyon nuritir ki planter fer antreliyn bizin rantab, lelvaz ki tablisman fer bizin profitab.

input: The absence of any thought on the development of an integrated agriculture is very serious for Mauritius, given that our resources in terms of the amount of arable land is obviously very limited.
target: Sa labsans reflexion ek devlopman enn lagrikiltir integre, li byen grav pu Moris, etan done ki nu resurs an term siperfisi later kiltivab ek lezot fakter, zot evidaman byen limite.

input: The present system evaluates agricultural production on the amount of “profit” that land owners make.
target: Sistem aktyel ziz prodiksyon agrikol par “profi” ki proprieter later fer.

input: There are other ways to evaluate agricultural production.
target: Ena lezot fason ziz prodiksyon dan lagrikiltir.

input: For example it is essential to assess whether this production can be maintained over time.
target: Par exanp, li esansyel ki nu gete si sa prodiksyon la kapav kontinye.

input: It also questions whether this agricultural production takes into account our environment, our ecology?
target: Li osi vedir, eski sa prodiksyon agrikol-la, li gard enn respe pu lanvironnman, pu ekolozi?

input: Furthermore, it is necessary to take into account human knowledge, that of planters and cattle breeders, and guarantee the continued transmission of this knowledge from one generation to the next.
target: Anplis de sa, li neseser asir proteksyon konesans imen, ki bann planter ek elver ena, e asir transmisyon sa konesans la depi enn zenerasyon a lot.

input: There are many experiments that have been done on different kinds of agriculture, which in fact do respect these criteria.
target: Ena buku lexperyans lor tu kalite lagrikiltir ki respekte sa bann kriter la.

input: For example “integrated farming” in China, where profit-making is not the main motive, but other questions are taken into consideration.
target: Par exanp, ena bann “laferm integre” dan Lasinn. Laba, dan sa bann laferm integre-la, zot pa get zis profi lor marse, me zot get lezot kestyon osi.

input: Whether water supply in the long term is protected?
target: Eski pe protez furnitir dilo a lonterm?

input: Whether there is misuse of resources, when it is not necessary?
target: Eski ena gaspiyaz, kan li pa neseser?

input: Then, they can actually re-allocate resources when necessary;
for example, they can increase or decrease the proportion of workers on the farm, or in the related industries.
target: par exanp, zot kapav ena enn pli gran ubyen pli tipti proporsyon travayer lor laferm la, ubyen dan lindistri asosye;

input: Researchers are also closely linked into production.
The proportion of researchers can also be changed – if the ‘integrated nature’ of this approach is respected.
target: Proporsyon dimunn lor resers, sa osi, kapav sanze – si gard respe pu sa lapros “integre” la.

input: Researchers are directly linked to the real needs of those who cultivate the land, and those working in the agro-industrial factory.
target: Resers li liye direk-direk avek seki pe pase lor terin plantasyon, e dan lizinn, dan realite.

input: It is not unconnected like in the ordinary capitalist system.
target: Li pa separe, kuma dan sistem kapitalis ordiner.

input: There have been 100 million of workers that have shifted from ‘on farm’ to ‘off farm’ in China’s agro-industry, without diminishing agricultural production.
target: Ena 100 milyon dimunn ki finn buze depi “on farm” ziska “off farm” dan agro-indistri dan Lasinn, san diminye prodiksyon agrikol.

input: On the contrary, food production in different forms has increased: in cans, frozen, freeze-dried, pickled, dried, and preserved in all forms.
target: O-kontrer, li finn ogmant prodiksyon manze dan totalite so diferan form: dan bwat, frigorifye, friz-dray, konfi, sek, prezerve dan tu sort kalite fason.

input: The capitalist system is always on the look-out for a quick “profit”.
target: Sistem kapitalis, li dir li pe rod “profi”.

input: But what is even truer is that they are always looking at profit in the short term only.
target: Me seki pli vre se li rod ek gayn profi selman akurterm.

input: In the long run even capitalist production will lose out, in lots of ways: the soil will get impoverished; the environment spoilt; underground water supplies will decrease drastically; the capitalist negligence will destroy insects and animals which contribute to the perpetuation of life on our planet.
target: Alonterm, li defisiter dan buku fason: li apovri later; li gat lanvironnman; li bes latab dilo suterin; li fini bann kreatir suterin ek seki anvole, e ki neseser pu lavi kontinye lor planet.

input: In the mid-west of the United States, the soil has been so impoverished (through uncontrolled cultivation and petrol exploitation), that today there is desertification over there.
target: Isi, li vo lapenn get seki finn arive dan Mid-West Leta Zini, kot finn telman apovri later (par plantasyon san reflesi, ek par tir petrol), ki zordi ena dezertifikasyon.

input: In Israel in the 1950’s the Kibbutz cooperatives developed integrated farming with an adapted irrigation system in the desert of Negev.
target: Dan Israel, lexperyans ki ti fer dan bann lane 1950 par bann koperativ Kibutz pu devlop laferm integre avek enn sistem irigasyon adpate dan Dezer Negev.

input: This shows how cooperation and integrated development can develop a new agricultural system.
target: montre kimanyer koperasyon e devlopman integre kapav develop nuvo sistem lagrikiltir.

input: Planters and farmers in regions where there is a scarcity of water like in India and Australia have also carried out this experiment.
target: Sa lexperyans integre finn kontinye devlope par bann planter, fermye dan lezot rezyon lemond kot pena dilo kuma serten rezyon dan Lind, dan Lostrali.

input: To cultivate in deserts and arid and semi-arid regions, is worthy twice-over.
target: Plante dan dezer, plante lor bann later arid e semi-arid, li ena dub valer.

input: Firstly it is worthy, because it allows the development of seeds, which can resist the desert climate, and it allows cultivation in regions where water is scarce.
target: Enn premye valer se li permet develop bann semans ki reziste klima dezer, e lerla permet plante lor later kot dilo byin mizer.

input: Secondly, it helps to prevent desertification.
target: So dezyem pli gran valer alonterm se li anpes dezer invayir ankor plis later.

input: These kinds of long term vision will not be possible with agriculture based on the profit motive.
target: Sa kalite vizyon alonterm li napa posib avek enn lagrikiltir ki baze lor zis fer maximum profi vit-vit.

input: In Mauritius there have been experiments on cattle rearing, cultivation and fish breeding.
target: Dan Moris, finn ena bann lexperyans kot ena lelvaz zanimo, anmemtan ki plantasyon, anmemtan ki nuri pwason.

input: The St Martin project has been one of those experiences, where waste from one production unit is recycled naturally into the next stage without it being of any cost (e.g. chicken waste becomes fertilizer).
target: Proze St Martin enn parmi sa lexperyans-la. Kot seki weys dan enn kalite prodiksyon, san okenn fre, li resikle natirelman dan prosenn letap. (e.g. kaka pul vinn fertilizan anplas-anplas).

input: This is an advantage because it increases the value of one waste product, and makes it become useful, replacing the need for fertilizers which cost money, pollute the earth and water, and can be harmful for the flora and the fauna.
target: Sa li ena lavantaz akoz li azut valer dan enn weys, ki fer li vinn itil. Olye servi fertilizan ki anmemtan kut ser, ki polye, e ki kapav fer ditor flora ek fona pu debon.

input: This kind of production (like in China or Mauritius) can be done on a large scale or can be done through the link between different projects (small planters and cattle breeders, cooperating in the same process).
target: Sa kalite prodiksyon (kuma ena Lasinn ubyen Moris) kapav lor relativman gran lesel (kuma tablisman) ubyen buku diferan proze inter-liye (kuma ti-planter, ti-elver, ki kopere ansam dan enn mem prosesis).

input: See references at the end of the book for articles on cooperative like the Plaisance & La Ferme Mixed Farming Society and on experiments in China.
target: Get referans pu bann lartik analiz lor koperativ Plaisance & La Ferme Mixed Farming Society e lor lexperyans dan Lasinn.

input: This system brings the land ownership question into focus.
target: Sa sistem la remet an kestyon propriete later.

input: Landowners have short-term interests; more profit can be made through speculation very often, than through agriculture.
target: Enn proprieter teryen, li ena lintere akurterm. Li kapav ena plis profi par fer spekilasyon.

input: For example IRS (Integrated Resort Schemes) will seem more profitable to land-owners than the development of the food sector, even though the latter would enhance the economy for everybody.
target: Par exanp, li kapav anvi tap enn lamone lor enn IRS (Integrated Resorts Scheme), olye ki li devlop prodiksyon alimanter pu anrisi lekonomi pu tu dimunn.

input: As long as land will be under private control, it will be very difficult to get the degree of food security that is essential for the people.
target: Tan ki later rest su kontrol sekter prive, li byen difisil pu gayn enn degre sekirite alimanter neseser pu enn pep.

input: We must move towards a collective control and ownership of land.
target: Fode nu al ver enn kontrol kolektif lor later, kote propriete osi byen ki kote kontrol.

input: The consequence of private control of land is that most human beings have no access to land at all.
target: Kan ena kontrol prive, seki arive se mazorite imen pena akse a later ditu.

input: This means that their contribution toward agricultural and economic development is absent, and thus our overall production of ideas is impoverished.
target: Sa vedir, li apovri kontribisyon ki tu dimunn ti kapav fer a devlopman agrikol ek ekonomik.

input: Dynamic development comes through research, observation and the transmission of millenarian knowledge.
target: Sa kalite devlopman ki dinamik-la, li vini atraver resers, obzervasyon, transmisyon konesans “milener”.

input: There is urgency in this work.
target: Ena enn irzans dan sa travay la.

input: If we lose this millenarian knowledge, we will never get it again.
target: Si nu perdi sa konesans “milener”-la, nu napa pu regayn li.

input: This means that we, the people of the planet, could be under the direct control of the big multinationals, registered in the United States, and which want to make profit through registering patents on life (seeds and animals), and where our food security will be endangered.
target: Sa vedir nu riske vinn alamersi bann gran gran miltinasyonal, anrezistre dan Leta Zini, ki pe rod fer profi atraver anrezistre patant lor lavi (lagren, zanimo), e kot nu sekirite alimanter pu konpletman ipoteke.

input: In the present context, it is important that we put the question of the production of energy together with agriculture and agro-industry.
target: Dan kontex aktyel, li inportan ki nu liye ansam avek kestyon lagrikiltir ek agro-lindistri, kestyon prodiksyon lenerzi osi.

input: The traditional petroleum sources of energy (fossil fuels) are becoming more and more expensive, and represent a serious and irreversible threat to our ecology.
target: Bann surs lenerzi tradisyonel depi petrol importe pe vinn de plizanpli ser, ek pe prezant bann danze ekolozik grav ek ireversib.

input: Thus it is necessary to think on a new politics for the supply of energy.
target: Alor li neseser ki nu reflesi lor enn politik pu purnisaz lenerzi, ki nuvo.

input: All modern production is dependant on energy.
target: Tu prodiksyon modern byen depandan lor lenerzi.

input: So, these are some of the real alternatives that are part of the Lalit campaign.
target: Ala bann veritab alternativ ki Lalit pe lans kanpayn pu promuvwar.

input: Everywhere in the world as well as in Mauritius and Rodrigues, the public is fed up with development, which is only in the interest of some capitalists short term profits.
target: Partu dan lemond, e dan Moris ek Rodrig li parey: Dimunn finn plen ar enn devlopman dan lintere profi enn poyne misye kapitalist.

input: We are fed up with governments which act as facilitators for these capitalists who are making profits.
target: Nu finn plen ar bann Guvernman ki azir kuma fasilitater pu sa bann misye ki pe fer profi-la.

input: Lalit is proposing to mobilize the public, and particularly working people and those who work the land, on these demands which will allow us to get out of the “economic catastrophe” that we about to experience.
target: Lalit pe propoz pu mobiliz dimunn lor baz bann demand ki pu permet nu sorti depi sa espes “katastrof ekonomik” kot nu ete asterla, ek al ver enn veritab transformasyon demokratik ek sosyalist nu lekonomi.

input: In the present context, people will easily understand the transitional nature of our proposals.
target: Dan kontext aktyel, lamas dimunn pu byen fasilman konpran natir tranzisyonel nu bann propozisyon.

input: That is, they are not only reasonable but they are necessary.
target: Setadir zot bann propozisyon ki pa zis rezonab, me zot indispansab asterla-mem.

input: The present system will be put into question when we put forward these eminently reasonable demands.
target: Sistem aktyel pu remet an kestyon par sa bann demand la.

input: The present system cannot deal with these demands.
target: Sistem aktyel pa pu kapab rann latas.

input: Simultaneously they are demands, which will only be possible when the political and economic balance of power gets to be in favour of the working class and the people, and when we will be able to make the ruling class to bear the brunt of the present crisis where there economic policy has brought us.
target: Me anmemtan zot bann demand ki pu selman kapav vinn enn realite kan rapor-de-fors sanze anfaver travayer ek lamas dimunn, ek kan nu reysi fer bann klas dirizant sarye fardo pu sorti depi kriz aktyel kot zot politik ekonomik finn amenn nu.

input: Here are our demands and propositions:
target: ALA NU BANN DEMAND EK PROPOZISYON:

input: * A conversion to a massive food production through ‘organic’ and ‘green’ method on a big scale, for our local needs and for exportations.
target: * Wi! a konversyon a enn prodiksyon alimanter masiv atraver metod “organik” ek “green” lor enn lesel imans, pu marse lokal e sirtu pu exportasyon.

input: (This big scale can be either ‘big unit’ like the sugar estates are nowadays, or composed of many ‘little units’ that work together like a true cooperative.)
target: (Sa lesel imans-la, kapav “gran inite” kuma tablisman aktyel, ek osi buku buku “inite pli tipti” ki travay ansam, kuma veritab koperativ.)

input: Thus Mauritius will be able to deal with the disaster of the sugar industry faced with the dismantling of the Sugar Protocol, and at the same time be the avant-garde of a “GMO-free guarantee” food producer.
target: Kumsa Moris kapav konturn dezast ki lindistri sikriyer pe fer fas avek demantelman Protokol Disik e anmemtan vinn an avangard prodiksyon alimanter ki “garanti-non-OGM” (GMO-FREE).

input: This will create employment and at the same time protect Mauritius’ natural heritage.
target: Sa pu kree buku lanplwa, anmemtan gard Moris so eritaz natirel an armoni.

input: We have the advantage of being a nation of islands, so that we can be free from “contamination par les OGM”.
target: Nu ena lavantaz ki nu pei li enn seri lil, alor nu lagrikiltir kapav proteze kont kontaminasyon OGM.

input: * The compulsory conversion of all sugar mills that are closing into agro-industrial factories, especially for massive exportation.
target: * Wi! a konversyon obligatwar tu ansyen mulen disik an lizinn agro-lindistri, sirtu pu exportasyon masiv.

input: This will create employment and can decrease the perilous effect of globalization that is threatening every country in the world.
target: Sa pu kree lanplwa e amorti larwinn ki globalizasyon aktyel pe fane partu dan lemond.

input: * In the fisheries, Lalit proposes that the government compels the private sector into investing in fishing on an industrial level, or the government might itself invest in this sector.
target: *Kote Lapes, LALIT propoze ki Guvernman fors patrona investi dan lapes o-nivo indistriyel, ubyen Guvernman kapav investi limem.

input: We must claim our rights on our Economic Zone around all the islands of our Republic, including Chagos and Tromelin.
target: Bizin kumans exziz nu drwa a nu Zonn Ekonomik otur tu lil nu Repiblik, setadir inklir Chagos ek Tromelin.

input: Chagossians must have the priority to work in every economic development in Chagos.
target: Chagosyen bizin gayn priorite pu travay dan tu devlopman ekonomik dan Chagos.

input: At the same time the Government must invest in the Barachois, fish breeding in marine farms, and the transformation of marine products, not only a “Sea-Food Hub” that will be like a fish free-zone.
target: Anmemtan Guvernman bizin investi dan baraswa, lelvaz pwason dan laferm marinn, plis transformasyon prodwi lamer, pa zis enn “Sea-Food Hub” ki kuma enn espes Zonn Frans pwason.

input: * The government must use the “European Compensation” for which negotiation are taking place in exchange for the Sugar Protocol dismantling, for this food production campaign, and stop perpetuating a squandering sugar industry.
target: * Bizin ki Guvernman servi “Konpansasyon Eropyen” ki li pe negosye an esanz pu demantelman Protokol Disik, pu sa kanpayn prodiksyon alimantasyon debaz, e napa pu perpetye enn lindistri sikriyer gaspiyaz.

input: * We need an “Optimal Land Utilization Authority” instead of a “Sugar Authority” which is obsolete.
target: * Bizin enn “Optimal Land Utilisation Authority” (“Lotorite pu Rod Fason Optimal pu Servi Later”), plito ki enn “Sugar Authority”, ki kadik.

input: * We need to oppose any new WTO “round” and put off the ancient WTO agreement till a “World-Wide Audit”.
target: * Bizin opoz tu nuvo “round” WTO ek sispann ansyen lakor WTO ziska enn “World-wide Social Audit”.

input: * No to the privatization of the CEB.
This process must be reversed now, and the CEB bureaucracy replaced by a democratic structure.
target: Bizin ranvers sa prosesis la, e ranplas sa “Birokrasi CEB” par enn “CEB su kontrol demokratik”.

input: Yes to a massive development of ‘clean’ and ‘renewable’ energy like solar energy, wind energy, tidal and wave energy.
target: Wi! a devlopman masiv lenerzi ki “prop” ek “veritableman renuvlab” kuma lenerzi soler, lenerzi Eoliyenn, lenerzi lamer (tidal and wave energy).

input: With this kind of vision, and a well-planned CEB, Mauritius can become a world leader in clean, durable and, in the long term, cheap energy.
target: Kumsa Moris (avek enn CEB byen planifye) kapav sitye li kuma enn pei lavangard dan prodiksyon lenerzi prop, dirab ek bonmarse.

input: This will create employment as well as decrease pollution.
target: Sa li pu kree buku lanplwa, anmemtan ki li diminye polisyon.

input: * Stop privatization of any new sector and stop the processes of privatization.
target: * Non a privatizasyon okenn nuvo sekter, e aret tu prosesis privatizasyon.

input: * Stop any form of politics, which try to destroy traditional agriculture. – Yes! To politics, which build scientific knowledge on knowledge and experience which planters, cattle breeder and fisherwoman/man had learned and accumulated from generation to generation.
target: * Non a politik ki rod detrir lagrikiltir tradisyonel- Wi! a enn politik ki batir konesans syantifik lor konesans ek lexperyans ki planter, elver ek peser finn akimile lor enn long peryod.

input: * The University of Mauritius should orientate research towards agricultural production based on traditional knowledge, not on its substitute.
target: * Liniversite Moris bizin oryant resers ver prodiksyon agrikol baze lor devlopman konesans tradisyonel, pa lor so ranplasman.

input: This kind of research should become conversant with the agro-industrial sector instead of the main objective of commercialization of product in short run.
target: Sa resers la bizin oryante ver sekter agro-alimanter plito ki ver prodwi ki ena zis valer azute komersyal a-kur-term.

input: *Profit based GMO product must be stopped.
target: *Bizin stop tu OGM ki fer lor baz profi.

input: The government must change the law on bio-technology so that it will be based on the ‘Precautionary Principle’.
target: Guvernman bizin sanz lalwa lor bio-teknolozi pu ki li baze lor “precautionary principle”.

input: Mauritius must develop a market for ‘Guaranteed GMO-Free’ products.
target: Moris bizin devlop enn marse pu prodiksyon agrikol ki “Guaranteed GMO-FREE”.

input: * To begin the immediate processes for the re-orientation of institutions that were set up to support Sugar Industry, to decline the emphasis made on sugar, and put more effort in the direction to develop agro-industry.
target: * Bizin demar enn prosesis pu re-oryant institisyon ki finn met dibut pu sutenir Lindistri Sikriyer, pu diminye zot lanfaz lor disik, ek pu met plis zefor dan direksyon sutenir devlopman agro-indistri.

input: * There is an urgency to set up an insurance to protect and encourage planters who engaged in the agricultural diversification production.
target: * Ena enn nesesite irzan pu met dibut enn form lasirans pu protez ek ankuraz bann planter ki angaz zot-mem dan prodiksyon agrikol diversifye.

input: Modern technology had allowed conditions for a greater form of democracy in the organization of the economy.
target: Teknolozi modern finn kree kondisyon pu enn pli gran demokrasi dan zesyon lekonomi.

input: We should be able to have the necessary political mean to demand to ask for more democracy.
target: Nu bizin gayn lemwayen politik pu nu exziz sa demokrasi la.

input: Technological progress increase the capacity of production in a sufficient amount so that workers who are occupied in production had the ability to run production, instead of only following the instructions from an employee who’s only interest is the making of profit.
target: Progre teknolozik finn ogmant prodiktivite ase pu ki travayer ki dan prodiksyon ena zordi kapasite pu zer prodiksyon, anplas zis exekit bann instriksyon depi enn patron ki selman interese ek profi.

input: OUR PROPOSALS TO MAKE THIS HAPPEN?

Basically, Lalit says that the government must compel the sugar factories ( and private sectors in general) to create employment, production of food, investing in agro-industries for the local market and also for exportation purposes, and to produce clean and renewable energy.
target: Dan enn premye tan, Lalit dir ki Guvernman bizin fors tablisman (ek sekter prive anzeneral) kree lanplwa, prodir manze, investi dan lindistri agro-alimanter pu marse lokal ek exportasyon, e prodiksyon lenerzi prop renuvlab.

input: But however it is not acceptable for people having land to refuse to produce food and that people who wants to produce food do not have land.
target: Me, antuka, li pa posib ki dimunn ki detenir later refiz prodir manze, kan ena dimunn ki ule prodir manze me ki pena later.

input: It is not acceptable that people who possess capital do not create employment and people in need of a work do not have the capital that they themselves produced.
target: Li pa posib ki dimunn ki ena kapital pa kree lanplwa. E dimunn ki bizin lanplwa pena kontrol lor kapital ki zot-mem finn prodir.

input: Eventually this bankrupt capitalist system must be overthrown and replaced by a socialist system where people organize collectively.
target: Evantyelman sa sistem kapitalist ki zordi bankrut, pu bizin ranverse ek ranplase par enn sistem sosyalist ek otozere.

input: 1. Integrated Farming Project St Martin, Republic of Mauritius.
target: 1. Proze Laferm integre St Martin, Repiblik Moris.

input: 2. Listwar ek Analiz “Plaisance & La Ferme Mixed Farming Society”- Revi Lalit de Klas, Mauritius, Feb 1977, Number 4, Page 17.
target: 2. Listwar ek Analiz “Plaisance & La Ferme Mixed Farming Society” - Revi Lalit de Klas, Moris, Fevriye 1977, Nimero 4 paz 17.

input: 3. An analysis of the Chinese experience with Integrated Farming in “The State of Food and Agriculture” 1998, Food & Agriculture Organization of the United Nations, Rome. 1998. 373pp.
target: 3. Analiz lexperyans Lasinn ek laferm integre dan The State of Food and Agriculture 1998. Food and Agriculture Organization of the United Nations, Rome. 1998. 373 pp.

input: 4. AGRO-ECOLOGICAL FARMING SYSTEMS IN CHINA. Edited by Li Wenhua, Chinese Academy of Science, Beijing People’s Republic of China, published in MEN AND THE BIOSPHERE SERIES VOLUME 26.
target: 4. AGRO-ECOLOGICAL FARMING SYSTEMS IN CHINA Edited by Li Wenhua, Chinese Academy of Sciences, Beijing People’s Republic of China, pibliye dan MAN AND THE BIOSPHERE SERIES VOLUME 26

input: * “Globalization, Food Security and War” by Vandana Shiva, Published by Ledikasyon Pu Travayer, PP 30-31
target: “Globalisation, Food Security and War” par Dr Vandana Shiva, Paz 30-31, Ledikasyon Pu Travayer

input: Bearing in mind that the Preamble to the Universal Declaration of Human Rights reads : “Whereas it is essential, if man is not to be compelled to have recourse, as a last resort, to rebellion against tyranny and oppression, that human rights should be protected by the rule of law.” ;
target: • Etan done ki dan preanbil Deklarasyon Iniversel Drwa Imin, dir ki: “ Li absoliman neseser ki lalwa protez drwa imin pu ki dimunn pa oblize, anfin-de-kont,  revolte kont latirani ek dominasyon”.

input: Recalling that one of the most important uprisings of the whole of the people in our history was sparked off by the death of Kaya in police cells on the 21st of February, 1999;
target: • Aster ki dimunn kone ki lamor santer Kaya dan selil lapolis le 21 Fevriye 1999 ti provok enn parmi bann pli gran sulevman lepep dan listwar nu pei.

input: And remembering that Kaya’s death, unelucidated up to today, is not the first case of suspicious death in police cells.
target: • E nu rapel ki, lamor Kaya lor lekel pankor gayn explikasyon ziska zordi, pa premye ka  lamor lus dan selil polisyer.

input: Since independence, there have been about thirty unexplained deaths in detention;
target: Depi lindepandans, finn ena plis ki trant ka lamor inexplikab an detansyon polisyer.

input: Noting that since the death in police cells of Kaya, there have been a further ten cases of unexplained deaths during arrest and detention, the most recent being those of Lorlène Dumazel in February 2001, Vijay Nancy in June 2001, Josian Bayaram in July 2001 and Clifford David in March 2002;
target: • Avek konesans ki depi lamor Kaya dan Alcatraz, finn ena ankor dis ka lamor an detansyon polisyer dan bann sirkonstans inexplikab. Parmi ka pli resan ena Lorlène Duzamel an Fevriye 2001, Vijay Nancy an Zin 2001, Josian Bayaram an Ziyet 2001 ek Clifford David an Mars 2002.

input: Bearing in mind all those who have been victim of police violence, of inhuman torture, and sadistic behaviour of police officers, who while on duty, abuse their position of power conferred on them by Law, with impunity;
target: • E nu rapel ki tu dimunn ki finn viktim vyolans polisyer, tortir ek konportman sadik par ofisye lapolis, ki dan zot travay, abiz puvwar ki lalwa donn zot avek inpinite.

input: Recalling that the State of Mauritius is signatory to:
target: • E gard an-memwar ki Leta Morisyin finn siyn:

input: •	The 1976 “International Covenant on Civil and Political Rights” that guarantees the right to liberty and security of each person,
target: “Konvansyon Internasyonal lor Drwa Sivil ek Politik” 1973 ki garanti ki tu dimunn ena drwa a liberte ek so sekirite.

input: •	The 1986 “African Charter on Human and Peoples’ Rights”;
target: “ Sart Afrikin lor Drwa Imin ek Drwa Bann Lepep” 1986.

input: •	The 1997 “Convention against Torture and Other Cruel, Inhuman or Degrading Treatment or Punishment” that specifically declares that the “term ‘torture’ means any act by which severe pain or suffering, whether physical or mental, is intentionally inflicted on a person for such purposes as obtaining from him or a third person information or a confession, punishing him for an act he or a third person has committed or is suspected of having committed, or intimidating or coercing him or a third person, or for any reason based on discrimination of any kind, when such pain or suffering is inflicted by or at the instigation of, or with the consent or acquiescence of, a public official or other person acting in an official capacity”;
target: “Konvansyon Kont Tortir ek Kont tu Pinisyon u Tretman Kriel, Inimin u  Degradan”  1997,  e kot definir tortir kuma: “ ninport ki aksyon ki provok enn gran duler u sufrans, ki li fizik u moral, e ki fer lor enn dimunn intansyonelman avek bi pu gayn linformasyon depi li u enn lot dimunn ubyin pu gayn so konfesyon, pu pini li pu kitsoz ki li ubyin enn lot dimunn finn komet u supsone finn fer, u pu intimid li u fors li avwe kitsoz kont so volonte, ubyin pu ninport ki rezon baze lor kik diskriminasyon, kan enn tel duler u sufrans ki inflize par u avek konsantman u aprobasyon enn ofisye Leta u lezot dimunn an zot kapasite ofisyel. ”

input: Recalling that Article (3) (a) of the Constitution of Mauritius similarly guarantees “the right of the individual to life, liberty, security of the person and the protection of the law”,
target: • San ki nu bliye osi ki Konstitisyon Moris seksyon 3 (a) garanti ki “sak dimunn ena drwa a lavi, liberte, so prop sekirite ek proteksyon lalwa”.

input: Given that the rule of law renders the State responsible and liable for the actions, omissions, misdemeanours and crimes of its police agents and that, in addition, they must be brought to justice for their breaches of the criminal law or infringements of human rights, as all other citizens;
target: • Etan done ki lalwa nu pei dir ki Leta responsab pu tu aksyon, mankman, move konportman u krim ki so ofisye lapolis fer e ki zot bizin pas divan lakur kuma ninport ki sitwayin sa pei-la, kan zot pa respekte lalwa e kan zot vyol drwa imin.

input: Aware of the fact that such police officers are in a position of power and abuse this power in their relations with to certain categories of citizens such as youth, the unemployed, people who are poor or otherwise socially oppressed, who do not have the means to defend themselves to ensure that their rights are respected;
target: • Avek konesans ki sa bann mem ofisye lapolis-la zot dan enn pozisyon de fors e ki zot abiz de puvwar ki sa pozisyon-la donn zot, dan zot relasyon vizavi sertin kategori sitwayin kuma zenn, somer, dimunn mizer, dimunn sosyalman oprime, e seki pena lemwayin defann zot mem pu asire ki zot drwa respekte.

input: Considering that we are all equal before the law, and that every person, without distinction, has the right to equal protection of the law, it is worth noting that every person, charged by police is presumed innocent until proven guilty by an open Court of law in which the person is ensured a proper defence;
target: • Etan done ki nu tu egal divan lalwa e ki nu tu, san okenn distinksyon, ena drwa a    mem proteksyon lalwa, li inportan rapel ki ninport ki dimunn ki lapolis akize, li prezime inosan ziska ki lakur truve ki li kupab apre enn prose piblik dan lekel so defans finn asire dapre lalwa.

input: Bearing in mind that it is essential that the media, especially the press and journalists, be conscious of their key role in denouncing cases of police violence and promoting and protecting human rights.
target: • Donk, nu truve ki li absoliman neseser ki bann medya, sirtu lagazet ek zurnalis konsyan de rol kle ki zot ena pu denons sa kalite vyolans polisyer-la, e pu promuvwar e protez drwa imin.

input: However, this contribution should be made in a professional and ethical manner.
target: Me selman fode ki zot fer zot metye dan enn fason profesyonel e avek etik.

input: The media must be made aware of its influence on public opinion, and should exert caution in publicizing photographs of a shocking or sensational nature so as to respect the privacy of victims and their families;
target: Bann medya bizin konsyan de linflians ki zot ena lor lopinyon piblik, e donk zot bizin pran an konsiderasyon respe lavi prive viktim e fami bann viktim kan zot pe pibliye foto ki kapav sokan ubyin sansasyonel.

input: Rejecting all attempts by public institutions to cover-up or minimise cases of police violence by accusing victims or their families of exaggeration or of fabricating allegations, so as to renounce their responsibilities or to try to justify such violence by claiming that it is part of “Mauritian culture” and thus accept it with cynicism and doom.
target: • Refiz tu tantativ bann linstitisyon piblik pu kuver u pu minimiz linportans bann ka vyolans polisyer, par akiz viktim ubyin fami viktim, kumkwa zot pe egzazere u pe invant alegasyon, pu ki sa bann institisyon-la abandonn tu responsabilite, ubyin sey zistifye sa kalite vyolans-la kuma kitsoz ki form parti “kiltir morisyin”, e pu lerla aksepte li avek sinism e kuma enn fatalite.

input: It is a key moment in Mauritian history for us to stop and think.
target: Li enn moman inportan pu refleksyon lor lekonomi.

input: Economic disaster could easily be looking us in the face very soon.
And it is not just Lalit saying so anymore.
target: E pa zis Lalit ki pe dir.

input: The bosses and the Government are finally coming to terms with the bankruptcy of their economy.
target: Mem patrona ek Guvernman pe finalman truv kler.

input: The Sugar Industry, even they admit it now at long last, has no future.
Mass redundancies in the Sugar Industry under the notorious VRS are now being more than matched by textile factory closures on a scale never seen before.
target: Lisansiman imans atraver VRS, atraver fermtir lizinn.

input: And the bosses now openly promise worse to come.
target: Somaz pe vinn enn nivo mortel.

input: Unemployment will begin to reach mortal levels soon.
target: Anmemtan nu pe truv Guvernman pran mezir ki agrav sa 2 problem la.

input: Government is doing no more than taking measures that ultimately only serve to aggravate these two major problems.
target: Anmemtan ki ena sa kriz mazer, ena enn deba inportan lor lavenir CEB.

input: While all these key things are taking place, there is also an important debate going on about the future of the CEB, a sector central to long-term planning.
target: Li dan tu sa kad-la ki Lalit pe lans enn kanpayn nasyonal pu fors Guvernman ek patrona, ek zot bann ideolog patante, uver zot lizye, get lavenir imen dan sa pei la pli kler.

input: Here is an outline of our campaign:

1.	We demand mass conversion of land to planting of food, and this to be done by “organic” and “green” methods on a huge scale, for peoples’ food needs and, on a larger scale than ever before, for export.
target: 1.	Wi! a konversyon a enn prodiksyon alimanter masiv atraver metod “organik” ek “green” lor enn lesel imans, pu marse lokal e sirtu pu exportasyon.

input: This way Mauritius can get around the disaster that the sugar industry is facing as the Sugar Protocol runs out.
target: Kumsa Moris kapav konturn dezast ki lindistri sikriyer pe fer fas avek terminasyon Protocol Disik.

input: This way Mauritius can become a world leader in food production, which is guaranteed GMO-FREE.
target: Kumsa Moris kapav vinn an avangard prodiksyon alimanter ki “garanti-non-OGM” (GMO-FREE).

input: This will create employment on a large scale, and, at the same time, respect Mauritius’ natural heritage.
target: Sa pu kree buku anplwa, anmemtan gard Moris so eritaz natirel an armoni.

input: 2.	We demand compulsory conversion of ex-sugar mills into agro-industrial plants, for exporting produce.
target: 2.	Wi! a konversyon obligatwar tu ansyen mulen disik an lizinn agro-lindistri, sirtu pu exportasyon masiv.

input: This will create employment and absorb the shock of the ruinous globalization that the multinationals are subjecting us to.
target: Sa pu kree anplwa e amorti larwinn ki globalizasyon aktyel pe fane partu dan lemond.

input: 3.	oppose all new “rounds” at the WTO and to call for suspension of existing WTO agreements until a “World-wide Social Audit”.
target: 3.	Opoz tu nuvo “round” WTO ek sispann ansyen lakor WTO ziska enn “World-wide Social Audit”.

input: 4.	We oppose privatization of the CEB.

Unfortunately the present debate on CEB is very parochial, never ever touching on the key issues being addressed world-wide in this epoch, i.e. kinds of energy that are neither polluting nor blindly reliant on finite stocks of fossil fuels that are being depleted irrationally.
target: Me, deba otur CEB, li resanble enn kerel parwasyal dan enn lepok kot partu dan lemond ena deba byen inportan ki pe met ankestyon kalite prodiksyon lenerzi, sirtu seki amenn polisyon, enn kote, e seki enn kantite faynayt, lot kote.

input: 5.	We demand massive investment into research and production of genuinely renewable and clean energy. In particular Solar, Wind and Sea (tidal and wave) energies.
target: 5.	Wi! a devlopman masiv lenerzi ki “prop” ek “veritableman renuvlab” kuma lenerzi soler, lenerzi Eyolyenn, lenerzi lamer (tidal and wave energy).

input: This can create a lot of employment and keep our islands’ ecologies balanced.
target: Sa li pu kree buku anplwa, an mem tan ki li diminye polisyon.

input: As long ago as in 1982-83, Lalit was already in the middle of a campaign to warn of the dangers of leaving the Sugar Oligarchs to dictate agricultural politics of the whole country. What happened then, was that we bumped into State repression.
target: An 1982-83 kan Lalit ti lans li dan kanpayn pu averti tu dimunn lor danze ki tablisman kontinye dikte politik agrikol enn pei an-antye, nu ti tap ar represyon Leta.

input: We had a Slide Show and Talk Series called “Disik, Ki Lavenir?” that was touring towns and villages of Mauritius.
target: Nu ti ena enn ‘Slide Show’ ek Kozri ki ti kumans fer letur bann kartye dan Moris.

input: We were, even then, proposing a legal framework that would oblige the Sugar Estates to plant their rows of cane in a format that allows inter-line cropping of food crops every year, and not just when there is new cane planted every seven or so years.
target: Deza lerla nu ti pe prekoniz enn kad legal pu obliz tu tablisman plant so kann dan enn format ki permet legim antreliyn dan tu so later, e nu ti osi prevwar enn pursantaz plantasyon alimater obligatwar, lor baz plennter.

input: The MMM-PSM Government did not take kindly to our Slide Show and Talk Series.
target: Guvernman MMM-PSM a-lepok pa ti dakor.

input: The Sugar bosses were furious too.
The police banned the Slide Show.
target: Alor, lapolis ti vinn kareman INTERDIR sa seri slayd show.

input: Now, when it is almost too late, when the Sugar Oligarchs have even gone and aggravated the situation by producing electricity from cane bagasse, now the Bosses and the Government, twenty years too late, find themselves in a blind panic.
target: Asterla kan li preske tro tar, kan tablisman finn mem al lans zot dan tu kalite prodiksyon lenerzi ar bagas ki vinn agrav problem-la, asterla Tablisman ek Guvernman, finalman, tulde, avek enn retar 20 an, pe panike.

input: We call on Government to get out of the rut of a ‘Sugar Authority’ and to break away from its obsession with sugar (an obsession which seems to blind them) and to think big for once.
target: Alor Guvernman bizin aret persiste avek so ‘Sugar Authority’ ek so obsesyon avek disik (kumsidire disik fer zot aveg) e plito pans gran.

input: What we need, in organizational terms, is something like an ‘Optimal Land Utilization Authority’ that proposes and helps research into crops that, for example, produce harvests three times in one year.
target: Met dibut enn organism kuma enn ‘Optimal Land Utilisation Authority’ pu devlop bann rekolt ki kapav fer trwa dan enn lane.

input: The Mauritian climate and soil is ideal for this kind of diversified food crop.
target: Moris ena enn klima ek enn later byen propis pu sa kalite lagrikiltir.

input: The peoples’ interests were never served by this kind of blinkered thinking.
target: Pa ti ena veritab lintere lepep Moris ladan.

input: The debate on electricity is part of this overall debate.
target: Deba ki pe derule lor kestyon elektrisite ek CEB, li form parti sa gran deba-la.

input: At the moment when Jack Bizlall, Swaleh Kasenally, Jean Mée Desvaux are arguing, it is mainly about the cost of production.
target: Pu lemoman deba ant Jack Bizlall, Swaleh Kasenally, Jean Mée Desvaux, li preske inikman lor kestyon ku prodiksyon.

input: It’s about whether the CEB is producing electricity cheaper than the Sugar Estates.
target: Eski CEB prodir elektrisite pli bonmarse ki Tablisman?

input: It’s about whether, based on the cost of production,  it should be the Sugar Estates, multinational corporations, or the CEB itself that produces power.
target: Baze lor ku prodiksyon eski li bizin Tablisman uswa korporasyon miltinasyonal, uswa CEB ki bizin prodir elektrisite dan Moris ek Rodrig.

input: And sometimes the debate also scouts around the edges of the equally important question of privatization.
target: Parfwa deba la tus kestyon privatizasyon.

input: In Lalit’s campaign, we are linking two-or-three important issues into the debate.
target: Dan kanpayn Lalit, nu ule liye de-trwa zafer inportan ansam.

input: Firstly, we believe it is a fundamental human right to have a power supply in one’s home.
target: Furnitir kuran dan lakaz dimunn li enn drwa sosyal.

input: At the same time, we believe that the new generation of “ecological rights” gives us a basic right to an unpolluted environment.
target: Enn lanvironnman san polisyon ler, ni polisyon sonor, li enn “drwa anvironnmantal”.

input: This means we believe that the debate should not be limited to the question of the selling price of what is a “factor of production” for some consumers and a mere “commodity” for others.
target: Alor, nu pa kapav kantonn deba-la a kestyon pri de vant enn fakter dan prodiksyon (pu serten konsomater) ubyen enn komodite (pu lezot).

input: With the increases in our electricity bills coming so regularly, with a number of families being burnt to death because of having to use candle-light in times when the precautions for these are no longer even known, with increasing unemployment, and with work that is here today gone tomorrow, the right to an electric supply in the home (as well as other things like running water, telephone, public transport) has to be respected.
target: Dan kad enn seri ogmantasyon preske konstan papye lalimyer CEB, e fas a enn seri lamor fami antye ki servi labuzi pu lalimyer, fas a somaz agrandisan e travay deplizanpli preker, drwa a elektrisite (e lezot infrastriktir sosyal kuma dilo, telefonn, transpor) bizin sibvansyone.

input: If this means subsidy, it must be subsidized. We must point out that Mauritius is a signatory, and that since 1976, to the UN Convention on Social and Economic Rights.
target: Tusala form parti dan drwa imen fondamantal. Dayer Moris enn sinnyater depi 1976 Konvansyon UN lor Drwa Sosyal ek Ekonomik.

input: At the same time, with the pollution being caused by “fossil-fuels”, and with the Sugar Industry (responsible for bagasse) imploding; Lalit is thus launching a double element in this campaign: No to privatization of the CEB! And pressure for CEB to turn to research and massive investment in sources of modern, clean and genuinely renewable energy.
target: An memtan, dan kad degradasyon lanatir par polisyon depi “fossil-fuels”; dan kad inplozyon iminan lindistri disik li-mem ki pe prodir enn parti kuran avek bagas ki reste dan prosesis fer disik, Lalit pe lans enn dub kanpayn: Kont privatizasyon CEB, e pu ki Guvernman ek CEB turn ver resers ek investisman masif dan surs lenerzi modern, prop e veritableman renuvlab.

input: Let us not now, as we finally get free (forcibly, as it turns out) from the prison of sugar, become prisoners of cane-for-bagasse. Land must be freed for the huge food production for export that is necessary.
target: Fode pa nu vinn prizonye kann-akoz-bagas asterla, zis kan nu pe oblize sorti dan prizon kann-akoz-disik. Bizin liber later pu plantasyon alimanter.

input: Renewable sources of power create employment as well as keeping the environment in harmony.
target: Prodiksyon lenerzi renuvlab li kree anplwa, e li an armoni avek enn devlopman pli seren lindistri turistik, parski so polisyon pu buku mwens.

input: The future lies in renewable power sources.
target: Lavenir li truv dan lenerzi renuvlab.

input: And it is Government that should be made to take the initiative.
target: Nu bizin fors Guvernman pran so responsabilite.

input: Everywhere in the world where there are developments in the use of Wind Power, for example, it is through “government-enabling initiatives”, whether in Germany, Denmark, USA, Spain, India, the UK and the Netherlands, in the first generation, and now in China, Canada, various South American countries, and Australia.
target: Dan tu pei kot ena lavansman ver Lenerzi Eyolyenn par exanp, se guvernman laba ki pran ledevan: Lalmayn, Dannmark, USA, Lespayn, Lenn, G.Bretayn, Laoland dan enn premye tan, ek Lasinn, Kanada, pei Lamerik Latinn ek Lostrali dan enn dezyem tan.

input: In the USA, the biggest ever Wind Farm took only one year to set up.
target: Dan Leta Zini, pli gran Laferm Eyolyenn (Wind Farm) dan lemond ti konstrir dan enn sel banane.
E li finn kree par milye plas travay.

input: Instead of paying for increasingly expensive fossil fuels, the same money pays workers for the ongoing upkeep of the farm.
target: An zeneral par milyon KWH verse lor grid nasyonal depi bann Laferm Eyolyenn.

input: Wind Power is already cheaper than coal-produced power (if you include as a cost the health bills of miners).
target: Deza Lenerzi Eyolyenn pli bonmarse ki prodiksyon lenerzi par sarbonnter (kan u inklir ku lasante pu travayer minn sarbonnter).

input: Mauritius, Rodrigues and Agalega are blessed with constant South East Trade Winds that make wind energy very easy.
target: Moris, Rodrig ek Agalega gayn divan Trade Winds a titre depi Sid-Es, preske tut long lane.

input: CEB is planning already to set up 3 Wind turbines in Trefles, in Rodrigues.
target: Li byen bon ki CEB pe planifye 3 tirbinn Eyolyenn dan Trefles, Rodrig. Me, li pa sifi.

input: As well as Wind Power being an enormous potential, there is also power production from the movement of the sea, which is ideal for islands like Mauritius, Rodrigues and Agalega.
target: Prodiksyon lenerzi par muvman lamer, li osi, byen interesan pu Moris, Rodrig ek Agalega.

input: There is both Wave Energy (one type of technology, where turbines are turned by the coming and going of each wave near the edge of the sea) and there is Tidal Energy (the constant rise and fall of the tide turning turbines).
target: Kapav servi muvman vag (enn kalite tirbinn kot lamonte-desann sak vag servi kuma enn lafors pu vir li), ek osi servi pwisans sanzman lamare (lamare-monte, lamare bese) kot ena enn lot teknolozi.

input: Britain has recently invested 1.1 million pounds in a Tidal plant.
target: Gran Bretayn finn fek-la investi plis ki enn milyon liv Sterling lor enn zenerater baze lor lamare.

input: So, instead of Mauritius continuing to accept old technology (and often ‘dumping’ of obsolete technology from Europe and elsewhere), we propose massive investment in new, modern forms of power-production.
target: Alor, anplas Moris kontinye aksepte vye, vye teknolozi (avek enn bon doz ‘dumping’ depi Lerop ek ayer), nu pe propoz investisman masif dan form lenerzi ki ena lavenir.

input: World-wide (and here it is the same) people are sick to death of development plans that are concocted in the interests of facilitating capitalists and their profit.
target: Partu dan lemond, e dan Moris ek Rodrig li parey: Dimunn finn plen ar enn devlopman dan lintere profi enn poyne misye. Nu finn plen ar bann Guvernman ki azir kuma fasilitater pu sa bann misye ki pe fer profi-la.
