input: Word had gone round during the day that old Major, the prize Middle White boar, had had a strange dream on the previous night and wished to communicate it to the other animals.
target: Pandan lazourne koze ti pe fane ki Bonom Mazor, enn koson mal kouler blan kase ki ti gagn Premie Pri Konkour Bote, ti fer enn rev etranz lanwit dernie e li ti anvi kominik sa ar lezot zanimo.

input: It had been agreed that they should all meet in the big barn as soon as Mr. Jones was safely out of the way.
target: Zot ti tom dakor pou zwenn dan gran langar kouma Misie.

input: Old Major (so he was always called, though the name under which he had been exhibited was Willingdon Beauty) was so highly regarded on the farm that everyone was quite ready to lose an hour’s sleep in order to hear what he had to say.
target: Bonom Mazor (sa ti so nom gate me nom ki Misie Jonns ti donn li kan li ti partisip dan konkour ti Bote Sanparey) ti respekte par tou zanimo e akoz sa tou zanimo ti pare pou perdi enn ertan somey pou kapav ekout li.

input: At one end of the big barn, on a sort of raised platform, Major was already ensconced on his bed of straw, under a lantern which hung from a beam.
target: Dan fon langar ti ena enn sort podiom lor ki Bonom Mazor ti fini tale lor enn ti matla lapay. Lor so latet, anpandan lor enn travers, ti ena enn fanal.

input: He was twelve years old and had lately grown rather stout, but he was still a majestic-looking pig, with a wise and benevolent appearance in spite of the fact that his tushes had never been cut.
target: Bonom la ti ena douz an e depi enn tan li ti bien grosi me li pa ti finn perdi so louk monarsik ki ti montre sazes ek bonte malgre ki so ledan kaninn ti bien vizib.

input: Before long the other animals began to arrive and make themselves comfortable after their different fashions.
target: Bien vit bann zanimo ti koumans vini e zot ti pran zot plas e ti kas enn poz kouma zot ti abitie.

input: First came the three dogs, Bluebell, Jessie, and Pincher, and then the pigs, who settled down in the straw immediately in front of the platform.
target: Premie dabor, trwa lisien, Fler Mov, Jesi ek Lake Koupe ti arive; answit bann koson ki ti al plak zot lor lapay koste ar podiom.

input: The hens perched themselves on the window-sills, the pigeons fluttered up to the rafters, the sheep and cows lay down behind the pigs and began to chew the cud.
target: Bann poul ti asiz lor rebor lafnet; bann pizon ti al poz lor bann travers; bann mouton ek vas ti al asiz deryer bann koson e komdabitid zot ti koumans rimine.

input: The two cart-horses, Boxer and Clover, came in together, walking very slowly and setting down their vast hairy hoofs with great care lest there should be some small animal concealed in the straw.
target: De seval ki ris saret, Boxer ek Tref, ti vini ansam e zot ti fer bien atansion tansion zot gro sabo bles bann ti zanimo ki ti kapav dan lapay.

input: Clover was a stout motherly mare approaching middle life, who had never quite got her figure back after her fourth foal.
target: Tref ti enn ziman portan ki ti bien maternel; li ti ni zenn, ni vie; e li pa ti regagn lekor zennfi depi nesans so katriyem poulen.

input: Boxer was an enormous beast, nearly eighteen hands high, and as strong as any two ordinary horses put together.
target: Boxer ti enn gran bebet, enn met katroven ot e li ti ena lafors de seval.

input: A white stripe down his nose gave him a somewhat stupid appearance, and in fact he was not of first-rate intelligence, but he was universally respected for his steadiness of character and tremendous powers of work.
target: Enn re blan lor so nene ti fer li paret kouyon. Bizen aksepte ki li pa ti enn zeni me tou zanimo ti respekte li pou so karakter ferm ek so gran kapasite travay.

input: After the horses came Muriel, the white goat, and Benjamin, the donkey.
target: Apre de seval la, Miryel, enn kabri blan, ek Benzamen, bourik lor laferm, ti rantre.

input: Benjamin was the oldest animal on the farm, and the worst tempered.
target: Benzamen, limem ti pli vie lor laferm e li ti ena bien move karakter.

input: He seldom talked, and when he did, it was usually to make some cynical remark for instance, he would say that God had given him a tail to keep the flies off, but that he would sooner have had no tail and no flies.
target: Li pa ti tro kontan koze e ler li ti koze li ti dir bann zafer zanfout. Par ekzanp ti kapav tann li dir ki Bondie ti donn li enn lake pou pous mous me ti pou preferab si pa ti ena ni lake, ni mous.

input: Alone among the animals on the farm he never laughed.
target: Li ti sel zanimo lor laferm ki zame ti riye.

input: If asked why, he would say that he saw nothing to laugh at.
target: Kan dimann li kifer, li ti pe dir ki li pa ti trouv nanye komik.

input: Nevertheless, without openly admitting it, he was devoted to Boxer.
target: Malgre sa, ansekre, li ti ena boukou afeksion pou Boxer.

input: The two of them usually spent their Sundays together in the small paddock beyond the orchard, grazing side by side and never speaking.
target: Dan Dimans sa de la ti pas lazourne dan enn ti padok lot kote verze e zot ti pou manz lerb trankilman san koze.

input: The two horses had just lain down when a brood of ducklings, which had lost their mother, filed into the barn, cheeping feebly and wandering from side to side to find some place where they would not be trodden on.
target: Zis apre ki de seval la ti asize, enn porte ti kanar orfelen ti rant dan langar; zot ti kwenkkwenke dousman e zot ti pe rod enn plas kot lezot pa ti pou kraz zot.

input: Clover made a sort of wall round them with her great foreleg, and the ducklings nestled down inside it and promptly fell asleep.
target: Tref ar so de lapat divan ti antour zot pou protez zot. Bann ti kanar la ti gagn li bonn dan zot ti lanklo e bien vit zot ti gagn somey.

input: At the last moment Mollie, the foolish, pretty white mare who drew Mr. Jones’s trap, came mincing daintily in, chewing at a lump of sugar.
target: Dernie ler Moli ti rantre. Li ti enn zoli ziman blan me lakrem kouyon. Limem ki ti pe ris karyol Misie Jonns. Ar so pa mannken, bataz alert, li ti pe sous enn kare disik.

input: She took a place near the front and began flirting her white mane, hoping to draw attention to the red ribbons it was plaited with.
target: Li ti pran enn plas divan e tanzantan li ti pe sakouy so krinier pou montre riban rouz ki ti trese ar so pwal.

input: Last of all came the cat, who looked round, as usual, for the warmest place, and finally squeezed herself in between Boxer and Clover; there she purred contentedly throughout Major’s speech without listening to a word of what he was saying.
target: Sat ti dernie pou vini. Komdabitid li ti rod plas plis pli so ek konfortab e finalman li ti al rant ant Boxer ek Tref. La, li ti ronrone san traka pandan diskour Bonom Mazor san ekout enn sel mo.

input: All the animals were now present except Moses, the tame raven, who slept on a perch behind the back door.
target: Tou bann zanimo ti prezan exepte Moiz, enn korbo aprivwaze, ki ti dormi lor enn bar kot laport deryer.

input: When Major saw that they had all made themselves comfortable and were waiting attentively, he cleared his throat and began:
target: Kan Bonom Mazor ti trouve ki tou bann zanimo ti dan zot plas e ti pe atann so diskour ar enpasians, li ti dres so lagorz e ti koumanse:

input: Comrades, you have heard already about the strange dream that I had last night.
target: Kamarad, zot tou kone ki mo ti fer enn rev etranz yer swar.

input: But I will come to the dream later.
target: Me taler mo pou koz lor la.

input: I have something else to say first.
target: Dabor mo ena enn zafer enportan pou dir zot.

input: I do not think, comrades, that I shall be with you for many months longer, and before I die, I feel it my duty to pass on to you such wisdom as I have acquired.
target: Mo pa res boukou letan pou viv me avan mo mor mo kwar li mo devwar partaz ar zot seki mo finn aprann.

input: I have had a long life, I have had much time for thought as I lay alone in my stall, and I think I may say that I understand the nature of life on this earth as well as any animal now living.
target: Mo finn bien viv e mo finn gagn boukou letan, ler mo repoze dan mo stal, pou reflesi lor lavi lor later e mo kapav dir ki mo konpran natir ekzistans osi bien ki nenport ki zanimo vivan.

input: It is about this that I wish to speak to you.
target: Se sa ki mo anvi koz ar zot.

input: Now, comrades, what is the nature of this life of ours?
target: Aster, kamarad, ki kalite lavi nou pe viv?

input: Let us face it: our lives are miserable, laborious, and short.
target: Nou get laverite anfas: nou pas mizer, nou travay dir, nou mor zenn.

input: We are born, we are given just so much food as will keep the breath in our bodies, and those of us who are capable of it are forced to work to the last atom of our strength; and the very instant that our usefulness has come to an end we are slaughtered with hideous cruelty.
target: Nou ne, nou gagn zis enn bouse manze pou res vivan, seki kapav travay rente ziska dernie gout disan; kouma nou kouraz fini, zot touy nou san pitie.

input: No animal in England knows the meaning of happiness or leisure after he is a year old.
target: Okenn zanimo dan nou pei pa konn boner ek lwazir apartir laz enn an.

input: No animal in England is free.
target: Okenn zanimo dan Angleter pa konn liberte.

input: The life of an animal is misery and slavery: that is the plain truth.
target: Nou manz lamizer ek nou bwar esklavaz: Samem laverite.

input: But is this simply part of the order of nature?
target: Be eski sa li normal sa?

input: Is it because this land of ours is so poor that it cannot afford a decent life to those who dwell upon it?
target: Eski later dan nou pei li telman pov ki li pa kapav nouri so zanfan?

input: No, comrades, a thousand times no!
The soil of England is fertile, its climate is good, it is capable of affording food in abundance to an enormously greater number of animals than now inhabit it.
target: Ki pou nou Later Angleter li bien fertil, so klima bon, li kapav nouri kouma bizen enn popilasion zanimo plis enportan ki zordi.

input: This single farm of ours would support a dozen horses, twenty cows, hundreds of sheep and all of them living in a comfort and a dignity that are now almost beyond our imagining.
target: Sa sel laferm-la kapav nouri enn douzenn seval, enn ventenn vas, plizier santenn mouton e nou tou kapav viv dan konfor ek dinite ki depas nou limazinasion.

input: Why then do we continue in this miserable condition?
target: Ki fer nou bizin viv dan sa kondisyon mizerab-la?

input: Because nearly the whole of the produce of our labour is stolen from us by human beings.
target: Parski tou seki nou prodir bann imen koken.

input: There, comrades, is the answer to all our problems.
target: Samem, kamarad, lasours tou nou problem.

input: It is summed up in a single word: Man.
target: Enn mo ase pou dir tou: imen.

input: Man is the only real enemy we have.
target: Imen samem nou sel vre ennmi.

input: Remove Man from the scene, and the root cause of hunger and overwork is abolished for ever.
target: Ras pouvwar imen, e rasinn lafen, dominasion ek explwatasion brile net ek disparet pou toultan.

input: Man is the only creature that consumes without producing.
target: Imen li sel kreatir ki konsome san prodwir.

input: He does not give milk, he does not lay eggs, he is too weak to pull the plough, he cannot run fast enough to catch rabbits.
target: Li pa donn dile, li pa ponn dizef, li tro feb pou ris lasari, li pa kapav galoup ase vit pou may lapen.

input: Yet he is lord of all the animals.
target: E li senyer tou bann zanimo.

input: He sets them to work, he gives back to them the bare minimum that will prevent them from starving, and the rest he keeps for himself.
target: Li fer zot travay, li donn nou enn ti bouse manze pou anpes nou kreve e li plen so pos ar nou travay.

input: Our labour tills the soil, our dung fertilises it, and yet there is not one of us that owns more than his bare skin.
target: Ar nou travay, later vinn prodiktif, ar nou fimie later vinn plis fertil me nou res nwar touni. Apart lapo-lezo nou peyna nanye.

input: You cows that I see before me, how many thousands of gallons of milk have you given during this last year?
target: Zot, bann vas ki divan mwa, zot kone komie milie galon dile zot finn done depi koumansman lane?

input: And what has happened to that milk which should have been breeding up sturdy calves?
target: Ki finn ariv sa dile la ki ti bizen nouri ek fortifie ti zenis ek toro?

input: Every drop of it has gone down the throats of our enemies.
target: Sak gout al dan lagorz nou bann ennmi.

input: And you hens, how many eggs have you laid in this last year, and how many of those eggs ever hatched into chickens?
target: Zot, bann poul, komie dizef zot ponn dan enn an? Komie dizef finn met kouve e finn eklo?

input: The rest have all gone to market to bring in money for Jones and his men.
target: Laplipar finn al bazar e gro lamone finn plen pos Jonns ek so bann zom.

input: And you, Clover, where are those four foals you bore, who should have been the support and pleasure of your old age?
target: Twa Tref, kot sa kat poulen ki to ti met ba e ki ti kapav okip twa ek soulaz twa dan to vie zour?

input: Each was sold at a year old you will never see one of them again.
target: Kouma zot ti gagn enn an ti vann zot e zame to pou retrouv zot ankor.

input: In return for your four confinements and all your labour in the fields, what have you ever had except your bare rations and a stall?
target: Pou kat akousman e tou travay ki to fer dan karo, to zis gagn enn bouse manze ek enn stal pou dormi.

input: And even the miserable lives we lead are not allowed to reach their natural span.
target: Malgre nou lavi dan pens, pa les nou mor natirelman.

input: For myself I do not grumble, for I am one of the lucky ones.
target: Mo pa gagn drwa plengne parski mo finn gagn sans.

input: I am twelve years old and have had over four hundred children.
target: Mo ena douz an e mo finn fer kat san zanfan.

input: Such is the natural life of a pig.
target: Sa li parkour natirel enn koson.

input: But no animal escapes the cruel knife in the end.
target: Me laplipar perdi lavi ar kouto bouse.

input: You young porkers who are sitting in front of me, every one of you will scream your lives out at the block within a year.
target: Zot, bann ti koson divan mwa, avan lane fini, zot tou pou konn douler ler kouto koup zot lagorz lor biyo.

input: To that horror we all must come: cows, pigs, hens, sheep, everyone.
target: Nou tou pou konn sa martir la: vas, koson, poul, mouton, tou.

input: Even the horses and the dogs have no better fate.
target: Mem seval ek lisien dan mem take.

input: You, Boxer, the very day that those great muscles of yours lose their power, Jones will sell you to the knacker, who will cut your throat and boil you down for the foxhounds.
target: Twa boxer, kan to bann misk perdi rannman, to plas labatwar kot pou trans to lagorz pou prepar manze pou lisien lasas.

input: As for the dogs, when they grow old and toothless, Jones ties a brick round their necks and drowns them in the nearest pond.
target: Kan lisien vinn tro vie, Jonns atas enn gro ros otour zot likou pou nway zot dan basen.

input: Is it not crystal clear, then, comrades, that all the evils of this life of ours spring from the tyranny of human beings?
target: Kan zot pou konpran, kamarad, ki lasours nou maler li pran nesans dan tirani imen?

input: Only get rid of Man, and the produce of our labour would be our own.
target: Bayant imen e lerla nou vinn propriyeter valer nou travay.

input: Almost overnight we could become rich and free.
target: Deswit nou vinn ris; deswit nou vinn lib.

input: Why, work night and day, body and soul, for the overthrow of the human race!
target: Lanwit-lizour nou bizen organize e lite pou ranvers pouvwar imen.

input: That is my message to you, comrades: Rebellion!
target: Ala mo mesaz: sel solision, revolision!

input: I do not know when that Rebellion will come, it might be in a week or in a hundred years, but I know, as surely as I see this straw beneath my feet, that sooner or later justice will be done.
target: Pa dimann mwa kan li pou vini. Kapav dan enn semenn; kapav dan san banane. Seki mo sir, osi sir ki mo santi lapay anba mo lipie, se ki enn zour pa enn zour nou pou gagn lazistis.

input: Fix your eyes on that, comrades, throughout the short remainder of your lives!
target: Konsantre lor la kamarad sak zour dan zot lavi kourt.

input: And above all, pass on this message of mine to those who come after you, so that future generations shall carry on the struggle until it is victorious.
target: Sirtou pa bliye pas mesaz la ar bann ki pou vinn apre zot pou ki fitir zenerasion kontinie lalit ziska laviktwar final.

input: And remember, comrades, your resolution must never falter.
No argument must lead you astray.
target: Pa les propagann anbet zot lespri.

input: Never listen when they tell you that Man and the animals have a common interest, that the prosperity of the one is the prosperity of the others.
target: Pa kwar zot kan zot rabase e dir ki imen ek zanimo ena enn lentere ek desten komen; kan enn gagne, lotla si gagne.

input: Man serves the interests of no creature except himself.
target: Imen konn zis so prop lentere.

input: And among us animals let there be perfect unity, perfect comradeship in the struggle.
target: E parmi zanimo bizen ena linite ek solidarite pou lalit avanse.

input: At this moment there was a tremendous uproar.
target: Zis sa moman la ti ena enn gran garrbarr.

input: While Major was speaking four large rats had crept out of their holes and were sitting on their hindquarters, listening to him.
target: Pandan Ki Bonom Mazor ti pe koze, kat gro lera ti sorti depi zot trou, ti asiz lor zot deryer pou ekoute.

input: The dogs had suddenly caught sight of them, and it was only by a swift dash for their holes that the rats saved their lives.
target: Bann lisien ki ti finn trouv zot e si bann lera la pa ti konn bour brit pou rant dan trou, zot ti pou fini laba mem.

input: Major raised his trotter for silence.
target: Bonom Mazor ti lev so lapat divan pou dir bann zanimo aret fer tapaz e ekout li.

input: Comrades, he said, here is a point that must be settled.
target: Kamarad, li ti dir, ala enn zafer ki nou bizen regle.

input: The wild creatures, such as rats and rabbits are they our friends or our enemies?
target: Bann zanimo ki pa domestik kouma lera ek lapen, eski zot ar nou ousa kont nou?

input: Let us put it to the vote.
I propose this question to the meeting: Are rats comrades?
target: Mo poz lasanble enn kestion: Eski lera nou bann ousa bannla?

input: The vote was taken at once, and it was agreed by an overwhelming majority that rats were comrades.
target: Lasanble ti vote e preske tou manm prezan ti axepte ki lera ti bizen konsidere kouma kamarad.

input: There were only four dissentients, the three dogs and the cat, who was afterwards discovered to have voted on both sides.
target: Zis kat ti kont, ti ena trwa lisien la ek sat, ki pli tar ti dekouver ki li ti vot de kote.

input: I have little more to say.
target: Pa res gran soz pou dir zot.

input: I merely repeat, remember always your duty of enmity towards Man and all his ways.
target: Nou rekapitile: Bizen toultan konbat imen ek so kiltir.

input: Whatever goes upon two legs is an enemy.
target: Seki mars lor de lapat li enn ennmi.

input: Whatever goes upon four legs, or has wings, is a friend.
target: Seki mars lor kat lapat ousa ena lezel li enn dalon.

input: And remember also that in fighting against Man, we must not come to resemble him.
target: Rapel osi ki kan nou pe konbat imen falepa nou fer kouma li.

input: Even when you have conquered him, do not adopt his vices.
target: Kan nou finn ranvers li, falepa nou adopte so move manier.

input: No animal must ever live in a house, or sleep in a bed, or wear clothes, or drink alcohol, or smoke tobacco, or touch money, or engage in trade.
target: Falepa zanimo viv dan lakaz; falepa dormi lor lili; falepa met lenz; falepa bwar lakol, fim sigaret, servi lamone ek fer biznes.

input: All the habits of Man are evil.
And, above all, no animal must ever tyrannise over his own kind.
target: Enportan: enn zanimo pa gagn drwa fer dominer ar enn lot zanimo.

input: Weak or strong, clever or simple, we are all brothers.
target: Ki nou for, ki nou feb, ki nou malen ousa enpe bet, nou tou ser-frer.

input: No animal must ever kill any other animal.
target: Enn zanimo pa gagn drwa touy enn lot zanimo.

input: And now, comrades, I will tell you about my dream of last night.
target: Aster, kamarad, mo pou dir zot rev ki mo ti fer yer swar.

input: I cannot describe that dream to you.
It was a dream of the earth as it will be when Man has vanished.
target: Li ti enn vizion kouma lemonn pou ete kan imen finn disparet.

input: But it reminded me of something that I had long forgotten.
target: Li ti fer mwa rapel enn zafer ki mo ti bliye.

input: Many years ago, when I was small, my mother and the other sows used to sing an old song of which they knew only the tune and the first three words.
target: Lontan-lontan ler mo ti tipti mo mama ek bann lezot mama ti pe sant enn santé tradisionel. Zot ti rapel zis so ler ek trwa premie mo.

input: I had known that tune in my infancy, but it had long since passed out of my mind.
target: Mo ti konn sante la kan mo ti zanfan me li ti efase dan mo memwar.

input: Last night, however, it came back to me in my dream.
target: Me yer swar li ti revini dan mo rev.

input: And what is more, the words of the song also came back  words, I am certain, which were sung by the animals of long ago and have been lost to memory for generations.
target: E seki plis extra se ki bann mo sante la ti revini. Samem sante ki bann zanimo ti pe sante bien avan letan lontan. Malsans li ti tengn dan nou memwar, zenerasion apre zenerasion.

input: I will sing you that song now, comrades.
target: Mo pou sant sa sante-la aster,kamarad.

input: I am old and my voice is hoarse, but when I have taught you the tune, you can sing it better for yourselves.
target: Mo vie e mo lavwa anrwe, me ler mo finn montre zot sante la, zot pou kapav sant li bien pou zotmem.

input: It is called Beasts of England.
Old Major cleared his throat and began to sing.
target: Bonom Mazor ti dres so lagorz e ti koumans sante.

input: As he had said, his voice was hoarse, but he sang well enough, and it was a stirring tune, something between Clementine and La Cucaracha.
target: Kouma li ti dir, so lavwa ti anrwe me li ti sant ase bien enn melodi ki tous leker. Sante la ti ant Klemantinn ek La Koukaracha.

input: Beasts of England, beasts of Ireland, Beasts of every land and clime, listen to my joyful tidings Of the golden future time.
target: Zanimo Angleter, zanimo Lirland, zanimo tou kontinan, ekout mesaz lavenir.

input: Almost before Major had reached the end, they had begun singing it for themselves.
target: Avan mem ki Bonom Mazor ti fini sante, zot ti koumans sant pou zotmem.

input: Even the stupidest of them had already picked up the tune and a few of the words, and as for the clever ones, such as the pigs and dogs, they had the entire song by heart within a few minutes.
target: Mem bann ki ti pli bet ti fini konn so ler ek detrwa mo, e bann pli malen, kouma koson ek lisien, ti fini konn li par ker net bien vit.

input: And then, after a few preliminary tries, the whole farm burst out into Beasts of England in tremendous unison.
target: E lerla, apre detrwa repetision, zot tou anker ti sant zanimo Angleter for-for.

input: The cows loved it, the dogs whined it, the sheep bleated it, the horses whinnied it, the ducks quacked it.
target: Bann vas ti kontan li; bann lisien ti wawwaw li; bann mouton ti baabaa li; bann seval ti hiiiinnhiiinn li; bann kanar ti kwakkwak li.

input: They were so delighted with the song that they sang it right through five times in succession, and might have continued singing it all night if they had not been interrupted.
target: Zot ti pe gagn li telman bonn ki zot ti sant li senk fwa dafile e zot ti pou kontinie toutlanwit si pa ti deranz zot.

input: Unfortunately, the uproar awoke Mr. Jones, who sprang out of bed, making sure that there was a fox in the yard.
target: Malerezman, tapaz la ti kas somey Misie Jonns ki ti sorti lor lili parski li ti sir ki renar ti rant dan lakour.

input: He seized the gun which always stood in a corner of his bedroom, and let fly a charge of number 6 shot into the darkness.
target: Li ti pran so fizi, kal dan enn kwen so lasam e tir detrwa kou.

input: The pellets buried themselves in the wall of the barn and the meeting broke up hurriedly.
target: Bann bal fane rant dan miray langar; renion arete andezord.

input: Everyone fled to his own sleeping-place.
target: Sakenn retourn dan zot prop plas dormi.

input: The birds jumped on to their perches, the animals settled down in the straw, and the whole farm was asleep in a moment.
target: Bann zwazo retourn lor zot bar; bann zanimo al dormi lor zot lapay, e lor vites tou ti revinn trankil.

input: Three nights later old Major died peacefully in his sleep.
target: Trwa nwit pli tar, Bonom Mazor ti mor dan so somey san soufer.

input: His body was buried at the foot of the orchard.
target: Ti anter so lekor dan fon verze.
Sa ti dan koumansman mwa Mars.

input: During the next three months there was much secret activity.
target: Pandan trwa mwa ki ti swiv ti ena boukou aktivite sekre.

input: Major’s speech had given to the more intelligent animals on the farm a completely new outlook on life.
target: Diskour Bonom Mazor ti vinn dan latet bann zanimo entelizan enn nouvo vizion.

input: They did not know when the Rebellion predicted by Major would take place, they had no reason for thinking that it would be within their own lifetime, but they saw clearly that it was their duty to prepare for it.
target: Zot pa ti kone kan revolision ki Bonom Mazor ti predir ti pou arive; zot pa ti ena okenn rezon kwar ki zot ti pou trouv sa avan zot mor; me zot ti sir ki li ti zot devwar fer tou pou prepar teren.

input: The work of teaching and organising the others fell naturally upon the pigs, who were generally recognised as being the cleverest of the animals.
target: Normal travay edikasion ek organizasion ti tom lor bann koson ki tou zanimo ti consider kouma kreatir plis entelizan.

input: Pre-eminent among the pigs were two young boars named Snowball and Napoleon, whom Mr. Jones was breeding up for sale.
target: Top parmi zot ti ena de mal, Boulkoton ek Napoleon ki Misie Jonns ti pe swagne pou vande.

input: Napoleon was a large, rather fierce-looking Berkshire boar, the only Berkshire on the farm, not much of a talker, but with a reputation for getting his own way.
target: Napoleon ti enn gran mal ras Barkshir, sel koson Barkshir lor laferm. Li ti ena enn regar danzere; rar li ti koze; me tou zanimo ti kone ki li ti extra konn trase.

input: Snowball was a more vivacious pig than Napoleon, quicker in speech and more inventive, but was not considered to have the same depth of character.
target: Boulkoton ti plis debrouyar ki Napoleon, pli bon orater ek pli entelizan me li ti mank epeser dan so karakter.

input: All the other male pigs on the farm were porkers.
target: Bann lezot koson mal ti pe angrese pou fer zanbon.

input: The best known among them was a small fat pig named Squealer, with very round cheeks, twinkling eyes, nimble movements, and a shrill voice.
target: Parmi zot ti ena enn ti koson bien gra ki ti apel Tronpet. Li ti ena gro lazou ron, lizie ki briye, demars fasil e enn lavwa fite kouma lam razwar.

input: He was a brilliant talker, and when he was arguing some difficult point he had a way of skipping from side to side and whisking his tail which was somehow very persuasive.
target: Li ti enn extra bon orater e kan li ti pe devlop enn argiman difisil, li ti ena enn manier sot-sot agos-adrwat, fwet so lake ki ti enpresionn lezot.

input: The others said of Squealer that he could turn black into white.
target: Bann lezot zanimo ti kontan dir ki Tronpet ti kapav fer nwar vinn blan.

input: These three had elaborated old Major’s teachings into a complete system of thought, to which they gave the name of Animalism.
target: Sa trwa la ti finn fer lansengnman Bonom Mazor vinn enn sistem panse entegral ki zot ti apel Zanimoism.

input: Several nights a week, after Mr. Jones was asleep, they held secret meetings in the barn and expounded the principles of Animalism to the others.
target: Plizier fwa aswar sak semenn, ler Misie Jonns ti pe dormi, zot ti organiz bann renion sekre dan langar pou montre lezot bann prensip Zanimoism.

input: At the beginning they met with much stupidity and apathy.
target: Dan koumansman zot ti bizen fer fas ar boukou stipidite ek pares mantal.

input: Some of the animals talked of the duty of loyalty to Mr. Jones, whom they referred to as Master, or made elementary remarks such as Mr. Jones feeds us.
target: Ena zanimo ki ti panse ki zot ti bizen rekonesan anver Misie Jonns ki zot ti apel zot 'met e patron'; ena ki ti pe dir, Misie Jonns donn nou manze.

input: If he were gone, we should starve to death.
target: Si li ale, nou pou mordefen.

input: Others asked such questions as why should we care what happens after we are dead?
target: Lezot ti poz sa kalite kestion la, kifer fatig latet lor seki pou arive kan nou finn fini mor?

input: or â€˜If this Rebellion is to happen anyway, what difference does it make whether we work for it or not?
target: Ousa, â€œSi revolision inevitab, kifer nou rent nou nam pou fer li arive?

input: The pigs had great difficulty in making them see that this was contrary to the spirit of Animalism.
target: Bann koson ti pe gagn taksion pou fer zot konpran ki tousa ti kont lespri Zanimoism.

input: The stupidest questions of all were asked by Mollie, the white mare.
target: Kestion plis kouyon ti dimande par Moli, ziman blan.

input: The very first question she asked Snowball was: will there still be sugar after the Rebellion?
target: Premie kestion ki li ti dimann Boulkoton se: apre revolision, eski pou ena disik?
Non, Boulkoton ti reponn avek lafors.

input: We have no means of making sugar on this farm.
target: Nou pa kapav prodwir disik lor sa laferm la.

input: You will have all the oats and hay you want.
target: Me to pou gagn otan lerb ek lavwann ki neseser.

input: And shall I still be allowed to wear ribbons in my mane? asked Mollie.
target: Mo pou gagn drwa met riban dan mo krinier?Moli ti dimande.

input: Comrade, said Snowball, those ribbons that you are so devoted to are the badge of slavery.
target: Kamarad,Boulkoton ti reponn, sa riban ki to adore, li senbol to esklavaz.

input: Can you not understand that liberty is worth more than ribbons?
target: Kan to pou konpran ki liberte vo plis ki riban?

input: Mollie agreed, but she did not sound very convinced.
target: Moli ti res trankil me li ti kler ki so lopinion pa ti sanze.

input: The pigs had an even harder struggle to counteract the lies put about by Moses, the tame raven.
target: Me bann mansonz Moiz, korbo aprivwaze, ti fer plis dimal.

input: Moses, who was Mr. Jones’s especial pet, was a spy and a tale-bearer, but he was also a clever talker.
target: Moiz, prefere Misie Jonns, ti enn espion ek enn faner rimer, e lor la li ti konn pas bagou.

input: He claimed to know of the existence of a mysterious country called Sugarcandy Mountain, to which all animals went when they died.
target: Li ti pe dir zot ki li ti konn enn landrwa misterye ki ti apel Montagn Sikdorz kot tou zanimo ale apre lamor.

input: It was situated somewhere up in the sky, a little distance beyond the clouds, Moses said.
target: Sa landrwa la ti dan lesiel, enpe pli ot ki niaz, Moiz ti dir.

input: In Sugarcandy Mountain it was Sunday seven days a week, clover was in season all the year round, and lump sugar and linseed cake grew on the hedges.
target: Dan Montagn Sikdorz, toulezour Dimans; gagn lerb tann toultan; bann baraz banbou kouver ar disik ek gato koko.

input: The animals hated Moses because he told tales and did no work, but some of them believed in Sugarcandy Mountain, and the pigs had to argue very hard to persuade them that there was no such place.
target: Bann zanimo pa ti kontan Moiz parski li ti nek rakont zistwar me zame li pa ti bizen travay parski ti ena zanimo ki ti kwar dan Montagn Sikdorz, bann koson ti bizen travay overtaym pou fer zot konpran ki tousa ti fos.

input: Their most faithful disciples were the two cart-horses, Boxer and Clover.
target: De disip bien fidel ti Boxer ek Tref.

input: These two had great difficulty in thinking anything out for themselves, but having once accepted the pigs as their teachers, they absorbed everything that they were told, and passed it on to the other animals by simple arguments.
target: Sa de la ti gagn gran difikilte pou panse par zotmem me kouma zot ti axepte koson kouma zot profeser, zot ti pran pou lamone kontan tou seki ti pe dir zot e zot ti pas mesaz la dan enn langaz bien senp.

input: They were unfailing in their attendance at the secret meetings in the barn, and led the singing of Beasts of England, with which the meetings always ended.
target: Zot ti prezan dan tou bann renion noktirn e zot ti diriz sante 'Zanimo Nou Pei' ar ki ti klotir bann renion.

input: Now, as it turned out, the Rebellion was achieved much earlier and more easily than anyone had expected.
target: Me anverite revolision ti akonpli bien avan e pli fasilman ki ti panse.

input: In past years Mr. Jones, although a hard master, had been a capable farmer, but of late he had fallen on evil days.
target: Dan lepase Misie Jonns ti enn bon fermie malgre ki li ti bien sever me depi enn tan li ti koumans fane.

input: He had become much disheartened after losing money in a lawsuit, and had taken to drinking more than was good for him.
target: Apre ki li ti finn perdi boukou lamone dan enn kees lakour, li ti koumans bwar enpe tro.

input: For whole days at a time he would lounge in his Windsor chair in the kitchen, reading the newspapers, drinking, and occasionally feeding Moses on crusts of bread soaked in beer.
target: Zour apre zour li ti pou kas poz dan lakwizinn dan so fotey spesial, lir lagazet, antonn labier e tanzantan li ti donn Moiz enn bout dipen tranpe dan labier.

input: His men were idle and dishonest, the fields were full of weeds, the buildings wanted roofing, the hedges were neglected, and the animals were underfed.
target: So bann travayer ti vinn pares ek malonet; bann karo ti ranpli ar move lerb; fetaz bann batiman ti pe depaye; baraz banbou ti vinn dezord e bann zanimo pa ti pe gagn ase manze.

input: June came and the hay was almost ready for cutting.
target: Kan lemwa Zwen ti arive, karo ti pare pou lakoup.

input: On Midsummer’s Eve, which was a Saturday, Mr. Jones went into Willingdon and got so drunk at the Red Lion that he did not come back till midday on Sunday.
target: Lavey ekinox ki ti enn Samdi, Misie Jonns ti al dan tavern vilaz e li ti telman sou ki li pa ti kapav retourn kot li avan midi Dimans.

input: The men had milked the cows in the early morning and then had gone out rabbiting, without bothering to feed the animals.
target: Bann travayer ti tir dile vas e apre zot ti al lasas san donn zanimo manze.

input: When Mr. Jones got back he immediately went to sleep on the drawing-room sofa with the News of the World over his face, so that when evening came, the animals were still unfed.
target: Kan Misie Jonns ti retourn kot li, li ti al kas enn poz lor divan dan salon ar lagazet Wikenn lor so figir. Kan labrim ti koumans leve, bann zanimo pa ti ankor gagn manze.

input: At last they could stand it no longer.
One of the cows broke in the door of the store-shed with her horn and all the animals began to help themselves from the bins.
target: Enn vas ti defons ar so korn laport stor kot gard manze e tou zanimo ti al plen zot boyo.

input: It was just then that Mr. Jones woke up.
target: Lerla ki Misie Jonns ti leve.

input: The next moment he and his four men were in the store-shed with whips in their hands, lashing out in all directions.
target: Li ek so bann zom ti rant dan stor, fwet dan lame. Fwet koumans kras dife dan tou direksion.

input: This was more than the hungry animals could bear.
With one accord, though nothing of the kind had been planned beforehand, they flung themselves upon their tormentors.
target: Enstenktivman tou bann zanimo anmemtan ti fons lor bann imen kriel.

input: Jones and his men suddenly found themselves being butted and kicked from all sides.
target: Jonns ek so bann zom pa ti atann kontatak zanimo. Zot ti gagn kout lapat, kout korn partou kote.

input: The situation was quite out of their control.

They had never seen animals behave like this before, and this sudden uprising of creatures whom they were used to thrashing and maltreating just as they chose, frightened them almost out of their wits.
target: Zame zot ti finn trouv bann zanimo fer koumsa. Sa revolt bann zanimo ki zot ti abitie bate ek maltrete ti fer zot petpom.

input: After only a moment or two they gave up trying to defend themselves and took to their heels.
target: Bien vit zot ti abandone e ti koumans kas pikan.

input: A minute later all five of them were in full flight down the cart-track that led to the main road, with the animals pursuing them in triumph.
target: Enn minit pli tar zot ti pe galoupe ver gransime e bann zanimo deryer zot ti pe kriye laviktwar.

input: Mrs. Jones looked out of the bedroom window, saw what was happening, hurriedly flung a few possessions into a carpet bag, and slipped out of the farm by another way.
target: Madam Jonns ti get par lafnet e ler li ti realize seki ti pe arive, li ti met detrwa zafer dan enn sak e li ti disparet par enn lot sime.

input: Moses sprang off his perch and flapped after her, croaking loudly.
target: Moiz ti kit so bar, bat so lezel pou swiv Madam la dan ler.

input: Meanwhile the animals had chased Jones and his men out on to the road and slammed the five-barred gate behind them.
target: Ala li ti pe kriye for-for! Letansa bann zanimo ti pous bann imen andeor Baz Jonns, ti ferm geet dibwa.

input: And so, almost before they knew what was happening, the Rebellion had been successfully carried through: Jones was expelled, and the Manor Farm was theirs.
target: Tou ti ariv kouma veritab mirak. Revolision la ti enn sikse; Baz Jonns ti sanz lame.

input: For the first few minutes the animals could hardly believe in their good fortune.
target: Pandan plizier minit bann zanimo pa ti'le kwar zot lizie.

input: Their first act was to gallop in a body right round the boundaries of the farm, as though to make quite sure that no human being was hiding anywhere upon it.
target: San reflesi zot tou ansam ti met enn lekours otour laferm la, koumadir li ti neseser cheke ki tou bann imen ti disparet.

input: Then they raced back to the farm buildings to wipe out the last traces of Jones’s hated reign.
target: Lerla zot ti retourn kot bann batiman pou eliminn tou bann tras rengn tiranik bann imen.

input: The harness-room at the end of the stables was broken open; the bits, the nose-rings, the dog-chains, the cruel knives with which Mr. Jones had been used to castrate the animals, were all flung down the well.
target: Dan fon lekiri ti ena enn godon kot ti gard bann arne, bann zafer ki ti pe servi pou atas bann zanimo, bann enstriman pou kastre bann zanimo e zot ti al zet tou dan pwi.

input: The whips also went into the fire.
All the animals capered with joy when they saw the whips going up in flames.
target: Bann zanimo ti sante-danse ler zot ti trouv bann fwet pe brile.

input: Snowball also threw on to the fire the ribbons with which the horses’ manes and tails had usually been decorated on market days.
target: Boulkoton ti osi zet dan dife bann riban ki ti servi pou dekor krinier ek lake seval zour lafwar.

input: Ribbons, he said, should be considered as clothes, which are the mark of a human being.
target: Riban, li ti dir, mem zafer ki lenz. Enn koutim imen sa.

input: When Boxer heard this he fetched the small straw hat which he wore in summer to keep the flies out of his ears, and flung it on to the fire with the rest.
target: Kan Boxer ti tann sa, li ti al sers so sapo ki li ti pe mete pou anpes mous pik-pik li e li ti zet li dan dife ar lezot kiksoz.

input: In a very little while the animals had destroyed everything that reminded them of Mr. Jones.
target: Bien vit bann zanimo ti detrir tou seki ti rapel zot lepok Misie Jonns.

input: Napoleon then led them back to the store-shed and served out a double ration of corn to everybody, with two biscuits for each dog.
target: Apre sa Napoleon ti amenn zot dan stor kot gard manze e li ti donn sak zanimo doub rasion may e sak lisien ti gagn de biskwi.

input: Then they sang Beasts of England from end to end seven times running, and after that they settled down for the night and slept as they had never slept before.
target: Apre zot ti sant 'Zanimo Nou Pei' set fwa boutanbout e apre sa zot ti al dormi. Zame zot ti dormi bien koumsa.

input: But they woke at dawn as usual, and suddenly remembering the glorious thing that had happened, they all raced out into the pasture together.
target: Lelandime zot ti leve boner gramaten kom dabitid e ler zot rapel seki ti arive lavey, zot tou ti al groupe dan patiraz.

input: A little way down the pasture there was a knoll that commanded a view of most of the farm.
target: Enpe pli lwen ti ena enn ti kolinn e depi laba ti kapav gagn enn vi konple laferm la.

input: The animals rushed to the top of it and gazed round them in the clear morning light.
target: Bann zanimo la ti fonse, mont lao e zot ti admir bote otour zot dan lalimier kler gramaten.

input: Yes, it was theirs everything that they could see was theirs!
target: Tou seki zot lizie ti pe montre zot ti net pou zot.

input: In the ecstasy of that thought they gambolled round and round, they hurled themselves into the air in great leaps of excitement. They rolled in the dew, they cropped mouthfuls of the sweet summer grass, they kicked up clods of the black earth and snuffed its rich scent.
target: Sa ti ranpli zot latet ek zot leker ar lazwa e zot ti galoup toutotour; fer koustik dan ler; roul-roul dan laroze; ranpli zot labous ar bon lerb tann; fouy later ar zot lapat e santi bon loder later.

input: Then they made a tour of inspection of the whole farm.
target: Apre zot ti vizit tou bann landrwa dan laferm la.

input: They surveyed with speechless admiration the ploughland, the hayfield, the orchard, the pool, the spinney.
target: Ar lagorz amare ar admirasion, zot ti kontanple bann karo fek laboure, bann karo plantasion, verze, basen, ti danbwa.

input: It was as though they had never seen these things before, and even now they could hardly believe that it was all their own.
target: Koumadir zame zot ti trouv tousa avan e zot pa ti'le kwar ki tousa ti net pou zot.

input: Then they filed back to the farm buildings and halted in silence outside the door of the farmhouse.
target: Apre, enn deryer lot, zot ti desann, al kot bann batiman e ansilans zot ti aret divan laport grannkaz.

input: That was theirs too, but they were frightened to go inside.
target: Sa'wsi ti pou zot, Me zot ti tro per pou rant andan.

input: After a moment, however, Snowball and Napoleon butted the door open with their shoulders and the animals entered in single file, walking with the utmost care for fear of disturbing anything.
target: Apre enn timoman ezitasion, Boulkoton ek Napoleon, ar enn kout zepol, ti ouver laport la e bann zanimo ti rantre enn deryer lot. Zot ti fer extra atansion tansion zot deranz kiksoz.

input: They tiptoed from room to room, afraid to speak above a whisper and gazing with a kind of awe at the unbelievable luxury, at the beds with their feather mattresses, the looking-glasses, the horsehair sofa, the Brussels carpet, the lithograph of Queen Victoria over the drawing-room mantelpiece.
target: Lor pwent lipie zot ti vizit lasam par lasam; zot ti telman enpresione ki zot ti pe zis mirmire e koumadir dan silans legliz, zot ti admir lix enkrwayab otour zot: lili ar matla plim poul, laglas, sofa rekouver ar pwal seval, karpet persan, foto larenn omilie miray.

input: They were just coming down the stairs when Mollie was discovered to be missing.
target: Ler zot ti pe desann leskalie, zot ti dekouver ki Moli ti disparet.

input: Going back, the others found that she had remained behind in the best bedroom.
target: Zot ti retourn lao e laba, dan pli zoli lasam, zot ti trouv Moli.

input: She had taken a piece of blue ribbon from Mrs. Jones’s dressing-table, and was holding it against her shoulder and admiring herself in the glass in a very foolish manner.
target: Li ti pran enn bout riban ble dan tirwar Madam Jonns e li ti poz li lor so zepol e li ti pe admir limem dan laglas kouma enn fol.

input: The others reproached her sharply, and they went outside.
target: Zot tou ti fann ar li avan zot sorti.

input: Some hams hanging in the kitchen were taken out for burial, and the barrel of beer in the scullery was stove in with a kick from Boxer’s hoof, otherwise nothing in the house was touched.
target: Zot ti okip lanterman lakwis zanbon ki ti pe anpandan dan lakwizinn; Boxer ti defons enn barik labier dan lofis. Apart sa zot pa ti tous nanye.

input: A unanimous resolution was passed on the spot that the farmhouse should be preserved as a museum.
target: Ti ena enn mosion ki grannkaz ti pou vinn enn mize e tou dimoun ti dakor.

input: All were agreed that no animal must ever live there.
target: Ti ena enn desizion inanim ki zame enn zanimo ti pou viv dan sa lakaz la.

input: The animals had their breakfast, and then Snowball and Napoleon called them together again.
target: Apre tidezene, Boulkoton ek Napoleon ti rasanble tou bann zanimo.

input: Comrades, said Snowball, it is half-past six and we have a long day before us.
target: Kamarad, Boulkoton ti dir, finn fini sizer-edmi e nou ena enn long lazourne divan nou.

input: Today we begin the hay harvest.
But there is another matter that must be attended to first.
target: Me avan, ena enn zafer pli prese.

input: The pigs now revealed that during the past three months they had taught themselves to read and write from an old spelling book which had belonged to Mr. Jones’s children and which had been thrown on the rubbish heap.
target: Lerla ki bann koson ti fer kone ki depi trwa mwa zot ti pe aprann lir ek ekrir dan enn vie liv ki bann zanfan Jonns ti finn servi e ki ti finn zete dan salte.

input: Napoleon sent for pots of black and white paint and led the way down to the five-barred gate that gave on to the main road.
target: Napoleon ti donn lord amen lapentir nwar ek blan e li ti al divan-divan dan direksion geet dibwa kot gran sime.

input: Then Snowball (for it was Snowball who was best at writing) took a brush between the two knuckles of his trotter, painted out MANOR FARM from the top bar of the gate and in its place painted ANIMAL FARM.
target: Lerla Boulkoton (li ti enn jak lor lekritir) ti trap enn penso ar so lapat, pas lapentir lor nom BAZ JONNS e dan so plas li ti ekrir baz zanimo.

input: This was to be the name of the farm from now onwards.
target: Apartir sa moman la samem ti pou nom laferm la.

input: After this they went back to the farm buildings, where Snowball and Napoleon sent for a ladder which they caused to be set against the end wall of the big barn.
target: Apre zot ti retourn kot bann batiman e Boulkoton ek Napoleon ti fer enstal enn lesel kont extansion miray langar.

input: They explained that by their studies of the past three months the pigs had succeeded in reducing the principles of Animalism to Seven Commandments.
target: Zot ti explike ki pandan trwa mwa zot letid ti finn demontre ki bann prensip Zanimoism ti kapav rezime par Set Komannman.

input: These Seven Commandments would now be inscribed on the wall; they would form an unalterable law by which all the animals on Animal Farm must live for ever after.
target: Aster zot pou fixe lor miray sa Set Komannman la ki pou vinn lalwa fondamantal permanan ki pou diriz ek kontrol lavi ek konportman tou zanimo pou toultan.

input: With some difficulty (for it is not easy for a pig to balance himself on a ladder) Snowball climbed up and set to work, with Squealer a few rungs below him holding the paint-pot.
target: Avek difikilte (pa fasil pou enn koson tini drwat lor enn lesel) Boulkoton ti koumans louvraz la; Tronpet ti zis detrwa bar pli ba ar enn touk lapentir dan so lapat divan.

input: The Commandments were written on the tarred wall in great white letters that could be read thirty yards away.
target: Bann Komannman ti ekrir an blan lor enn fon koltar nwar. Bann let la ti ase gro pou ki zot ti lizib trant met pli lwen.

input: 1 Whatever goes upon two legs is an enemy.
target: 1 Seki mars lor de lapat li enn ennmi.

input: 2 Whatever goes upon four legs, or has wings, is a friend.
target: 2 Seki mars lor kat lapat ousa ena lezel li enn kamarad.

input: 4 No animal shall sleep in a bed.
6 No animal shall kill any other animal.
target: 6 Falepa zanimo touy enn lot zanimo.

input: It was very neatly written, and except that friend was written freind and one of the S’s was the wrong way round, the spelling was correct all the way through.
target: Tex la ti bien prop, san fot apart 'kamarad' ti ekrir 'karamad' ek 's' ti koumadir pe get li dan laglas.

input: Snowball read it aloud for ‎the benefit of the others.
target: Boulkoton ti lir bann Komannman aotvwa pou ed bann ki pa ti konn lir.

input: All the animals nodded in complete agreement, and the cleverer ones at once began to learn the Commandments by heart.
target: Tou bann zanimo ti sakouy latet pou dir ki zot ti foul dakor e bann ki ti pli malen ti koumans aprann bann Komannman par ker.

input: Now, comrades, cried Snowball, throwing down the paint-brush, to the hayfield! Let us make it a point of honour to get in the harvest more quickly than Jones and his men could do.
target: Aster, kamarad, Boulkoton ti kriye for apre ki li ti finn zet so penso, nou al dan karo! Nou montre bann imen ki nou kapav fer enn travay pli sasi ki zot.

input: But at this moment the three cows, who had seemed uneasy for some time past, set up a loud lowing.
target: Me zis salerla, bann vas ki ti finn montre sign endispozision ti koumans begle for-for.

input: They had not been milked for twenty-four hours, and their udders were almost bursting.
target: Pa ti finn tir zot dile depi plis ki vennkat er e zot tetinn ti pre pou eklate.

input: After a little thought, the pigs sent for buckets and milked the cows fairly successfully, their trotters being well adapted to this task.
target: Apre enn timoman reflexion bann koson ti dimann seo e ar bout zot lapat zot ti kapav tir dile vas.

input: Soon there were five buckets of frothing creamy milk at which many of the animals looked with considerable interest.
target: Toutswit apre zot ti ranpli senk seo ar dile epe apetisan. Bann zanimo ti enpresione.

input: What is going to happen to all that milk? said someone.
target: Ki pou fer ar sa dile la? enn zanimo ti dimande.

input: Jones used sometimes to mix some of it in our mash, said one of the hens.
target: Jonns ti abitie melanz li ar manze poul, enn poul ti dir.

input: Never mind the milk, comrades! cried Napoleon, placing himself in front of the buckets.
target: Bliye dile, kamarad, Napoleon ti dir e li ti vinn dibout divan bann seo la.
Plis enportan se travay dan karo.

input: Comrade Snowball will lead the way.
target: Kamarad Boulkoton pou diriz operasion la.

input: I shall follow in a few minutes.
target: Dan detrwa minit mo pou vinn zwenn zot.

input: Forward, comrades! The hay is waiting.
target: Fonse kamarad, travay prese pe atann!

input: So the animals trooped down to the hayfield to begin the harvest, and when they came back in the evening it was noticed that the milk had disappeared.
target: Tou bann zanimo ti al dan karo pou koumans lakoup e aswar ler zot ti retourne, zot ti remarke ki dile la ti disparet.

input: How they toiled and sweated to get the hay in!
target: Ala zot ti rente, ala zot ti transpire pou ramas rekolt la. Me zot pa ti fer zefor dan vid parski

input: But their efforts were rewarded, for the harvest was an even bigger success than they had hoped.
target: lakoup ti enn pli gran sikse ki zot ti espere.

input: Sometimes the work was hard; the tools had been designed for human beings and not for animals, and it was a great drawback that no animal was able to use any tool that involved standing on his hind legs.
target: Parfwa travay la ti extra dir; bann zouti ti fer pou travay imen, pa pou travay zanimo e pli gran difikilte se ki bann zanimo pa ti kone kouma pou tini lor lapat deryer ler zot itiliz enn zouti.

input: But the pigs were so clever that they could think of a way round every difficulty.
target: Me bann koson ti telman malen ki zot ti toultan trouv enn sime pou kontourn nenport ki difikilte.

input: As for the horses, they knew every inch of the field, and in fact understood the business of mowing and raking far better than Jones and his men had ever done.
target: Bann seval ti konn realite karo boutanbout. Anfet zot ti pli konn travay koupaz ek grataz ki Jonns ek so bann travayer.

input: The pigs did not actually work, but directed and supervised the others.
target: Bann koson pa ti travay me ti kontrole ek dirize lezot.

input: With their superior knowledge it was natural that they should assume the leadership.
target: Akoz zot konesans siperyer, normal ki zot ti pran lidership.

input: In the end they finished the harvest in two days less time than it had usually taken Jones and his men.
target: Alafen, rekolt ti pran de zour mwens ki dan lepok Jonns.

input: Moreover, it was the biggest harvest that the farm had ever seen.
The hens and ducks with their sharp eyes had gathered up the very last stalk.
target: Bann poul ek kanar avek zot lizie person zot ti zwenn pou enn dernie fwa.

input: And not an animal on the farm had stolen so much as a mouthful.
target: E okenn zaniomo dan laferm pa ti kokin kantite enn bouse manze.

input: All through that summer the work of the farm went like clockwork.
target: Pandan lete travay ti bien regilie.

input: The animals were happy as they had never conceived it possible to be.
Every mouthful of food was an acute positive pleasure, now that it was truly their own food, produced by themselves and for themselves, not doled out to them by a grudging master.
target: Sak bouse manze ti donn enn plezir spesial parski zot ki ti prodwir zot prop manze e zot pa ti ena pou ekout bann komanter negatif ki bann imen ti pe fer avan.

input: With the worthless parasitical human beings gone, there was more for everyone to eat.
target: Avek disparision bann parazit imen, ti ena plis manze pou tou zanimo.

input: There was more leisure too, inexperienced though the animals were.
target: Ti ena osi plis lwazir malgre ki bann zanimo pa ti tro kone kouma pou fer.

input: Boxer was the admiration of everybody.
target: Boxer ki ti enn admirasion pou tou dimounn.

input: He had been a hard worker even in Jones’s time, but now he seemed more like three horses than one; there were days when the entire work of the farm seemed to rest on his mighty shoulders.
target: Travay zame ti fer li per. Me aster li ti pe montre kouraz trwa seval. Parfwa ti pe gagn lenpresion ki san li nanye pa ti pou arive.

input: From morning to night he was pushing and pulling, always at the spot where the work was hardest.
target: Depi gramaten ziska aswar li ti partou kot so lafors ti neseser.

input: He had made an arrangement with one of the cockerels to call him in the mornings half an hour earlier than anyone else, and would put in some volunteer labour at whatever seemed to be most needed, before the regular day’s work began.
target: Li ti fer enn aranzman ar enn kok pou sante demi-er pli boner pou ki li kapav okip zafer irzan avan travay normal koumanse.

input: His answer to every problem, every setback, was I will work harder! which he had adopted as his personal motto.
target: Sak fwa ti ena problem ek difikilte li ti reponn prezan ar so moto Mo pou travay plis.

input: But everyone worked according to his capacity.
target: Sak zanimo ti kontribie dapre so kapasite.

input: The hens and ducks, for instance, saved five bushels of corn at the harvest by gathering up the stray grains.
target: Par ekzanp, bann poul ek kanar ti reysi ramas plizier kilo may ki ti kapav perdi dan karo.

input: Nobody stole, nobody grumbled over his rations, the quarrelling and biting and jealousy which had been normal features of life in the old days had almost disappeared.
target: Okenn zanimo pa ti koken ousa plengne ki pa ti pe gagn ase manze; bizbiz, lager ek zalouzi ki ti minn lavi lontan ti finn preske disparet.
Okenn zanimo pa ti kasiet lekor anfen preske.

input: Mollie, it was true, was not good at getting up in the mornings, and had a way of leaving work early on the ground that there was a stone in her hoof.
target: Moli ti gagn difikilte leve gramaten e souvan li ti kit travay boner akoz enn ti ros ti rant dan so sabo.

input: And the behaviour of the cat was somewhat peculiar.
It was soon noticed that when there was work to be done the cat could never be found.
target: Sak fwa ki ti ena travay pou fer, sat la ti maynes.

input: She would vanish for hours on end, and then reappear at meal-times, or in the evening after work was over, as though nothing had happened.
target: Li ti pou disparet pandan enn long peryod me rekta li ti pou paret ler manze ousa dan tanto kan travay pou lazourne ti konplete. Anplis vadire tousa ti bien normal.

input: But she always made such excellent excuses, and purred so affectionately, that it was impossible not to believe in her good intentions.
target: Me li ti toultan donn bon exkiz e so ronronnman ti telman senser ki okenn zanimo pa ti kapav dout li.

input: Old Benjamin, the donkey, seemed quite unchanged since the Rebellion.
target: Vie Benzamen, sel bourik lor laferm, pa ti sanze ditou.

input: He did his work in the same slow obstinate way as he had done it in Jones’s time, never shirking and never volunteering for extra work either.
target: Li ti parey kouma avan.Li pa ti kouyonn servis me li ti refiz travay siplemanter.

input: About the Rebellion and its results he would express no opinion.
target: Li pa ti donn so lopinion lor revolision.

input: When asked whether he was not happier now that Jones was gone, he would say only Donkeys live a long time.
target: Kan ti dimann li si li pa ti plis ere aster ki Jonns nepli la, li ti reponn, Bourik viv lontan.

input: None of you has ever seen a dead donkey, and the others had to be content with this cryptic answer.
target: Okenn parmi zot pa finn trouv enn bourik mor, e tou zanimo ti oblize aksepte so repons misterye kouma parabol.

input: On Sundays there was no work.
target: Zour Dimans pa ti ena travay.

input: Breakfast was an hour later than usual, and after breakfast there was a ceremony which was observed every week without fail.
target: Nasta ti fer enn ertan pli tar e apre ti ena enn seremoni ki ti fer rekta toulesemenn.

input: First came the hoisting of the flag.
Snowball had found in the harness-room an old green tablecloth of Mrs. Jones’s and had painted on it a hoof and a horn in white.
target: Boulkoton ti dekouver enn tapi ver e lor la anblan li ti penn enn sabo ek enn korn.

input: This was run up the flagstaff in the farmhouse garden every Sunday, morning.
target: Ti fer sa flote lor lema, ki ti dan lakour, toule Dimans.

input: The flag was green, Snowball explained, to represent the green fields of England, while the hoof and horn signified the future Republic of the Animals which would arise when the human race had been finally overthrown.
target: Boulkoton ti explike ki ver senboliz bann karo  plantasion dan Angleter; sabo ek korn senboliz pouvwar zanimo kan imen pou finn disparet net.

input: After the hoisting of the flag all the animals trooped into the big barn for a general assembly which was known as the Meeting.
target: Apre ki ti finn lev pavyon, tou bann zanimo ti rasanble dan langar pou enn lasanble zeneral ki ti apel 'Miting'.

input: Here the work of the coming week was planned out and resolutions were put forward and debated.
target: La ti fer plan pou lasemenn ki ti pe vini e ti diskit ek vot bann mosion.

input: It was always the pigs who put forward the resolutions.
target: Bann koson ki ti pe propoz bann mosion.

input: The other animals understood how to vote, but could never think of any resolutions of their own.
target: Bann lezot zanimo ti kone kouma pou vote me zame zot ti fouti vinn ar zot prop mosion.

input: Snowball and Napoleon were by far the most active in the debates.
target: Se Boulkoton ek Napoleon ki ti plis feros dan deba.

input: But it was noticed that these two were never in agreement: whatever suggestion either of them made, the other could be counted on to oppose it.
target: Me li ti pe vinn kler ki sa de la zame ti dakor lor okenn zafer. Si enn ti propoz kiksoz, benker sek lot la ti pou opoze.

input: Even when it was resolved a thing no one could object to in itself to set aside the small paddock behind the orchard as a home of rest for animals who were past work, there was a stormy debate over the correct retiring age for each class of animal.
target: Mem kan pa ti posib ena polemik kouma ler ti deside pou kre enn ti padok pou bann vie zanimo retrete, ti ena enn diskision violan lor laz retret pou sak group zanimo.

input: The Meeting always ended with the singing of Beasts of England, and the afternoon was given up to recreation.
target: Miting ti touzour klotire ar santé Zanimo Nou Angleter, e pandan leres lazourne bann zanimo ti lib.

input: The pigs had set aside the harness-room as a headquarters for themselves. Here, in the evenings, they studied blacksmithing, carpentering, and other necessary arts from books which they had brought out of the farmhouse.
target: Bann koson ti fer godon dan fon lekiri vinn zot biro kot zot ti pe aprann metie forzron, menwizie ek lezot metie dan bann liv ki zot ti pran dan grannkaz.

input: Snowball also busied himself with organising the other animals into what he called Animal Committees.
target: Boulkoton ti organiz bann komite zanimo.

input: He formed the Egg Production Committee for the hens, the Clean Tails League for the cows, the Wild Comrades Re-education Committee (the object of this was to tame the rats and rabbits), the Whiter Wool Movement for the sheep, and various others, besides instituting classes in reading and writing.
target: Li ti kre Komite Prodiksion pou bann poul, Lel Lake Prop pou bann vas, Komite Re-edikasion Pou Kamarad San Kiltir (sa ti pou fer lera ek lapen vinn sivilize), Mouvman Lalenn Pli Blan Ki Blan e plizier lezot komite. Apart sa ti ena bann klas literesi.

input: On the whole, these projects were a failure.
The attempt to tame the wild creatures, for instance, broke down almost immediately.
target: Komite pou aprivwaz lera ek lapen ti mor avan li ti ne.

input: They continued to behave very much as before, and when treated with generosity, simply took advantage of it.
target: Zot ti kontinie fer kouma avan. Zot ti zis profite kan ti tret zot bien.

input: The cat joined the Re-education Committee and was very active in it for some days.
target: Sat ti rant dan Komite Re-edikasion e li ti bien aktif pandan detrwa zour.

input: She was seen one day sitting on a roof and talking to some sparrows who were just out of her reach.
target: Enn fwa ti trouv li lor twa grannkaz pe koz ar bann mwano.

input: She was telling them that all animals were now comrades and that any sparrow who chose could come and perch on her paw; but the sparrows kept their distance.
target: Li ti pe dir zot ki zot ti kapav vinn dibout lor so lapat parski tou zanimo zot kamarad aster; me bann mwano ti prefer gard enn bon distans.

input: The reading and writing classes, however, were a great success.
target: Bann klas literesi ti enn gran sikse.

input: After a few months, almost every animal on the farm was literate in some degree.
target: Apre detrwa mwa, preske tou zanimo ti konn lir ek ekrir selon zot kapasite.

input: As for the pigs, they could already read and write perfectly.
The dogs learned to read fairly well, but were not interested in reading anything except the Seven Commandments.
target: Bann lisien pa ti move me zot ti refiz lir plis ki Set Komannman.

input: Muriel, the goat, could read somewhat better than the dogs, and sometimes used to read to the others in the evenings from scraps of newspaper which she found on the rubbish heap.
target: Miryel, enn kabri, ti pli kone ki bann lisie e parfwa li ti lir for pou lezot bann bout lagazet ki li ti ramase dan depotwar.

input: Benjamin could read as well as any pig, but never exercised his faculty.
target: Benzamen, nou bourik, ti konn otan ki bann koson me li ti refiz lir.

input: So far as he knew, he said, there was nothing worth reading.
target: Li ti kontan dir ki pa ti ena nanye enportan pou lir.

input: Clover learnt the whole alphabet, but could not put words together.
target: Tref ti konn tou alfabet me li ti enkapab met de mo ansam dan enn fraz.

input: Boxer could learn A, B, C, D.
target: Boxer ti reysi aprann A, B, C, D.

input: In the dust with his great hoof, and then would stand staring at the letters with his ears back, sometimes shaking his forelock, trying with all his might to remember what came next and never succeeding.
target: Ar so gro sabo li ti desinn sa kat let la lor later. Lerla li ti dibout pou admir so kreasion, dres so zorey e sakouy krinier ki ti tom lor so fron.

input: On several occasions, indeed, he did learn E, F, G, H, but by the time he knew them, it was always discovered that he had forgotten A, B, C, and D.
target: Parfwa li ti reysi aprann E, F, G, H me kan sa ti arive, li ti bliye A, B, C, D.

input: Finally he decided to be content with the first four letters, and used to write them out once or twice every day to refresh his memory.
target: Finalman li ti deside ki kat premie let ti ase. Pa ti bizen plis. Li ti pratik regilierman so kat let pou rafresi so memwar.

input: Mollie refused to learn any but the six letters which spelt her own name.
target: Moli ti aprann zis kat let ki ti neseser pou ekrir so nom: M, O, L, I.

input: She would form these very neatly out of pieces of twig, and would then decorate them with a flower or two and walk round them admiring them.
target: Li ti form sa kat let la ar tibout dibwa, dekor zot ar detrwa fler e lerla li ti fer zot letour pou admir zot.

input: None of the other animals on the farm could get further than the letter A.
target: Me mazorite zanimo pa ti depas A.

input: It was also found that the stupider animals, such as the sheep, hens, and ducks, were unable to learn the Seven Commandments by heart.
target: Bann zanimo bien bet kouma mouton, poul ek kanar pa ti pe kapav aprann bann komannman par ker.

input: After much thought Snowball declared that the Seven Commandments could in effect be reduced to a single maxim, namely: Four legs good, two legs bad.
target: Apre boukou zefor, Boulkoton ti deklare ki ti posib senplifie tou e amalgam bann komannman dan enn sel prensip: Kat lapat bon, de lapat move.

input: This, he said, contained the essential principle of Animalism.
target: Sa propozision la ti fer tou vinn enn.

input: Whoever had thoroughly grasped it would be safe from human influences.
target: Kan ti finn bien konpran sa, lenflians imen ti pou bat lamok.

input: The birds at first objected, since it seemed to them that they also had two legs, but Snowball proved to them that this was not so.
target: Bann zwazo ti obzekte parski dapre zot, zot ti ena de lipie me Boulkoton ti prouv zot ki zot ti dan erer.

input: A bird’s wing, comrades, he said, is an organ of propulsion and not of manipulation. It should therefore be regarded as a leg.
target: Kamarad, li ti dir, lezel li enn organn propilsion. Pa servi li pou trape kouma imen servi lame. Si servi li pou bouze, avanse, savedir li enn organn parey kouma lapat.

input: The distinguishing mark of man is the hand, the instrument with which he does all his mischief.
target: Imen servi lame e se lame ki enstriman so dominasion.

input: The birds did not understand Snowball’s long words, but they accepted his explanation, and all the humbler animals set to work to learn the new maxim by heart.
target: Pou bann zwazo, explikasion Boulkoton ti tro konplike me zot ti aksepte li. Bann ti zanimo ordiner ti koumans fer zefor pou aprann sa prensip la par ker.

input: FOUR LEGS GOOD, TWO LEGS BAD, was inscribed on the end wall of the barn, above the Seven Commandments and in bigger letters.
target: Ti azout KAT LAPAT BON, DE LAPAT MOVE lor extansion miray langar pli lao ek pli gro ki lezot komannman.

input: When they had once got it by heart, the sheep developed a great liking for this maxim, and often as they lay in the field they would all start bleating Four legs good, two legs bad!
target: Enn fwa ki zot ti finn aprann sa bien, bann mouton ti extra kontan sa slogan la. Kan zot ti pe kas enn poz dan patiraz zot ti pou baabaa slogan la: Kat lapat bon, de lapat move!

input: Four legs good, two legs bad! and keep it up for hours on end, never growing tired of it.
target: Kat lapat bon, de lapat move! Zot ti pou ale mem pandan plizier ertan san fatige.

input: Napoleon took no interest in Snowball’s committees.
target: Napoleon pa ti enterese ditou ar bann komite Boulkoton.

input: He said that the education of the young was more important than anything that could be done for those who were already grown up.
target: Dapre li ledikasion bann zenn ti boukou plis enportan ki nenport ki zafer ki ti kapav fer pou bann ki ti finn fini grandi.

input: It happened that Jessie and Bluebell had both helped soon after the hay harvest, giving birth between them to nine sturdy puppies.
target: Ti arive, Jesi ek Fler Mov, ki ti toulde ede toutswit apre rekolt ti met ba antou nef ti toutou gayar.

input: As soon as they were weaned, Napoleon took them away from their mothers, saying that he would make himself responsible for their education.
target: Kouma zot ti aret tete ar zot mama, Napoleon ti separ zot ar zot mama. Li ti dir zot ki li personelman ti pou okip zot ledikasion.

input: He took them up into a loft which could only be reached by a ladder from the harness-room, and there kept them in such seclusion that the rest of the farm soon forgot their existence.
target: Li ti ferm zot dan grenie lao godon. Ti bizen servi lesel pou kapav mont dan grenie la. Li ti ferm zot laba e ti koup tou kontak ant zot ek leres laferm.

input: After some time other animals completely forgot about their existence.
target: Apre enpe letan lezot zanimo ti bliye zot lekzistans net.

input: It was mixed every day into the pigs’ mash.
target: Toulezour bann koson ti pe melanz li ar zot nouritir.

input: The early apples were now ripening, and the grass of the orchard was littered with windfalls.
target: Dan verze bann fri ti pe koumans mir. Sak fwa ki labriz ti soufle, enn kantite ti pe tom anba.

input: The animals had assumed as a matter of course that these would be shared out equally;
target: Bann zanimo ti kwar ki tou bann zanimo ti pou gagn zot par.

input: one day, however, the order went forth that all the windfalls were to be collected and brought to the harness-room for the use of the pigs.
target: Me enn zour enn lord ti koumans sirkile ki ti bizen ramas bann fri, ki ti finn tonbe, dan godon pou koson manze.

input: At this some of the other animals murmured, but it was no use.
target: Malgre ki bann lezot zanimo ti mekontan, nanye pa ti sanze.

input: All the pigs were in full agreement on this point, even Snowball and Napoleon.
target: Lor la, mem Boulkoton ek Napoleon ti foul dakor.

input: Squealer was sent to make the necessary explanations to the others.
target: Zot ti avoy Tronpet pou explike kifer sa ti neseser.

input: Comrades! he cried. You do not imagine, I hope, that we pigs are doing this in a spirit of selfishness and privilege?
target: Kamarad, li ti irle, mo sir zot konpran ki nou, bann koson, nou pa pe fer sa parki nou egois ousa nou kwar nou siperyer.

input: Many of us actually dislike milk and apples.
target: Anverite nou pa kontan dile ek pom.

input: Our sole object in taking these things is to preserve our health.
target: Me nou oblize manz sa pou prezerv nou lasante.

input: Milk and apples (this has been proved by Science, comrades) contain substances absolutely necessary to the well-being of a pig.
target: Siyans finn demontre ki fri ek dile neseser pou lasante koson.

input: He makes our brains work well so that we can take care of the animal farm as needed; so that we can look after them soon.
target: Li fer nou servo travay bien pou ki nou kapav okip Baz Zanimo kouma bizen; pou ki nou kapav okip zot biennet.

input: By the late summer the news of what had happened on Animal Farm had spread across half the county.
target: Ver lafen lete, nouvel lor seki ti finn arive dan Baz Zanimo ti fini fane dan enn bon parti pei.

input: Every day Snowball and Napoleon sent out flights of pigeons whose instructions were to mingle with the animals on neighbouring farms, tell them the story of the Rebellion, and teach them the tune of Beasts of England.
target: Toulezour Boulkoton ek Napoleon ti pe avoy enn trale pizon dan bann laferm dan leparaz pou ki zot rakont Revolision e pou montre zot sant 'Zanimo Angleter'.

input: Most of this time Mr. Jones had spent sitting in the taproom of the Red Lion at Willingdon, complaining to anyone who would listen of the monstrous injustice he had suffered in being turned out of his property by a pack of good-for-nothing animals.
target: Pandan tousa letan la Misie Jonns ti pe asiz dan tavern e ti pe rakont so mizer: kouma enn geng zanimo vwayou ti finn koken so propriyete prive.

input: The other farmers sympathised in principle, but they did not at first give him much help.
target: Bann lezot fermie ti sagren li me zot pa ti pe fer nanye pou ed li.

input: At heart, each of them was secretly wondering whether he could not somehow turn Jones’ misfortune to his own advantage.
target: Anverite sakenn ti pe tir plan pou gete kimanier li ti kapav profit febles Jonns.

input: It was lucky that the owners of the two farms which adjoined Animal Farm were on permanently bad terms.
target: Enn sans ki de laferm ki ti akote Baz Zanimo zot pa ti anbon term.

input: One of them, which was named Foxwood, was a large, neglected, old-fashioned farm, much overgrown by woodland, with all its pastures worn out and its hedges in a disgraceful condition.
target: Enn ladan ki ti apel Bwarenar, ti gran, preske abandone, mal-okipe; bann touf pie ek brousay ti pe fane partou; so patiraz ti preske sek e so baraz ti andezord konple e ti pe pous dan tou direksion.

input: Its owner, Mr. Pilkington, was an easy-going gentleman farmer who spent most of his time in fishing or hunting according to the season.
target: So propriyeter, Misie Pilkingtonn, ti enn fermie-bourzwa ki ti plis enterese ar lapes ek lasas.

input: The other farm, which was called Pinchfield, was smaller and better kept.
target: Lot kote ti ena TrapTou, enn ti laferm ki ti bienzere.

input: Its owner was a Mr. Frederick, a tough, shrewd man, perpetually involved in lawsuits and with a name for driving hard bargains.
target: So propriyeter, Misie Frederik, ti for dan biznes e ti toultan pe pourswiv lezot.

input: These two disliked each other so much that it was difficult for them to come to any agreement, even in defence of their own interests.
target: Laenn ant sa de la ti telman for ki zot pa ti fouti tom dakor mem kan zot ti pe defonn enn mem lentere.

input: Nevertheless, they were both thoroughly frightened by the rebellion on Animal Farm, and very anxious to prevent their own animals from learning too much about it.
target: Me toulede ti per Revolision dan Baz Zanimo e zot ti pe fer tou pou anpes zot zanimo kontamine e gagn niouz lor lavi dan sa nouvo baz la.

input: At first they pretended to laugh to scorn the idea of animals managing a farm for themselves.
target: Okoumansman zot ti fer kwar ki zot ti trouv sa komik ki ban zanimo kapav diriz enn laferm.

input: The whole thing would be over in a fortnight, they said.
target: Dan detrwa zour tou ti pou revinn normal.

input: They put it about that the animals on the Manor Farm (they insisted on calling it the Manor Farm; they would not tolerate the name Animal Farm were perpetually fighting among themselves and were also rapidly starving to death.
target: Zot ti pe fann rimer ki dan Baz Jonns (zot ti refiz so nouvo nom) bann zanimo ti pe lager ant zot e ki biento zot ti pou mordefen.

input: When time passed and the animals had evidently not starved to death, Frederick and Pilkington changed their tune and began to talk of the terrible wickedness that now flourished on Animal Farm.
target: Me amizir letan ti pe pase e Baz Zanimo ti pe tini ferm, Frederik ek Pilkingtonn ti oblize sanz refren. Zot ti koumans rakonte kimanier imoralite, dekadans ek degradasion ti pe fer firer dan laferm modi.

input: It was given out that the animals there practised cannibalism, tortured one another with red-hot horseshoes, and had their females in common.
target: Zanimo ti pe manz zanimo; seki for ti pe tortir seki feb ar fer sofe dan labrez laforz; orzi ti ranplas respe.

input: This was what came of rebelling against the laws of Nature, Frederick and Pilkington said.
target: Ala ki arive kan nepli respekte lalwa natirel, Frederik ek Pilkingtonn ti dir.

input: However, these stories were never fully believed.
target: Selman, sa bann zstwar-la pa ti pe tro morde.

input: Rumours of a wonderful farm, where the human beings had been turned out and the animals managed their own affairs, continued to circulate in vague and distorted forms, and throughout that year a wave of rebelliousness ran through the countryside.
target: Ti ena rimer lor so kontrer ki ti pe sirkile: ti ena enn plas merveye kot imen ti finn perdi plas, kot zanimo ti finn pran zot desten dan zot lame. Apre enpe letan lespri revolision ti koumans fane enpe partou.

input: Bulls which had always been tractable suddenly turned savage, sheep broke down hedges and devoured the clover, cows kicked the pail over, hunters refused their fences and shot their riders on to the other side.
target: Toro nepli ti ekout lord; mouton ti defons baraz pou al manz zenn pous dan potaze; vas ti pe devir seo dile; lisien lasas ti refiz res dan zot lanklo.

input: Above all, the tune and even the words of Beasts of England were known everywhere.
target: Partou-partou ti pe tann zanimo sant 'Zanimo Angleter'.

input: It had spread with astonishing speed.
target: Li ti fane partou kouma lafime dan divan.

input: The human beings could not contain their rage when they heard this song, though they pretended to think it merely ridiculous.
target: Bann imen ti pe grense sak fwa zot ti pe tann sa sante la mem si zot ti pe dir ki sante la ti ridikil.

input: They could not understand, they said, how even animals could bring themselves to sing such contemptible rubbish.
target: Zis toke, zot ti dir, ti kapav pans enn zafer koumsa.
