input: Any animal caught singing it was given a flogging on the spot.
target: Si ti may enn zanimo pe sant sa sante la, li ti gagn kout fwet.

input: And yet the song was irrepressible.
target: Malgre represion, ankor plis zanimo ti pe sant li.

input: The blackbirds whistled it in the hedges, the pigeons cooed it in the elms, it got into the din of the smithies and the tune of the church bells.
target: Toutrel ti sifle li lor lerb; pizon ti roukoul li lor twatir; ti tann li dan laforz malgre tapaz; mem laklos legliz ti aprann so ler.

input: And when the human beings listened to it, they secretly trembled, hearing in it a prophecy of their future doom.
target: Bann imen ti pe tranble ler zot ti pe tann sa sante la parski li ti pe anons lafen zot rengn.

input: Early in October, when the corn was cut and stacked and some of it was already threshed, a flight of pigeons came whirling through the air and alighted in the yard of Animal Farm in the wildest excitement.
target: Dan koumansman Oktob, apre rekolt may, kan ti pe prepar janta pou kraz may, enn group enportan pizon ti vinn poz dan lakour Baz Zanimo ar move nouvel.

input: Jones and all his men, with half a dozen others from Foxwood and Pinchfield, had entered the five-barred gate and were coming up the cart-track that led to the farm.
target: Jonns ek so bann travayer ede par detrwa zom Frederik ek Pilkingtonn ti pe anvair Baz Zanimo. Zot ti pe mont lamonte lale dan direksion laferm.

input: They were all carrying sticks, except Jones, who was marching ahead with a gun in his hands. Obviously they were going to attempt the recapture of the farm.
target: Bann zom ti pe sarye gro baton e Jonns ti pe mars divan-divan ar so fizi.

input: This had long been expected, and all preparations had been made.
target: Lager ti deklare. Sa ti inevitab. Bann zanimo ti pare.

input: Snowball, who had studied an old book of Julius Caesar’s campaigns which he had found in the farmhouse, was in charge of the defensive operations.
target: Boulkoton ki ti etidie taktik militer Zil Sezar dan enn vie liv, ti pare pou fer fas.

input: He gave his orders quickly, and in a couple of minutes every animal was at his post.
target: Lor vites li ti donn bann enstriksion e san tarde bann zanimo ti lor baz.

input: As the human beings approached the farm buildings, Snowball launched his first attack.
target: Ler bann imen ti apros bann batiman, Boulkoton ti lans premie atak.

input: All the pigeons, to the number of thirty-five, flew to and fro over the men’s heads and muted upon them from mid-air; and while the men were dealing with this, the geese, who had been hiding behind the hedge, rushed out and pecked viciously at the calves of their legs.
target: Trannsenk pizon ti anvol lot latet ennmi e ti devid zot entesten. Lelamem bann lezwa ki ti pe kasiet deryer banbou, ti fons lor zot, ti mord zot mole.

input: However, this was only a light skirmishing manoeuvre, intended to create a little disorder, and the men easily drove the geese off with their sticks.
target: Me sa li ti zis enn tipti manev pou detourn latansion parski bien vit bann zom ti servi zot baton pou met sime kler.

input: Snowball now launched his second line of attack.
target: Boulkoton ti lans so dezien atak.

input: Muriel, Benjamin, and all the sheep, with Snowball at the head of them, rushed forward and prodded and butted the men from every side, while Benjamin turned around and lashed at them with his small hoofs.
target: Miryel, Benzamen, bann mouton ek Boulkoton divan-divan ti fons lor ennmi e ti donn zot koutet ek koutpie partou kote.

input: But once again the men, with their sticks and their hobnailed boots, were too strong for them; and suddenly, at a squeal from Snowball, which was the signal for retreat.
target: Benzamen ti vire e ar so de lapat deryer li ti fou zot enn bon rakle.

input: All the animals turned and fled through the gateway into the yard.
target: Me bann zom ar zot baton ek zot gro bogi ti refiz defet. Enn kou san atann, Boulkoton ti larg enn kriye spesial ki ti enn signal pou rekile. Bann zanimo ti pran sime lakour laferm.

input: The men gave a shout of triumph.
target: Ennmi ti kriye laviktwar parski pou zot bann zanimo ti pe sove.

input: They saw, as they imagined, their enemies in flight, and they rushed after them in disorder.
This was just what Snowball had intended.
As soon as they were well inside the yard, the three horses, the three cows, and the rest of the pigs, who had been lying in ambush in the cowshed, suddenly emerged in their rear, cutting them off.
target: Kouma bann zom la ti ariv dan lakour, bann seval, bann vas ek bann lezot koson ki ti pe kasiet dan lekiri vas, ti sorti deryer zot e ti blok zot sime.

input: Snowball now gave the signal for the charge.
target: Lerla Boulkoton ti donn signal atak.

input: He himself dashed straight for Jones.
target: Li li ti fons drwat lor Jonns.

input: Jones saw him coming, raised his gun and fired.
target: Ler Jonns ti trouv sa li ti lev so fize, vize e tire.

input: The pellets scored bloody streaks along Snowball’s back, and a sheep dropped dead.
target: Bal fane ti bles ledo Boulkoton e ti touy enn mouton.

input: Without halting for an instant, Snowball flung his fifteen stone against Jones’s legs. Jones was hurled into a pile of dung and his gun flew out of his hands.
target: San perdi letan Boulkoton ti zet tou so pwa lor Jonns ki ti perdi lekilib e ti tom lor enn ta fimie e anmemtan so fizi ti voltize.

input: But the most terrifying spectacle of all was Boxer, rearing up on his hind legs and striking out with his great iron-shod hoofs like a stallion.
target: Me pli zoli ki tou se travay Boxer. Li ti dibout lor so lapat deryer e so lapat divan arme ar sabo fer ti pe fer enn masak.

input: His very first blow took a stable-lad from Foxwood on the skull and stretched him lifeless in the mud.
target: Ar so premie kou lor latet, li ti avoy enn zenes Bwarenar plot dan labou.

input: At the sight, several men dropped their sticks and tried to run.
target: apre premie vi, boukou dimounn ti zet zot baton e zot ti esay galoupe.

input: Panic overtook them, and the next moment all the animals together were chasing them round and round the yard.
target: Panik ti pran zot, e lot moman tou zanimo ansam ti galoup deryer zot otour lakour-la.

input: There was not an animal on the farm that did not take vengeance on them after his own fashion.
target: Tou bann zanimo ti regle zot kont dan zot prop fason.

input: Even the cat suddenly leapt off a roof onto a cowman’s shoulders and sank her claws in his neck.
target: Mem sat ti rod so bout. Depi twatir, li ti fransi lor enn gardien bef e ti plonz so grif dan so likou.

input: It had to hear him yelled horribly.
At a moment when the opening was clear, the men were glad enough to rush out of the yard and make a bolt for the main road.
target: Kan zot ti gagn enn ti sans pou sove, zot ti profite, sot baryer, al lor gran sime.

input: All the men were gone except one.
target: Tou bann zom, exepte enn, ti fini boure.

input: Back in the yard Boxer was pawing with his hoof at the stable-lad who lay face down in the mud, trying to turn him over.
target: Dan lakour laferm, Boxer ti pe sey, ar so lapat, retourn lekor zenes Bwarenar, ki ti anba ar so figir dan labou.
Garson la pa ti pe bouze.

input: He is dead, said Boxer sorrowfully.
target: Mo finn touy li, Boxer ti pe dir ar enn lavwa tris.

input: I had no intention of doing that.
I forgot that I was wearing iron shoes.
target: Mo ti bliye ki mo ti ena sabo anfer.

input: Who will believe that I did not do this on purpose?
target: Kisannla pou kwar mwa ler mo dir mo pa finn fer sa par expre?

input: No sentimentality, comrade! cried Snowball from whose wounds the blood was still dripping.
target: Peyna plas pou santiman, kamarad! Boulkoton ti kriye. Blesir lor so ledo ti pe segne.

input: The only good human being is a dead one.
target: Enn imen li bon zis kan li dan tom!

input: I have no wish to take life, not even human life, repeated Boxer, and his eyes were full of tears.
target: Mo pa 'le touy personn, ni mem enn imen, Boxer ti repete e so lizie ti ranpli ar larm.

input: For a moment there was great alarm;
target: Tou zanimo ti per ki bann imen ti finn fer li ditor ou mem ti kidnap li.

input: it was feared that the men might have harmed her in some way, or even carried her off with them.
target: Me alafen ti trouv li dan so stal ar so latet kasiet dan enn ta lerb sek.

input: In the end, however, she was found hiding in her stall with her head buried among the hay in the manger.
target: Kouma li ti tann kout fizi Jonns, li ti fonn.

input: She had taken to flight as soon as the gun went off.
target: Ler bann zanimo ti retourne apre ki zot ti retrouv Moli, zot ti dekouver ki zenes Bwarenar ti disparet.

input: And when the others came back from looking for her, it was to find that the stable-lad, who in fact was only stunned, had already recovered and made off.
target: Li ti zis gagn enn kou ki ti fer li perdi konesans.

input: The animals had now reassembled in the wildest excitement, each recounting his own exploits in the battle at the top of his voice.
target: Bann zanimo ti rasanble. Zot ti extra exite e sakenn ti pe rakont so explwa for-for.

input: An impromptu celebration of the victory was held immediately.
target: Ti organiz enn evennman lor vites.

input: The flag was run up and Beasts of England was sung a number of times, then the sheep who had been killed was given a solemn funeral, a hawthorn bush being planted on her grave.
target: Ti lev pavyon, sant 'Zanimo Nou Pei' plizier fwa; ti anter mouton ki ti mor dan lager e lor so tom ti plant enn pie friyapen.

input: At the graveside Snowball made a little speech, emphasising the need for all animals to be ready to die for Animal Farm if need be.
target: Kot so tom Boulkoton ti fer enn diskour pou dir ki zanimo bizen pare pou mor pou Baz Zanimo, si neseser.

input: The animals decided unanimously to create a military decoration, Animal Hero, First Class, which was conferred there and then on Snowball and Boxer.
target: Tou zanimo ti dakor pou kree enn dekorasion militer spesial, Zanimo Ero, Premie Klas e ti donn sa meday la Boulkoton ek Boxer.

input: It consisted of a brass medal (they were really some old horse-brasses which had been found in the harness-room), to be worn on Sundays and holidays.
target: Ti fer meday la ar bout bronz (ti ena enn ta dan godon). Bann dekore ti gagn drwa met li Dimans ek konze piblik.

input: There was also Animal Hero, Second Class, which was conferred posthumously on the dead sheep.
target: Ti ena osi meday Zanimo Ero, Deziem Klas ki ti donn mouton mor.

input: There was much discussion as to what the battle should be called. In the end, it was named the Battle of the Cowshed, since that was where the ambush had been sprung.
target: Ti ena bel diskision lor nom ki ti pou donn batay ki zanimo ti fek gagne e ti finalman deside pou apel li Batay Lekiri Vas parski se laba ki ti ena moman desizif ki ti donn laviktwar.

input: Mr. Jones’s gun had been found lying in the mud, and it was known that there was a supply of cartridges in the farmhouse.
target: Zot ti trouv fizi Jonns dan labou e zot ti kone ki dan grannkaz ti ena enn bwat bal.

input: It was decided to set the gun up at the foot of the Flagstaff, like a piece of artillery, and to fire it twice a year once on October the twelfth, the anniversary of the Battle of the Cowshed, and once on Midsummer Day, the anniversary of the Rebellion.
target: Zot ti deside pou plas fizi la kot lipie Lemapavyon koumadir artilri defans e pou tir kout bal de fwa par an le douz Oktob pou laniverser Batay Lekiri Vas e ekinox lete pou laniverser Revolision.

input: As winter drew on, Mollie became more and more troublesome.
target: Amizir liver avanse, Moli ti pe donn boukou traka.

input: She was late for work every morning and excused herself by saying that she had overslept, and she complained of mysterious pains, although her appetite was excellent.
target: Toulegramaten li ti anretar dan travay e so sel exkiz se ki so lipie ti may dan dra. Li ti pe toultan plengne ki li ti pe gagn douler partou. Pourtan so lapeti ti exselan.

input: On every kind of pretext she would run away from work and go to the drinking pool, where she would stand foolishly gazing at her own reflection in the water.
target: Li ti pe servi sak ti pretex pou al kot basen dilo e la li ti pou admir so prop reflexion dan dilo.

input: But there were also rumours of something more serious.
target: Me ti ena koze pli serye.

input: One day, as Mollie strolled blithely into the yard, flirting her long tail and chewing at a stalk of hay, Clover took her aside.
target: Enn zour ti trouv Moli pe mars-marse dan lakour san problem; li ti pe balans-balans so long lake pandan ki li ti pe griyot enn bren lerb. Tref ti al koz ar li dan enn kwen.

input: Mollie,she said, I have something very serious to say to you.
target: Moli, mo ena enn zafer serye pou koz ar twa.

input: This morning I saw you looking over the hedge that divides Animal Farm from Foxwood.
target: Gramaten mo ti trouv twa pe get lot kote baraz ki sapar Baz Zanimo ar Bwarenar.

input: One of Mr. Pilkington’s men was standing on the other side of the hedge.
target: Lot kote ti ena enn zom Pilkingtonn.

input: And I was a long way away, but I am alvmost certain I saw this he was talking to you and you were allowing him to stroke your nose.
target: Mem mo ti enpe lwen, mo sir mo ti trouv li pe koz ar twa e to ti pe les li kares to mizo.

input: It isn’t true! cried Mollie, beginning to prance about and paw the ground.
target: Manti sa! Moli ti krye, li ti pe lev so lapat e tap li lor later.

input: Mollie, Look at me in the face.
target: Moli, get mwa dan mo lizie.

input: Do you give me your word of honour that that man was not stroking your nose?
target: Eski to kapav donn mwa to parol-doner ki li pa ti pe kares to mizo?

input: but she could not look Clover in the face, and the next moment she took to her heels and galloped away into the field.
target: me li pa ti kapav get tref dan so figir, e lot moman li ti galoupe li ti al dan karo.

input: Without saying anything to the others, she went to Mollie’s stall and turned over the straw with her hoof.
target: San dir personn nanye, li ti al dan stal Moli e li ti fouy dan lapay ar so sabo.

input: Hidden under the straw was a little pile of lump sugar and several bunches of ribbon of different colours.
target: Ti en plizier morso disik ek plizie pake riban kouler kasiet anba lapay.
Trwa zour pli tar Moli ti disparet.

input: For some weeks nothing was known of her whereabouts, then the pigeons reported that they had seen her on the other side of Willingdon.
target: Pandan plizier semenn pa ti tann nanye lor li ziska ki bann pizon ti raporte ki zot ti trouv Moli atle ar enn karyol.

input: In January there came bitterly hard weather.
target: An Zanvie ti ena bien move letan.

input: The earth was like iron, and nothing could be done in the fields.
target: Later ti kouma feray, e nanye pa ti kapav fer dan karo.

input: Many meetings were held in the big barn, and the pigs occupied themselves with planning out the work of the coming season.
target: Ti ena boukou renion dan langar, e bann koson ti pe fer plan pou prosen sezon.

input: It had come to be accepted that the pigs, who were manifestly cleverer than the other animals, should decide all questions of farm policy, though their decisions had to be ratified by a majority vote.
target: Tou zanimo ti aksepte ki bann koson, ki ti pli intelizan ki bann lezot zanimo, ti pou bizin deside ki bon pou Baz Zanimo me tou desizion ti bizen ratifie par enn vot mazoriter.

input: This arrangement would have worked well enough if it had not been for the disputes between Snowball and Napoleon.
target: Sa ti pou enn solision akseptab si pa ti ena enn konfli permanan ant Boulkoton ek Napoleon.

input: These two disagreed at every point where disagreement was possible.
target: Sa de la pa ti dakor lor sak pwin kot dezakor ti posib.

input: If one of them suggested sowing barley, the other was certain to demand a bigger acreage of oats, and if one of them said that such and such a field was just right for cabbages, the other would declare that it was useless for anything except potato.
target: Si enn ti dir bizen plant dible, lotla ti pou dir bizen plant kanpes; si enn propoze pou plant lisou, lotla ti pou dir ki pomdeter meyer.

input: Each had his own following, and there were some violent debates.
target: Sakenn ti ena so prop disip ek fann e souvan bann deba ti vinn violan.

input: At the Meetings Snowball often won over the majority by his brilliant speeches, but Napoleon was better at canvassing support for himself in between times.
target: Souvan Boulkoton ti pe gagn mazorite parski li ti enn extra bon orater me lor marday ek magouy Napoleon ti pli bon.

input: He was especially successful with the sheep.
target: So popilarite ti gran parmi bann mouton.

input: Of late the sheep had taken to bleating Four legs good, two legs bad.
target: Sak fwa ki Boulkoton ti pe devlop enn pwen enportan, bann mouton ti pou baabaa zot slogan prefere, Kat lapat bon, de lapat move.

input: Napoleon produced no schemes of his own, but said quietly that Snowball’s would come to nothing, and seemed to be biding his time.
target: Napoleon pa ti propoz nanye; li ti zis pas bann komanter negatif.

input: In the long pasture, not far from the farm buildings, there was a small knoll which was the highest point on the farm.
target: Dan patiraz, pa tro lwen ar bann batiman laferm, ti ena enn ti kolinn ki ti landrwa pli ot lor laferm.

input: After surveying the ground, Snowball declared that this was just the place for a windmill, which could be made to operate a dynamo and supply the farm with electrical power.
target: Boulkoton ti anonse ki sa landrwa la ti ideal pou konstrir enn eolienn, ki ti pou kapav oper lor dynamo e donn elektrisite laferm.

input: This would light the stalls and warm them in winter, and would also run a circular saw, a chaff-cutter, a mangel-slicer, and an electric milking machine.
target: Ti pou kapav osi servi elektrisite pou fer bann diferan masinn marse kouma masinn koup dibwa, masinn koup lerb, masinn tir dile vas.

input: The animals had never heard of anything of this kind before, for the farm was an old-fashioned one and had only the most primitive machinery), and they listened in astonishment while Snowball conjured up pictures of fantastic machines which would do their work for them while they grazed at their ease in the fields or improved their minds with reading and conversation.
target: Bann zanimo zame ti tann bann zafer koumsa parski laferm Jonns ti arkaik e zot ti ekout Boulkoton rakont zot kouma bann masinn ti pou fer travay dir pandan ki bann zanimo ti pou rilax e servi zot letan lib pou devlop zot lespri atraver lir, ekrir ek diskision serye.

input: Within a few weeks Snowball’s plans for the windmill were fully worked out.
target: Detrwa semenn pli tar plan eolienn ti pare.

input: Gradually the plans grew into a complicated mass of cranks and cog-wheels, covering more than half the floor, which the other animals found completely unintelligible but very impressive.
target: Gradielman bann plan tin inn bien konplike ar enn ta manivel ek langrenaz ki ti kouver omwen lamwatie sirfas lasam la ki bann zanimo ti extra enpresione mem si zot pa ti konpran nanye.

input: The whole farm was deeply divided on the subject of the windmill.
target: Lor eolienn Baz Zanimo ti kas ande.

input: Snowball did not deny that to build it would be a difficult business.
target: Boulkoton ti konsian ki sa louvraz la ti pou bien difisil.

input: Stone would have to be carried and built up into walls, then the sails would have to be made and after that there would be need for dynamos and cables.
target: Ti pou bizen sarye ros depi lwen pou ranz miray; ti bizen ranz lavwal pou may divan ki ti pou fer moulenavan tourne; anplis ti pou bizen dinamo ek bann kab.

input: How these were to be procured, Snowball did not say.
target: Boulkoton pa ti pe dir kot pou gagn tousa.

input: But he maintained that it could all be done in a year.
target: Li ti ensiste ki eolienn ti pou operasionel dan enn an.

input: And thereafter, he declared, so much labour would be saved that the animals would only need to work three days a week.
target: Apartir sa moman la, bann zanimo ti pou travay zis trwa zour par semenn.

input: Napoleon, on the other hand, argued that the great need of the moment was to increase food production, and that if they wasted time on the windmill they would all starve to death.
target: Napoleon, lot kote, ti insiste ki prodiksion alimanter ti priyorite pou lemoman e si perdi letan lor eolienn bann zanimo ti pou mordefen.

input: The animals formed themselves into two factions under the slogan, vote for Snowball and the three-day week and vote for Napoleon and the full manager.
target: Ti ena de blok politik: bann Boulkotonis ki ti pe kriye, vot Boulkoton pou trwa zour travay e bann Napoleonien ki ti pe kriye, vot Napoleon pou plen gardmanze.

input: Benjamin was the only animal who did not side with either faction.
target: Benzamen tousel pa ti dan okenn kan.

input: He refused to believe either that food would become more plentiful or that the windmill would save work.
target: Li ti refiz kwar ki dan lavenir ti pou ena plis manze ousa mwens travay.

input: Windmill or no windmill, he said, life would go on as it had always gone on that is, badly.
target: Eolienn pa ti pou sanz nanye, li ti dir, lavi ti pou kontinie.

input: Apart from the disputes over the windmill, there was the question of the defence of the farm.
target: Apart dispit lor eolienn, ti ena osi kestion defans Baz Zanimo.

input: It was fully realised that though the human beings had been defeated in the Battle of the Cowshed they might make another and more determined attempt to recapture the farm and reinstate Mr. Jones. They had all the more reason for doing so because the news of their defeat had spread across the countryside and made the animals on the neighbouring farms more restive than ever.
target: Tou zanimo ti konsian ki malgre zot defet dan Batay Lekiri Vas, bann imen ti pou resey pran kontrol pou donn pouvwar Misie Jonns sirtou ki depi enn tan ti ena boukou moulougandaz lor bann diferan laferm parski nouvel defet imen ti pe fane partou.

input: As usual, Snowball and Napoleon were in disagreement.
target: Kouma touzour, Boulkoton ek Napoleon ti an dezakor.

input: According to Napoleon, what the animals must do was to procure firearms and train themselves in the use of them.
target: Dapre Napoleon, seki bann zanimo bizin aste zarm e aprann servi zot.

input: According to Snowball, they must send out more and more pigeons and stir up rebellion among the animals on the other farms.
target: Dapre Boulkoton, ti bizen avoy boukou plis pizon pou fer mekontantman grandi parmi bann zanimo dan lezot bann laferm.

input: The one argued that if they could not defend themselves they were bound to be conquered, the other argued that if rebellions happened everywhere they would have no need to defend themselves.
target: Enn ti pe dir ki si zot pa kapav defann zot baz zot pou perdi pouvwar; lotla ti pe dir ki si revolision fane partou, pa pou mem bizen defann zot.

input: The animals listened first to Napoleon, then to Snowball, and could not make up their minds which was right.
target: Bann zanimo ti pe ekout premie Napoleon, apre Boulkoton, e pa ti pe fouti deside kisannla ti korek.

input: Indeed, they always found themselves in agreement with the one who was speaking at the moment.
target: Anfet, zot ti toultan foul dakor ar orater ki ti pe koze.

input: At last the day came when Snowball’s plans were completed.
target: Anfen plan eolienn Boulkoton ti konplete.

input: At the Meeting on the following Sunday the question of whether or not to begin work on the windmill was to be put to the vote.
target: Dan Miting Dimans ki ti swiv, ti pou pran desizion par enn vot.

input: When the animals had assembled in the big barn, Snowball stood up and, though occasionally interrupted by bleating from the sheep, set forth his reasons for advocating the building of the windmill.
target: Kan tou zanimo ti fini rasanble, Boulkoton ti koumans koze, tanzantan bann mouton ti pe deranz li, e li ti donn bann rezon kifer eolienn ti neseser.

input: Then Napoleon stood up to reply.
target: Apre se Napoleon ki ti pran laparol.

input: He said very quietly that the windmill was nonsense and that he advised nobody to vote for it, and promptly sat down again.
target: Li ti dir dousman ki eolienn ti enn lide fos e li ti konsey person pou vot li, e li ti asiz toutswit.

input: He had spoken for barely thirty seconds, and seemed almost indifferent as to the effect he produced.
target: Li ti koz anviron trant segonn e li pa ti paret enterese ar enpak so diskour.

input: At this Snowball sprang to his feet, and shouting down the sheep, who had begun bleating again, broke into a passionate appeal in favour of the windmill.
target: Boulkoton ti repran laparol; ti fer bann mouton aret fer tapaz e li ti fer enn long diskour lor bienfe eolienn.

input: Until now the animals had been about equally divided in their sympathies, but in a moment Snowball’s eloquence had carried them away.
target: Ziska aster bann zanimo ki ti divize fifti-fifti avan, aster ti pe soutenir mosion Boulkoton.

input: His imagination had now run far beyond chaff-cutters and turnip-slicers.
target: So limazinasion ti sarye li net. Li ti kit masinn koup dibwa ousa koup lerb.

input: By the time he had finished speaking, there was no doubt as to which way the vote would go.
target: Ler li ti fini so diskour, li ti kler ki tou zanimo ti pou vot pour.

input: But just at this moment Napoleon stood up and, casting a peculiar sidelong look at Snowball, uttered a high-pitched whimper of a kind no one had ever heard him utter before.
target: Lerlamem Napoleon ti dibout, ti get Boulkoton dan kwen lizie e ti larg enn kriye person ki zame okenn zanimo pa ti deza tande avan.

input: At this there was a terrible baying sound outside, and nine enormous dogs wearing brass-studded collars came bounding into the barn.
target: Lerla ti ena enn tapaz grogne terifian deor, e nef lisien enorm ar kolie dekore ar tiboul bronz ti debark dan langar.

input: They dashed straight for Snowball, who only sprang from his place just in time to escape their snapping jaws.
target: Zot ti fons drwat lor Boulkoton ki ti avanse atan pou evit lamaswar sa bann mons la.

input: Too amazed and frightened to speak, all the animals crowded through the door to watch the chase.
target: Bann lezot zanimo ti paralize ar lafreyer, ot zis ti kapav diboute, gete.

input: Snowball was racing across the long pasture that led to the road. He was running as only a pig can run, but the dogs were close on his heels.
target: Boulkoton ti travers patiraz e bann lisien araze la ti pre ar li.

input: Suddenly he slipped and it seemed certain that they had him.
target: Enn kou li ti glise. Pou tou zanimo sa ti so lamor.

input: Then he was up again, running faster than ever, then the dogs were gaining on him again.
target: Lerla li ti releve ankor, bann lisien la ti preske zwenn li.

input: One of them all but closed his jaws on Snowball’s tail, but Snowball whisked it free just in time.
target: Enn ladan ti pre pou mord so lake me Boulkoton ti ris li atan.

input: Then he put on an extra spurt and, with a few inches to spare, slipped through a hole in the hedge and was seen no more.
target: Lerla li ti fer enn dernie sprint, ti pas par enn trou dan baraz e se dernie fwa ki ti trouv li dan Baz Zanimo.

input: Silent and terrified, the animals crept back into the barn.
target: Lalang amare, terer dan leker, bann zanimo ti retourn trankilman dan langar.

input: In a moment the dogs came bounding back.
target: Inpe pli tar bann lisien la ti galoupe retourne.

input: At first no one had been able to imagine where these creatures came from, but the problem was soon solved: they were the puppies whom Napoleon had taken away from their mothers and reared privately.
target: Okoumansman okenn zanimo pa ti kapav devine kot zot ti sorti me bien vit ti gagn so repons: rapel nef ti toutou ki Jesi ek Fler Mov ti met ba e ki Napoleon ti pran pou okip zot ledikasion personelman.

input: Though not yet full-grown, they were huge dogs, and as fierce-looking as wolves.
target: Mem si zot pa ti ankor vinn gran net, zot ti enorm e zot ti paret feros kouma loulou araze.
Zot ti dibout koste ar Napoleon.

input: It was noticed that they wagged their tails to him in the same way as the other dogs had been used to do to Mr. Jones.
target: Zot ti pe balans zot lake parey kouma lezot lisien ti pe balans zot lake dan prezans Misie Jonns.

input: Napoleon, with the dogs following him, now mounted on to the raised portion of the floor where Major had previously stood to deliver his speech.
target: Napoleon ek bann lisien ti mont lor podiom kot Bonom Mazor ti diboute pou fer so diskour.

input: He announced that from now on the Sunday-morning Meetings would come to an end.
target: Li ti anonse ki apartir sa moman la nepli pou ena Miting Dimans.

input: They were unnecessary, he said, and wasted time.
In future all questions relating to the working of the farm would be settled by a special committee of pigs, presided over by himself.
target: Aster tou bann problem ti pou regle par enn komite koson sou so prezidans.

input: These would meet in private and afterwards communicate their decisions to the others.
target: Zot pou zwenn anprive ek zot pou kominik bann desizion ar lezot zanimo.

input: The animals would still assemble on Sunday mornings to salute the flag, sing Beasts of England, and receive their orders for the week.
target: Dan Dimans gramaten bann zanimo ti pou bizen prezan dan lasanble pou salie pavyon, sant Zanimo Angleter, e answit gagn enstriksion pou travay lasemenn.

input: There would be no more debates.
target: Nepli ti pou ena okenn deba.

input: In spite of the shock that Snowball’s expulsion had given them, the animals were dismayed by this announcement.
target: Malgre sok ki zot ti gagne ar expilsion Boulkoton, sa nouvo dekre la ti fatig latet bann zanimo.

input: Several of them would have protested if they could have found the right arguments.
target: Plizier parmi zot ti pou proteste si zot ti gagn bon argiman.
Mem Boxer ti montre bann sign ki li ti malalez.

input: He set his ears back, shook his forelock several times, and tried hard to marshal his thoughts; but in the end he could not think of anything to say.
target: Li ti dres so zorey, ti sakouy krinier lor so fron plizier fwa, ti sey organiz so lespri; finalman li ti prefer abandone.

input: Some of the pigs themselves, however, were more articulate.
target: Ti ena parmi bann koson detrwa ki ti for lor koze.

input: Four young porkers in the front row uttered shrill squeals of disapproval, and all four of them sprang to their feet and began speaking at once.
target: Kat ti koson dan premie ranze ti kriye for zot mekontantman; e toule kat zot ti diboute e ti koumans koze.

input: But suddenly the dogs sitting round Napoleon let out deep, menacing growls.
target: Me toutswit bann lisien ki ti pe asiz otour Napoleon ti grogn enn grogne menasan.

input: The pigs fell silent and sat down again.
target: Bann ti koson ti res trankil e ti al assize ankor.

input: Then the sheep broke out into a tremendous bleating of four legs good, two legs bad! which went on for nearly a quarter of an hour and put an end to any chance of discussion.
target: Toutswit bann mouton ti koumans zot refren, kat lapat bon, de lapat move pandan kenz minit e sa ti anpes lezot diskite.

input: Afterwards Squealer was sent round the farm to explain the new arrangement to the others.
target: Apre Tronpet ti fer letour laferm pou explik nesesite nouvo aranzman.

input: Comrades, he said, I trust that every animal here appreciates the sacrifice that Comrade Napoleon has made in taking this extra labour upon himself.
target: Kamarad, li ti dir, mo espere ki zot tou isi apresie sakrifis ki Kamarad Napoleon pe fer.

input: Suppose you had decided to follow Snowball, with his moonshine of windmills Snowball, who, as we now know, was no better than a criminal?
target: Nou sipoze ki zot ti desid pou mars ar Boulkoton ek so bann lide fouka. Ki ti pou arive? Zot ti pou mars ar enn kriminel.

input: He fought bravely at the Battle of the Cowshed, said somebody.
target: Li ti lite ar kouraz dan Batay Lekiri Vas, enn lavwa ti kriye.

input: Bravery is not enough, said Squealer.
target: Zis kouraz pa ase, Tronpet ti azoute.

input: Loyalty and obedience are more important.
And as to the Battle of the Cowshed, I believe the time will come when we shall find that Snowball’s part in it was much exaggerated.
target: Enn zour zot pou realize ki nou pe tro ekzazer kontribision Boulkoton dan Batay Lekiri Vas.

input: One false step, and our enemies would be upon us.
target: Enn fopa e ennmi vir nou anbalao.

input: Surely, comrades, you do not want Jones back?
target: Sirman, Kamarad, zot pa anvi Jonns revini?

input: Once again this argument was unanswerable.
target: Ankor enn fwa sa ti enn argiman san repons.

input: Certainly the animals did not want Jones back.
target: Okenn zanimo pa ti 'le retour Jonns.

input: if the holding of debates on Sunday mornings was liable to bring him back, then the debates must stop.
target: Si deba Dimans kapav fer li retourne, preferab aboli li.

input: Boxer, who had now had time to think things over, voiced the general feeling.
target: Boxer ki ti pe rod trouv kler dan tousa ti anfen dekouver lalimier.

input: He said: If Comrade Napoleon says it, it must be right.
target: Li ti dir, si Kamarad Napoleon dir sa, li bizen bon.

input: And from then on he adopted the maxim, Napoleon is always right, in addition to his private motto of will work harder.
target: Eapartir sa zour la li ti adopte enn nouvo teorem, Napoleon ti touletan korek, osi pou so prop rezolision pou travay pli dir.

input: By this time the weather had broken and the spring ploughing had begun.
target: Letansa letan ti vinn pli bon e travay dan karo ti kapav koumanse.

input: The shed where Snowball had drawn his plans of the windmill had been shut up and it was assumed that the plans had been rubbed off the floor.
target: Kouma landrwa kot Boulkoton ti fer so plan eolienn ti barikade, tou zanimo ti panse ki ar letan plan la ti efase.

input: Every Sunday morning at ten o’clock the animals assembled in the big barn to receive their orders for the week.
target: Sak Dimans gramaten, 10 er, bann zanimo ti pe zwenn dan langar pou gagn zot latas pou enn semenn.

input: The skull of old Major, now clean of flesh, had been disinterred from the orchard and set up on a stump at the foot of the flagstaff, beside the gun.
target: Ti deter lekor Bonom Mazor e so krann ki ti vinn prop ti plase lor enn biyo kot lipie Lemapavyon akote fizi.

input: After the hoisting of the flag, the animals were required to file past the skull in a reverent manner before entering the barn.
target: Apre ki ti finn lev pavyon, bann zanimo ti bizen mars divan krann la ar foul respe avan zot rant dan langar.

input: Nowadays they did not sit all together as they had done in the past.
target: Zot nepli ti pe asiz ansam kouma avan.

input: Napoleon, with Squealer and another pig named Minimus, who had a remarkable gift for composing songs and poems, sat on the front of the raised platform, with the nine young dogs forming a semicircle round them, and the other pigs sitting behind.
target: Napoleon, Tronpet ek enn trwaziem koson ki ti apel Tikalite exper lor ekrir poem ek konpoz lamizik ti asiz divan lor podiom; nef lisien ti form enn demiserk otour zot; lezot koson ti asiz deryer zot.

input: The rest of the animals sat facing them in the main body of the barn.
target: Lezot zanimo ti asiz anba lor sali vizavi zot.

input: Napoleon read out the orders for the week in a gruff soldierly style, and after a single singing of Beasts of England, all the animals dispersed.
target: Napoleon ti lir bann enstriksion pou lasemenn ar enn lavwa militer sek e apre ti sant Zanimo Angleter enn sel fwa e lerla lafoul ti disperse.

input: On the third Sunday after Snowball’s expulsion, the animals were somewhat surprised to hear Napoleon announce that the windmill was to be built after all.
target: Trwaziem dimans apre expilsion Boulkoton, bann zanimo ti gagn enn sok. Napoleon ti anonse ki ti bizen koumans konstriksion eolienn.

input: He did not give any reason for having changed his mind, but merely warned the animals that this extra task would mean very hard work, it might even be necessary to reduce their rations.
target: Li pa ti donn okenn rezon. Li ti zis dir zot ki zot tou ti bizen pare pou fer travay extra ki extra dir. Ti bizen fer sakrifis. Akoz sa ti pou bizen diminie rasion manze.

input: The plans, however, had all been prepared, down to the last detail.
target: Bann plan pou eolienn ti fini prepare.

input: A special committee of pigs had been at work upon them for the past three weeks.
target: Enn komite spesial ti fer sa travay la pou dernie 3 semenn.

input: The building of the windmill, with various other improvements, was expected to take two years.
target: Bann konstriksion ek lezot ameliorasion ti pou pran de banane.

input: That Sunday evening Squealer explained privately to the other animals that Napoleon had never in reality been opposed to the windmill.
target: Sa Dimans tanto la, Tronpet ti explik bann lezot zanimo an prive ki anverite zame Napoleon ti kont eolienn.

input: Now that Snowball was out of the way, the plan could go forward without his interference.
target: Aster ki Boulkoton nepli la, travay kapav koumanse san interferans.

input: The animals were not certain what the word meant, but Squealer spoke so persuasively, and the three dogs who happened to be with him growled so threateningly, that they accepted his explanation without further questions.
target: Bann zanimo pa ti tro konpran ki ti vedir 'taktik' me manier koze Tronpet ti enpresionan e trwa lisien ki ti pe grogne ar menas ti plis enpresionan ankor. Ti preferab aksepte explikasion Tronpet san poz kestion.

input: All that year the animals worked like slaves, but they were happy in their work.
target: Toutlong lane lane la, bann zanimo ti travay kouma esklav me zot ti kontan zot travay.

input: They grudged no effort or sacrifice, well aware that everything that they did was for the benefit of themselves and those of their kind who would come after them, and not for a pack of idle, thieving human beings.
target: Zot pa ti refiz fer sakrifis parski zot ti pe travay pou zotmem, pou zot zanfan e pa ti ena bann imen profiter ki ti pe bwar disan lezot.

input: Throughout the one year they worked a sixty-hour week, and in August Napoleon announced that there would be work on Sunday afternoons as well.
target: Pandan preske enn an zot ti pe travay swasant er par semenn e an Out, Napoleon ti fer kone ki ti pou bizen travay Dimans tanto 'si.

input: This work was strictly voluntary, but any animal who absented himself from it would have his rations reduced by half.
target: Sa travay la, li ti pou strikteman volonter me, seki refize, pou gagn demi-porsion rasion manze.

input: Even so, it was found necessary to leave certain tasks undone.
target: Malgre sa ti ena serten travay ki zanimo pa ti pe kapav fer.

input: The harvest was a little less successful than in the previous year, and two fields which should have been sown with roots in the early summer were not sown because the ploughing had not been completed early enough.
target: Lakoup ti mwen bon ki lane presedan e de karo kot ti bizen plant pomdeter ek maniok ti res abandone parski travay fouy later ek binn later pa ti fer.

input: It was possible to foresee that the coming winter would be a hard one.
target: Ti bien kler ki liver ki ti pe vini ti pou extra difisil.
Konstriksion batiman eolienn ti pe kre boukou problem.

input: There was a good quarry of limestone on the farm, and plenty of sand and cement had been found in one of the outhouses, so that all the materials for building were at hand.
target: Ti ena enn karyer bazalt lor laferm e dan enn depandans ti ena enn stok siman ek disab.

input: Only after weeks of vain effort did the right idea occur to somebody namely, to utilise the force of gravity.
target: Apre plizier semenn zefor dan vid kikenn ti gagn enn lide extra: servi lafors gravite.

input: Huge boulders, far too big to be used as they were, were lying all over the bed of the quarry.
target: Dan karyer la ti ena bann gro-gro ros ki pa ti pou kapav servi kouma zot ti ete.

input: The animals lashed ropes round these, and then all together, cows, horses, sheep, any animal that could lay hold of the rope even the pigs sometimes joined in at critical moments they dragged them with desperate slowness up the slope to the top of the quarry, where they were toppled over the edge, to shatter to pieces below.
target: Pou fer sa tou bann zanimo ansam, vas, seval, mouton, ninport ki zanimo ti bizen marye pike (mem bann koson parfwa ti bizen donn koudme) pou ris gro ros ziska latet karyer e lerla larg li lor lapant, les li roule, al kraze anba.

input: Transporting the stone when it was once broken was comparatively simple.
target: Konpare ar sa, sarye bann bout ros ti sinp.

input: The horses carried it off in cart-loads, the sheep dragged single blocks, even Muriel and Benjamin yoked themselves into an old governess-cart and did their share.
target: Bann seval ti ris saret ranpli ar ros; sak mouton ti ris so ti ros; mem Miryel ek Benzamem ti atas zot lekor ar enn vie saret pou amenn zot blok.

input: By late summer a sufficient store of stone had accumulated, and then the building began, under the superintendence of the pigs.
target: Ver lafen lete ti ena ase ros pou ki travay ti kapav koumanse sou kontrol bann koson, bien sir.

input: But it was a slow, laborious process.
target: Louvraz la ti difisil e ti pran boukou letan.

input: Frequently it took a whole day of exhausting effort to drag a single boulder to the top of the quarry, and sometimes when it was pushed over the edge it failed to break.
target: Souvan li ti pran zot enn zourne net pou ris enn gro ros lao e parfwa ler ti larg li, li ti desann priz e ti res antie anba.

input: Nothing could have been achieved without Boxer, whose strength seemed equal to that of all the rest of the animals put together.
target: Pa ti pou ena okenn progre san Boxer. Par li tousel, li ti ena otan lafors ki tou lezot zanimo met ansam.

input: When the boulder began to slip and the animals cried out in despair at finding themselves dragged down the hill, it was always Boxer who strained himself against the rope and brought the boulder to a stop.
target: Kan enn gro ros ti koumans glise e ti menas pou ris tou bann zanimo dan ladesant, zis Boxer ki ti kapav tini ros la e anpes enn masak.

input: To see him toiling up the slope inch by inch, his breath coming fast, the tips of his hoofs clawing at the ground, and his great sides matted with sweat, filled everyone with admiration.
target: Ti enn spektak extra get li ris sa ros la lor lamonte pous par pous, parfwa souf koupe, lekor kouver ar transpirasion e so sabo pe agrip ar later.

input: Clover warned him sometimes to be careful not to overstrain himself, but Boxer would never listen to her.
target: Parfwa Tref ti konsey li fer atansion me Boxer ti ekout zis so prop lespri.

input: His two slogans, I will work harder and Napoleon is always right, seemed to him a sufficient answer to all problems.
target: So de proverb, Mo pou travay dir e Napoleon touletan ena rezon, paret pou li enn repons ase pou tou bann problem.

input: He had made arrangements with the cockerel to call him three-quarters of an hour earlier in the mornings instead of half an hour.
target: Li ti diman so kok sante 45 minit pli boner dan gramatin olie 30 minit.

input: And in his spare moments, of which there were not many nowadays, he would go alone to the quarry, collect a load of broken stone, and drag it down to the site of the windmill unassisted.
target: Kan li ti ena enpe letan lib enn zafer bien rar li ti al sers bann bout ros, ris zot ziska sayt batiman eolienn san led personn.

input: The animals were not badly off throughout that summer, in spite of the hardness of their work.
target: Bann zanimo pa ti tro dan pens pandan lete malgre ki travay ti extra dir.

input: If they had no more food than they had had in Jones’s day, at least they did not have less.
target: Mem si zot pa ti gagn plis manze ki dan lepok Jonns, zot pa ti pe gagn mwens.

input: The advantage of only having to feed themselves, and not having to support five extravagant human beings as well, was so great that it would have taken a lot of failures to outweigh it.
target: Zot ti pe travay pou nouri zotmem. Pa ti neseser nouri lever senk imen. Sa ti ase pou zot pou aksepte zot difikilte.

input: And in many ways the animal method of doing things was more efficient and saved labour.
target: Anzeneral bann zanimo ti plis prodiktif ek efisian ki imen.

input: Such jobs as weeding, for instance, could be done with a thoroughness impossible to human beings.
target: Kan ti pe aras move lerb, zanimo ti fer enn louvraz pli prop ki imen.

input: And again, since no animal now stole, it was unnecessary to fence off pasture from arable land, which saved a lot of labour on the upkeep of hedges and gates.
target: Parski bann zanimo pa ti pe koken manze pa ti neseser met fennsing ek laport separasion ant patiraz ek later pou kiltivasion.

input: Nevertheless, as the summer wore on, various unforeseen shortages began to make them selves felt.
target: Me amizir letan pase, boukou kiksoz ti koumans manke.

input: There was need of paraffin oil, nails, string, dog biscuits, and iron for the horses shoes, none of which could be produced on the farm.
target: Ti bizen bann zafer ki pa ti kapav prodwir dan laferm kouma petrol, koulou, lafisel, manze-lisien, fer pou sabo seval.

input: Later there would also be need for seeds and artificial manures, besides various tools and, finally, the machinery for the windmill.
target: Pli tar ti pou bizen lagren pou seme ek fertilizan artifisiel apart zoutiyaz ek masinnri pou batiman eolienn.

input: How these were to be procured, no one was able to imagine.
target: Personn pa ti kone kouma pou gagn tousa.

input: One Sunday morning, when the animals assembled to receive their orders, Napoleon announced that he had decided upon a new policy.
target: Enn Dimans gramaten, kan bann zanimo ti reyni pou resevwar zot latas pou lasemenn, Napoleon ti anons enn nouvo politik.

input: From now on-wards Animal Farm would engage in trade with the neighbouring farms: not, of course, for any commercial purpose, but simply in order to obtain certain materials which were urgently necessary.
target: Apartir sa zour la Baz Zanimo ti pou fer komers ar bann laferm vwazen pa pou fer profi me pou aste lekipman ek marsandiz neseser pou zot devlopman.

input: The needs of the windmill must override everything else, he said.
target: Konstriksion batiman eolienn li ti enn priyorite e so bezwen ti plis priyoriter ki nenport ki zafer.

input: He was therefore making arrangements to sell a stack of hay and part of the current year’s wheat crop, and later on, if more money were needed, it would have to be made up by the sale of eggs, for which there was always a market in Willingdon.
target: Li ti pe fer enn diil pou vann lerb ki zanimo manze, tou rekolt dible sa lane la, e si neseser ti pou vann dizef ki ti angrann-demann dan bazaar Willingdon.

input: The hens, said Napoleon, should welcome this sacrifice as their own special contribution towards the building of the windmill.
target: Napoleon ti dir ar lafors ki bann poul ti bizen aksepte fer sa sakrifis la parski sa ti pou zot kontribision pou ki proze eolienn materyalize.

input: Once again the animals were conscious of a vague uneasiness.
target: Ankor enn fwa bann zanimo ti malalez.

input: Never to have any dealings with human beings, never to engage in trade, never to make use of money had not these been among the earliest resolutions passed at that first triumphant Meeting after Jones was expelled?
target: Eski pa ti deside ki pa ti pou fer okenn tranzaksion ar imen, pa ti pou fer komers ar zot, pa ti pou servi lamone?

input: All the animals remembered passing such resolutions: or at least they thought that they remembered it.
target: Bann zanimo ti rapel ou plito zot ti kwar ki zot ti rapel.

input: The four young pigs who had protested when Napoleon abolished the Meetings raised their voices timidly, but they were promptly silenced by a tremendous growling from the dogs.
target: Kat ti koson ki ti proteste kan Napoleon ti aboli Miting Dimans ti relev zot lavwa bien timidman me grogne lisien ti ferm zot labous.

input: Then, as usual, the sheep broke into four legs good, two legs bad! and the momentary awkwardness was smoothed over.
target: Apre, kouma touzour, bann mouton ti larg zot refren, kat lapat bon, de lapat move e malez ti fonn.

input: Finally Napoleon raised his trotter for silence and announced that he had already made all the arrangements.
target: Napoleon ti lev so lapat divan pou dir lasanble res trankil e li ti enform zot ki li ti finn okip tou personelman.

input: There would be no need for any of the animals to come in contact with human beings, which would clearly be most undesirable.
target: Bann zanimo pa ti pou bizen ena kontak ar imen, ki ti klerman pa ti fezab.

input: He intended to take the whole burden upon his own shoulders.
target: Li ti prefer met tou fardo lor so prop zepol.

input: A Mr. Whymper, a solicitor living in Willingdon, had agreed to act as intermediary between Animal Farm and the outside world, and would visit the farm every Monday morning to receive his instructions.
target: Ti ena enn avwe, Misie Triyanger, ki ti pou azir kouma bayan ant Baz Zanimo ek leres lemonn. Sak Lendi gramaten li ti pou vinn lor laferm pou pran bann enstriksion.

input: Napoleon ended his speech with his usual cry of Long live Animal Farm! and after the singing of Beasts of England the animals were dismissed.
target: Napoleon ki ti klotir renion ar Viv Baz Zanimo!  Apre sante Zanimo Angleter lafoul ti disperse.

input: Afterwards Squealer made a round of the farm and set the animals minds at rest.
target: Pli tar Tronpet ti fer letour laferm e li ti fer lespri bann zanimo repose.

input: He assured them that the resolution against engaging in trade and using money had never been passed, or even suggested.
target: Li ti asir zot ki zame pa ti finn ena enn rezolision kont komers ar imen ousa kont servi lamone dan tranzaksion.

input: It was pure imagination, probably traceable in the beginning to lies circulated by Snowball.
target: Sa ti fos net. Sirman ti enn sa bann mansonz ki Boulkoton ti pe fane pou destabiliz Baz Zanimo.

input: A few animals still felt faintly doubtful, but Squealer asked them shrewdly, are you certain that this is not something that you have dreamed, comrades?
target: Detrwa zanimo pa ti pe gob explikasion Tronpet ki ti azoute, eski zot sir ki zot pa ti gagn sa dan enn rev, kamarad?
Eski sa finn ekrir sa kit plas?

input: Every Monday Mr. Whymper visited the farm as had been arranged.
target: Sak Lendi Misie Triyanger ti vizit Baz Zanimo kouma Napoleon ti deside.

input: He was a sly-looking little man with side whiskers, a solicitor in a very small way of business, but sharp enough to have realised earlier than anyone else that Animal Farm would need a broker and that the commissions would be worth having.
target: Li ti enn ti bonom rize ar long moustas, enn ti avwe nanye ditou me ki ti ase malen pou konpran bien vit ki Baz Zanimo ti pou bien bizen enn bayan-arkanter e ki dan tranzaksion ti pou ena bon paysa.

input: The animals watched his coming and going with a kind of dread, and avoided him as much as possible. Nevertheless, the sight of Napoleon, on all fours, delivering orders to Whymper, who stood on two legs, roused their pride and partly reconciled them to the new arrangement.
target: Bann zanimo ti pe yam li delwen me ler zot ti trouv Napoleon lor so kat lapat pe donn lord enn dimounn lor de lapat zot ti extra fier, sitan fier ki finalman zot ti aksepte aranzman la.

input: Their relations with the human race were now not quite the same as they had been before.
target: Zot relasion ar imen ti pe vinn mwens ostil.

input: The human beings did not hate Animal Farm any less now that it was prospering; indeed, they hated it more than ever.
target: Me bann imen zot laenn pou Baz Zanimo pa ti diminie. Okontrer. Plis Baz Zanimo ti pe propere, plis zot ti air li.

input: Every human being held it as an article of faith that the farm would go bankrupt sooner or later, and, above all, that the windmill would be a failure.
target: Sak imen ti sir ki biento laferm la ti pou met fayit e ki eolienn ti pou enn fiasko.

input: They would meet in the public-houses and prove to one another by means of diagrams that the windmill was bound to fall down, or that if it did stand up, then that it would never work.
target: Zot ti pe zwenn dan tavern e zot ti pe prouve nwar lor blan ek blan lor nwar ki batiman eolienn la ti pou grene e si li pa ti grene li pa ti pou marse.

input: And yet, against their will, they had developed a certain respect for the efficiency with which the animals were managing their own affairs.
target: Me malgre zot, zot ti oblize rekonet ki bann zanimo ti pe roul zot biznes bien.

input: One symptom of this was that they had begun to call Animal Farm by its proper name and ceased to pretend that it was called the Manor Farm.
target: Enn sign kler sa sanzman la se ki zot nepli ti pe apel laferm la Baz Jonns me Baz Zanimo.

input: They had also dropped their championship of Jones, who had given up hope of getting his farm back and gone to live in another part of the county.
target: Anplis zot ti aret soutenir Jonns ki finalman ti kit landrwa la pou al viv enn lot plas.

input: Except through Whymper, there was as yet no contact between Animal Farm and the outside world, but there were constant rumours that Napoleon was about to enter into a definite business agreement either with Mr. Pilkington of Foxwood or with Mr. Frederick of Pinchfield but never, it was noticed, with both simultaneously.
target: Apart ar Misie Triyanger, pa ti ena okenn tranzaksion ar imen me rimer ti pe sirkile ki Napoleon ti pe prepar enn diil swa ar Frederik, swa ar Pilkingtonn me zame ar toulede anmemtan.

input: It was about this time that the pigs suddenly moved into the farmhouse and took up their residence there.
target: Apepre mem lepok, bann koson ti al viv dan grannkaz.

input: Again the animals seemed to remember that a resolution against this had been passed in the early days, and again Squealer was able to convince them that this was not the case.
target: Bann zanimo ti rapel vagman enn rezolision kont sa. Me ti bien fasil pou Tronpet pou prouv zot ki zot ti dan erer.

input: It was absolutely necessary, he said, that the pigs, who were the brains of the farm, should have a quiet place to work in.
target: Bann koson ti pe travay dir, zotmem ti servo Baz Zanimo. Zot ti bizen konfor pou ki zot ti kapav akonpli zot mision.

input: It was also more suited to the dignity of the Leader (for of late he had taken to speaking of Napoleon under the title of Leader) to live in a house than in a mere sty.
target: Apre tou, Lider pa kapav viv dan enn maray. Depi enn tan Tronpet ki apel Napoleon Lider'.

input: Nevertheless, some of the animals were disturbed when they heard that the pigs not only took their meals in the kitchen and used the drawing-room as a recreation room, but also slept in the beds.
target: Me ti ena detrwa zanimo ki pa ti tro dakor ki bann koson manze dan lakwizinn, repose dan salon e dormi lor lili.

input: Boxer passed it off as usual with Napoleon is always right!, but Clover, who thought she remembered a definite ruling against beds, went to the end of the barn and tried to puzzle out the Seven Commandments which were inscribed there.
target: Pou Boxer pa ti ena problem. Napoleon kone ki li pe fer. Me Tref ki ti rapel kiksoz kont dormi lor lili, ti al reget Set Komannman.

input: Finding herself unable to read more than individual letters, she fetched Muriel.
target: Kouma li ti zis kapav rekonet bann let alfabet, li ti amenn Miryel ar li.

input: Muriel, she said, read me the Fourth Commandment.
target: Miryel, dir mwa si dan Katriyem Komannman.

input: Does it not say something about never sleeping in a bed?
target: pa ena kiksoz ki dir pa gagn drwa dormi lor lili?

input: With some difficulty Muriel spelt it out.
target: Ar boukou difikilte Miryel ti dir sa.

input: It says, No animal shall sleep in a bed with sheets, she announced finally.
target: Finn dir, Zanimo pa gagn drwa dormi lor lili ar dra, li ti anonse finalman.

input: Curiously enough, Clover had not remembered that the Fourth Commandment mentioned sheets; but as it was there on the wall, it must have done so.
target: Drol sa! Tref pa ti pe rapel ditou ki ti mansionn dra dan Katriyem Komannman me pwiske parol la ti ekrir lor miray, ti bizen aksepte.

input: And Squealer, who happened to be passing at this moment, attended by two or three dogs, was able to put the whole matter in its proper perspective.
target: Anmemtan, par sans, Tronpet ti pe pas par la akonpagne ar detrwa lisien e bien vit tou ti rant dan lord.

input: You have heard then, comrades, he said, that we pigs now sleep in the beds of the farmhouse?
target: Kamarad, mo'nn tann dir ki zot finn aprann ki nou bann koson, nou dormi lor lili dan grannkaz?

input: A bed merely means a place to sleep in.
target: Enn lili, li enn plas kot enn zanimo dormi.

input: A pile of straw in a stall is a bed, properly regarded.
target: Enn matla lapay dan enn stal, li enn lili sa, si nou get bien.

input: The rule was against sheets, which are a human invention.
target: Lalwa li kont dra ki enn envansion imen.

input: We have removed the sheets from the farmhouse beds, and sleep between blankets.
target: Peyna dra lor nou lili. Nou dormi ant de moulton.

input: And very comfortable beds they are too!
But not more comfortable than we need, I can tell you, comrades, with all the brainwork we have to do nowadays.
target: Me pa plis konfortab ki bizen, nou servo ki fer travoforse bizen kapav repoze.

input: When winter was coming close the animals were tired but happy.
target: Ler liver ti pe aprose bann zanimo ti fatige me ere.

input: They had had a hard year, and after the sale of part of the hay and corn, the stores of food for the winter were none too plentiful, but the windmill compensated for everything.
target: Zot ti finn gagn enn lane extra difisil e apre lavant lerb ek rekolt dible, manze ti zis pou zis me batiman eolienn ti pe grandi.

input: It was almost half built now.

After the harvest there was a stretch of clear dry weather, and the animals toiled harder than ever, thinking it well worth while to plod to and fro all day with blocks of stone if by doing so they could raise the walls another foot.
target: Apre lakoup ti ena enn bon period letan sek. Bann zanimo ti volonter pou double zefor pou ris ros pou ki miray la vinn enn pie pli ot.

input: Boxer would even come out at nights and work for an hour or two on his own by the light of the harvest moon.
target: Kan ti ena lalinn, Boxer ti al travay aswar pandan enn ou de ertan.

input: In their spare moments the animals would walk round and round the half-finished mill, admiring the strength and perpendicularity of its walls and marvelling that they should ever have been able to build anything so imposing.
target: Kan zot ti lib, bann zanimo ti mars otour batiman ankonstriksion pou admir so solidite; so miray ti drwat-drwat, kare-kare. Zot pa ti 'le kwar ki zot ti reysi ranz sa mervey la.

input: Only old Benjamin refused to grow enthusiastic about the windmill, though, as usual, he would utter nothing beyond the cryptic remark that donkeys live a long time.
target: Zis Benzamen ki ti gard so kalm e li ti zis dir ki bourik ti viv lontan.

input: November came, with raging south-west winds.
target: An Novam ti ena move letan.

input: Building had to stop because it was now too wet to mix the cement.
target: Travay ti bizen arete akoz lapli ti pe anpes bat beton.

input: Finally there came a night when the gale was so violent that the farm buildings rocked on their foundations and several tiles were blown off the roof of the barn.
target: Enn swar, rafal ti telman for ki bann batiman ti tranble e boukou bardo ti anvole.

input: The hens woke up squawking with terror because they had all dreamed simultaneously of hearing a gun go off in the distance.
target: Bann poul zot somey ti kase dan lafreyer total parski zot ti reve, zot tou, ki ti ena kout fizi.

input: In the morning the animals came out of their stalls to find that the flagstaff had been blown down and an elm tree at the foot of the orchard had been plucked up like a radish.
target: Gramaten ler zot ti sorti, zot ti trouve ki Lemapavyon ti tonbe, enn pie dan verze ti derasine net.

input: They had just noticed this when a cry of despair broke from every animal’s throat.
target: Ti ena enn gran kriye dezespwar ki ti sorti dan lagorz sak zanimo.

input: A terrible sight had met their eyes.
target: Zot pa ti 'le kwar zot lizie.
Batiman eolienn ti vinn enn mel ros.

input: With one accord they dashed down to the spot.
target: Zot tou ti fons drwat ver sayt la.

input: Napoleon, who seldom moved out of a walk, raced ahead of them all.
target: Mem Napoleon ki zame ti prese, ki koumans galoupe divan-divan.

input: Yes, there it lay, the fruit of all their struggles, levelled to its foundations, the stones they had broken and carried so laboriously scattered all around. Unable at first to speak, they stood gazing mournfully at the litter of fallen stone Napoleon paced to and fro in silence, occasionally snuffing at the ground.
target: Wi, tou zot travay ti tom plat e bann ros miray ti fane partou. Enkapab koze, zot nek ti pe fixe zot moniman anrwinn. Napoleon ti pe ale-vini, renifle teren.

input: His tail had grown rigid and twitched sharply from side to side, a sign in him of intense mental activity.
target: So lake ti drese e ti pe bouz-bouze. Sa ti enn sign ki so servo ti pe travay for-for.

input: Suddenly he halted as though his mind were made up.
target: Enn kou li ti arete net koumadir li ti finn dekouver enn zafer enportan.

input: Comrades, he said quietly, do you know who is responsible for this?
target: Kamarad, li ti koze dan enn lavwa kalm, zot kone kisannla responsab sa krim la?

input: Do you know the enemy who has come in the night and overthrown our windmill?
target: Zot konn sa ennmi finn vini dan nwar pou detrir nou travay?

input: SNOWBALL! he suddenly roared in a voice of thunder.
target: BOULKOTON! li ti kriye ar tapaz loraz.

input: In sheer malignity, thinking to set back our plans and avenge himself for his ignominious expulsion, this traitor has crept here under cover of night and destroyed our work of nearly a year.
target: Li finn vinn vanze parski nou finn expilse li, sal tret la. Li finn kraz zefor enn an travay.

input: Comrades, here and now I pronounce the death sentence upon Snowball.
target: Kamarad, isi e aster mo dekret lapenn kapital pou Boulkoton.

input: Animal Hero, Second Class, and half a bushelof apples to any animal who brings him to justice.
target: Meday Zanimo Ero, Deziem klas ek liv pom pou sak zanimo ki permet so kaptir.

input: A full bushel to anyone who captures him alive!
target: 48 liv pom pou seki kaptir li vivan.

input: The animals were shocked beyond measure to learn that even Snowball could be guilty of such an action.
target: Bann zanimo ti extra soke par sa nouvel la. Personn pa ti atann ki Boulkoton ti kapav fer enn zafer koumsa.

input: There was a cry of indignation, and everyone began thinking out ways of catching Snowball if he should ever come back.
target: Enn vag koler ti traverse e bann diferan zanimo ti pe fer lespri travay kouma ti pou may li si li ti retourne.

input: Almost immediately the footprints of a pig were discovered in the grass at a little distance from the knoll.
target: Pa ti tarde pou dekouver tras lapat koson lor lerb pre kot kolinn.

input: They could only be traced for a few yards, but appeared to lead to a hole in the hedge.
target: Ti ena tras lor enn ti distans dan direksion trou dan baraz separasion.

input: Napoleon snuffed deeply at them and pronounced them to be Snowball’s.
target: Napoleon ti renifle tras la e li ti deside ki sir-sir sa ti tras lapat Boulkoton.

input: He gave it as his opinion that Snowball had probably come from the direction of Foxwood Farm.
target: Pa ti ena dout. Boulkoton ti vinn depi laferm Bwarenar.

input: No more delays, comrades! cried Napoleon when the footprints had been examined.
target: Peyna letan pou perdi, kamarad, Napoleon ti kriye kan ti finn fini ekzaminn bann tras.

input: There is work to be done.
This very morning we begin rebuilding the windmill, and we will build all through the winter, rain or shine.
target: Toutswit nou pe rekoumans konstriksion batiman eolienn e nanye pa pou fer nou kile: ni liver, ni soley, ni lapli.

input: We will teach this miserable traitor that he cannot undo our work so easily.
target: Sal sal tret la pou konpran ki li pa pou kapav kal nou lelan.

input: Remember, comrades, there must be no alteration in our plans: they shall be carried out to the day.
target: Rapel, kamarad, plan pa pou sanze nou pou manz ar li ziska travay la fini.

input: Out of spite, the human beings pretended not to believe that it was Snowball who had destroyed the windmill: they said that it had fallen down because the walls were too thin.
target: Pou mok bann zanimo, bann imen ti pe dir ki li pa ti vre ki se Boulkoton ki ti detrir batiman eolienn; batiman eolienn ti grene parski miray pa ti ase epe.

input: The animals knew that this was not the case.
target: Bann zanimo ti sir ki sa koze la ti fos.

input: Still, it had been decided to build the walls three feet thick this time instead of eighteen inches as before, which meant collecting much larger quantities of stone.
target: Me par prekosion ti ena enn desizion pou fer miray la trwa pie pli larz sa fwa la olie dizwit pous kouma avan, ki vedir ramas pli gran kantite ros.

input: Some progress was made in the dry frosty weather that followed, but it was cruel work, and the animals could not feel so hopeful about it as they had felt before.
target: Kan letan ti lapli-lapli travay ti arete; zis kan ti sek ki ti kapav fer travay avanse. Lavi bann zanimo ti bien amer. Lespwar ti bien mens.

input: They were always cold, and usually hungry as well.
target: Zot ti malnouri e zot ti pe gagn fre.

input: Only Boxer and Clover never lost heart.
target: Zis Boxer ek Tref ti gard moral ot.

input: Squealer made excellent speeches on the joy of service and the dignity of labour, but the other animals found more inspiration in Boxer’s strength and his never-failing cry of I will work harder!.
target: Tronpet ti pe fer bann zoli diskour lor lazwa dan devwar ek dinite dan travay me se lekzanp Boxer ki ti enspir lezot. Mo pou travay pli dir! li ti kontinie dir.
An Zanvie manze ti koumans manke.

input: The corn ration was drastically reduced, and it was announced that an extra potato ration would be issued to make up for it.
target: Rasion may ti diminie e ti ena enn lanons ki ti pou konpans rediksion la par enn rasion extra pomdeter.

input: Then it was discovered that the greater part of the potato crop had been frosted in the clamps, which had not been covered thickly enough.
target: Apre ti dekouver ki gran parti pomdeter ti pouri dan later ki pa ti kouver ase.

input: For days at a time the animals had nothing to eat but chaff and mangels.
target: Parfwa ti ena zis lapay ek rasinn pou manze.

input: Starvation seemed to stare them in the face.
It was vitally necessary to conceal this fact from the outside world.
target: Li ti neseser kasiet sa depi lemond deor.

input: Emboldened by the collapse of the windmill, the human beings were inventing fresh lies about Animal Farm.
target: Depi problem batiman eolienn bann imen ti pe fann toutsort kalite rimer lor Baz Zanimo.

input: Once again it was being put about that all the animals were dying of famine and disease, and that they were continually fighting among themselves and had resorted to cannibalism and infanticide.
target: Ankor enn fwa ti fer konpran ki tou zanimo ti pe mordefen; zot ti pe lager ant zot; zot ti pe manz laser zot prosen; zot ti pe touy zot zanfan.

input: Napoleon was well aware of the bad results that might follow if the real facts of the food situation were known, and he decided to make use of Mr Whymper to spread a contrary impression.
target: Napolen ti kone ki si laverite eklate sa ti pou bien move pou Zanimoism. Li ti desid pou servi Misie Triyanger pou fer vadire tou pe mars korek-korek.

input: Hitherto the animals had had little or no contact with Whymper on his weekly visits: now, however, a few selected animals, mostly sheep, were instructed to remark casually in his hearing that rations had been increased.
target: Pa ti les li gagn kontak ar zanimo. Zis detrwa mouton bien selekte ti apros li pou dir ant zot, me pou fer li tande, ki finn ogmant zot rasion kotidien.

input: In addition, Napoleon ordered the almost empty bins in the store-shed to be filled nearly to the brim with sand, which was then covered up with what remained of the grain and meal.
target: Anplis Napoleon ti donn lord ranpli bann barik ek gamel manze ar disab ziska bor lao e lor la aroz manze pou donn lenpresion ki bann resipian la ti pe deborde ar manze.

input: On some suitable pretext Whymper was led through the store-shed and allowed to catch a glimpse of the bins.
target: Lerla ti envit Misie Triyanger pou vizit stor.

input: He was deceived, and continued to report to the outside world that there was no food shortage on Animal Farm.
target: Li ti may dan lak parski li ti pe dir tou dimoun ki ti ena plennti-plennti manze dan Baz Zanimo.

input: Nevertheless, towards the end of January it became obvious that it would be necessary to procure some more grain from somewhere.
target: Me ver lafen Zanvie, li ti kler ki ti bizen rod enn lot sours nouritir.

input: In these days Napoleon rarely appeared in public, but spent all his time in the farmhouse, which was guarded at each door by fierce-looking dogs.
target: Pandan lepok dir, pa ti pe trouv Napoleon ki ti res dan grannkaz e bann laport ti veye par bann lisien feros.

input: When he did emerge, it was in a ceremonial manner, with an escort of six dogs who closely surrounded him and growled if anyone came too near.
target: Sak fwa ki li ti kit so lakaz, li ti adopte enn stil protokoler, sis lisien ti antour li e si kikenn ti rod koste bann lisien ti menas pou morde.

input: Frequently he did not even appear on Sunday mornings, but issued his orders through one of the other pigs, usually Squealer.
target: Souvan li pa ti prezan dan Miting Dimans e se Tronpet ki ti distribie latas.

input: One Sunday morning Squealer announced that the hens, who had just come in to lay again, must surrender their eggs.
target: Enn Dimans Tronpet ti dir bann poul ki ti vinn ponn zot dizef, ki zot ti pou bizen donn zot dizef.

input: Napoleon had accepted, through Whymper, a contract for four hundred eggs a week.
target: Napoleon ti finn sign enn kontra ar Misie Triyanger pou lavant 400 dizef par semenn.

input: The price of these would pay for enough grain and meal to keep the farm going till summer came on and conditions were easier.
target: Ar kas ki ti pou gagne ti pou aste manze pou zanimo ziska ki letan ti ameliore e lavi ti revinn normal.

input: When the hens heard this, they raised a terrible outcry.
target: Pa bizen dir, ler bann poul ti tann sa ti ena enn gran mouvman protestasion.

input: They had been warned earlier that this sacrifice might be necessary, but had not believed that it would really happen.
target: Ti deza dir zot ki sa ti kapav vinn neseser me zot ti kwar ki sa ti enposib.

input: They were just getting their clutches ready for the spring sitting, and they protested that to take the eggs away now was murder.
target: Zot ti pe prepare pou kouv zot dizef e zot ti pe dir ki si pran zot dizef se koumadir ti pe touy zot zanfan.

input: For the first time since the expulsion of Jones, there was something resembling a rebellion.
target: Premie fwa depi expulsion Jonns ti ena enn sitiasion ki ti resanble enn rebelyon.

input: Led by three young Black Minorca pullets, the hens made a determined effort to thwart Napoleon’s wishes.
target: Sou lidership trwa zenn poul nwar, bann poul ti deside pou dam pion Napoleon.

input: Their method was to fly up to the rafters and there lay their eggs, which smashed to pieces on the floor.
target: Zot ti anvole, al poz lor bann travers e ler zot ti ponn zot dizef li ti tonbe, al kraz lor sali.

input: He ordered the hens’ rations to be stopped, and decreed that any animal giving so much as a grain of corn to a hen should be punished by death.
target: Li ti deside ki bann poul refrakter pa ti pou gagn manze e si kikenn donn zot mem enn lagren may, li ti pou sibir enn pinision ekzanpler: lapenn kapital.

input: The dogs saw to it that these orders were carried out.
target: Bann lisien ti gagn lord pou reprim dezobeisans.

input: For five days the hens held out, then they capitulated and went back to their nesting boxes.
target: Pandan senk zour bann poul ti tini ferm me apre zot ti kapitile e ti retourn dan zot kazot.

input: Nine hens had died in the meantime.
Their bodies were buried in the orchard, and it was given out that they had died of coccidiosis.
target: Selon rapor ofisiel zot ti gagn enn move gastro.

input: Whymper heard nothing of this affair, and the eggs were duly delivered, a grocer’s van driving up to the farm once a week to take them away.
target: Triyanger pa ti okouran. Ti livre komann dizef rekta. Vann boutikie ti borde enn fwa par semenn pou pran livrezon.

input: All this while no more had been seen of Snowball.
target: Pandan sa letan la ti bliye Boulkoton.

input: He was rumoured to be hiding on one of the neighbouring farms, either Foxwood or Pinchfield.
target: Ti ena enn rimer ki li ti pe kasiet dan enn bann laferm vwazen; swa dan Bwarenar, swa dan TrapTou.

input: Napoleon was by this time on slightly better terms with the other farmers than before.
target: Napoleon sa lepok la ti pe devlop bann meyer relasion ar bann lezot fermie.

input: It happened that there was in the yard a pile of timber which had been stacked there ten years earlier when a beech spinney was cleared.
target: Dan lakour Baz Zanimo ti ena enn ta dibwa ki ti ramase apre ki ti finn met enn ti danbwa prop dis an oparavan.

input: Whymper had advised Napoleon to sell it.
target: Triyanger ti konsey Napoleon pou vann li.

input: Mr. Pilkington and Mr. Frederick were anxious to buy it.
target: Misie Pilkingtonn ek Misie Frederik, toulede ti anvi aste li.

input: Napoleon was hesitating between the two, unable to make up his mind.
target: Napoleon pa ti pe kapav deside ar kisannla ti pou fer diil la.

input: It was noticed that whenever he seemed on the point of coming to an agreement with Frederick, Snowball was declared to be in hiding at Foxwood, while, when he inclined toward Pilkington, Snowball was said to be at Pinchfield.
target: Enn zafer drol ti pe arive. Kan Napoleon ti pre pou tom dakor ar Frederik ti ena niouz ki Boulkoton ti pe kasiet dan Bwarenar; si li ti pre pou tom dakor ar Pilkingtonn, Boulkoton ti pe kasiet dan TrapTou.

input: Suddenly, at the end of winter, an alarming thing was discovered.
target: Ver lafen liver ti ena enn nouvel sok.

input: Snowball was secretly frequenting the farm by night!
target: Ti tann dir ki Boulkoton ti pe vizit Baz Zanimo ansekre aswar.

input: The animals were so disturbed that they could hardly sleep in their stalls.
target: Bann zanimo ti telman boulverse ki zot pa ti pe kapav dormi.

input: Every night, it was said, he came creeping in under cover of darkness and performed all kinds of mischief.
target: Dapre rimer, li ti atann marenwar konple pou vinn fer so bakanal.

input: He stole the corn, he upset the milk-pails, he broke the eggs, he trampled the seedbeds, he gnawed the bark off the fruit trees.
target: li ti koken may, ranvers seo dile, kraz dizef, mars lor platband, desir lekors bann pie fri.

input: Whenever anything went wrong it became usual to attribute it to Snowball.
target: Kan enn zafer ti golmal se Boulkoton ki ti responsab.

input: If a window was broken or a drain was blocked up, someone was certain to say that Snowball had come in the night and done it, and when the key of the store-shed was lost, the whole farm was convinced that Snowball had thrown it down the well.
target: Enn vit lafnet ti fele? Boulkoton mem sa! Lakle stor ti disparet. Limem sa! Sirman li ti finn zet li dan danpi!

input: Curiously enough, they went on believing this even after the mislaid key was found under a sack of meal.
target: Seki ti drol, bann zanimo ti kontinie kwar ki Boulkoton ti responsab mem kan ti trouv lakle la anba enn bal may.

input: The cows declared unanimously that Snowball crept into their stalls and milked them in their sleep.
target: Bann vas ti pe rakonte ki aswar dan zot somey, Boulkoton ti vinn tir zot dile.

input: The rats, which had been troublesome that winter, were also said to be in league with Snowball.
target: Bann lera ti pe fer dezord parski zot ti pe rod manze. Sirman zot ti konplis Boulkoton.

input: Napoleon decreed that there should be a full investigation into Snowball’s activities.
target: Napoleon ti dekrete ki ti bizen enn lanket konple lor bann aktivite Boulkoton.

input: With his dogs in attendance he set out and made a careful tour of inspection of the farm buildings, the other animals following at a respectful distance.
target: Akonpagne par so bann lisien, li ti fer enn enspeksion konple tou bann batiman. Bann lezot zanimo ti pe swiv li lwen deryer pou pa deranz li.

input: At every few steps Napoleon stopped and snuffed the ground for traces of Snowball’s footsteps, which, he said, he could detect by the smell.
target: Apre detrwa pa, li ti arete, renifle later pou rod tras prezans Boulkoton. Li ti dir zot li ti kapav detekte so prezans ar so nene.

input: He snuffed in every corner, in the barn, in the cow-shed, in the henhouses, in the vegetable garden, and found traces of Snowball almost everywhere.
target: Li ti ekzaminn tou bann kwen dan langar, dan lekiri, dan poulaye, dan potaze e partou li ti dekouver tras Boulkoton.

input: He would put his snout to the ground, give several deep sniffs, ad exclaim in a terrible voice, Snowball!
target: Li ti pou met so nene pre ar later, respir enn gran kou e lerla li ti pou kriye ar enn lavwa toner, Boulkoton!

input: I can smell him distinctly! and at the word Snowball all the dogs let out blood-curdling growls and showed their side teeth.
target: So loder mem sa! e kouma li ti pronons nom 'Boulkoton'. bann lisien kondisione ti pou menase e montre zot kaninn.
Bann zanimo zot leker ti pe bate for-for.
