input: It seemed to them as though Snowball were some kind of invisible influence, pervading the air about them and menacing them with all kinds of dangers.
target: Pou zot Boulkoton ti enn lafors envizib ki ti partou e ki ti pe fer zot lavi vinn martir.

input: In the evening Squealer called them together, and with an alarmed expression on his face told them that he had some serious news to report.
target: Tar dan tanto, Tronpet ti konvok tou bann zanimo. So figir ti trakase. Li ti enform zot ki li ti ena nouvel bien grav pou donn zot.

input: Comrades! cried Squealer, making little nervous skips, a most terrible thing has been discovered.
target: Kamarad! li ti kriye for. Komdabitid li ti pe sot-sote adrwat-agos me li ti pli nerve. Nou finn dekouver enn zafer extraordiner.

input: Snowball has sold himself to Frederick of Pinchfield Farm, who is even now plotting to attack us and take our farm away from us!
target: Boulkoton finn vande ar Frederik, propriyeter TrapTou. Zot pe prepare pou atak nou pou koken nou laferm.

input: Snowball is to act as his guide when the attack begins.
target: Boulkoton pou gide kan latak koumanse.

input: But there is worse than that.
We had thought that Snowball’s rebellion was caused simply by his vanity and ambition.
target: Nou ti kwar ki Boulkoton ti motive par foligrander ek anbision.

input: Snowball was in league with Jones from the very start!
target: Depi koumansman Boulkoton ti pe mars ar Jonns.

input: It has all been proved by documents which he left behind him and which we have only just discovered.
target: Ena dokiman, ki li ti lese deryer li e ki nou ti dekouver, pou prouv sa.

input: To my mind this explains a great deal, comrades.
Did we not see for ourselves how he attempted fortunately without success to get us defeated and destroyed at the Battle of the Cowshed?
target: Aster li kler ki li ti fer tou pou fer nou manz feyaz dan Batay Lekiri Vas?
Bann zanimo nepli ti kone ki pou panse.

input: This was a wickedness far outdoing Snowball’s destruction of the windmill.
target: Sa krim la li ti pir ki destriksion batiman eolienn.

input: But it was some minutes before they could fully take it in.
target: Me li ti kout Selman de-trwa minit avan ki zot pran li kompletman.

input: They all remembered, or thought they remembered, how they had seen Snowball charging ahead of them at the Battle of the Cowshed, how he had rallied and encouraged them at every turn, and how he had not paused for an instant even when the pellets from Jones’s gun had wounded his back.
target: Zot ti bizen letan pou met enpe lord dan zot lespri parski zot ti pe gagn lenpresion ki Boulkoton ti lite kouma enn solda liberte; li ti pe mars divan-divan; li ti blese me li pa ti aret konbat ennmi.

input: At first it was a little difficult to see how this fitted in with his being on Jones’s side.
target: Koumansman li ti difisil pou trouve kimanier li ti kapav pe mars ar Jonns.

input: Even Boxer, who seldom asked questions, was puzzled.
target: Mem Boxer ti pe gagn taxion.

input: He lay down, tucked his fore hoofs beneath him, shut his eyes, and with a hard effort managed to formulate his thoughts.
target: Li ti asize, met so sabo divan anba li, li ti ferm so lizie e apre enn zefor mazistral, li ti reysi exprim so panse.

input: I do not believe that, he said.
target: Mo pa dakor! li ti dir.

input: Snowball fought bravely at the Battle of the Cowshed.
target: Boulkoton ti lite ar kouraz, ti konbat ennmi dan Batay Lekiri Vas.

input: Did we not give him Animal Hero, First Class, immediately afterwards?
target: Akoz sa nou ti pa donn li tit Zanimo Ero, Premie Klas?
Samem ti nou pli gran erer, kamarad.

input: For we know now it is all written down in the secret documents that we have found  that in reality he was trying to lure us to our doom.
target: Aster nou finn realiz sa grasa bann dokiman ki nou finn dekouver e an realite li ti fer enn plan pou ris nou dan enn piez.

input: But he was wounded, said Boxer. We all saw him running with blood.
target: Me li ti blese; nou ti trouv so disan pe koule, Boxer ti dir ar lafors.

input: That was part of the arrangement! cried Squealer. Jones’s shot only grazed him.
target: Sa ti dan zot plan, Tronpet ti sey explike ki Jonns ti servi so fizi pa pou touye me pou fer enn ti dimal pou permet Boulkoton gagn senpati.

input: I could show you this in his own writing, if you were able to read it.
target: Mo ti kapav donn zot dokiman la pou lir me lekritir sa tret la pa prop.

input: The plot was for Snowball, at the critical moment, to give the signal for flight and leave the field to the enemy.
target: Dapre zot plan ler moman krisial ti vini, Boulkoton ti pou donn lord depoz zarm e kit kan pou lennmi.

input: And he very nearly succeeded I will even say, comrades, he would have succeeded if it had not been for our heroic Leader, Comrade Napoleon.
target: Li ti preske reysi e li ti pou reysi si nou Lider eroik, Kamarad Napoleon, pa ti dam so pion.

input: Comrade Napoleon sprang forward with a cry of Death to Humanity! and sank his teeth in Joness leg?
target: Kamarad Napoleon ti fons lor Jonns e ti mord so mole.

input: Our Leader, Comrade Napoleon, announced Squealer, speaking very slowly and firmly, has stated categorically  categorically, comrade  that Snowball was Jones’s agent from the very beginning  yes, and from long before the Rebellion was ever thought of.
target: Nou Lider, Kamarad Napoleon, Tronpet ti dir lantman dan enn ton ferm, finn dir kategorikman “ ka te go rik man, kamarad “ ki Boulkoton ti enn azan Jonns depi koumansman “ wi “ mem avan ki lide Revolision ti ne.

input: If Comrade Napoleon says it, it must be right.
target: Si Kamarad Napoleon dir sa, li bizin korek.

input: That is the true spirit, comrade! cried Squealer, but it was noticed he cast a very ugly look at Boxer with his little twinkling eyes.
target: Sa ki veritab lespri Zanimoism! Tronpet ti dir. Li ti pe get Boxer ar lizie traver.

input: He turned to go, then paused and added impressively: I warn every animal on this farm to keep his eyes very wide open.
target: Avan li ti ale, Li ti tourney e li ti ale, lerla li ti reste trankil e li ti donn enn warning. Fer atansion, mo dir zot.

input: For we have reason to think that some of Snowballs secret agents are lurking among us at this moment!
target: Boulkoton ena so bann azan isi, parmi nou, dan nou laferm.

input: Four days later, in the late afternoon, Napoleon ordered all the animals to assemble in the yard.
target: Kat zour apre, tar dan tanto, Napoleon donn lord tou bann zanimo zwenn dan lakour.

input: When they were all gathered together, Napoleon emerged from the farmhouse, wearing both his medals (for he had recently awarded himself Animal Hero, First Class, and Animal Hero, Second Class), with his nine huge dogs frisking round him and uttering growls that sent shivers down all the animals spines.
target: Kan tou zanimo ti fini rasanble, Napoleon ti sorti dan lakaz, rant dan lakour. Li ti met so de meday (li ti fek donn limem meday 'Zanimo Ero, Premie Klas' ek 'Zanimo Ero, Deziem Klas') e so nef lisien ti pe sot-sote otour li e zot manier grogne ek zape ti pe fer bann zanimo gagn tranbleman.

input: They all cowered silently in their places, seeming to know in advance that some terrible thing was about to happen.
target: Bann zanimo ansilans ti bes latet, al asiz dan zot plas. Zot tou ti resanti ki enn zafer terib ti pou arive.

input: Napoleon stood sternly surveying his audience; then he uttered a high-pitched whimper.
target: Napoleon ti dibout drwat e ti pe get bann zanimo ar enn regar sever.

input: Immediately the dogs bounded forward, seized four of the pigs by the ear and dragged them, squealing with pain and terror, to Napoleons feet.
target: Enn kou, san atann li ti larg enn son koler sourd. Deswit bann lisien ti fons drwat lor kat koson, ti trap zot par zot zorey, trenn-trenn zot ziska lipie Napoleon.

input: The pigs ears were bleeding, the dogs had tasted blood, and for a few moments they appeared to go quite mad.
target: Bann koson la ti pe irle ar douler. Zot ti terifie e zot zorey ti pe segne. Bann lisien la ti gagn gou disan e pandan enn tibout letan zot ti koumadir fou.

input: Boxer saw them coming and put out his great hoof, caught a dog in mid-air, and pinned him to the ground.
target: Boxer ki ti trouv zot pe vinn lor li. Ar so sabo divan, li ti blok enn lisien e ti koulout li lor later.

input: The dog shrieked for mercy and the other two fled with their tails between their legs.
target: Lisien la ti koumans plengne pou dimann pardon; de lezot la ti fonn lor vites, lake ant lakwis.

input: Boxer looked at Napoleon to know whether he should crush the dog to death or let it go.
target: Boxer ti get Napoleon pou kone si ti bizen tir trip lisien la ousa donn li enn sans.

input: Napoleon appeared to change countenance, and sharply ordered Boxer to let the dog go.
target: Napoleon so figir ti paret dekouyone e li ti dimann Boxer les lisien la ale.

input: Boxer lifted his hoof, and the dog slunk away, bruised and howling.
target: Boxer ti lev so sabo e lisien la ti glise, ale, ti tann li pe kriye-plore.
Apre enn timama, tapaz ti tengn.

input: The four pigs waited, trembling, with guilt written on every line of their countenances.
target: Kat koson la ti pe tranble koumadir zot ti koupab enn gran krim.

input: Napoleon now called upon them to confess their crimes.
target: Napoleon ti ordonn zot konfes zot krim.

input: They were the same four pigs as had protested when Napoleon abolished the Sunday Meetings.
target: Zot ti sa mem kat koson ki ti proteste kan ti aboli Miting Dimans.

input: Without any further prompting they confessed that they had been secretly in touch with Snowball ever since his expulsion, that they had collaborated with him in destroying the windmill, and that they had entered into an agreement with him to hand over Animal Farm to Mr Frederick.
target: Deswit zot ti konfese ki depi so expilsion zot ti ankontak ar Boulkoton; zot ti ed li pou detrir batiman eolienn e ki zot ti fer enn diil ar li pou ki Misie Frederik vinn propriyeter Baz Zanimo.

input: They added that Snowball had privately admitted to them that he had been Joness secret agent for years past.
target: Zot ti azoute ki Boulkoton ti dir zot ki depi toultan li ti enn azan Jonns.

input: When they had finished their confession, the dogs promptly tore their throats out, and in a terrible voice Napoleon demanded whether any other animal had anything to confess.
target: Kan zot ti fini zot konfesion, bann lisien ti desir zot lagorz e Napoleon ar enn lavwa sorti direk dan lanfer, ti dimande si pa ti ena okenn lezot zanimo ki ti ena krim pou konfese.

input: The three hens who had been the ringleaders in the attempted rebellion over the eggs now came forward and stated that Snowball had appeared to them in a dream and incited them to disobey Napoleons orders.
target: Trwa poul ki ti diriz rebelion lor zafer dizef ti vinn divan pou konfese ki Boulkoton ti vinn dan zot rev pou fer zot fer dezord.

input: Then a goose came forward and confessed to having secreted six ears of corn during the last years harvest and eaten them in the night.
target: Enn lezwa ti avanse pou dir ki li ti koken sis zepi dible ki li ti manze aswar.

input: Then a sheep confessed to having urinated in the drinking pool  urged to do this, so she said, by Snowball and two other sheep confessed to having murdered an old ram, an especially devoted follower of Napoleon, by chasing him round and round a bonfire when he was suffering from a cough.
target: Enn mouton ti vinn dir ki li ti fer titour dan basen dilo kot zanimo bwar e ki se Boulkoton ki ti fer li fer sa. De lezot mouton ti vinn konfese ki zot ti fer enn vie mouton mal galoup otour enn dife ziska ki li ti tom sek. Li ti asmatik. Zot ti fer sa parski vie mouton la ti enn admirater Napoleon.

input: And so the tale of confessions and executions went on, until there was a pile of corpses lying before Napoleons feet and the air was heavy with the smell of blood, which had been unknown there since the expulsion of Jones.
target: Isteri konfesion ek ekzekision ti kontinie ziska ki ti ena enn ti montagn kadav kot lipie Napoleon. Ler ti lour ar loder disan. Premie fwa sa ti arive depi expilsion Jonns.

input: When it was all over, the remaining animals, except for the pigs and dogs, crept away in a body.
target: Apre sa masak la, apart koson ek lisien, tou bann zanimo ansam ti koumans deklase.

input: They did not know which was more shocking the treachery of the animals who had leagued themselves with Snowball, or the cruel retribution they had just witnessed.
target: Zot pa ti pe kapav deside ki zafer ti pli pir: traizon serten zanimo ki ti fer enn lalians diabolik ar Boulkoton ousa sa karnaz ki ti finn deroule divan zot lizie.

input: In the old days there had often been scenes of bloodshed equally terrible, but it seemed to all of them that it was far worse now that it was happening among themselves.
target: Dan lepok Jonn ti ena sa kalite masak la me aster li ti pir parski zanimo ti pe touy zanimo.

input: Since Jones had left the farm, until today, no animal had killed another animal.
target: Depi depar Jonns okenn zanimo pa ti finn pran lavi enn lot zanimo.

input: Not even a rat had been killed.
target: Mem lera ti pe sirkil ansekirite.

input: They had made their way on to the little knoll where the half-finished windmill stood, and with one accord they all lay down as though huddling together for warmth  Clover, Muriel, Benjamin, the cows, the sheep, and a whole flock of geese and hens  everyone, indeed, except the cat, who had suddenly disappeared just before Napoleon ordered the animals to assemble.
target: Tou bann zanimo ansam ti pe trenn zot lipie pou mont lor ti kolinn kot batiman eolienn ti ankonstriksion. Zot tou enstenktivman ti asiz enn akote lot koumadir zot ti bizen enpe saler zot prosen. Zot tou ti kole enn kont lot: Tref, Miryel, Benzamen, bann vas, bann mouton, bann lezwa ek poul. Enn sel absan: sat. Li ti disparet kouma li ti santi lay.

input: Only Boxer remained on his feet.
target: Zis Boxer ki ti res dibout.

input: He fidgeted to and fro, swishing his long black tail against his sides and occasionally uttering a little whinny of surprise.
target: Li pa ti pe kapav res anplas. Ar so long lake nwar li ti pe fwet so lekor, de kote. Tanzantan li ti larg enn ti enisman ki ti montre ki li ti malalez.

input: Finally he said: I do not understand it.
target: Finalman li ti koze: Mo pa pe konpran nanye.

input: I would not have believed that such things could happen on our farm.
target: Zame mo ti pou kwar ki enn zafer koumsa ti kapav arive lor nou laferm.

input: It must be due to some fault in ourselves.
target: Sirma tousa pe koze par nou prop fot.

input: The solution, as I see it, is to work harder.
target: Sel solision se travay pli dir.

input: From now onwards I shall get up a full hour earlier in the mornings.
target: Apartir aster, mo pou leve enn ertan pli boner dan gramatin.

input: And he moved off at his lumbering trot and made for the quarry.
target: Li ti kit zot ar so pa lour pou al dan karyer.

input: Having got there, he collected two successive loads of stone and dragged them down to the windmill before retiring for the night.
target: Laba li ti ramas de voyaz ros ki li ti rise ziska sayt konstriksion. Apre li ti al dormi.

input: The animals huddled about Clover, not speaking.
target: Bann zanimo ti plot enn kont lot otour Tref, ansilans.

input: The knoll where they were lying gave them a wide prospect across the countryside.
target: Depi oter kolinn la zot ti gagn enn vi konple pei otour zot.

input: Most of Animal Farm was within their view the long pasture stretching down to the main road, the hayfield, the spinney, the drinking pool, the ploughed fields where the young wheat was thick and green, and the red roofs of the farm buildings with the smoke curling from the chimneys.
target: Enn bon parti Baz Zanimo ti vizib: patiraz ki ti desann ziska gran sime, bann plantasion, enn ti danbwa, basen kot zanimo al bwar, later laboure kot bann zenn pous ti frengan, twatir rouz grannkaz ek so lafime ki ti pe monte par lasemine.

input: It was a clear spring evening.
target: Sa tanto la, lesiel ti kler.

input: The grass and the bursting hedges were gilded by the level rays of the sun.
target: Soley kousan ti pe aroz lerb ek baraz banbou ki ti pe larg nouvo leker.

input: Never had the farm and with a kind of surprise they remembered that it was their own farm, every inch of it their own property appeared to the animals so desirable a place.
target: Laferm la, zot prop laferm, ti ena enn bote spesial.

input: As Clover looked down the hillside her eyes filled with tears.
target: Tref so lizie ti plen ar larm.

input: If she could have spoken her thoughts, it would have been to say that this was not what they had aimed at when they had set themselves years ago to work for the overthrow of the human race.
target: Dan so latet, pa sa masak ki ti deroule divan zot lizie ki ti dan zot rev ler zot ti expilse bann imen.

input: These scenes of terror and slaughter were not what they had looked forward to on that night when old Major first stirred them to rebellion.
target: Kan Bonom Mazor ti fer zot anvi viv enn nouvo lavi, pa ti ena plas pou terer, masak, disan ek destriksion.

input: If she herself had had any picture of the future, it had been of a society of animals set free from hunger and the whip, all equal, each working according to his capacity, the strong protecting the weak, as she had protected the lost brood of ducklings with her foreleg on the night of Majors speech.
target: Dan so lespri ti ena enn lavi san lafen, san kout fwet; ti ena egalite pou tou zanimo; ti ena solidarite kot seki for ti pou protez seki feb kouma li ti protez bann ti kanar orfelen swar diskour Bonom Mazor.

input: Instead she did not know why they had come to a time when no one dared speak his mind, when fierce, growling dogs roamed everywhere, and when you had to watch your comrades torn to pieces after confessing to shocking crimes.
target: Olie sa, pa kone kifer, zanimo per pou koze, lisien feros menase pou enn wi, pou enn non. Pir ki tou, zanimo, enpwisan, bizen get zanimo martirize, tortire apre ki zot ti finn konfes bann krim enkrwayab.

input: There was no thought of rebellion or disobedience in her mind.
target: Li pa ti pe pans rebelion ousa dezobeisans dan so lespri.

input: She knew that, even as things were, they were far better off than they had been in the days of Jones, and that before all else it was needful to prevent the return of the human beings.
target: Li kone ki malgre tou difikilte zot lavi ti meyer ki lepok Jonns e okenn zanimo pa ti le retour imen lor Baz Zanimo.

input: Whatever happened she would remain faithful, work hard, carry out the orders that were given to her, and accept the leadership of Napoleon.
target: Ariv seki ariv, li ti pou res fidel ar so laferm, ti pou travay dir, ti pou fer seki ti pou dir li fer e li ti pou mars deryer Napoleon.

input: But still, it was not for this that she and all the other animals had hoped and toiled.
target: Me ti ena enn lasagren dan so leker.

input: It was not for this that they had built the windmill and faced the bullets of Joness gun.
target: Pa pou sa ki zot ti fer tou sa zefor la; pa pou sa ki zot ti trime pou konstrir batiman eolienn; pa pou sa ki zot ti fer fas bal ek fizi Jonns.

input: Such were her thoughts, though she lacked the words to express them.
target: So leker ti lour, so vant mama ti pe brile me parol pa ti pe sorti.

input: At last, feeling this to be in some way a substitute for the words she was unable to find, she began to sing Beasts of England.
target: Alafen, koumadir li ti finn gagn enn stepne pou bann emosion ki li pa ti pe kapav exprime, li ti koumans sant Zanimo Angleter.

input: The other animals sitting round her took it up, and they sang it three times over  very tunefully, but slowly and mournfully, in a way they had never sung it before.
target: Bann lezot zanimo otour li ti koumans sant ar li, lantman ar tristes me annarmoni. Zame zot ti sant li dan enn fason osi tousan.

input: They had just finished singing it for the third time when Squealer, attended by two dogs, approached them with the air of having something important to say.
target: Ler zot ti fini sant li trwa fwa, Tronpet akonpagne par de lisien ti vinn zwenn zot pou dir zot ki Kamarad Nopoleon ti finn fek dekrete ki

input: He announced that, by a special decree of Comrade Napoleon, Beasts of England had been abolished.
From now onwards it was forbidden to sing it.
target: Apartir aster ti interdi sant sa.
Ti pran bann zanimo par sirpriz.

input: Its no longer needed, comrade, said Squealer stiffly.
Beasts of England was the song of the Rebellion.
But the Rebellion is now completed.
The execution of the traitors this afternoon was the final act.
target: Ekzekision bann tret ti endik solision final.

input: The enemy both external and internal has been defeated.
target: Ennmi andeor ek andan laferm finn gagn enn bate kondire.

input: Clearly this song has no longer any purpose.

Frightened though they were, some of the animals might possibly have protested, but at this moment the sheep set up their usual bleating of Four legs good, two legs bad, which went on for several minutes and put an end to the discussion.
target: Malgre lafreyer, detrwa zanimo ti kapav proteste me zis salerla bann mouton ti koumans zot refren: Kat lapat bon, de lapat move. Zot ti alemem pandan plizier minit e okenn diskision pa ti posib.

input: So Beasts of England was heard no more. In its place Minimus, the poet, had composed another song which began: Animal Farm, Animal Farm, Never through me shall come to harm!
target: Dan plas Zanimo Angleter Tikalite ti konpoz enn ti sante patriyotik: Baz Zanimo, Baz Zanimo Mo pa pou les twa gagn kongolo.

input: This was sung every Sunday morning after the hoisting of the flag.
target: Zot ti sant sa sak Dimans gramaten apre ki ti lev pavyon.

input: But somehow neither the words nor the tune ever seemed to the animals to come up to Beasts of England.
target: Pou bann zanimo, sa sante la pa ti kapav koste ar Zanimo Angleter.

input: A few days later, when the terror caused by the executions had died down, some of the animals remembered  or thought they remembered  that the Sixth Commandment decreed No animal shall kill any other animal.
target: Detrwa zour pli tar, kan lespri tromatize ti pe koumans rekipere, bann zanimo ti pe koumans rapel “ ousa zot ti pe kwar ki kikfwa zot ti pe rapel “ ki Siziem Komannman ti dir ki Okenn zanimo pa gagn drwa touy enn lot zanimo.

input: And though no one cared to mention it in the hearing of the pigs or the dogs, it was felt that the killings which had taken place did not square with this.
target: E mem si okenn zanimo pa ti panse pou dir sa divan koson ousa lisien, ti ena enn konsansis ki evennman tromatik la pa ti kadre ar Siziem Komannman.

input: Clover asked Benjamin to read her the Sixth Commandment, and when Benjamin, as usual, said that he refused to meddle in such matters, she fetched Muriel.
target: Tref ti dimann Benzamen lir sa Komannman la pou li me nou bourik ti refize parski li pa ti anvi met so nene dan zafer ki pa regard li.

input: Muriel read the Commandment for her.
target: Lerla Tref ti al dimann Miryel lir sa.

input: It ran: No animal shall kill any other animal without cause.
target: Ala ki Miryel ti trouve: Okenn zanimo pa gagn drwa touy enn lot zanimo, san rezon.

input: Somehow or other, the last two words had slipped out of the animals memory.
target: Aster li ti paret kler ki de dernie mo la ti efase dan zot memwar.

input: But they saw now that the Commandment had not been violated.
target: Donk pa ti viol okenn Komannman.

input: Clearly there was good reason for killing the traitors who had leagued themselves with Snowball.
target: Li ti kler ki ti ena bon rezon pou touy bann tret ki ti pe mars ar Boulkoton.

input: Throughout the year the animals worked even harder than they had worked in the previous year.
target: Pandan sa lane la, bann zanimo ti travay ankor pli dir ki lane presedan.

input: To rebuild the windmill, with walls twice as thick as before, and to finish it by the appointed date, together with the regular work of the farm, was a tremendous labour.
target: Pa ti fasil rekonstrir batiman eolienn la ar enn miray de fwa pli epe, terminn li atan e anmemtan kontinie ar travay normal lor laferm.

input: There were times when it seemed to the animals that they worked longer hours and fed no better than they had done in Jones’s day.
target: Parfwa bann zanimo la ti pe santi ki zot ti pe travay boukou plis e ti pe gagn mwens manze ki dan lepok Jonns.

input: On Sunday mornings Squealer, holding down a long strip of paper with his trotter, would read out to them lists of figures proving that the production of every class of foodstuff had increased by two hundred per cent, three hundred per cent, or five hundred per cent, as the case might be.
target: Toule Dimans gramaten, Tronpet ti pe donn zot bann sif lor prodiksion manze ki ti ogmante par de san, trwa san, mem senk san pour san.

input: The animals saw no reason to disbelieve him, especially as they could no longer remember very clearly what conditions had been like before the Rebellion.
target: Bann zanimo pa ti ena okenn rezon pa kwar Tronpet sirtou ki zot nepli ti rapel sitiasion avan.

input: All the same, there were days when they felt that they would sooner have had less figures and more food.
target: Me parfwa zot ti pou prefer gagn mwens sif ek plis manze.

input: All orders were now issued through Squealer or one of the other pigs.
target: Aster ti pe donn bann lord atraver Tronpet ousa enn lot koson.

input: Napoleon himself was not seen in public as often as once in a fortnight.
target: Rar-rar Napoleon ti paret anpiblik, pa plis ki enn fwa toulekenz zour.

input: When he did appear, he was attended not only by his retinue of dogs but by a black cockerel who marched in front of him and acted as a kind of trumpeter, letting out a loud cock-a-doodle-doo before Napoleon spoke.
target: Kan li ti paret lor baz, apart so larme lisien, ti ena osi enn kok nwar ki ti mars divan li pou anons so prezans ousa so diskour ar enn koukouroukoukou pli for ki bigoul.

input: Even in the farmhouse, it was said, Napoleon inhabited separate apartments from the others.
target: Andan grannkaz, li ti ena enn apartman separe.

input: He took his meals alone, with two dogs to wait upon him, and always ate from the Crown Derby dinner service which had been in the glass cupboard in the drawing-room.
target: Li ti pe pran so repa tousel e li ti pe manze dan vesel porslenn.

input: It was also announced that the gun would be fired every year on Napoleons birthday, as well as on the other two anniversaries.
target: Zour so laniverser ti tir enn kout fizi. Ti pe kontinie selebre de lot laniverser ki ti deside avan.

input: Napoleon was now never spoken of simply as Napoleon.
target: Kan ti fer referans Napoleon ti bizen dir Nou Lider, Kamarad Napoleon.

input: He was always referred to in formal style as our Leader, Comrade Napoleon, and this pigs liked to invent for him such titles as Father of All Animals, Terror of Mankind, Protector of the Sheep-fold, Ducklings Friend, and the like.
target: Bann koson ti kontan envant bann tit pou li: Papa Tou Zanimo, Terer Limanite, Protekter Lanklo-Mouton, Kamarad ti kanar ets.

input: In his speeches, Squealer would talk with the tears rolling down his cheeks of Napoleons wisdom the goodness of his heart, and the deep love he bore to all animals everywhere, even and especially the unhappy animals who still lived in ignorance and slavery on other farms.
target: Dan so bann diskour, Tronpet ti pou koz, ar larm lor lazou, lor sazes Napoleon, lor bonte so leker, lor so lamour san frontier pou tou zanimo, sirtou bann zanimo malere ki pe viv dan ignorans ek servitid dan bann lezot laferm.

input: It had become usual to give Napoleon the credit for every successful achievement and every stroke of good fortune.
target: Li ti vinn enn koutim pou asosie Napoleon ar tou bon kiksoz ki ti pe arive.

input: You would often hear one hen remark to another, Under the guidance of our Leader, Comrade Napoleon, I have laid five eggs in six days; or two cows, enjoying a drink at the pool, would exclaim, Thanks to the leadership of Comrade Napoleon, how excellent this water tastes!
target: Lot zour enn poul ti dir enn lot poul, To pa kone twa! Gide par lespri Nou Lider, Kamarad Napoleon, mo finn ponn senk dizef dan sis zour. Enn vas ti dir enn lot, ler zot pe bwar dilo dan basen, Grasa Nou Lider, Kamarad Napoleon, dilo basen gagn bon gou.

input: The general feeling on the farm was well expressed in a poem entitled Comrade Napoleon, which was composed by Minimus and which ran as follows:
target: Santiman zeneral lor laferm ti gagn so expresion dan enn poem, Kamarad Napoleon, ki Tikalite ti ekrir.

input: Napoleon approved of this poem and caused it to be inscribed on the wall of the big barn, at the opposite end from the Seven Commandments.
target: Napoleon ti aprouv redaksion sa poem la e li ti fer ekrir li lor miray langar lot kote set Komannman.

input: The pile of timber was still unsold.
At the same time there were renewed rumours that Frederick and his men were plotting to attack Animal Farm and to destroy the windmill, the building of which had aroused furious jealousy in him.
target: Mem lepok ti ena rimer ki Frederik ek so bann zom ti ena enn plan pou atak Baz Zanimo, pou detrir eolienn parski li ti zalou prosperite Baz Zanimo.

input: Snowball was known to be still skulking on Pinchfield Farm.
target: Boulkoton ti pe kasiet dan TrapTou.

input: In the middle of the summer the animals were alarmed to hear that three hens had come forward and confessed that, inspired by Snowball, they had entered into a plot to murder Napoleon.
target: Omilie lete bann zanimo ti gagn enn lot sok. Trwa poul ti vinn konfese ki Boulkoton ti persiad zot pou asasinn Napoleon.

input: They were executed immediately, and fresh precautions for Napoleons safety were taken.
target: Ti ekzekit zot anplas. Sekirite Napoleon ti ranforse.

input: Four dogs guarded his bed at night, one at each corner, and a young pig named Pinkeye was given the task of tasting all his food before he ate it, lest it should be poisoned.
target: Kat lisien, enn dan sak kwen so lili, ti vey li toutlanwit; enn zenn koson, Lizie Roz, ti gout so manze avan li manze, tansion ti ena tantativ anpwazonnman.

input: At about the same time it was given out that Napoleon had arranged to sell the pile of timber to Mr. Pilkington; he was also going to enter into a regular agreement for the exchange of certain products between Animal Farm and Foxwood.
target: Apepre mem lepok, ti ena koze ki Napoleon ti fer bann aranzman pou vann dibwa la ar Misie Pilkingtonn; anplis ti pou ena enn tranzaksion regilie lor serten prodwi ant Baz Zanimo ek Bwarenar.

input: The relations between Napoleon and Pilkington, though they were only conducted through Whymper, were now almost friendly.
target: Relasion ant Napoleon ek Pilkingtonn, malgre ki li ti pas par Triyanger, ki pe vinn plis kordial.

input: The animals distrusted Pilkington, as a human being, but greatly preferred him to Frederick, whom they both feared and hated.
target: Bann zanimo pa ti kontan Pilkingtonn parski li ti enn imen me zot ti prefer gagn zafer ar li plito ki gagn zafer ar Frederik ki zot ti air. Zot ti osi per li.

input: As the summer wore on, and the windmill neared completion, the rumours of an impending treacherous attack grew stronger and stronger.
target: Amizir lete pase, e ki konstriksion batiman eolienn ti pre pou fini, rimer lor enn atak antret ti pe anplifie.

input: Frederick, it was said, intended to bring against them twenty men all armed with guns, and he had already bribed the magistrates and police, so that if he could once get hold of the title-deeds of Animal Farm they would ask no questions.
target: Frederik ti pe prepar enn larme ven zom arme ar fizi, dapre rimer la; li ti finn bribe mazistra ek lapolis ki ti pou res trankil ler li ti pou met Baz Zanimo lor so nom.

input: Moreover, terrible stories were leaking out from Pinchfield about the cruelties that Frederick practised upon his animals.
target: Anplis, zistwar ti pe sikile lor tretman kriel ki bann zanimo ti pe sibir dan TrapTou.

input: He had flogged an old horse to death, he starved his cows, he had killed a dog by throwing it into the furnace, he amused himself in the evenings by making cocks fight with splinters of razor-blade tied to their spurs.
target: Li ti finn fwet enn vie seval ziska lamor; li pa ti pe donn so bann vas manze; li ti zet enn lisien vivan dan dife; touletanto li ti organiz, pou so plezir, batay kok spesial; dabor li ti atas bout lam razwar ar zot zergo.

input: The animals blood boiled with rage when they heard of these things being done to their comrades, and sometimes they clamoured to be allowed to go out in a body and attack Pinchfield Farm, drive out the humans, and set the animals free.
target: Ler zot ti pe tann sa bann zistwar la, bann zamino zot disan ti pe bwi.

input: One Sunday morning Napoleon appeared in the barn and explained that he had never at any time contemplated selling the pile of timber to Frederick; he considered it beneath his dignity, he said, to have dealings with scoundrels of that description.
target: Enn Dimans gramaten, Napoleonti vinn dan langar pou dir bann zanimo ki zame, zame, zame li pa ti ena lentansion vann dibwa Baz Zanimo ar Frederik; so dinite zanimo anpes li fer tranzaksion ar enn mons kouma Frederik.

input: The pigeons who were still sent out to spread tidings of the Rebellion were forbidden to set foot anywhere on Foxwood, and were also ordered to drop their former slogan of Death to Humanity in favour of Death to Frederick.
target: Bann pizon ki ti pe al repann mesaz revolision, ti gagn lord aret al dan Bwarenar; ti dir zot osi sanz modord. Ti bizen ranplas Touy sa bann salte imen la! par Touy sa salte Frederik la.

input: In the late summer yet another of Snowballs machinations was laid bare.
target: Ver la fin lete ti dekouver enn lot traizon Boulkoton.

input: The wheat crop was full of weeds, and it was discovered that on one of his nocturnal visits Snowball had mixed weed seeds with the seed corn.
target: Karo dible ti plen ar move lerb. Lanket ti montre ki aswar, dan-nwar-dan-nwar, Boulkoton ti melanz lagren move lerb ar lagren dible.

input: A gander who had been privy to the plot had confessed his guilt to Squealer and immediately committed suicide by swallowing deadly nightshade berries.
target: Enn femel lezwa ti konfese ki li ti konplis Boulkoton e apre so konfesion li ti swiside ar enn overdoz lagrenjab.

input: The animals now also learned that Snowball had never  as many of them had believed hitherto  received the order of Animal Hero, First Class.
target: Bann zanimo ti aprann osi ki Boulkoton pa ti zame gagn Zanimo Ero, Premie Klas; sa ti enn envansion Boulkoton akoz so foli grander.

input: Once again some of the animals heard this with a certain bewilderment, but Squealer was soon able to convince them that their memories had been at fault.
target: Ankor enn fwa, detrwa zanimo ti ebete par sa nouvel la me Tronpet bien vit ti fer zot realize ki zot memwar parfwa fer fos.

input: The machinery had still to be installed, and Whymper was negotiating the purchase of it, but the structure was completed.
target: Ti nek res pou enstal bann masinn. Triyanger ti pe negosie pri.

input: In the teeth of every difficulty, in spite of inexperience, of primitive implements, of bad luck and of Snowballs treachery, the work had been finished punctually to the very day!
target: Malgre difikilte, malgre mank experyans, malgre zoutiyaz primitif, malgre malsans ek traizon Boulkoton, travay ti konplete zour pou zour dapre plan.

input: Tired out but proud, the animals walked round and round their masterpiece, which appeared even more beautiful in their eyes than when it had been built the first time.
target: Fatige me fier, bann zanimo ti fer letour batiman la ar admirasion. Li ti boukou pli zoli ki premie konstriksion la.

input: Moreover, the walls were twice as thick as before.
target: Anplis, miray la ti de fwa pli epe ki avan.

input: And when they thought of how they had laboured, what discouragements they had overcome, and the enormous difference that would be made in their lives when the sails were turning and the dynamos running  when they thought of all this, their tiredness forsook them and they gambolled round and round the windmill, uttering cries of triumph.
target: Aster ler zot ti pans zefor ki ti finn neseser, dekourazman ki zot ti finn sirmonte, sanzman ki ti pou ena dan zot lavi kan prodiksion kouran ti pou koumanse, negatif ti disparet, pozitif ti pran kontrol. Zot tou ti pe galoupe, sot-sote otour batiman la e zot ti pe exprim zot lazwa for-for.

input: Napoleon himself, attended by his dogs and his cockerel, came down to inspect the completed work.
target: Napoleon limem, so bann lisien ek so kok ti vinn fer enn enspeksion travay la.

input: He personally congratulated the animals on their achievement, and announced that the mill would be named Napoleon Mill.
target: Li ti felisit bann zanimo pou zot sikse e li ti anonse ki eolienn la pou apel Moulen Napoleon.

input: Two days later the animals were called together for a special meeting in the barn.
target: De zour pli tar ti rasanble bann zanimo pou enn renion spesial dan langar.

input: They were struck dumb with surprise when Napoleon announced that he had sold the pile of timber to Frederick.
target: Zot tou ti vinn gounga ler zot ti aprann ki Napoleon ti pe vann dibwa la ar Frederik.

input: Tomorrow Fredericks wagons would arrive and begin carting it away.
target: Lelandime bann saret Frederik ti pou vinn sers dibwa la.

input: Throughout the whole period of his seeming friendship with Pilkington, Napoleon had really been in secret agreement with Frederick.
target: Ler tou zanimo ti kwar ki relasion ar Pilkingtonn ti foul korek, Napoleon ti pe negosie ansekre ar Frederik.

input: All relations with Foxwood had been broken off; insulting messages had been sent to Pilkington.
target: Ti diskontinie tou aranzman ar Bwarenar e Pilkingtonn ti pe resevwar plen ensilt.

input: The pigeons had been told to avoid Pinchfield Farm and to alter their slogan from Death to Frederick to Death to Pilkington.
target: Bann pizon ti gagn lord sanz trazektwar ek slogan.

input: At the same time Napoleon assured the animals that the stories of an impending attack on Animal Farm were completely untrue, and that the tales about Fredericks cruelty to his own animals had been greatly exaggerated.
target: Touy sa salte Frederik la ti ranplase par Touy sa salte Pilkingtonn la.

input: All these rumours had probably originated with Snowball and his agents.
target: Anmemtan Napoleon ti asir bann zanimo ki pa ti ena okenn menas lor Baz Zanimo; li pa ti toutafe vre ki Frederik ti pe martiriz so bann zanimo.

input: It now appeared that Snowball was not, after all, hiding on Pinchfield Farm, and in fact had never been there in his life: he was living  in considerable luxury, so it was said  at Foxwood, and had in reality been a pensioner of Pilkington for years past.
target: Ankor enn fwa Boulkoton ti pe sem zizani.

input: The pigs were in ecstasies over Napoleons cunning.
target: Zame Frederik pa ti donn Boulkoton drwa rezidans dan TrapTou. Anverite li ti pe viv kouma enn prens dan Bwarenar sou proteksion Pilkingtonn.

input: By seeming to be friendly with Pilkington he had forced Frederick to raise his price by twelve pounds.
target: Bann koson ti anextaz divan fines ek entelizans politik Napoleon. Ler li ti fer kwar ki li ti anbon term ar Pilkingtonn, sa ti fors Frederik ogmant so lof par mil roupi.

input: But the superior quality of Napoleons mind, said Squealer, was shown in the fact that he trusted nobody, not even Frederick.
target: Me pli zoli ekzanp entelizans ek sazes Napoleon se ki li pa ti fer personn konfians.

input: Frederick had wanted to pay for the timber with something called a cheque.
target: Frederik ti ole pey ar enn chek.

input: But Napoleon was too clever for him.
target: Napoleon ti tro malen pou li.

input: He had demanded payment in real five-pound notes, which were to be handed over before the timber was removed.
target: Li ti dimann li pey kash ar biye mil avan livrezon.

input: Boxer put out his nose to sniff at the bank-notes, and the flimsy white things stirred and rustled in his breath.
target: Boxer ti renifle bann biye la; zot ti tranble ar so respirasion.

input: Three days later there was a terrible hullabaloo.
target: Trwa zour pli tar ti ena enn bel komosion.

input: Whymper, his face deadly pale, came racing up the path on his bicycle, flung it down in the yard and rushed straight into the farmhouse.
target: Triyager, figir pal kouma lamor, ti pedal so bisiklet, mont lamonte ziska lakour santral, zet so bisiklet anba e disparet dan grannkaz.

input: The next moment a choking roar of rage sounded from Napoleons apartments.
target: Lot moman enn explozion koler toufe ti travers lafnet apartman Napoleon.

input: The news of what had happened sped round the farm like wildfire.
target: Nouvel katastrofik ti fane lor laferm kouma dife.

input: The banknotes were forgeries! Frederick had got the timber for nothing!
target: Frederik ti pey dibwa ar fos lamone. Li ti gagn tousa dibwa la kado.

input: Napoleon called the animals together immediately and in a terrible voice pronounced the death sentence upon Frederick.
target: Napoleon ti konvok enn renion tou bann zanimo. Ar enn lavwa grav ek makab, li ti pronons lapenn kapital pou Frederik.

input: When captured, he said, Frederick should be boiled alive.
target: Si ti may li, ti pou plonz li dan dilwil bouyant, vivan.

input: At the same time he warned them that after this treacherous deed the worst was to be expected.
target: Aster ti bizen pare pou bann atak antret nenport ki moman.

input: Sentinels were placed at all the approaches to the farm.
target: Ti plas bann santinel dan tou bann landrwa vilnerab dan laferm.

input: In addition, four pigeons were sent to Foxwood with a conciliatory message, which it was hoped might re-establish good relations with Pilkington.
target: Anplis ti avoy kat pizon Bwarenar ar mesaz lape. Ti pe sey rekonsilie ar Pilkingtonn.

input: The very next morning the attack came.
The animals were at breakfast when the look-outs came racing in with the news that Frederick and his followers had already come through the five-barred gate.
target: Bann zanimo ti pe fer nasta kan bann santinel ti rantre kouma siklonn pou dir ki Frederik ek so bann zom ti fini rant dan laferm.

input: Boldly enough the animals sallied forth to meet them, but this time they did not have the easy victory that they had had in the Battle of the Cowshed.
target: Bann zanimo pa ti tike. Zot ti fons lor ennmi. Konba la pa ti fasil.

input: There were fifteen men, with half a dozen guns between them, and they opened fire as soon as they got within fifty yards.
target: Ti ena kenz zom arme ar sis fizi antou. Ler bann zanimo ti apepre 50 met divan zot, zot ti koumans tir kout bal.

input: The animals could not face the terrible explosions and the stinging pellets, and in spite of the efforts of Napoleon and Boxer to rally them, they were soon driven back.
target: Bann zanimo pa ti pe kapav fer fas explozion ek enn lapli bal fan e malgre zefor Napoleon ek Boxer pou regroup zot, bann zanimo ti oblize kile ek sove.

input: A number of them were already wounded.
They took refuge in the farm buildings and peeped cautiously out from chinks and knot-holes.
target: Zot ti sove, al kasiet dan bann batiman laferm; ar lafreyer dan leker zot ti louk dan fant ek bann trou dan dibwa.

input: The whole of the big pasture, including the windmill, was in the hands of the enemy.
target: Patiraz ek Moulen ti sou kontrol ennmi.

input: For the moment even Napoleon seemed at a loss.
He paced up and down without a word, his tail rigid and twitching.
target: Li ti pe ale, vini san kone ki ti bizen fer; so lake ti drese e ti pe tranble.

input: Wistful glances were sent in the direction of Fox wood.
target: Tanzantan ti ena enn regar dan direksion Bwarenar.

input: If Pilkington and his men would help them, the day might yet be won.
target: Si Pilkingtonn sayde ar Baz Zanimo, zot ti pou kapav fer fas.

input: But at this moment the four pigeons, who had been sent out on the day before, returned, one of them bearing a scrap of paper from Pilkington.
target: Zis sa ler la, kat pizon ki ti avoye lavey, ti retourne e dan lapat enn ladan ti ena enn bout papie depi Pilkingtonn.

input: The animals watched them, and a murmur of dismay went round.
target: Bann zanimo ti pe vey zot mouvman.

input: Two of the men had produced a crowbar and a sledge hammer.
target: Zot ti santi danze ler de zom ti koumans manipil enn lapens ek enn teti.

input: They were going to knock the windmill down.
target: Zot ti pou kraz batiman la.

input: We have built the walls far too thick for that.
target: Nou batiman tro solid pou zot.

input: They could not knock it down in a week.
target: Mem dan enn semenn zot pa pou reysi.

input: But Benjamin was watching the movements of the men intently.
target: Me Benzamen ti pe obzerv bann zom la zot demars.

input: The two with the hammer and the crowbar were drilling a hole near the base of the windmill.
target: De zom ar lapens ek teti ti pe pers enn trou dan soubasman batiman la.

input: Slowly, and with an air almost of amusement, Benjamin nodded his long muzzle.
target: Vadire Benzamen ti trouv tousa bien komik. Li ti bouz so mizo gos-drwat, lao-anba.

input: Do you not see what they are doing?
target: Zot pa trouve ki zot pe fer?

input: In another moment they are going to pack blasting powder into that hole.
target: Apre zot pou plen li ar lapoud kanon.
Terer dan leker, bann zanimo ti atann.

input: It was impossible now to venture out of the shelter of the buildings.
target: Ti enposib sorti andeor bann batiman.

input: After a few minutes the men were seen to be running in all directions.
target: Detrwa minit pli tar bann zom Frederik ti koumans galoup dan tou direksion.

input: Then there was a deafening roar.
The pigeons swirled into the air, and all the animals, except Napoleon, flung themselves flat on their bellies and hid their faces.
target: Bann pizon ti saye, fer koustik dan lezer. Tou bann zanimo, apart Napoleon, ti dormi lor zot vant pou kasiet zot figir.

input: When they got up again, a huge cloud of black smoke was hanging where the windmill had been.
target: Ler zot ti releve, ti ena enn imans niaz lafime nwar kot batiman eolienn ti ete.

input: Slowly the breeze drifted it away.
The windmill had ceased to exist!
At this sight the animals courage returned to them.
target: Sa ti tro! Bann zanimo zot kouraz ti revini.

input: The fear and despair they had felt a moment earlier were drowned in their rage against this vile, contemptible act.
target: Dan plas lafreyer ek dezespwar ti ena enn koler nwar, enn laenn pou bann kriminel ki ti detrir zot erv.

input: A mighty cry for vengeance went up, and without waiting for further orders they charged forth in a body and made straight for the enemy.
target: Enn pwisan dezir vanzans ti leve. Pa ti bizen atann lord. Zot ti fons lor ennmi.

input: This time they did not heed the cruel pellets that swept over them like hail.
target: Lapli bal nepli ti pe fer zot per.

input: It was a savage, bitter battle.
The men fired again and again, and, when the animals got to close quarters, lashed out with their sticks and their heavy boots.
target: Detonasion ti swiv detonasion. Kan zanimo ek imen ti koste, bann zom ti pe servi baton ek zot gro bogi.

input: A cow, three sheep, and two geese were killed, and nearly everyone was wounded.
target: Enn vas, trwa mouton ek de lezwa ti mor. Laplipar ti blese.

input: Even Napoleon, who was directing operations from the rear, had the tip of his tail chipped by a pellet.
target: Mem Napoleon ki ti pe diriz operasion par deryer ti gagn enn kout bal ki ti sot enn bout so lake.

input: But the men did not go unscathed either.
Three of them had their heads broken by blows from Boxers hoofs; another was gored in the belly by a cows horn; another had his trousers nearly torn off by Jessie and Bluebell.
target: Trwa zom ti blese lor latet; sabo Boxer ti fer enn masak ar zot; enn lot ti gagn enn blesir profon dan vant ar korn enn vas; enn lot so kalson ti desire net ar ledan Jesi ek Fler Mov.

input: And when the nine dogs of Napoleons own bodyguard, whom he had instructed to make a detour under cover of the hedge, suddenly appeared on the mens flank, baying ferociously, panic overtook them.
target: E ler nef lisien-bodigard Napoleon ti swiv enstriksion, pas deryer baraz e enn kout tret, san atann, paret lor flan bann zom, ar zot zape-grogne feros, ar kaninn menasan, bann ennmi ti koumans panik.

input: They saw that they were in danger of being surrounded.
target: Zot ti realize ki bann zanimo ti pe anserkle zot.

input: Frederick shouted to his men to get out while the going was good, and the next moment the cowardly enemy was running for dear life.
target: Frederik ti donn lord boure, ti kriye sove. San tarde ennmi ti pe bourbrit pou sov zot lavi.

input: The animals chased them right down to the bottom of the field, and got in some last kicks at them as they forced their way through the thorn hedge.
target: Bann zanimo ti fons deryer zot ziska dan bout karo; ti donn zot detrwa bon koutpie ler zot ti pe sey travers baraz pikan loulou.

input: They had won, but they were weary and bleeding.
target: Zot ti viktorye me zot ti fatige ek blese.

input: Slowly they began to limp back towards the farm.
target: Dousma-dousma zot ti trenn zot lapat pou retourn dan laferm.

input: The sight of their dead comrades stretched upon the grass moved some of them to tears.
target: Ler zot ti trouv kadav zot kamarad alonze lor lerb, ena pa ti kapav tini zot larm.

input: And for a little while they halted in sorrowful silence at the place where the windmill had once stood.
target: Tristes dan leker zot ti dibout enn timama kot batiman eolienn ti ete, ansilans.

input: Yes, it was gone; almost the last trace of their labour was gone!
target: Plas la ti vid; bann imen ti efas zot travay.

input: Even the foundations were partially destroyed.
And in rebuilding it they could not this time, as before, make use of the fallen stones.
target: E si ti bizen rekonstrir, sannfwala pa ti pou kapav servi bann ros ki ti servi avan parski explozion violan la ti finn voltiz zot bien lwen partou.

input: It was as though the windmill had never been.
target: Koumadir zame pa ti ena enn batiman eolienn lor kolinn la.

input: As they approached the farm Squealer, who had unaccountably been absent during the fighting, came skipping towards them, whisking his tail and beaming with satisfaction.
target: Me ler zot ti pe koste ar bann batiman laferm, zot ti trouv Tronpet pe mars ver zot ar ti pa frengan, “ pa ti trouv so bout pandan batay “ so lake drese ti pe zwe sef-dorkes e so figir ti ilimine.

input: And the animals heard, from the direction of the farm buildings, the solemn booming of a gun.
target: Bann zanimo ti tann enn kout fizi protokoler depi divan grannkaz.

input: What is that gun firing for? said Boxer.
target: Kifer finn tir kout fizi? Boxer ti dimande.

input: To celebrate our victory! cried Squealer.
His knees were bleeding, he had lost a shoe and split his hoof, and a dozen pellets had lodged themselves in his hind leg.
target: So zenou ti pe segne, li ti finn perdi enn fer, enn so sabo ti fele, ti ena omwen douz bal fane dan so lapat deryer.

input: Have we not driven the enemy off our soil the sacred soil of Animal Farm?
target: Nou pa finn fer ennmi kas pikan, bourbrit? Nou pa finn liber later sakre Baz Zanimo?

input: But they have destroyed the windmill.
target: Me zot finn detrir batiman eolienn.

input: And we had worked on it for two years!
target: Travay de banane finn tom dan dilo!
Nou va konstrir enn lot batiman.

input: We will build six windmills if we feel like it.
target: Nou pou konstrir sis batiman si nou anvi.

input: You do not appreciate, comrade, the mighty thing that we have done.
target: Zot pa pe kapav apresie nou aksion eroik.

input: The enemy was in occupation of this very ground that we stand upon.
target: Ennmi ti pe okip nou teritwar me nou finn reysi balye karo.

input: And now thanks to the leadership of Comrade Napoleon we have won every inch of it back again!
target: Aster grasa lidership Kamarad Napoleon, nou finn repran kontrol sak pous teren.

input: Then we have won back what we had before, said Boxer.
target: Nou finn zis repran seki ti deza pou nou!Boxer ti dir.

input: That is our victory, said Squealer.
target: Samem nou laviktwar!Tronpet ti dir avek konviksion.
Bwat-bwate, zot ti rant dan lakour.

input: The pellets under the skin of Boxers leg smarted painfully.
target: Boxer so blesir ti pe extra fermal.

input: He saw ahead of him the heavy labour of rebuilding the windmill from the foundations, and already in imagination he braced himself for the task.
target: Li ti pe pans travay dir ki zot ti pou bizen fer pou reranz batiman eolienn depi baz ziska finision e dan so lespri li ti pe prepare pou fer fas.

input: But for the first time it occurred to him that he was eleven years old and that perhaps his great muscles were not quite what they had once been.
target: Me premie fwa dan so lavi li ti pans so laz. Li ti ena onz an e so bann misk ti nepli osi for.

input: But when the animals saw the green flag flying, and heard the gun firing again  seven times it was fired in all  and heard the speech that Napoleon made, congratulating them on their conduct, it did seem to them after all that they had won a great victory.
target: Me ler bann zanimo ti trouv zot pavyon ver pe flote dan divan, kan zot ti tann set kout fizi, kan zot ti tann diskour Napoleon ki ti pe felisit zot, zot moud ti sanze. Wi, zot aksion ti viktorye.

input: The animals slain in the battle were given a solemn funeral.
target: Ti anter bann zanimo ki ti mor dan batay dan enn manier dign.

input: Boxer and Clover pulled the wagon which served as a hearse, and Napoleon himself walked at the head of the procession.
target: Boxer ek Tref ti ris saret ki ti servi kouma korbiyar e Napoleon limem ti mars divan kortez fineb.

input: Two whole days were given over to celebrations.
There were songs, speeches, and more firing of the gun, and a special gift of an apple was bestowed on every animal, with two ounces of corn for each bird and three biscuits for each dog.
target: Ti ena sante, diskour, ek ti tir kout fizi plizier fwa. Sak zanimo ti gagn enn pom ankado; sak zwazo ti gagn enn rasion siplemanter may; sak lisien ti gagn trwa biskwi.

input: It was announced that the battle would be called the Battle of the Windmill, and that Napoleon had created a new decoration, the Order of the Green Banner, which he had conferred upon himself.
target: Ti deside ki batay la ti pou apel Batay Eolienn. Napoleon ti kre enn nouvo dekorasion, Lord Pavyon Ver, ki li ti donn limem.

input: In the general rejoicings the unfortunate affair of the banknotes was forgotten.
target: Dan sa latmosfer fet la, zafer fos biye ti rant dan departman nepli rapel.

input: It was a few days later than this that the pigs came upon a case of whisky in the cellars of the farmhouse.
target: Detrwa zour pli tar, bann koson ti dekouver enn kes wiski dan lakav grannkaz.

input: It had been overlooked at the time when the house was occupied.
target: Zot pa ti pran sa kont kan zot ti vinn res dan lakaz ki ti okip.

input: That night there came from the farmhouse the sound of loud singing, in which, to everyones surprise, the strains of Beasts of England were mixed up.
target: Sa swar la ti tann sante for-for dan grannkaz. Ti enn sante kari melanz, enn popouri kot mem ler Zanimo Angleter ti pe may-may ar lezot sante.

input: At about half past nine Napoleon, wearing an old bowler hat of Mr. Jones, was distinctly seen to emerge from the back door, gallop rapidly round the yard, and disappear in doors again.
target: Ver nef er trant, Napoleon ar sapo gran-sorti Jonns lor so latet, ti sorti par laport deryer, galoup otour lakour avan ki li ti redisparet dan grannkaz.

input: But in the morning a deep silence hung over the farmhouse.
target: Lelandime gramaten, ti ena enn silans lanterman ki ti pe plane lor grannkaz.

input: Not a pig appeared to be stirring.
target: Okenn koson pa ti ankor leve.

input: It was nearly nine oclock when Squealer made his appearance, walking slowly and dejectedly, his eyes dull, his tail hanging limply behind him, and with every appearance of being seriously ill.
target: Ver nef er Tropet ti paret; li ti paret dan pens; li ti pe mars ar difikilte; so lizie ti som; so lake mou ti pe anpandan las-las; li ti paret bien malad.

input: He called the animals together and told them that he had a terrible piece of news to impart.
target: Li ti rasanble tou bann zanimo pou donn zot enn bien move nouvel: Kamarad Napoleon ti pe mor.

input: A cry of lamentation went up.
target: Ti met enn ta lapay divan laport grannkaz e bann zanimo ti pe mars dousma lor pwent lapat.

input: Straw was laid down outside the doors of the farmhouse, and the animals walked on tiptoe.
target: Larm dan lizie, zot ti pe rod kone ki zot ti pou kapav fer si zot Lider ti kit zot.

input: With tears in their eyes they asked one another what they should do if their Leader were taken away from them.
target: Ti ena enn rimer ki sa verminn Boulkoton ti finn reysi met pwazon dan so manze.

input: A rumour went round that Snowball had after all contrived to introduce poison into Napoleons food.
target: Onz er, Tronpet ti vinn fer enn lot anons.

input: At eleven oclock Squealer came out to make another announcement.
target: Dernie testaman Kamarad Napoleon, avan li ti ferm so lizie: Bizen sot likou seki konsom lalkol.

input: As his last act upon earth, Comrade Napoleon had pronounced a solemn decree: the drinking of alcohol was to be punished by death.
target: Ler labrim ti leve, Napoleon ti pe koumans degaze e lelandime gramaten Tronpet ti kapav anonse ki Kamarad Napoleon ti andeor danze.

input: By the evening, however, Napoleon appeared to be somewhat better, and the following morning Squealer was able to tell them that he was well on the way to recovery.
target: Dan tanto, mem zour, Napoleon ti rekoumans travay e lelandime li ti dimann Triyanger aste bann liv lor brasri ek distilri.

input: By the evening of that day Napoleon was back at work, and on the next day it was learned that he had instructed Whymper to purchase in Willingdon some booklets on brewing and distilling.

target: Anba kot miray lor ki ti ena set Komannman, ti ena enn lesel ki ti kas ande.

input: At the foot of the end wall of the big barn, where the Seven Commandments were written, there lay a ladder broken in two pieces.
target: Tronpet ti pe tale. Koste ar li ti ena enn fanal, enn penso ek enn po lapentir blan.

input: Squealer, temporarily stunned, was sprawling beside it, and near at hand there lay a lantern, a paintbrush, and an overturned pot of white paint.
target: Lor vites bann lisien ti kre enn sentir proteksion pou protez Tronpet e zot ti akonpagn li ziska grannkaz ler li ti kapav diboute ek marse.

input: The dogs immediately made a ring round Squealer, and escorted him back to the farmhouse as soon as he was able to walk.
target: Okenn zanimo pa ti paret konpran seki ti pe pase, apart Benzamen ki ti bouz-bouz so mizo koumadir li ti finn konpran gordonn net me li ti bous so labous komdabitid.

input: None of the animals could form any idea as to what this meant, except old Benjamin, who nodded his muzzle with a knowing air, and seemed to understand, but would say nothing.
target: Detrwa zour pli tar, Miryel ki ti pe lir bann Komannman, ti remarke ki ti ena enn lot Komannman ki bann zanimo pa ti pe rapel bien.

input: But a few days later Muriel, reading over the Seven Commandments to herself, noticed that there was yet another of them which the animals had remembered wrong.
target: Zot ti kwar ki Senkiem Komannman ti dir: Falepa zanimo bwar lalkol me ti ena de mo ki zot ti blie.

input: They had thought the Fifth Commandment was No animal shall drink alcohol, but there were two words that they had forgotten.
target: Anfet komannman ti lir: Falepa zanimo bwar lalkol an-exe.

input: Actually the Commandment read: No animal shall drink alcohol to excess.
target: Sabo Boxer ti pe tarde pou geri.

input: Boxers split hoof was a long time in healing.
target: Bann zanimo ti rekoumans konstrir batiman lelandime lafen selebrasion.

input: They had started the rebuilding of the windmill the day after the victory celebrations were ended.
target: Boxer ti refiz pran sik e ti pe fer tou pou kasiet so soufrans.

input: Boxer refused to take even a day off work, and made it a point of honour not to let it be seen that he was in pain.
target: Tanto li ti aksepte anprive ar Tref ki so sabo ti pe fatig li.

input: In the evenings he would admit privately to Clover that the hoof troubled him a great deal.
target: Tref ti prepar enn kataplas ar lerb ki li ti kraze dan so labous.

input: Clover treated the hoof with poultices of herbs which she prepared by chewing them, and both she and Benjamin urged Boxer to work less hard.
target: Benzamen ek li ti pe dimann Boxer travay mwens.

input: A horses lungs do not last for ever, she said to him.
target: Poumon seval pa eternel,li ti dir li.
Me Boxer ti ekout zis so prop latet.

input: He had, he said, only one real ambition left  to see the windmill well under way before he reached the age for retirement.
target: Li ti ena, li ti dir, enn sel rev: trouv eolienn pe fonksione foul-foul avan li pran pansion.

input: At the beginning, when the laws of Animal Farm were first formulated, the retiring age had been fixed for horses and pigs at twelve, for cows at fourteen, for dogs at nine, for sheep at seven, and for hens and geese at five.
target: Okoumansman, kan ti desid bann lalwa, ti fixe laz retret bann zanimo dan sa fason la: pou seval ek koson: 12 an; pou vas: 14 an; pou lisien: 9 an; pou mouton: 7 an; pou poul ek lezwa: 5 an.

input: Liberal old-age pensions had been agreed upon.
target: Ti finn desid pou donn tou zanimo enn pansion vieyes zenere.

input: As yet no animal had actually retired on pension, but of late the subject had been discussed more and more.
target: Malgre ki okenn zanimo pa ti zwir sa bann privilez la, resaman ti ena boukou diskision lor sa size la.

input: Now that the small field beyond the orchard had been set aside for barley, it was rumoured that a corner of the large pasture was to be fenced off and turned into a grazing-ground for superannuated animals.
target: Apre ki ti finn desid pou servi padok lot kote verze pou kiltiv malt, ti ena enn koze ki ti pou bar enn bout dan patiraz pou fer enn lespas pou bann zanimo trwaziemaz.

input: For a horse, it was said, the pension would be five pounds of corn a day and, in winter, fifteen pounds of hay, with a carrot or possibly an apple on public holidays.
target: Enn seval ti pou gagn senk liv may par zour e anliver, kenz liv lerb sek e anplis zot ti pou gagn enn karot ousa enn pom zour konze piblik.

input: Boxers twelfth birthday was due in the late summer of the following year.
target: Dan enn an ti pou ena laniverser douz an Boxer.
Lavi lor Baz Zanimo ti finn vinn bien-bien dir.

input: The winter was as cold as the last one had been, and food was even shorter.
target: Liver ti extra fre e manze ti bien mens.

input: Once again all rations were reduced, except those of the pigs and the dogs.
target: Ankor enn fwa ti diminie rasion pou tou zanimo exepte koson ek lisien.

input: A too rigid equality in rations, Squealer explained, would have been contrary to the principles of Animalism.
target: Tronpet ti vinn explik zot ki pa ti posib swiv bann prensip alalet me ti bizen get so lespri. Egalite rasion ti kont lespri Zanimoism.

input: The animals believed every word of it.
Truth to tell, Jones and all he stood for had almost faded out of their memories.
target: Anverite zot mempa ti rapel seki ti finn pase lepok Jonns.

input: They knew that life nowadays was harsh and bare, that they were often hungry and often cold, and that they were usually working when they were not asleep.
target: Zot ti kone se ki zot lavi ti dir; zot ti toultan gagn fen, toultan gagn fre; kan zot pa ti pe dormi, zot ti pe toultan travay.

input: But doubtless it had been worse in the days of Jones.
target: Me sirman lepok Jonns tou ti pli pir.

input: They were glad to believe so.
target: Sa lenpresion la ti fer zot kontan.

input: Besides, in those days they had been slaves and now they were free.
target: Apretou, lontan zot ti bann esklav, aster zot ti lib.

input: That made all the difference, as Squealer did not fail to point out.
target: Samem ki ti plis enportan kouma Tronpet ti kontan dir.

input: There were many more mouths to feed now.
target: Ti ena boukou plis labous pou nouri.

input: Towards the end of summer the four sows had all littered about simultaneously, producing thirty-one young pigs between them.
target: Ver lafen lete, kat femel koson ti met ba. Ti ena trante-enn ti koson antou.

input: The young pigs were piebald, and as Napoleon was the only boar on the farm, it was possible to guess at their parentage.
target: Bann zen koson ti resanble Napoleon ki ti sel mal lor laferm.

input: It was announced that later, when bricks and timber had been purchased, a schoolroom would be built in the farmhouse garden.
target: Ti ena enn desizion ki pli tar, ler ti finn aste dibwa ek brik, ti pou ena enn lekol dan zarden grannkaz.

input: For the time being, the young pigs were given their instruction by Napoleon himself in the farmhouse kitchen.
target: Letansa Napoleon limem ti pou okip zot ledikasion dan lakwizinn grannkaz.

input: They took their exercise in the garden, and were discouraged from playing with the other young animals.
target: Zot ti fer lekzersis dan zarden e ti konsey zot pa zwe ar bann zanfan lezot zanimo.

input: About this time, too, it was laid down as a rule that when a pig and any other animal met on the path, the other animal must stand aside: and also that all pigs, of whatever degree, were to have the privilege of wearing green ribbons on their tails on Sundays.
target: Apepre sa lepok la mem ti dekret enn regleman ki si enn koson ek enn lot zanimo ti pe krwaze lor enn pasaz, lot zanimo la ti bizen avanse pou les koson la pase. Anplis, enn koson nenport ki ran ti gagn drwa met enn riban ver dan so lake sak Dimans.

input: The farm had had a fairly successful year, but was still short of money.
target: Baz Zanimo so performans pa ti tro move sa lane la me ti touzour mank kapital.

input: There were the bricks, sand, and lime for the schoolroom to be purchased, and it would also be necessary to begin saving up again for the machinery for the windmill.
target: Ti ena pou aste brik, disab, laso pou konstriksion lekol; ti bizen ramas kas pou aste masinnri pou eolienn.

input: Then there were lamp oil and candles for the house, sugar for Napoleons own table (he forbade this to the other pigs, on the ground that it made them fat), and all the usual replacements such as tools, nails, string, coal, wire, scrap-iron, and dog biscuits.
target: Ti bizen osi aste petrol pou lalanp, labouzi pou grannkaz, disik pou konsomasion Napoleon (li ti defann bann lezot koson manz disik parski sa ti pou fer zot vinn gro ek gra) ek bann lezot obze konsomasion kouran kouma zouti, koulou, lafisel, sarbon, difil metalik, vie feray ek biskwi pou lisien.

input: A stump of hay and part of the potato crop were sold off, and the contract for eggs was increased to six hundred a week, so that that year the hens barely hatched enough chicks to keep their numbers at the same level.
target: Enn parti manze zanimo, enn parti rekolt pomdeter ti finn vande; ti ogmant lavant dizef (600 olie 400 par semenn). Pa ti ena ase dizef pou eklo pou ki reysi gard popilasion poul lor mem nivo.

input: Rations, reduced in December, were reduced again in February.
target: Rasion ki ti diminie an Desam ti konn enn nouvo rediksion an Fevriye.

input: Lanterns in the stalls were forbidden to save oil.
target: Ti defann alim lalanp dan bann stal pou fer ekonomi petrol.

input: But the pigs seemed comfortable enough, and in fact were putting on weight if anything.
target: Me bann koson ti dan bien. Zot tou ti pe grosi.

input: Someone said it was the smell of cooking barley.
target: Kikenn ti dir ki sa ti loder malt kwi.

input: The animals sniffed the air hungrily and wondered whether a warm mash was being prepared for their supper.
target: Bann zanimo ti pe renifle ler dan lespwar ki ti pe prepar enn bon pire pou zot pou dine.

input: But no warm mash appeared, and on the following Sunday it was announced that from now onwards all barley would be reserved for the pigs.
target: Pa ti ena okenn pire. Dan lasanble Dimans ki ti swiv, ti ena enn lanons ki malt ti pou rezerve pou bann koson.

input: The field beyond the orchard had already been sown with barley.
target: Ti fini rezerv karo lot kote verze pou prodiksion malt.

input: And the news soon leaked out that every pig was now receiving a ration of a pint of beer daily, with half a gallon for Napoleon himself, which was always served to him in the Crown Derby soup tureen.
target: E bien vit nouvel ti pe sirkile ki sak koson ti pe gagn enn boutey labier par zour e ki Napoleon ti pe gagn enn galon par zour ki li ti pe bwar dan enn soupier anporslenn.

input: But if there were hardships to be borne, they were partly offset by the fact that life nowadays had a greater dignity than it had had before.
target: Me si lavi pa ti fasil, ti ena enn serten konpansasion parski omwen zot ti ena plis dinite.

input: There were more songs, more speeches, more processions.
target: Ti ena plis sante, plis diskour, plis laprosesion.

input: Napoleon had commanded that once a week there should be held something called a Spontaneous Demonstration, the object of which was to celebrate the struggles and triumphs of Animal Farm.
target: Napoleon ti donn lord ki sak semenn ti bizen organiz enn evennman ki ti apel Expresion Spontane pou selebre lalit ek trionf Baz Zanimo.

input: At the appointed time the animals would leave their work and march round the precincts of the farm in military formation, with the pigs leading, then the horses, then the cows, then the sheep, and then the poultry.
target: Kan ler ki ti fixe ti arive, bann zanimo ti bizen kit zot travay, mars otour laferm an formasion militer. Bann koson ti mars divan; apre bann seval ti swiv; apre ti ena bann vas, mouton ek zanimo poulaye.

input: The dogs flanked the procession and at the head of all marched Napoleons black cockerel.
target: Bann lisien ti poste de kote laprosesion e divan-divan ti ena kok nwar Napoleon.

input: Boxer and Clover always carried between them a green banner marked with the hoof and the horn and the caption, Long live Comrade Napoleon!
target: Boxer ek Tref ti pe toultan sarye enn banier ver lor ki ti ena senbol Baz Zanimo (sabo ek korn) ek anba ti ena lezand Viv Kamarad Napoleon.

input: Afterwards there were recitations of poems composed in Napoleons honour, and a speech by Squealer giving particulars of the latest increases in the production of foodstuffs, and on occasion a shot was fired from the gun.
target: Apre ti ena resitasion poem lor grander Napoleon; answit Tronpet ti fer enn diskour lor ogmantasion prodiksion alimanter; tanzantan ti tir enn kout fizi.

input: The sheep were the greatest devotees of the Spontaneous Demonstration, and if anyone complained (as a few animals sometimes did, when no pigs or dogs were near) that they wasted time and meant a lot of standing about in the cold, the sheep were sure to silence him with a tremendous bleating of Four legs good, two legs bad!
target: Bann mouton ti bann pli gran nam Expresion Spontane e si nenport kisannla ti plengne (ti ena zanimo ki ti proteste kan pa ti ena koson ousa lisien dan leparaz) ki ti pe perdi zot letan, ki ti pe fer zot dibout dan freser, bann mouton rekta ti pou bous zot labous ar enn saple Kat lapat bon, de lapat move!.

input: But by and large the animals enjoyed these celebrations.
target: Me anzeneral bann zanimo ti kontan partisip dan sa bann selebrasion la.

input: They found it comforting to be reminded that, after all, they were truly their own masters and that the work they did was for their own benefit.
target: Ti bon pou zot moral kan zot ti tann dir ki, malgre tou, zot ki ti propriyeter Baz Zanimo e ki zot ti pe travay pou zot prop lentere.

input: So that, what with the songs, the processions, Squealers lists of figures, the thunder of the gun, the crowing of the cockerel, and the fluttering of the flag, they were able to forget that their bellies were empty, at least part of the time.
target: Savedir bann sante, bann laprosesion, bann diskour Tronpet, lalis sif, kout fizi, sante kok nwar, zot pavyon ki flote dan lezer ti fer zot enpe bliye, tanzantan, ki zot vant ti pe grogne.

input: In April, Animal Farm was proclaimed a Republic, and it became necessary to elect a President.
target: An Avril Baz Zanimo ti vinn enn Repiblik e donk ti neseser elir enn Prezidan.

input: There was only one candidate, Napoleon, who was elected unanimously.
target: Ti ena enn sel kandida ki ti eli alinanimite.

input: On the same day it was given out that fresh documents had been discovered which revealed further details about Snowballs complicity with Jones.
target: Mem zour ti dekouver nouvo dokiman ki ti prouve ki Boulkoton ti konplis Jonns.

input: It now appeared that Snowball had not, as the animals had previously imagined, merely attempted to lose the Battle of the Cowshed by means of a stratagem, but had been openly fighting on Joness side.
target: Li pa ti zis fer tou pou ki Jonns gagn Batay Lekiri Vas me li ti pe lager dan larme Jonns.

input: In fact, it was he who had actually been the leader of the human forces, and had charged into battle with the words Long live Humanity! on his lips.
target: Anfet, limem ki ti pe diriz larme imen e li ti lans atak lor Baz Zanimo ar slogan Viv Imen!.

input: The wounds on Snowballs back, which a few of the animals still remembered to have seen, had been inflicted by Napoleons teeth.
target: Bann blesir lor so ledo Boulkoton ki detrwa zanimo ti rapel zot ti trouve ti anfet tras ledan Napoleon ki ti manz ar li.

input: In the middle of the summer Moses the raven suddenly reappeared on the farm, after an absence of several years.
target: Omilie lete, Moiz, ki ti finn disparet pandan plizier lane, ti reaparet.

input: He was quite unchanged, still did no work, and talked in the same strain as ever about Sugarcandy Mountain.
target: Li ti parey kouma avan, pa ti pe travay e ti pe kontinie rakont so bann zistwar lor Montagn Sikdorz.

input: He would perch on a stump, flap his black wings, and talk by the hour to anyone who would listen.
target: Li ti pou dibout lor enn siko, bat-bat so lezel nwar, koze nenport ki ler ar nenport kisannla ki ti anvi ekout li.

input: Up there, comrades, he would say solemnly, pointing to the sky with his large beak  up there, just on the other side of that dark cloud that you can see  there it lies, Sugarcandy Mountain, that happy country where we poor animals shall rest for ever from our labours!
target: Lao laba, kamarad, li ti pou lev so bek pou donn direksion, laba pre kot sa niaz nwar la, laba mem ki ena Montagn Sikdorz, landrwa beni kot nou, bann zanimo, pou gan repo eternel apre enn lavi kot nou oblize rent nou nam.

input: He even claimed to have been there on one of his higher flights, and to have seen the everlasting fields of clover and the linseed cake and lump sugar growing on the hedges.
target: Li ti mem rakonte ki li ti finn deza al laba e li ti trouve ar so prop lizie, bann karo lerb tann, bann baraz kouver ar disik ek gato koko.

input: Many of the animals believed him.
Their lives now, they reasoned, were hungry and laborious; was it not right and just that a better world should exist somewhere else?
target: Zot lavi lor later ti enn martir. Eski li pa ti normal ki apre ti pou ena enn lavi meyer?

input: A thing that was difficult to determine was the attitude of the pigs towards Moses.
target: Tretman ki bann koson ti donn Moiz ti ase bizar.

input: They all declared contemptuously that his stories about Sugarcandy Mountain were lies, and yet they allowed him to remain on the farm, not working, with an allowance of a gill of beer a day.
target: Zot ti boufonn so bann zistwar lor Montagn Sikdorz me zot ti les li res lor Baz Zanimo san travay e anplis zot ti donn li enn topet labier toulezour.

input: After his hoof had healed up, Boxer worked harder than ever.
target: Kan so sabo ti geri, Boxer ti travay pli dir.

input: Indeed, all the animals worked like slaves that year.
target: Anfet tou bann zanimo ti travay kouma esklav sa lane la.

input: Apart from the regular work of the farm, and the rebuilding of the windmill, there was the schoolhouse for the young pigs, which was started in March.
target: Apart travay routinn lor laferm, apart nouvo konstriksion batiman eolienn, ti ena osi pou konstrir lekol pou bann ti koson. Travay la ti koumanse an Mars.

input: Sometimes the long hours on insufficient food were hard to bear, but Boxer never faltered.
target: Travay extra san ase manze pa ti fasil me Boxer pa ti kil parad.

input: The others said, Boxer will pick up when the spring grass comes on; but the spring came and Boxer grew no fatter.
target: Lezot ti pe dir,  Kan nouvo sezon lerb vini, Boxer pou repran.Me nouvo sezon ti vini e ti pre pou ale e Boxer pa ti sanze.

input: Sometimes on the slope leading to the top of the quarry, when he braced his muscles against the weight of some vast boulder, it seemed that nothing kept him on his feet except the will to continue.
target: Parfwa lor lapant ki ti amenn lao karyer, kan li ti donn so tou pou ris enn gro ros, li ti kler ki se zis so volonte ki ti pe tini li.

input: At such times his lips were seen to form the words, I will work harder; he had no voice left.
target: Dan sa moman la koumadir so lalev ti pe dir Mo pou travay plis me okenn son pa ti pe sorti.

input: Once again Clover and Benjamin warned him to take care of his health, but Boxer paid no attention.
target: Ankor enn fwa Tref ek Benzamen ti konsey li okip so lasante me li ti fer sourd.
So laniverser douz an ti pe aprose.

input: He did not care what happened so long as a good store of stone was accumulated before he went on pension.
target: Me li pa ti pe pran kont. So sel preokipasion se ramas enn bon stok ros avan li pran pansion.

input: Late one evening in the summer, a sudden rumour ran round the farm that something had happened to Boxer.
target: Bien tar enn tanto lete, enn move nouvel ti koumans sirkile dan Baz Zanimo ki Boxer ti dan dife.

input: He had gone out alone to drag a load of stone down to the windmill.
target: Li ti al ris ros pou konstriksion batiman eolienne.
