input: A few minutes later two pigeons came racing in with the news: Boxer has fallen! He is lying on his side and cant get up!
target: De-trwa minit plitar de pizon ti vinn dir zot ki Boxer ti finn tom lor so kote e li pa ti pe kapav leve.

input: About half the animals on the farm rushed out to the knoll where the wind-mill stood.
target: Omwen lamwatie popilasion zanimo ti galoupe, al lor kolinn kot batiman eolienn ti ete.

input: There lay Boxer, between the shafts of the cart, his neck stretched out, unable even to raise his head.
target: Boxer ti anba ant brankar saret, so likou ti redi e li pa ti pe kapav lev so latet.

input: His eyes were glazed, his sides matted with sweat.
target: So lizie ti vwale e so lekor ti kouver ar transpirasion.

input: A thin stream of blood had trickled out of his mouth.
target: Dan kwen so labous ti ena enn ti file disan.

input: Clover dropped to her knees at his side.
Boxer! she cried, how are you?
target: Boxer, li ti dimande, kouma to santi twa?

input: It is my lung, said Boxer in a weak voice.
target: Mo kwar mo poumon sa,li ti reponn dousma.

input: I think you will be able to finish the windmill without me.
target: Mo krwar zot pou kapav fini travay la san mwa.

input: There is a pretty good store of stone accumulated.
target: Mo finn ramas enn bon stok ros.

input: I had only another month to go in any case.
target: Dan enn mwa mo ti pou pran pansion tou manier.

input: To tell you the truth, I had been looking forward to my retirement.
target: Mo dir twa laverite: mo ti pe anvi aret travay.

input: And perhaps, as Benjamin is growing old too, they will let him retire at the same time and be a companion to me.
target: E kapav, kouma Benzamen pe vinn vie pou kapav pran pansion ansam ar mwa e koumsa nou pou kapav pas nou letan ansam.

input: We must get help at once, said Clover.
target: Nou bizen led toutswit,Tref ti dir.

input: Run, somebody, and tell Squealer what has happened.
target: Kikenn, degaze al dir Tronpet ki finn arive.

input: All the other animals immediately raced back to the farmhouse to give Squealer the news.
target: Tou bann zanimo ti galoupe al dan grannkaz pou dir Tronpet seki finn arive.

input: Only Clover remained, and Benjamin who lay down at
target: Selman Tref ti reste, e Benzamen ti alonze akote Boxer e, san dir nanye, ar so lake li ti pe anpes bann mous agas so kamarad.

input: Boxers side, and, without speaking, kept the flies off him with his long tail.
target: Kenz minit pli tar Tronpet ti arive. Li ti montre boukou senpati e ti paret trakase.

input: After about a quarter of an hour Squealer appeared, full of sympathy and concern.
target: Li ti dir zot ki Napoleon ti aprann sa move nouvel la ar boukou tristes parski Boxer ti zanimo plis fidel ek lwayal lor laferm. Lider ti pe fer bann demars pou avoy Boxer dan enn bon lopital kot gagn meyer swen.

input: He said that Comrade Napoleon had learned with the very deepest distress of this misfortune to one of the most loyal workers on the farm, and was already making arrangements to send Boxer to be treated in the hospital at Willingdon.
target: Bann zanimo pa ti tro dakor ar sa desizion la.

input: The animals felt a little uneasy at this.
target: Apart Moli ek Boulkoton, okenn zanimo pa ti finn kit Baz Zanimo e zot pa ti tro dakor pou les bann imen okip zot kamarad malad.

input: Except for Mollie and Snowball, no other animal had ever left the farm, and they did not like to think of their sick comrade in the hands of human beings. However, Squealer easily convinced them that the veterinary surgeon in Willingdon could treat Boxers case more satisfactorily than could be done on the farm.
target: Me Tronpet ti persiad zot ki enn veteriner ti pou okip Boxer pli bien ki zanimo lor laferm.

input: And about half an hour later, when Boxer had somewhat recovered, he was with difficulty got on to his feet, and managed to limp back to his stall, where Clover and Benjamin had prepared a good bed of straw for him.
target: Trant minit pli tar Boxer ti santi li enpe pli bien e ar boukou difikilte ti ed li pou diboute e li ti trenn-trenn so lipie pou retourn dan so stal kot Tref ek Benzamen ti prepar enn lili lapay epe pou li.

input: For the next two days Boxer remained in his stall.
target: Pandan de zour ki ti swiv, Boxer ti res dan so stal.

input: The pigs had sent out a large bottle of pink medicine which they had found in the medicine chest in the bathroom, and Clover administered it to Boxer twice a day after meals.
target: Bann koson ti avoy enn gro boutey meksinn roz ki zot ti trouve dan bwat farmasi Jonns e Tref ti donn li so meksinn de fwa par zour apre repa.

input: In the evenings she lay in his stall and talked to him, while Benjamin kept the flies off him.
target: Apre travay, Tref ti vinn asiz dan so stal pou koz-koz ar li pandan ki Benzamen ti pe pous bann mous.

input: Boxer professed not to be sorry for what had happened.
target: Boxer ti axepte ki li pa ti tro sagren seki ti ariv li.

input: If he made a good recovery, he might expect to live another three years, and he looked forward to the peaceful days that he would spend in the corner of the big pasture.
target: Si li degaze, li pou viv ankor trwa lane e li ti pe fer plan pou viv enn ti lavi trankil dan lanklo ki tipou fer dan enn kwen patiraz.

input: It would be the first time that he had had leisure to study and improve his mind.
target: Premie fwa li ti pou gagn letan pou okip so devlopman.

input: He intended, he said, to devote the rest of his life to learning the remaining twenty-two letters of the alphabet.
target: Li ti ena lentansion konn par ker tou bann let alfabet.

input: However, Benjamin and Clover could only be with Boxer after working hours,and it was in the middle of the day when the van came to take him away.
target: Alors Tref ek Benzamen ti okip li apre ler travay me anplen lazourne vann ti vinn sers li.

input: The animals were all at work weeding turnips under the supervision of a pig, when they were astonished to see Benjamin come galloping from the direction of the farm buildings, braying at the top of his voice.
target: Bann zanimo ti bizi aras lerb dan karo rav sou kontrol enn koson kan Benzamen ti arive atoutvites depi bann batiman laferm e li ti pe hihan for-for.

input: It was the first time that they had ever seen Benjamin excited  indeed, it was the first time that anyone had ever seen him gallop.
target: Zame bann zanimo ti trouv Benzamen exite koumsa anfet premie fwa zot ti trouv li galoupe.

input: Come at once! Theyre taking Boxer away!
target: Vini toutswit, zot pe pran Boxer, ale!

input: Without waiting for orders from the pig, the animals broke off work and raced back to the farm buildings.
target: San atann lord bann koson, bann zanimo pa ti dimann okenn permision. Zot ti aret travay e ti koumans galoupe dan direksion bann batiman laferm.

input: Sure enough, there in the yard was a large closed van, drawn by two horses, with lettering on its side and a sly-looking man in a low-crowned bowler hat sitting on the drivers seat.
target: Dan lakour ti ena enn vann rise par de seval. De kote vann la ti ena lansengn. Enn misie ar sapo formel lor latet ek regar marday lor figir ti lor siez kondikter.

input: The animals crowded round the van.
target: Bann zanimo ti antour vann la.
Salam Boxer!zot tou ti dir anmemtan, salam!

input: Fools! Fools! shouted Benjamin, prancing round them and stamping the earth with his small hoofs.
target: Enbesil! Kouyon! Zot pa finn lir seki finn ekrir lor vann la? Benzamen ti pe galoup toutotour vann la e anmemtan li ti pe tap so sabo for-for lor later.

input: That gave the animals pause, and there was a hush.
target: Bann zanimo ti aret zestikile e ti ena silans.

input: Muriel began to spell out the words.
target: Miryel ti koumans dekod bann mo.

input: But Benjamin pushed her aside and in the midst of a deadly silence he read: Alfred Simmonds, Horse Slaughterer and Glue Boiler, Willingdon.
target: Me Benzamen ti fer li avanse. Li ti lir dan enn atmosfer silans zeneralize:  'Alfred Simond, Bouse; Marsan Lakol, Lapo ek Lezo seval.'

input: They are taking Boxer to the knackers!
A cry of horror burst from all the animals.
At this moment the man on the box whipped up his horses and the van moved out of the yard at a smart trot.
target: Lerlamem kondikter ti fwet so seval e vann la ti pe kit lakour.

input: Boxer! cried Clover in a terrible voice. Boxer! Get out! Get out quickly!
target: Boxer! Tref ti kriye pli for ki li ti kapav, Sote, sorti!

input: Theyre taking you to your death!
All the animals took up the cry of Get out, Boxer, get out!
target: Tou bann lezot zanimo ti pe kriye sote, sorti!

input: But the van was already gathering speed and drawing away from them.
target: Me vann la ti pe roul deplizanpli vit e ti pe kit bann zanimo lwen deryer.

input: It was uncertain whether Boxer had understood what Clover had said.
target: Eski Boxer ti konpran mesaz Tref?

input: But a moment later his face disappeared from the window and there was the sound of a tremendous drumming of hoofs inside the van.
target: Apre enn ti bout letan, so latet ti disparet depi lafnet e ti koumans ena enn gran tapaz sabo kont parwa vann la.

input: Too late, someone thought of racing ahead and shutting the five-barred gate.
target: Tro tar kikenn ti pans pou al ferm geet me vann ti pe roul pli vit ki li.

input: But in another moment the van was through it and rapidly disappearing down the road.
target: Me enn timama apre vann la ti disparet dan ladesant.
Zame personn pa ti retrouv Boxer.

input: Three days later it was announced that he had died in the hospital at Willingdon, in spite of receiving every attention a horse could have.
target: Trwa zour pli tar ti anons bann zanimo ki Boxer ti mor dan lopital malgre tou swen ki ti donn li.

input: Squealer came to announce the news to the others.
target: Tronpet ti dir zot ki li ti ar Boxer ler so lavi ti pe ale.

input: I was at his bedside at the very last.
target: Mo ti res kot so lili ziska lafen.

input: And at the end, almost too weak to speak, he whispered in my ear that his sole sorrow was to have passed on before the windmill was finished.
target: Ler li ti vinn tro feb, li ti mirmir dan mo zorey ki so pli gran sagrin se ki li pe mor avan eolienn ti koumans prodwir elektrisite.

input: Long live Comrade Napoleon! Napoleon is always right.
target: Viv Kamarad Napoleon! Napoleon kone ki li fer!'

input: Those were his very last words, comrades.

And when Squealer went on to give further graphic details of Boxers death-bed, the admirable care he had received, and the expensive medicines for which Napoleon had paid without a thought as to the cost, their last doubts disappeared and the sorrow that they felt for their comrades death was tempered by the thought that at least he had died happy.
target: Sa nouvel la ti soulaz bann zanimo e ler zot ti gagn plis detay lor tretman ki Boxer ti resevwar, lor depans ki Kamarad Napoleon ti fer pou sov so lavi, zot dout ti koumans fonn e zot sagren ti diminie parski Boxer ti ere ler lamor ti pe koste.

input: Napoleon himself appeared at the meeting on the following Sunday morning and pronounced a short oration in Boxers honour.
target: Dan renion Dimans ki ti swiv, Napoleon anpersonn ti prezan. Li ti fer enn ti diskour pou selebre granker Boxer.

input: It had not been possible, he said, to bring back their lamented comrades remains for interment on the farm, but he had ordered a large wreath to be made from the laurels in the farmhouse garden and sent down to be placed on Boxers grave.
target: Parski li pa ti posib pou fer so lanterman dan laferm, Napoleon ti donn lord pou fer enn kouronn ar fler lorye dan zarden grannkaz ki ti pou depoz lor tom Boxer.

input: And in a few days time the pigs intended to hold a memorial banquet in Boxers honour.
target: Dan detrwa zour bann koson ti pou organiz enn gran banke pou selebre Boxer so kontribision.

input: Napoleon ended his speech with a reminder of Boxers two favourite maxims, I will work harder and Comrade Napoleon is always right  maxims, he said, which every animal would do well to adopt as his own.
target: Napoleon ti terminn so diskour pou fer tou zanimo rapel de prensip Boxer: 'Mo pou travay pli dir' e 'Napoleon kone ki li fer.' Li ti espere ki tou zanimo ti pou adopte sa de prensip la.

input: On the day appointed for the banquet, a grocers van drove up from Willingdon and delivered a large wooden crate at the farmhouse.
target: Zour banke, vann laboutik ti livre enn gran kes komision dan grannkaz.

input: That night there was the sound of uproarious singing, which was followed by what sounded like a violent quarrel and ended at about eleven oclock with a tremendous crash of glass.
target: Sa swar la ti ena enn gran tamtam sante dekontrole ki ti presed enn bagar violan. Banke ti termine ver onz er ar enn gran tapaz ver kraze.

input: No one stirred in the farmhouse before noon on the following day.
target: Grannkaz ti res silansie ziska midi lelandime.

input: The word went round that from somewhere or other the pigs had acquired the money to buy themselves another case of whisky.
target: Koze ti koumans fane ki bann koson ti gagn lamone pou aste enn lot kes wiski.

input: The seasons came and went, the short animal lives fled by.
target: Sezon vini, sezon ale; bann zanimo ne, grandi, mor.

input: A time came when there was no one who remembered the old days before the Rebellion, except Clover, Benjamin, Moses the raven, and a number of the pigs.
target: Ar pasaz letan laplipar zanimo pa ti kone kouma lavi ti finn deroule avan Revolision exepte Tref, Benzamen, Korbo Moiz e detrwa koson.

input: Muriel was dead; Bluebell, Jessie, and Pincher were dead.
target: Miryel ti mor; Fler Mov, Jesi ek Lake Koupe ti fini mor.

input: Jones too was dead  he had died in an inebriates home.
target: Jonns ti mor dan enn sant detox.

input: Boxer was forgotten, except by the few who had known him.
target: Pa ti rapel Boxer 'si apart detrwa ki ti finn konn li.

input: Clover was an old stout mare now, stiff in the joints and with a tendency to rheumy eyes.
target: Tref ti vinn enn vie matant ki ti pe soufer rematis e so lizie ti pe toultan larme.

input: She was two years past the retiring age, but in fact no animal had ever actually retired.
target: Li ti de an apre so laz pansion, me anfet okenn zanimo pa ti konn retret.

input: The talk of setting aside a corner of the pasture for superannuated animals had long since been dropped.
target: Lide pou rezerv enn parti patiraz pou zanimo trwaziemaz ti finn abandone depi lontan.

input: Napoleon was now a mature boar of twenty-four stone.
target: Napoleon ti vinn enn mal obez.

input: Squealer was so fat that he could with difficulty see out of his eyes.
target: Tronpet ti telman gro ek gra ki li ti gagn difikilte ouver so lizie.

input: Only old Benjamin was much the same as ever, except for being a little greyer about the muzzle, and, since Boxers death, more morose and taciturn than ever.
target: Zis Benzamen ki ti res preske parey exepte ki ti ena enpe pwal blan lor so mizo e depi lamor Boxer li ti enpe pli tris ek silansie.

input: There were many more creatures on the farm now, though the increase was not so great as had been expected in earlier years.
target: Popilasion laferm ti grandi me krwasans la pa ti osi gran ki ti kwar li ti pou ete avan.

input: Many animals had been born to whom the Rebellion was only a dim tradition, passed on by word of mouth, and others had been bought who had never heard mention of such a thing before their arrival.
target: Boukou zanimo ki ti ne ti tann koze Revolision vagman me bann zanimo ki Baz Zanimo ti aste pa ti konn nanye lor la.

input: The farm possessed three horses now besides Clover.
target: Lor laferm, apart Tref, ti ena trwa seval.

input: They were fine upstanding beasts, willing workers and good comrades, but very stupid.
target: Zot ti bann zoli bebet, bon travayer ek bon kamarad me zot ti bann lakrem kouyon.

input: None of them proved able to learn the alphabet beyond the letter B.
target: Zot pa ti fouti depas alfabet 'B'.

input: They accepted everything that they were told about the Rebellion and the principles of Animalism, especially from Clover.
target: Zot ti gob tou seki ti pe rakont zot lor Revolision ek Zanimoism, sirtou kan Tref ti pe rakont zot.

input: The windmill had been successfully completed at last, and the farm possessed a threshing machine and a hay elevator of its own, and various new buildings had been added to it.
target: Eolienn ti anfonksion. Ti ena masinn depayaz, masinn pou sarye ek klas bann balo lerb; ti ena nouvo batiman.

input: The windmill, however, had not after all been used for generating electrical power, but for milling corn, and brought in a handsome money profit.
target: Eolienn pa ti servi pou prodwir elektrisite me pou kraz may e sa ti enn aktivite bien profitab.

input: The animals were hard at work building yet another windmill; when that one was finished, so it was said, the dynamos would be installed.
target: Bann zanimo ti pe travay dir pou konstrir enn deziem eolienn. Sannfwala, ti dir zot, sa pou servi pou prodwir elektrisite avek enstalasion enn dinamo.

input: But the luxuries of which Snowball had once taught the animals to dream, the stalls with electric light and hot and cold water, and the three-day week, were no longer talked about.
target: Me bann ti lix ki Boulkoton ti mansione (lalimier ek sofaz dan stal, dilo so ek fre, trwa zour travay par semenn) ti rant net dan arsiv bliye.

input: Napoleon had denounced such ideas as contrary to the spirit of Animalism.
target: Napoleon ti dir ki sa ti bann lide retrograd ki ti kont lespri Zanimoism.

input: The truest happiness, he said, lay in working hard and living frugally.
target: Pou li, veritab boner li ti dan travay dir e dan enn lavi senp.

input: Somehow it seemed as though the farm had grown richer without making the animals themselves any richer  except, of course, for the pigs and the dogs.
target: Lenpresion zeneral se ki laferm la ti pli dan bien san ki bann zanimo ti pli dan bien, apart, bien sir, koson ek lisien.

input: Perhaps this was partly because there were so many pigs and so many dogs.
target: Tousa parski kikfwa ti ena boukou plis koson ek lisien.

input: It was not that these creatures did not work.
target: Falepa kwar ki bann kreatir pa ti pe travay.

input: There was, as Squealer was never tired of explaining, endless work in the supervision and organisation of the farm.
target: Dan zot prop fason zot ti pe fourni boukou zefor. Kouma Tronpet ti kontan dir, travay kontrol ek organizasion zame ti fini.

input: Much of this work was of a kind that the other animals were too ignorant to understand.
target: Bann lezot zanimo pa ti pe konpran zot lenportans.

input: For example, Squealer told them that the pigs had to expend enormous labours every day upon mysterious things called files, reports, minutes, and memoranda. These were large sheets of paper which had to be closely covered with writing, and as soon as they were so covered, they were burnt in the furnace.
target: Par exanp, Tref ti dir zot toulezour bann koson ti bizen travay lor bann dosie, rapor, minit ek memoranndom.

input: This was of the highest importance for the welfare of the farm, Squealer said.
target: Sa ti bann larz fey papie ki ti bizen ranpli ar lekritir e kan zot ti plen zot ti bril zot four.

input: But still, neither pigs nor dogs produced any food by their own labour; and there were very many of them, and their appetites were always good.
target: Sa li ti vital pou biennet laferm, Tref ti dir Me, kanmem, ni koson, ni lisien pa ti pe prodwir zot prop manze. E ti ena boukou e zot lapeti ti anbonn sante.

input: As for the others, their life, so far as they knew, was as it had always been.
target: Pou lezot zanimo, lavi ti parey kouma avan.

input: They were generally hungry, they slept on straw, they drank from the pool, they laboured in the fields; in winter they were troubled by the cold, and in summer by the flies.
target: Zot vant ti pe toultan grogne; zot ti dormi lor lapay; zot ti bwar dilo basen; zot ti travay dan karo; kan fer fre zot ti pe tranble; kan fer so mous ti pe minn zot lavi.

input: Sometimes the older ones among them racked their dim memories and tried to determine whether in the early days of the Rebellion, when Jones’s expulsion was still recent, things had been better or worse than now.
target: Parfwa bann vie zanimo ti pe sey fouy dan zot memwar som pou sey rapel si apre Revolision, kan zot ti fek expilse bann imen, lavi ti meyer ousa pir. Ti difisil pou dir.

input: They could not remember anything with which they could compare their present lives.
target: Zot pa ti rapel nanye ar ki zot ti kapav konpar zot lavi zordi.

input: They had nothing to go upon except Squealers lists of figures, which invariably demonstrated that everything was getting better and better.
target: Sel referans ki zot ti ena se lalis sif ki Tronpet ti pe donn zot regilierman. Bann sif la ti pe toultan dir ki lavi aster ti meyer ki yer.

input: The animals found the problem insoluble; in any case, they had little time for speculating on such things now.
target: Bann zanimo pa ti pe trouv lizour; tou manier zot pa ti ena boukou letan pou sey trouv lizour.

input: Only old Benjamin professed to remember every detail of his long life and to know that things never had been, nor ever could be much better or much worse  hunger, hardship, and disappointment being, so he said, the unalterable law of life.
target: Zis Benzamen ti pretann ki li ti rapel tou detay dan so long lavi e li ti kapav dir ki lavi pa ti kapav pli bon ousa pli move parski lafen, difikilte ek fristrasion zot bann lalwa fixe par lanatir.

input: And yet the animals never gave up hope.
target: Me bann zanimo pa ti abandonn lespwar.

input: More, they never lost, even for an instant, their sense of honour and privilege in being members of Animal Farm.
target: Plis enportan, zame zot ti bliye, mempa pou enn timama, ki li ti enn gran loner ek privilez viv lor Baz Zanimo.

input: They were still the only farm in the whole county in all England, owned and operated by animals.
target: Li ti sel laferm dan pei kot zanimo ti propriyeter zot teritwar e ki zot ki ti pe diriz tou.

input: And when they heard the gun booming and saw the green flag fluttering at the masthead, their hearts swelled with imperishable pride, and the talk turned always towards the old heroic days, the expulsion of Jones, the writing of the Seven Commandments, the great battles in which the human invaders had been defeated.
target: E kan zot ti tann detonasion fizi, kan zot ti trouv zot pavyon flote dan lezer lot lemapavyon, zot leker ti gonfle ar lazwa e otomatikman zot ti pou koz bann gran moman eroik dan zot istwar “ expilsion Jonns, redaksion Set Komannman, bann gran batay viktorye kont envazion bann imen.

input: None of the old dreams had been abandoned.
target: Bann vie rev ti ankor fre dan zot latet.

input: The Republic of the Animals which Major had foretold, when the green fields of England should be untrodden by human feet, was still believed in.
target: Rev enn Repiblik Zanimo kot ti pou efas tou tras imen, kouma Bonom Mazor ti imazine, ti res fre dan zot lespri.

input: Some day it was coming: it might not be soon, it might not be within the lifetime of any animal now living, but still it was coming.
target: Enn zour pa enn zour li ti pou vini. Pa zordi, pa dime me li ti pou vini.

input: Even the tune of Beasts of England was perhaps hummed secretly here and there: at any rate, it was a fact that every animal on the farm knew it, though no one would have dared to sing it aloud.
target: Mem zot sante 'Zanimo Nou Pei' pa ti disparet. Tanzantan ti ena zanimo ki ti pou mirmir sante la. Anverite bann zanimo ti konn sante la me zot ti per pou sant li for.

input: It might be that their lives were hard and that not all of their hopes had been fulfilled; but they were conscious that they were not as other animals.
target: Zot lavi ti dir, zot bann rev pa ti finn materyalize me zot ti konsian ki zot ti diferan ar lezot zanimo.

input: If they went hungry, it was not from feeding tyrannical human beings; if they worked hard, at least they worked for themselves.
target: Si ti mank manze se pa akoz zot ti bizen nouri lever bann imen tiranik; si zot ti bizen travay dir, omwen zot ti pe travay pou zotmem.

input: No creature among them went upon two legs.
target: Okenn zanimo parmi zot pa ti mars lor de lapat.

input: No creature called any other creature Master.
target: Okenn zanimo pa ti apel enn lot zanimo 'Patron'.

input: One day in early summer Squealer ordered the sheep to follow him, and led them out to a piece of waste ground at the other end of the farm, which had become overgrown with birch saplings.
target: Enn zour dan koumansman lete, Tronpet ti donn lord bann mouton pou swiv li e li ti amen zot dan enn kwen abandone plen ar pie konde kouver ar fey tann.

input: The sheep spent the whole day there browsing at the leaves under Squealers supervision.
target: Pandan enn zourne mouton ti manz fey sou kontrol Tronpet.

input: In the evening he returned to the farmhouse himself, but, as it was warm weather, told the sheep to stay where they were.
target: Ler tanto ti vini, li ti retourn grannkaz tousel. Kouma ti fer bon deor, li ti dir bann mouton ki zot ti kapav pas lanwit anplenner.

input: It ended by their remaining there for a whole week, during which time the other animals saw nothing of them.
target: Finalman zot ti res laba enn semenn net. Pandan sa semenn la okenn lezot zanimo pa ti kone ki zot ti pe deveni.

input: Squealer was with them for the greater part of every day.
target: Tronpet tousel ti pe pas boukou letan ar zot.

input: He was, he said, teaching them to sing a new song, for which privacy was needed.
target: Li ti dir ki li ti pe montre zot enn nouvo sante e sa ekzersis la ti dimann konsantrasion. Pa ti gagn drwa deranz zot.

input: It was just after the sheep had returned, on a pleasant evening when the animals had finished work and were making their way back to the farm buildings, that the terrified neighing of a horse sounded from the yard.
target: Mem lepok ki bann mouton ti retourne, enn tanto kan ti pe fer bon deor e ki bann zanimo ti fini zot lazourne travay e ti pe retourn ver bann batiman laferm, ti tann enn seval kriye ar lafreyer.

input: Startled, the animals stopped in their tracks.
target: Soke, bann zanimo ti arete pou kone ki ti pe arivi.

input: She neighed again, and all the animals broke into a gallop and rushed into the yard.
target: Li ti rekriye e bann zanimo ti galoupe pou al gete ki ti pe arive.

input: Then they saw what Clover had seen.
target: Lerla zot ti trouve seki Tref ti trouve.

input: It was a pig walking on his hind legs.
target: Enn koson ti pe mars lor so de lapat deryer.

input: A little awkwardly, as though not quite used to supporting his considerable bulk in that position, but with perfect balance, he was strolling across the yard.
target: So mouvman ti gos-gos parski li pa ti ena labitid fer zis de lapat tini pwa lekor net. Me bizen rekonet ki li ti tini bien so lekilib ler li ti travers lakour.

input: And a moment later, out from the door of the farm-house came a long file of pigs, all walking on their hind legs.
target: Enn timama apre, laport grannkaz ti ouver e enn trale koson ti sorti e zot tou ti pe mars lor zot de lapat deyer.

input: Some did it better than others, one or two were even a trifle unsteady and looked as though they would have liked the support of a stick, but every one of them made his way right round the yard successfully.
target: Ena ti mars pli bien ki lezot; ti ena ennde ki ti golmal “ andire zot ti bizen enn baton pou tini zot. Me finalman zot tou ti fer parkour la san tro problem.

input: And finally there was a tremendous baying of dogs and a shrill crowing from the black cockerel, and out came Napoleon himself, majestically upright, casting haughty glances from side to side, and with his dogs gambolling round him.
target: E finalman ti ena enn gran tapaz zape lisien e son egi sante enn kok e Napoleon, drwat kouma enn lerwa ar regar oten, ti sorti lor so de lapat. So bann bodigard-lisien ti pe sot-sote otour li.

input: He carried a whip in his trotter.
target: Li ti ena enn fwet dan so lapat divan.

input: Amazed, terrified, huddling together, the animals watched the long line of pigs march slowly round the yard.
target: Terifie, boulverse, soke, bann zanimo ti koste sere enn kont lot ler zot ti pe get enn long filwar koson lor de lapat deryer pe mars kouma senater otour lakour.

input: All the sheep burst out into a tremendous bleating of Four legs good, two legs better! Four legs good, two legs better! Four legs good, two legs better!
target: Tou bann mouton ti larg nouvo sawal: Kat lapat bon, de lapat meyer! Kat lapat bon, de lapat meyer! Kat lapat bon, de lapat meyer!

input: It went on for five minutes without stopping.
target: Pandan senk minit san arete zot ti ale mem.

input: And by the time the sheep had quieted down, the chance to utter any protest had passed, for the pigs had marched back into the farmhouse.
target: E ler ti ler pou bann mouton aret zot tapaz, ti nepli posib proteste parski bann koson ti fini rant dan grannkaz.

input: Benjamin felt a nose nuzzling at his shoulder.
target: Benzamen ti santi enn nene pe respire lor so zepol.

input: Her old eyes looked dimmer than ever.
target: So lizie ti vinn bien som.

input: Without saying anything, she tugged gently at his mane and led him round to the end of the big barn, where the Seven Commandments were written.
target: Ar douser li ti ris krinier Benzamen, amenn li kot miray langar kot ti ena Set Komannman.

input: For a minute or two they stood gazing at the tatted wall with its white lettering.
target: Pandan enn minit zot ti get miray dekrepit ar so lekritir blan.

input: My sight is failing, she said finally.
target: Mo nepli trouv bien, Tref ti dir Benzamen.

input: Even when I was young I could not have read what was written there.
target: Mem kan mo ti zenn mo pa ti kapav lir seki ti ekrir lor miray.

input: But it appears to me that that wall looks different.
target: Me mo gagn lenpresion ki lekritir finn sanze.

input: Are the Seven Commandments the same as they used to be, Benjamin?
target: Eski Set Komannman parey kouma avan, Benzamen?

input: For once Benjamin consented to break his rule, and he read out to her what was written on the wall.
target: Sannfwala Benzamen ti desid pou al kont so prop prensip, e li ti lir pou Tref seki ti ena lor miray.

input: There was nothing there now except a single commandment.
target: Ti ena enn sel Komannman. Tou lezot ti disparet.

input: BUT SOME ANIMALS ARE MORE EQUAL THAN OTHERS.
target: ME ENA DETRWA ZANIMO KI PLIS EGAL KI LEZOT.

input: After that it did not seem strange when next day the pigs who were supervising the work of the farm all carried whips in their trotters.
target: Apre sa evennman la, li pa ti tro anormal ki lelandime, kan bann koson ti pe kontrol travay, zot ti koumans sarye enn fwet dan zot lapat divan.

input: It did not seem strange to learn that the pigs had bought themselves a wireless set, were arranging to install a telephone, and had taken out subscriptions to several newspapers.
target: Li pa ti anormal ki zot ti aste enn radio, ki zot ti fer enstal telefonn, ki zot ti abone ar diferan lagazet.

input: It did not seem strange when Napoleon was seen strolling in the farmhouse garden with a pipe in his mouth  no, not even when the pigs took Mr. Jones’s clothes out of the wardrobes and put them on, Napoleon himself appearing in a black coat, ratcatcher breeches, and leather leggings, while his favourite sow appeared in the watered silk dress which Mrs Jones had been used to wear on Sundays.
target: Nanye pa ti drol mem kan Napoleon ti promne dan zarden grannkaz, enn pip dan labous; mem kan bann koson ti koumans met lenz Misie Jonns; mem kan Napoleon ti met palto, bretel ek bot ankwir; mem kan so konkibinn prefere ti met rob Dimans Madam Jonns.

input: A week later, in the afternoon, a number of dogcarts drove up to the farm.
target: Enn semenn apre, enn tanto, ti ena detrwa karyol ki ti vinn dan laferm.

input: A deputation of neighbouring farmers had been invited to make a tour of inspection.
target: Ti ena viziter depi lezot laferm.

input: They were shown all over the farm, and expressed great admiration for everything they saw, especially the windmill.
target: Zot ti enpresione par seki zot ti pe dekouver, sirtou eolienn la.

input: The animals were weeding the turnip field.
target: Bann zanimo ti pe aras move lerb dan karo rav.

input: What could be happening in there, now that for the first time animals and human beings were meeting on terms of equality?
target: Ki ti pe pase laba? Imen ek zanimo ti pe sosialize lor enn baz egalite.

input: With one accord they began to creep as quietly as possible into the farmhouse garden.
target: Zot tou anmemtan ti desid pou rant dan zarden grannkaz.

input: At the gate they paused, half frightened to go on but Clover led the way in.
target: Ler zot ti ariv kot geet, zot ti tike me Tref pa ti kile.

input: They tiptoed up to the house, and such animals as were tall enough peered in at the dining-room window.
target: Zot ti avanse lor pwent lipie e ti al pre ar lakaz la e bann zanimo ki ti pli ot ti kapav louk par lafnet salamanze.

input: There, round the long table, sat half a dozen farmers and half a dozen of the more eminent pigs.
target: Otour gran latab ti ena sis imen ek sis koson VIP.

input: Napoleon himself occupying the seat of honour at the head of the table.
The pigs appeared completely at ease in their chairs.
target: Bann koson ti paret bien alez lor zot sez.

input: The company had been enjoying a game of cards but had broken off for the moment, evidently in order to drink a toast.
target: Lakonpagni ti pe zwe kart e zot ti pran enn ti brek pou bwar enn lasante.

input: A large jug was circulating, and the mugs were being refilled with beer.
target: Enn gran brok labier ti pe sirkile e bann ver ti pe ranpli.

input: No one noticed the wondering faces of the animals that gazed in at the window.
target: Personn pa ti pran kont bann figir dan sok lor vit lafnet.

input: Mr. Pilkington, of Foxwood, had stood up, his mug in his hand.
target: Misie Pilkingtonn, propriyeter Bwarenar, ti dibout ar so ver dan so lame.

input: In a moment, he said, he would ask the present company to drink a toast.
target: Dan enn timama li ti pou envit tou dimoun prezan pou bwar enn lasante.

input: But before doing so, there were a few words that he felt it incumbent upon him to say.
target: Me avan li ti panse ki li ti so devwar dir detrwa mo.

input: It was a source of great satisfaction to him, he said  and, he was sure, to all others present to feel that a long period of mistrust and misunderstanding had now come to an end.
target: Li ti extra kontan “ e li ti sir ki tou bann dimoun prezan ti pans parey kouma li “ ki enn long peryod mefians ek malantandi ti pe al mor.

input: There had been a time  not that he, or any of the present company, had shared such sentiments  but there had been a time when the respected proprietors of Animal Farm had been regarded, he would not say with hostility, but perhaps with a certain measure of misgiving, by their human neighbours.
target: Ti ena enn lepok “ li pa ti kwar ki bann dimoun prezan ti pans koumsa “ ti ena enn lepok kan bann onorab propriyeter Baz Zanimo ti konsidere, li pa pou dir, kouma ennmi, me kouma dimoun diferan ki zot pa ti tro konpran.

input: Unfortunate incidents had occurred, mistaken ideas had been current.
target: Ti finn ena bann ensidan malere, ti finn ena bann fos konsepsion.

input: It had been felt that the existence of a farm owned and operated by pigs was somehow abnormal and was liable to have an unsettling effect in the neighbourhood.
target: Ena ti panse ki enn laferm dirize par bann koson ti drol, ti bizar; ti kapav amenn dezekilib dan vwazinaz.

input: Too many farmers had assumed, without due enquiry, that on such a farm a spirit of licence and indiscipline would prevail.
target: Boukou fermie, san fer okenn lanket, ti kwar ki dan Baz Zanimo ti ena dezord, endisiplinn, kao.

input: They had been nervous about the effects upon their own animals, or even upon their human employees.
target: Zot ti per ki sa ti kapav afekte zot zanimo ek zot anplwaye.

input: But all such doubts were now dispelled.
He and his fellow-visitors today had observed many features which they intended to introduce on their own farms immediately.
target: Li ek so bann koleg fermie ti pou met anpratik lor zot laferm seki zot ti finn aprann zordi.

input: He would end his remarks, he said, by emphasising once again the friendly feelings that subsisted, and ought to subsist, between Animal Farm and its neighbours.
target: Li ti dir ki li ti pou terminn so diskour ar nesesite devlop relasion kordial ant Baz Zanimo ek bann lezot laferm.

input: And now, he said finally, he would ask the company to rise to their feet and make certain that their glasses were full.
target: Alafen li ti dimann tou dimoun dibout, plen zot ver.

input: Gentlemen, he concluded, gentlemen, I give you a toast: To the prosperity of Animal Farm!
target: Mesie, li ti dir, nou lev nou ver pou bwar lasante, prosperite Baz Zanimo.

input: There was enthusiastic cheering and stamping of feet.
Napoleon was so gratified that he left his place and came round the table to clink his mug against Mr Pilkingtons before emptying it.
target: Napoleon ti telman kontan ki li ti kit so plas, ti vinn kogn so ver ar ver Pilkingtonn e li ti devid li enn sel tre.

input: When the cheering had died down, Napoleon, who had remained on his feet, intimated that he too had a few words to say.
target: Kan tapaz aplodisman ti koumans diminie, Napoleon ti fer kone ki li ti anvi dir detrwa mo.

input: Like all of Napoleons speeches, it was short and to the point.
target: Kouma tou Napoleon so bann diskour li ti kourt ek direk.

input: He too, he said, was happy that the period of misunderstanding was at an end.
target: Li osi li ti kontan ki peryod malantandi ti depase.

input: For a long time there had been rumours  circulated, he had reason to think, by some malignant enemy that there was something subversive and even revolutionary in the outlook of himself and his colleagues.
target: Pandan lontan ti ena rimer ki ti pe sirkile “ sirman louvraz bann ennmi “ ki li ek so bann koleg ti bann revolisioner ki ti pe fer sibversion, ti pe rod ranvers pouvwar imen partou.

input: This farm which he had the honour to control, was a co-operative enterprise.
target: Laferm ki li ti pe dirize li ti enn antrepriz korperativ.

input: The title-deeds, which were in his own possession, were owned by the pigs jointly.
target: Dapre bann drwa propriyete, ki li ti gard ar li, tou bann koson ti propriyeter ansam.

input: But as the animals outside gazed at the scene, it seemed to them that some strange thing was happening.
target: Me pou bann zanimo ki ti pe louke par lanet, enn zafer bien-bien drol ti pe arive.

input: What was it that had altered in the faces of the pigs?
target: Ki ti ete sa ki ti pe sanz bann figir koson?

input: Clovers old dim eyes flitted from one face to another.
target: Tref so lizie som ti flit lor enn figir pou al lor enn lot.

input: Some of them had five chins, some had four, some had three.
target: Ena ti ena senk manton, kat manton, trwa manton.

input: Some of the things were melting and changing.
target: Ena kiksoz ti pe fonn, ti pe sanze.

input: Then, the applause having come to an end, the company took up their cards and continued the game that had been interrupted, and the animals crept silently away.
target: Zis lerla aplodisman ti pe al dan tengn e lakonpagni ti retourn zwe kart. Bann zanimo deor ti glise trankilman, ale.

input: But they had not gone twenty yards when they stopped short.
target: Me zot pa ti gagn letan mars ven met kan zot ti tann enn tapaz enfernal. Zot ti aret sek.

input: An uproar of voices was coming from the farmhouse.
target: Tapaz la ti sorti dan grannkaz.

input: They rushed back and looked through the window again.
target: Lor vites zot ti retourn kot lafnet pou louke.

input: Yes, a violent quarrel was in progress.
target: Ti ena enn mari lager andan.

input: There were shoutings, bangings on the table, sharp suspicious glances, furious denials.
target: Ti ena kriye, zoure, devir latab, akizasion, protestasion.

input: The source of the trouble appeared to be that Napoleon and Pilkington had each played an ace of spades simultaneously.
target: Napoleon ek Pilkingtonn ti zwe lasdepik anmemtan.

input: Twelve voices were shouting in anger, and they were all alike.
target: Douz lavwa firye ti pe kriye ar koler anmemtan e zot ti resanble net.

input: The creatures outside looked from pig to man, and from man to pig, and from pig to man again; but already it was impossible to say which was which.
target: Bann zanimo ti get figir koson, apre figir imen, apre figir koson, apre figir imen, apre figir koson. Pa ti ena okenn diferans.

input: Which bus should I take to go to the beach?
target: Ki bis mo bizin pran pou al laplaz?

input: Is Grand Baie situated at the northern part of the island?
target: Eski Grand Baie sitie dan nor lil?

input: A thief stole from his house.
target: Enn voler to koken dan so lakaz.

input: When you dream, then you do the work.
target: Kan to reve, to fer travay la.

input: Flowers of different colours will be good for decorating the house for the wedding.
target: Bann fler diferan kouler pou bon pou dekor lakaz la pou mariaz la.

input: The quick brown fox jumps over the lazy dog.
target: Sa renar rapid la finn sot lor sa lisyen pares la.

input: The girl wearing a red dress went into the forest with her father to collect wood.
target: Sa tifi ki met enn rob rouz la ti al dan lafore avek so papa pou rams dibwa.

input: When I am working on my computer, I do not want anyone to disturb me.
target: Kan mo pe travay lor mo ordinater, mo pas kontan personn deranz mwa.

input: The lady with blue eyes is beautiful.
target: Sa madam avek lizie ble la bien zoli.

input: It is very good for you.
Once when a Lion was asleep, a little Mouse began running up and down upon him.
target: Enn zour kan enn lion ti dormi, enn ti lera to koumans sot enba e lao lor li.

input: This soon wakened the Lion, who placed his huge paw upon him and opened his big jaws to swallow him.
target: Sa ti lev lion, ki ti plas so gro lapat lor li e ti ouver so gro lagel pou aval li.

input: "Pardon, O King!" cried the little Mouse, "Forgive me this time. I shall never repeat it and I shall never forget your kindness. And who knows, but I may be able to do you a good turn one of these days?"
target: “Pardon, O Lerwa!”, ti lera ti krie, “Exkiz mwa sa fwa la. Mo pa pou repet sa zame e mo pa pou blie ou bonte. E ki kone, me pou kapav fer ou enn bon tour sa bann zour la?”

input: The Lion was so tickled at the idea of the Mouse being able to help him, that he lifted up his paw and let him go.
target: Lion la ti tro gagn rie ar lide ki lera kapav ed li, ki li ti lev so lapat e finn les li ale.

input: Sometime later a few hunters captured the King and tied him to a tree while they went in search of a wagon to carry him on.
target: Inpe letan plitar enn bann saser ti may lerwa la e ti atas li avek enn pie kan zot ti al sers enn vagon pou sarie li.

input: Just then the little Mouse happened to pass by, and seeing the sad plight in which the Lion was, ran up to him and soon gnawed away the ropes that bound the King of the Beasts.
target: Zis lerla ti lera la ti arive pe pas laba, e kan li trouv sa sor tris dan ki Lion la ti ete, li ti galoupe ziska li e li ti ronz bann lakord ki ti atas lerwa bann zanimo.

input: "Was I not right?" said the little Mouse, very happy to help the Lion.
target: “Mo pa ti bien dir?” ti lera ti dir, bien kontan pou ed lion la.

input: Moral: Little friends may prove great friends.

target: Sa lasam la ena trop tapaz.

target: Alo, mo apel Deni, mo ena enn rezervasion.

target: Eski ena enn diferans pri ant le de?

target: Korek, mo pou al pou enn ki fer fas losean, silvouple.

input: And you would like that for three nights, correct?
target: E ou anvi sa pou trwa nwit, korek?

input: I'll have the porter bring up your bags.
target: Mo pou fer porter amenn ou bann sak.

input: We have you booked in room nunber 300.
target: Nou finn reserv lasam nimero 300 pou ou.

Well, it's a little dark. Do you have any that are brighter?
target: Bon, li inpe nwar. Ou ena enn ki pli eklere?

input: Yes, we do have one, but it faces the street, so it's a little noisy.
target: Wi, nou ena enn, me li fer fas sime, alors ena inpe tapaz.

input: Could I take a look at that one?
target: Mo ti kapav zet enn koudey sannla?

target: Bien sir, li lasam nimero 305 e li lao dan ou gos. Ala lakle.

target: Sa lasam la parfe, mo pou pran li.

input: How do I get to the town from here? Can I take a bus or should I take a taxi?

The fare to the town is usually $20. Would you like me to call a cab?
target: Tarif pou al lavil li souvan $20. Eski ou ti anvi mo korl enn taxi?

target: Bien sir, mo kapav gagn enn pou 2.00 pm?

target: Absoliman, Li pou atann ou divan lotel. Ena lot kitsoz mo kapav fer pou ou?

target: Wi ou kapav fer kikenn sanz dra dan mo lasam?

target: Wi, ou kapav les zot dan nou stor.

input: A high court judge has given doctors permission to perform an urgent caesarean section on a mentally ill woman who has diabetes.
target: Enn ziz ot kour fiin donn dokter permision to fer enn sezaryenn irzan lor enn madam ki ti ena malad mantal e ti ena diabet.

input: Mr Justice Hayden gave specialists working for the Royal Free London NHS Trust the go-ahead after a five-hour hearing in the court of protection in London.
target: Misie Justice Hayden ti donn bann spesialis ki ti pe travay pou Royal Free London NHS Trust otorizasion apre sink er deba dan lakour proteksion dan Lond.

input: The judge said a decision "compelling" a caesarean was "draconian", but he had heard evidence that the woman's life might be in danger.
target: Ziz la ti dir enn desizion “pou obliz” enn sezarienn ti “drakonien”, me li ti tand prev ki sa madam la so lavi kapav an danze.

input: He said he had concluded that the woman, who is 32 and 32 weeks pregnant, lacked the mental capacity to make decisions about whether or not to have her baby delivered by C-section.
target: Li ti konklir ki sa madam la, ki ena 32 an e 32 semenn ansint, ti mank kapasite mantal pou pran decizion aproposi bizin ou non pou gagn enn tibaba par sezaryenn.

input: Trust officials had applied for permission, saying doctors thought an urgent caesarean necessary so that the woman's "unstable mental state" could properly be treated.
target: Bann ofisie Trust ti fer aplikasion pou permision, pou dir dokter panse enn sezaryenn irzan neseser pou sa madam la so leta mantal instab kapav trete bien.

input: One specialist told the judge that the priority was "keeping this woman alive".
target: Enn spesialis ti dir ziz ki priorite ti “gard sa madam la vivan”.

input: He heard that she was thought to be suffering from paranoid schizophrenia and had attempted suicide.
target: Li ti tande ki li ti panse li soufer schizophreni e li ti esay komet swisid.

input: The judge said neither the woman nor the hospital could be identified, but said the health authority could and should be named.
target: Ziz ti dir ni madam la ni lopital la ti finn idantifie, me li dir ki lotorite lasante ti kapav e ti bizin nome.

input: He said the scrutiny of doctors' conduct could only "serve to reassure public confidence".
target: Li ti dir ki verifikasion kondwit bann dokter ti pou “servi pou rasir konfians piblik”.

input: The court of protection is part of the high court and analyses issues relating to sick and vulnerable people.
target: Lakour proteksion li enn parti ot kour e li analiz zafer konsernan maladi e dimounn vilnerab.

input: "The decision to compel a caesarean section on an incapacitous woman who is mentally and physically ill is an extremely draconian one," said Mr Justice Hayden.
target: “Desizion pou obliz enn sezaryenn lor enn madam inkapab ki mantalman e fizikman malad li extremman draconien,” Mr Justice Hayden ti dir.

input: "Doctors do not embark upon this lightly.
target: Dokter pa kapav anbark lor sa lezerman.

input: It is one that the lawyers also take very seriously indeed.
target: Li enn ki bann avoka osi pran bien serie anfet.

input: I am perfectly satisfied that at the moment this woman is not able to make any reasoned evaluation of the advantages and disadvantages of a caesarean section.
target: Mo bien satisfe asterla ki sa madam la pa kapav fer enn evaliasion rezonan lavantaz e dizavantaz enn sezaryenn.

input: He said he had also concluded that the woman – who had stopped eating – lacked the capacity to regulate her own diabetic medicine and monitor her own intake of food and water.
target: Li ti dir ki li ti osi konklir ki sa fam la – ki ti aret manze – ti mank kapasite pou reglemant so medsinn diabete vey so manze e delo ki li bizin pran.

input: But doctors were not given permission to use force or restrain the woman.
target: Me dokter pa ti gagn permision pou servi lafors ou anpes fam la.

input: Medics thought that the woman could be persuaded to agree to sedation and did not think that force or restraint would be needed, said the judge.
target: Bann dimounn medikal ti panse ki kapav persiad fam la pou aksepte kalman e pa ti panse ki lafors ou ou anpes li fer kitsoz ti pou nesesser, ziz ti dir.

input: One doctor told the court that the woman's physical and mental problems should lessen – and be easier to treat – once the baby was born.
target: Enn dokter ti dir lakour ki sa fam la so problem fizik e mantal ti pou diminie – e pou pli fasil pou trete – enn fwa tibaba ti ne.

input: And the doctor said it was feared that the woman might have to have to be restrained so that nutrients could be fed through a drip if the baby was not delivered.
target: E dokter la ti dir li ti per ki pou bizin anpes fam la pou ki kapav nouri li par enn serom si li pa ti pou akouse.

input: A specialist said the baby should not be at risk if delivered via caesarean section at 32 weeks.
target: Enn spesialis ti dir tibaba la pa ti pou ena risk si li ne par sezaryenn lor 32 semenn.

input: I don't like to go to the hospital.
The doctor gave him an injection.
target: Dokter ti fer enn pikir avek li.

input: Four Seasons hotel, how can I hep you.

I'd go with the smaller one, the single room. It's much nicer and two people can stay in the room.

Perfect. We have an underground lot where you can park your car.

target: Kan ou sorti depi parking, tourn agos lor sime prinsipal. Kontinie kondir ziska 10 blok, e ou pou ariv Central Avenue.

target: Plas restoran la apepre 5 blok depi laba.

target: Alors, nou bizin fer enn tour adrwat lor Central Avenue?

input: I love this room. It's very pretty!

target: Mo kontan sa restoran la. Manze la bien goute.

target: Mo pa kontan fason li fer. Li bien grosie!

input: I love the service here. It's very professional.
target: Mo kontan servis isi. Li bien profesionel.

input: I won't take the room. It's too noisy.
target: Mo pa pou pran lasam la. Fer tro tapaz ladan.

input: I won't take the room. It's a little too expensive.
target: Mo pa pou pran lasam la. Li tro ser.

input: I don't like this room. It doesn't seem safe.
target: Mo pa kontan lasam la. Li pa paret an sekirite.

input: I really like this room. It's very cozy.
target: Mo bien kontan sa lasam la. Li bien bon.

input: No, it's included in the price of the room.
target: Non, li inkli dan pri lasam.

input: Do I have to pay for breakfast?
target: Eski mo bizin pey pou tidezene?

input: In the restaurant next to the reception desk.

target: Ant 7 er gramatin ek 10 er gramatin.
Non, mo bien sagrin. Nou ranpli.

input: Do you have any free rooms?
No, but each room has a ceiling fan.
target: Non, me sak lasam ena enn vantilater.

input: Does the room have air conditioning?
target: Eski lasam la ena air conditioner?

input: There is a bank that's right outside the hotel to the right.
target: Ena enn labank ki trouv zis deor lotel kote drwat.

input: You have to press "9" on your phone.
target: Ou bizin pez "9" lor ou telefonn.

input: How do I check my messages?
target: Kouma mo bizin fer pou check mo mesaz?

input: Yes, you can leave them in the storage room next to the restaurant.
target: Wi, ou kapav les zot dan stor akote restoran.

input: Can I leave my bags here?
target: Mo kapav les mo bann sak isi?

input: No, not yet. Here it is.
Did you give me back my passport?
target: Eski ou finn retournn mo paspor?

input: Where's the check-in counter for American Airlines?
target: Kot kontwar check-in pou American Airlines?

input: That's in terminal 2. This is terminal 1.
target: Sa se terminal 2. Isi se terminal 1.

input: Is there a shuttle bus that goes between terminals?
target: Eski ena enn navet ki al ant terminal?

input: Yes, there's one right in front here.
Thanks. How much time should I allow to check in?
target: Mersi. Komie letan mo bizin lese pou check-in?

input: If you're on an international flight I believe you have to check-in 3 hours before your flight.
target: Si ou lor vol internasional mo krwar ou bizin 3 er avan ou vol.

input: On those flights you have to check-in 1 and a half hours before.
target: Lor sa bann vol la ou bizin check-in 1 er tan edmi avan.

input: Can I see your ticket and your passport, please?
target: Mo kapav get ou biye e ou paspor, silvouple?

input: Sure. Here's my passport. And here's my e-ticket.
target: Bien sir. Ala mo paspor. E ala mo biye.

input: Thank you. Would you like a window seat?
target: Mersi. Ou anvi enn siez kot lafnet?

input: No, I'd like an aisle seat please.
target: Non, mo anvi enn siez koulwar silvouple.

input: OK, and is all this luggage yours?
target: Ok, e eski tou sa bagaz la pou ou?
Sa de sak la pou mwa.

input: All right. One of your bags is overweight... I'm going to have to charge you for the excess weight.
target: Bon. Enn bann sak la ena pwa an exses... Mo bizin fer ou pey pou sa pwa exses la.

input: I see. How much cash do I have to pay? And can I pay by credit card?
target: Mo trouve. Komie larzan mo bizin peye? E mo kapav pey par kart kredi?

input: $30 dollars more, sir, and yes, we do accept credit cards.
target: $30 dollar anplis, misie, e wi, nou aksepte kart kredi.

input: I'm flying to Miami, but I need a ticket... Can I buy here?
target: Mo pe al Miami, me mo bizin enn biye... Mo kapav aste isi?

input: No, you'll have to go to the ticket counter... That's over in terminal 3.
target: Non, ou bizin al kot kontwar biye... Sa kot terminal 3.

input: Just turn right and go all the way to end of this terminal and you'll be in Terminal 3.
target: Zis tourn a drwat e al ziska lafin terminal e ou pou dan terminal 3.

input: Hi there. I was told I could buy a ticket here?
target: Alo laba. Zot finn dir mwa mo kapav aster enn biye isi?

input: I need a ticket to Miami, please, for today if possible.
target: Mo bizin enn biye pou Miami, silvouple, pou azordi si posib.

input: All right... Yes, I can get you on the flight at 7:00 PM tonight, which arrives in Miami at 10:00 PM. This ticket is $650.
target: Korek... Wi, Mo kapav met ou lor vol 7.00 pm aswar, ki ariv Miami 10:00 pm. Biye la $650.
Eski ou ena enn pli bomarse?

input: No, not on such short notice, sir.
target: Non, pa dan sa ti letan la, misie.

input: That's the lowest price I can get you for today or tomorrow.
target: Sa pri pli bomarse ki kapav donn ou pou azordi e demin.

input: I lost my wallet and all my money was inside it.
target: Mo finn perdi mo portmone e tou mo larzan ti ladan.

input: I can't find my departure gate.
target: Mo pa pe trouv mo gate depar.

input: The airline lost one of my bags.
target: Konpagni avion la finn perdi enn mo sak.

input: I don't have enough money to buy a sandwich.
target: Mo pena ase larzan pou aste sandwich.

input: They won't let me take my bottle of water on the plane.
target: Zot pa pou les mwa pran mo boutey delo dan avion.
Mo finn perdi mo boarding pass.

input: My flight has been delayed for three hours.
target: Mo vol finn an retar pou trwa er.

input: Is there a public phone here? My mobile isn't working.
target: Eski ena enn telefonn piblik isi? Mo portab pa pe marse.

input: No, you'll have to transfer either in Chicago or Kansas City.
target: Non, Ou bizin transfer swa dan sikago ou lavil Kansas.

input: Are there any direct flights to Dallas?
It's right there, next to that restaurant.

target: Kot sa biro ban zafer perdi e gagne?

input: I'm sorry, this bathroom is being cleaned.
target: Mo bien sagrin, saldebin pe neoye.

input: Can I go into the bathroom?
How much do I have to pay for the extra bag?
target: Komie mo bizin peye pou sa sak adisionel la?

input: When does the flight to Bangkok leave?
No, this is the arrival area.
How much does a locker cost?
It was. The gate has been changed to 44D.
target: Li ti ete. Gate la finn sanze finn vinn 44D.

input: Is this the gate for flight 234 to Madrid?
target: Eski samem gate pou vol 234 pou Madrid?

input: You can bring one small bag on the plane with you.
target: Ou kapav amenn enn ti sak dan avion avek ou.

input: How much carry-on luggage am I allowed?
Could I get another blanket, please? I'm a little cold.
target: Eski mo kapav gagn enn lot molton, silvouple? Mo pe gagn inpe fre.

input: Certainly, sir. Would you like a pillow as well?
target: Bien sir, misie. Eski ou bizin enn lorye osi?

input: No, thanks. But could you please bring me a Coke?
target: Non, mersi. Me ou kapav amenn enn koka pou mwa?

input: Sure, would you like ice in that?
target: Bien sir, ou anvi glason ladan?

input: Yes, please... Oh! Could you also lend me a pen to fill out this immigration form?
target: Wi, silvouple... Oh! ou kapav osi pret mwa enn plim pou ranpli sa form imigrasion la?

input: I don't have one on me right now, but I'll get one for you.
target: Mo pena enn avek mwa zis aster la, me mo pou rod enn pou ou.

input: Thanks. Do you know when we will we be landing?
target: Mersi. Eski ou kone kan nou pe aterir?

input: What's the temperature in Seattle right now?
I'm not sure... I'll check with the pilot.
target: Mo pa sir... Mo pou verifie avek pilot la.

input: Excuse me, would it be possible to interchange seats with someone? My wife and I would like to sit together.
target: Exkiz mwa, eski li posib pou mo sanz plas avek kikenn? Mo madam e mwa nou anvi asiz ansam.

input: Certainly, sir. For now, please take your seat, and once the plane takes off, I'll help you with that.
target: Bien sir, misie. asterla, silvouple pran ou plas, e enn fwa avion dekole, mo pou ed ou avek sa.

input: Thank you. Could you help me put this bag in the overhead compartment?
target: Mersi. Ou kapav ed mwa pou met sa sak la dan kompartiman lao?

input: I'm sorry, I think you're in my seat.
target: Sori, mo krwar ou dan mo plas.

input: Oh, let me check my boarding pass... Yes, I'm sorry, my mistake.
target: Oh, les mo verifie mo boarding pass... Wi, sori, mo finn fer erer.
